Text

Chapter 1 [Selden]108-selden paused in surprise . In the afternoon rush of [the Grand Central Station]303-the grand central station [his]108-selden eyes had been refreshed by the sight of [Miss Lily Bart]109-lily . It was a Monday in early September , and [he]108-selden was returning to [his]108-selden work from a hurried dip into [the country]304-the country ; but what was [Miss Bart]109-lily doing in [town]305-town at that season ? If [she]109-lily had appeared to be catching [a train]306-a train , [he]108-selden might have inferred that [he]108-selden had come on [her]109-lily in the act of transition between one and another of [the country houses which disputed [her]109-lily presence after the close of the Newport season]307-the country houses which disputed her presence after the close of the newport season ; but [her]109-lily desultory air perplexed [him]108-selden . [She]109-lily stood apart from [the crowd]308-the crowd , letting it drift by [her]109-lily to [the platform]309-the platform or [the street]310-the street , and wearing an air of irresolution which might , as [he]108-selden surmised , be the mask of a very definite purpose . It struck [him]108-selden at once that [she]109-lily was waiting for some one , but [he]108-selden hardly knew why the idea arrested [him]108-selden . There was nothing new about [Lily Bart]109-lily , yet [he]108-selden could never see [her]109-lily without a faint movement of interest : it was characteristic of [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily always roused speculation , that [her]109-lily simplest acts seemed the result of far - reaching intentions . An impulse of curiosity made [him]108-selden turn out of [his]108-selden direct line to the door , and stroll past [her]109-lily . [He]108-selden knew that if [she]109-lily did not wish to be seen [she]109-lily would contrive to elude [him]108-selden ; and it amused [him]108-selden to think of putting [her]109-lily skill to the test . “ [Mr. Selden]108-selden — what good luck ! ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily came forward smiling , eager almost , in [her]109-lily resolve to intercept [him]108-selden . [One or two persons]311-one or two persons , in brushing past [them]311-one or two persons , lingered to look ; for [Miss Bart]109-lily was a figure to arrest even [the suburban traveller rushing to [[his]108-selden last train]313-his last train]312-the suburban traveller rushing to his last train . [Selden]108-selden had never seen [her]109-lily more radiant . [Her]109-lily vivid head , relieved against the dull tints of [the crowd]308-the crowd , made [her]109-lily more conspicuous than in [a ball - room]315-a ball - room , and under [her]109-lily dark hat and veil [she]109-lily regained the girlish smoothness , the purity of tint , that [she]109-lily was beginning to lose after eleven years of late hours and indefatigable dancing . Was it really eleven years , [Selden]108-selden found [himself]108-selden wondering , and had [she]109-lily indeed reached the nine - and - twentieth birthday with which [[her]109-lily rivals]316-her rivals credited [her]109-lily ? “ What luck ! ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily repeated . “ How nice of [you]108-selden to come to [my]109-lily rescue ! ”[109-lily] [He]108-selden responded joyfully that to do so was [his]108-selden mission in life , and asked what form the rescue was to take . “ Oh , almost any — even to sitting on a bench and talking to [me]109-lily . [One]2737-one sits out a cotillion — why not sit out [a train]306-a train ? It is n’t a bit hotter here than in [[Mrs. Van Osburgh]110-mrs. van osburgh ’s conservatory]2739-mrs. van osburgh ’s conservatory — and [some of [the women]2741-the women]2740-some of the women are not a bit uglier . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily broke off , laughing , to explain that [she]109-lily had come up to [town]305-town from [Tuxedo]1-tuxedo , on [her]109-lily way to [the [Gus Trenors]111-gus ’ at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]2-the gus trenors ’ at bellomont , and had missed [the three - fifteen train]318-the three - fifteen train to [Rhinebeck]4-rhinebeck . “ And there is n’t another till half - past five . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily consulted the little jewelled watch among [her]109-lily laces . “ Just two hours to wait . And [I]109-lily do n’t know what to do with [myself]109-lily . [[My]109-lily maid]2742-my maid came up this morning to do some shopping for [me]109-lily , and was to go on to [Bellomont]3-bellomont at one o’clock , and [[[my]109-lily aunt]2743-my aunt ’s house]2744-my aunt ’s house is closed , and [I]109-lily do n’t know [a soul in [town]305-town]2745-a soul in town . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily glanced plaintively about [the station]319-the station . “ It IS hotter than [[Mrs. Van Osburgh]110-mrs. van osburgh ’s]2747-mrs. van osburgh ’s , after all . If [you]320-he can spare the time , do take [me]109-lily somewhere for a breath of air . ”[109-lily] [He]320-he declared [himself]320-he entirely at [her]109-lily disposal : the adventure struck [him]320-he as diverting . As [a spectator]321-a spectator , [he]320-he had always enjoyed [Lily Bart]109-lily ; and [his]320-he course lay so far out of [her]109-lily orbit that it amused [him]320-he to be drawn for a moment into the sudden intimacy which [her]109-lily proposal implied . “ Shall [we]2748-we go over to [Sherry ’s]5-sherry ’s for a cup of tea ? ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily smiled assentingly , and then made a slight grimace . “ [So many people]2749-so many people come up to [town]305-town on a Monday — [one]2737-one is sure to meet [a lot of [bores]2753-bores]2752-a lot of bores . [I]109-lily ’m as old as [the hills]2754-the hills , of course , and it ought not to make any difference ; but if [I’M]109-lily old enough , [you]320-he ’re not , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily objected gaily . “ [I]109-lily ’m dying for tea — but is n’t [there]2755-there [a quieter place]2756-a quieter place ? ”[109-lily] [He]320-he answered [her]109-lily smile , which rested on [him]320-he vividly . [Her]109-lily discretions interested [him]320-he almost as much as [her]109-lily imprudences : [he]320-he was so sure that both were part of the same carefully - elaborated plan . In judging [Miss Bart]109-lily , [he]320-he had always made use of the “ argument from design . ”[320-he] “ The resources of [New York]6-new york are rather meagre , ”[320-he] [he]320-he said ; “ but [I]320-he ’ll find a hansom first , and then [we]2757-we ’ll invent something . ”[320-he] [He]320-he led [her]109-lily through [the throng of returning holiday - makers]322-the throng of returning holiday - makers , past [sallow - faced girls in preposterous hats , and flat - chested women struggling with paper bundles and palm - leaf fans]323-sallow - faced girls in preposterous hats , and flat - chested women struggling with paper bundles and palm - leaf fans . Was it possible that [she]109-lily belonged to [the same race]324-the same race ? The dinginess , the crudity of [this average section of womanhood]325-this average section of womanhood made [him]320-he feel how highly specialized [she]109-lily was . A rapid shower had cooled the air , and clouds still hung refreshingly over [the moist street]326-the moist street . “ How delicious ! Let [us]327-they walk a little , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said as [they]327-they emerged from [the station]319-the station . [They]327-they turned into [Madison Avenue]7-madison avenue and began to stroll northward . As [she]109-lily moved beside [him]320-he , with [her]109-lily long light step , [Selden]108-selden was conscious of taking a luxurious pleasure in [her]109-lily nearness : in the modelling of [her]109-lily little ear , the crisp upward wave of [her]109-lily hair — was it ever so slightly brightened by art?—and the thick planting of [her]109-lily straight black lashes . Everything about [her]109-lily was at once vigorous and exquisite , at once strong and fine . [He]320-he had a confused sense that [she]109-lily must have cost a great deal to make , that [a great many dull and ugly people]329-a great many dull and ugly people must , in some mysterious way , have been sacrificed to produce [her]109-lily . [He]320-he was aware that the qualities distinguishing [her]109-lily from the herd of [her]109-lily sex were chiefly external : as though a fine glaze of beauty and fastidiousness had been applied to vulgar clay . Yet the analogy left [him]320-he unsatisfied , for a coarse texture will not take a high finish ; and was it not possible that the material was fine , but that circumstance had fashioned it into a futile shape ? As [he]320-he reached this point in [his]320-he speculations the sun came out , and [her]109-lily lifted parasol cut off [his]320-he enjoyment . A moment or two later [she]109-lily paused with a sigh . “ Oh , dear , [I]109-lily ’m so hot and thirsty — and what [a hideous place [New York]6-new york]2758-a hideous place new york is ! ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily looked despairingly up and down [the dreary thoroughfare]330-the dreary thoroughfare . “ [Other cities]2759-other cities put on [their]2759-other cities best clothes in summer , but [New York]6-new york seems to sit in [its]6-new york shirtsleeves . ”[109-lily] [Her]109-lily eyes wandered down [one of [the side streets]332-the side streets]331-one of the side streets . “ [Someone]2760-someone has had the humanity to plant a few trees over there . Let [us]333-us go into the shade . ”[109-lily] “ [I]108-selden am glad [[my]108-selden street]2761-my street meets with [your]108-selden approval , ”[108-selden] said [Selden]108-selden as [they]333-us turned the corner . “ [[Your]108-selden street]2762-your street ? Do [you]108-selden live [here]2763-here ? ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily glanced with interest along [the new brick and limestone house - fronts]334-the new brick and limestone house - fronts , fantastically varied in obedience to the American craving for novelty , but fresh and inviting with [their]334-the new brick and limestone house - fronts awnings and flower - boxes . “ Ah , yes — to be sure : [THE BENEDICK]8-the benedick . What [a nice - looking building]2764-a nice - looking building ! [I]109-lily do n’t think [I]109-lily ’ve ever seen [it]2764-a nice - looking building before . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily looked across at [the flat - house]335-the flat - house with [its]335-the flat - house marble porch and pseudo - Georgian facade . “ Which are [your]108-selden windows ? Those with the awnings down ? ”[109-lily] “ On the top floor — yes . ”[109-lily] “ And [that nice little balcony]2765-that nice little balcony is [yours]108-selden ? How cool it looks up there ! ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden paused a moment . “ Come up and see , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden suggested . “ [I]108-selden can give [you]109-lily a cup of tea in no time — and [you]109-lily wo n’t meet any bores . ”[108-selden] [Her]109-lily colour deepened — [she]109-lily still had the art of blushing at the right time — but [she]109-lily took the suggestion as lightly as it was made . “ Why not ? It ’s too tempting — [I’ll]109-lily take the risk , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily declared . “ Oh , [I]108-selden ’m not dangerous , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said in the same key . In truth , [he]108-selden had never liked [her]109-lily as well as at that moment . [He]108-selden knew [she]109-lily had accepted without afterthought : [he]108-selden could never be a factor in [her]109-lily calculations , and there was a surprise , a refreshment almost , in the spontaneity of [her]109-lily consent . On the threshold [he]108-selden paused a moment , feeling for [his]108-selden latchkey . “ There ’s [no one]2766-no one [here]2763-here ; but [I]108-selden have [a servant who is supposed to come in the mornings]2768-a servant who is supposed to come in the mornings , and it ’s just possible [he]2768-a servant who is supposed to come in the mornings may have put out the tea - things and provided some cake . ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden ushered [her]109-lily into a slip of [a hall hung with old prints]336-a hall hung with old prints . [She]109-lily noticed the letters and notes heaped on the table among [his]108-selden gloves and sticks ; then [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily in [a small library]337-a small library , dark but cheerful , with [its]337-a small library walls of books , a pleasantly faded Turkey rug , a littered desk and , as [he]108-selden had foretold , a tea - tray on a low table near the window . A breeze had sprung up , swaying inward the muslin curtains , and bringing a fresh scent of mignonette and petunias from the flower - box on [the balcony]338-the balcony . [Lily]109-lily sank with a sigh into one of the shabby leather chairs . “ How delicious to have [a place like this all to [one]2737-one ’s self]2769-a place like this all to one ’s self ! What a miserable thing it is to be [a woman]2771-a woman . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily leaned back in a luxury of discontent . [Selden]108-selden was rummaging in a cupboard for the cake . “ Even [women]2772-women , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said , “ have been known to enjoy the privileges of [a flat]2773-a flat . ”[108-selden] “ Oh , [governesses]2774-governesses — or [widows]2775-widows . But not [girls]2776-girls — not [poor , miserable , marriageable girls]2777-poor , miserable , marriageable girls ! ”[108-selden] “ [I]109-lily even know [a girl who lives in [a flat]2773-a flat]2778-a girl who lives in a flat . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily sat up in surprise . “ [You]108-selden do ? ”[109-lily] “ [I]108-selden do , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden assured [her]109-lily , emerging from the cupboard with the sought - for cake . “ Oh , [I]108-selden know — [you]108-selden mean [Gerty Farish]112-gerty . ”[108-selden] [She]109-lily smiled a little unkindly . “ But [I]109-lily said MARRIAGEABLE — and besides , [she]2778-a girl who lives in a flat has [a horrid little place]2780-a horrid little place , and [no maid]2781-no maid , and such queer things to eat . [[Her]2778-a girl who lives in a flat cook]2782-her cook does the washing and the food tastes of soap . [I]109-lily should hate that , [you]108-selden know . ”[109-lily] “ [You]109-lily should n’t dine with [her]2778-a girl who lives in a flat on wash - days , ”[108-selden] said [Selden]108-selden , cutting the cake . [They]339-they both laughed , and [he]108-selden knelt by the table to light the lamp under the kettle , while [she]109-lily measured out the tea into a little tea - pot of green glaze . As [he]108-selden watched [her]109-lily hand , polished as a bit of old ivory , with its slender pink nails , and the sapphire bracelet slipping over [her]109-lily wrist , [he]108-selden was struck with the irony of suggesting to [her]109-lily such a life as [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin [Gertrude Farish]113-miss farish had chosen . [She]109-lily was so evidently the victim of the civilization which had produced [her]109-lily , that the links of [her]109-lily bracelet seemed like manacles chaining [her]109-lily to [her]109-lily fate . [She]109-lily seemed to read [his]108-selden thought . “ It was horrid of [me]109-lily to say that of [Gerty]112-gerty , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said with charming compunction . “ [I]109-lily forgot [she]340-his cousin was [[your]108-selden cousin]2783-your cousin . But [we]2784-we ’re so different , [you]108-selden know : [she]340-his cousin likes being good , and [I]109-lily like being happy . And besides , [she]340-his cousin is free and [I]109-lily am not . If [I]109-lily were , [I]109-lily daresay [I]109-lily could manage to be happy even in [[her]340-his cousin flat]2785-her flat . It must be pure bliss to arrange the furniture just as [one]2737-one likes , and give all the horrors to [the ash - man]2787-the ash - man . If [I]109-lily could only do over [[[my]109-lily aunt]2743-my aunt ’s drawing - room]2789-my aunt ’s drawing - room [I]109-lily know [I]109-lily should be [a better woman]2790-a better woman . ”[109-lily] “ Is it so very bad ? ”[341-he] [he]341-he asked sympathetically . [She]342-i smiled at [him]341-he across the tea - pot which [she]342-i was holding up to be filled . “ That shows how seldom [you]341-he come [there]2755-there . Why do n’t [you]341-he come oftener ? ”[342-i] “ When [I]109-lily do come , it ’s not to look at [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s furniture . ”[109-lily] “ Nonsense , ”[342-i] [she]342-i said . “ [You]341-he do n’t come at all — and yet [we]2792-we get on so well when [we]2792-we meet . ”[342-i] “ Perhaps that ’s the reason , ”[341-he] [he]341-he answered promptly . “ [I]341-he ’m afraid [I]341-he have n’t any cream , [you]341-he know — shall [you]341-he mind a slice of lemon instead ? ”[341-he] “ [I]342-i shall like it better . ”[342-i] [She]342-i waited while [he]341-he cut the lemon and dropped a thin disk into [her]342-i cup . “ But that is not the reason , ”[342-i] [she]342-i insisted . “ The reason for what ? ”[342-i] “ For [your]341-he never coming . ”[342-i] [She]342-i leaned forward with a shade of perplexity in [her]342-i charming eyes . “ [I]342-i wish [I]342-i knew — [I]342-i wish [I]342-i could make [you]341-he out . Of course [I]342-i know there are [men who do n’t like [me]342-i]2793-men who do n’t like me — [one]2737-one can tell that at a glance . [I]342-i ’ve been about too long — [people]2804-people are getting tired of [me]342-i ; [they]2804-people are beginning to say [I]342-i ought to marry . ”[342-i] There was a moment ’s pause , during which [Selden]115-selden meditated one or two replies calculated to add a momentary zest to the situation ; but [he]115-selden rejected them in favour of the simple question : “ Well , why do n’t [you]115-selden ? ”[349-i] [She]349-i coloured and laughed . “ Ah , [I]349-i see [you]115-selden ARE [a friend]2800-a friend after all , and that is one of the disagreeable things [I]349-i was asking for . ”[349-i] “ It was n’t meant to be disagreeable , ”[115-selden] [he]115-selden returned amicably . “ Is n’t marriage [your]115-selden vocation ?
