Chapter 2 In [the hansom]390-the hansom [she]109-lily leaned back with a sigh . Why must [a girl]2828-a girl pay so dearly for [her]2828-a girl least escape from routine ? Why could [one]2737-one never do a natural thing without having to screen it behind a structure of artifice ? [She]109-lily had yielded to a passing impulse in going to [[Lawrence Selden]108-selden ’s rooms]393-lawrence selden ’s rooms , and it was so seldom that [she]109-lily could allow [herself]109-lily the luxury of an impulse ! This one , at any rate , was going to cost [her]109-lily rather more than [she]109-lily could afford . [She]109-lily was vexed to see that , in spite of so many years of vigilance , [she]109-lily had blundered twice within five minutes . That stupid story about [her]109-lily dress - maker was bad enough — it would have been so simple to tell [Rosedale]124-rosedale that [she]109-lily had been taking tea with [Selden]108-selden ! The mere statement of the fact would have rendered it innocuous . But , after having let [herself]109-lily be surprised in a falsehood , it was doubly stupid to snub the witness of [her]109-lily discomfiture . If [she]109-lily had had the presence of mind to let [Rosedale]124-rosedale drive [her]109-lily to [the station]319-the station , the concession might have purchased [his]124-rosedale silence . [He]124-rosedale had [his]124-rosedale race ’s accuracy in the appraisal of values , and to be seen walking down [the platform]309-the platform at the crowded afternoon hour in the company of [Miss Lily Bart]109-lily would have been money in [his]124-rosedale pocket , as [he]124-rosedale might [himself]124-rosedale have phrased it . [He]124-rosedale knew , of course , that there would be a large house - party at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and the possibility of being taken for [one of [[Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s guests]397-mrs. trenor ’s guests]396-one of mrs. trenor ’s guests was doubtless included in [his]124-rosedale calculations . [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale was still at a stage in [his]124-rosedale social ascent when it was of importance to produce such impressions . The provoking part was that [Lily]109-lily knew all this — knew how easy it would have been to silence [him]124-rosedale on the spot , and how difficult it might be to do so afterward . [Mr. Simon Rosedale]124-rosedale was [a man who made it [his]124-rosedale business to know everything about [every one , whose idea of showing [himself]124-rosedale to be at [home]400-home in society]399-every one , whose idea of showing himself to be at home in society was to display an inconvenient familiarity with the habits of [those with whom [he]124-rosedale wished to be thought intimate]401-those with whom he wished to be thought intimate]398-a man who made it his business to know everything about every one , whose idea of showing himself to be at home in society was to display an inconvenient familiarity with the habits of those with whom he wished to be thought intimate . [Lily]109-lily was sure that within twenty - four hours the story of [her]109-lily visiting [her]109-lily dress - maker at [the Benedick]8-the benedick would be in active circulation among [[Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s acquaintances]402-mr. rosedale ’s acquaintances . The worst of it was that [she]109-lily had always snubbed and ignored [him]124-rosedale . On [his]124-rosedale first appearance — when [[her]109-lily improvident cousin]403-her improvident cousin , [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney , had obtained for [him]124-rosedale ( in return for favours too easily guessed ) a card to one of the vast impersonal [Van Osburgh]119-gwen “ crushes”—Rosedale[124-rosedale] , with that mixture of artistic sensibility and business astuteness which characterizes [his]124-rosedale race , had instantly gravitated toward [Miss Bart]109-lily . [She]109-lily understood [his]124-rosedale motives , for [her]109-lily own course was guided by as nice calculations . Training and experience had taught [her]109-lily to be hospitable to [newcomers]404-newcomers , since the most unpromising might be useful later on , and there were plenty of available OUBLIETTES to swallow [them]405-them if they were not . But some intuitive repugnance , getting the better of years of social discipline , had made [her]109-lily push [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale into [his]124-rosedale OUBLIETTE without a trial . [He]124-rosedale had left behind only the ripple of amusement which [his]124-rosedale speedy despatch had caused among [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends ; and though later ( to shift the metaphor ) [he]124-rosedale reappeared lower down [the stream]407-the stream , it was only in fleeting glimpses , with long submergences between . Hitherto [Lily]109-lily had been undisturbed by scruples . In [her]109-lily little set [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale had been pronounced “ impossible , ”[124-rosedale] and [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney roundly snubbed for [his]124-rosedale attempt to pay [his]124-rosedale debts in dinner invitations . [Even [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , whose taste for variety had led [her]123-mrs. trenor into some hazardous experiments]123-mrs. trenor , resisted [Jack]125-jack stepney ’s attempts to disguise [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale as a novelty , and declared that [he]124-rosedale was [the same little Jew who had been served up and rejected at the social board a dozen times within [her]123-mrs. trenor memory]408-the same little jew who had been served up and rejected at the social board a dozen times within her memory ; and while [Judy Trenor]126-judy was obdurate there was small chance of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s penetrating beyond the outer limbo of the [Van Osburgh]119-gwen crushes . [Jack]125-jack stepney gave up the contest with a laughing “ [You]2852-you ’ll see , ”[125-jack stepney] and , sticking manfully to [his]124-rosedale guns , showed [himself]125-jack stepney with [Rosedale]124-rosedale at [the fashionable restaurants]409-the fashionable restaurants , in company with [the personally vivid if socially obscure ladies who are available for such purposes]410-the personally vivid if socially obscure ladies who are available for such purposes . But the attempt had hitherto been vain , and as [Rosedale]124-rosedale undoubtedly paid for the dinners , the laugh remained with [[his]124-rosedale debtor]411-his debtor . [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , it will be seen , was thus far not a factor to be feared — unless [one]2737-one put [one]2737-one ’s self in [his]2737-one power . And this was precisely what [Miss Bart]109-lily had done . [[Her]109-lily clumsy fib]414-her clumsy fib had let [him]124-rosedale see that [she]109-lily had something to conceal ; and [she]109-lily was sure [he]124-rosedale had a score to settle with [her]109-lily . Something in [his]124-rosedale smile told [her]109-lily [he]124-rosedale had not forgotten . [She]109-lily turned from the thought with a little shiver , but it hung on [her]109-lily all the way to [the station]319-the station , and dogged [her]109-lily down [the platform]309-the platform with the persistency of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale [himself]124-rosedale . [She]109-lily had just time to take [her]109-lily seat before [the train]2843-the train started ; but having arranged [herself]109-lily in [her]109-lily corner with the instinctive feeling for effect which never forsook [her]109-lily , [she]109-lily glanced about in the hope of seeing [some other member of [the Trenors]111-gus ’ party]418-some other member of the trenors ’ party . [She]109-lily wanted to get away from [herself]109-lily , and conversation was the only means of escape that [she]109-lily knew . [Her]109-lily search was rewarded by the discovery of [a very blond young man with a soft reddish beard , who , at the other end of [the carriage]420-the carriage]419-a very blond young man with a soft reddish beard , who , at the other end of the carriage , appeared to be dissembling [himself]419-a very blond young man with a soft reddish beard , who , at the other end of the carriage behind an unfolded newspaper . [Lily]109-lily ’s eye brightened , and a faint smile relaxed the drawn lines of [her]109-lily mouth . [She]109-lily had known that [Mr. Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce was to be at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , but [she]109-lily had not counted on the luck of having [him]127-mr. gryce to [herself]109-lily in [the train]2843-the train ; and the fact banished all perturbing thoughts of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale . Perhaps , after all , the day was to end more favourably than it had begun . [She]109-lily began to cut the pages of a novel , tranquilly studying [her]109-lily prey through downcast lashes while [she]109-lily organized a method of attack . Something in [his]124-rosedale attitude of conscious absorption told [her]109-lily that [he]124-rosedale was aware of [her]109-lily presence : [no one]2766-no one had ever been quite so engrossed in an evening paper ! [She]109-lily guessed that [he]124-rosedale was too shy to come up to [her]109-lily , and that [she]109-lily would have to devise some means of approach which should not appear to be an advance on [her]109-lily part . It amused [her]109-lily to think that [any one as rich as [Mr. Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce]423-any one as rich as mr. percy gryce should be shy ; but [she]109-lily was gifted with treasures of indulgence for such idiosyncrasies , and besides , [his]124-rosedale timidity might serve [her]109-lily purpose better than too much assurance . [She]109-lily had the art of giving self - confidence to [the embarrassed]424-the embarrassed , but [she]109-lily was not equally sure of being able to embarrass [the self - confident]425-the self - confident . [She]109-lily waited till [the train]2843-the train had emerged from [the tunnel]427-the tunnel and was racing between [the ragged edges of [the northern suburbs]429-the northern suburbs]428-the ragged edges of the northern suburbs . Then , as it lowered [its]2843-the train speed near [Yonkers]16-yonkers , [she]109-lily rose from [her]109-lily seat and drifted slowly down [the carriage]420-the carriage . As [she]109-lily passed [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , [the train]2843-the train gave a lurch , and [he]127-mr. gryce was aware of a slender hand gripping the back of [his]127-mr. gryce chair . [He]127-mr. gryce rose with a start , [his]127-mr. gryce ingenuous face looking as though it had been dipped in crimson : even the reddish tint in [his]127-mr. gryce beard seemed to deepen . [The train]2843-the train swayed again , almost flinging [Miss Bart]109-lily into [his]127-mr. gryce arms . [She]109-lily steadied [herself]109-lily with a laugh and drew back ; but [he]127-mr. gryce was enveloped in the scent of [her]109-lily dress , and [his]127-mr. gryce shoulder had felt [her]109-lily fugitive touch . “ Oh , [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , is it [you]127-mr. gryce ? [I]109-lily ’m so sorry — [I]109-lily was trying to find [the porter]2853-the porter and get some tea . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily held out [her]109-lily hand as [the train]2843-the train resumed its level rush , and [they]434-they stood exchanging a few words in [the aisle]435-the aisle . Yes — [he]127-mr. gryce was going to [Bellomont]3-bellomont . [He]127-mr. gryce had heard [she]109-lily was to be of [the party]436-the party — [he]127-mr. gryce blushed again as [he]127-mr. gryce admitted it . And was [he]127-mr. gryce to be [there]2755-there for a whole week ? How delightful ! But at this point [one or two belated passengers from [the last station]439-the last station]438-one or two belated passengers from the last station forced [their]438-one or two belated passengers from the last station way into [the carriage]420-the carriage , and [Lily]109-lily had to retreat to [her]109-lily seat . “ The chair next to [mine]109-lily is empty — do take it , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said over [her]109-lily shoulder ; and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , with considerable embarrassment , succeeded in effecting an exchange which enabled [him]127-mr. gryce to transport [himself]127-mr. gryce and [his]127-mr. gryce bags to [her]109-lily side . “ Ah — and here is [the porter]2853-the porter , and perhaps [we]2855-we can have some tea . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily signalled to [that official]441-that official , and in a moment , with the ease that seemed to attend the fulfilment of all [her]109-lily wishes , a little table had been set up between the seats , and [she]109-lily had helped [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce to bestow [his]127-mr. gryce encumbering properties beneath it . When the tea came [he]127-mr. gryce watched [her]109-lily in silent fascination while [her]109-lily hands flitted above the tray , looking miraculously fine and slender in contrast to the coarse china and lumpy bread . It seemed wonderful to [him]127-mr. gryce that [any one]442-any one should perform with such careless ease the difficult task of making tea in public in [a lurching train]443-a lurching train . [He]127-mr. gryce would never have dared to order it for [himself]127-mr. gryce , lest [he]127-mr. gryce should attract the notice of [[his]127-mr. gryce fellow - passengers]444-his fellow - passengers ; but , secure in the shelter of [her]109-lily conspicuousness , [he]127-mr. gryce sipped the inky draught with a delicious sense of exhilaration . [Lily]109-lily , with the flavour of [Selden]108-selden ’s caravan tea on [her]109-lily lips , had no great fancy to drown it in the railway brew which seemed such nectar to [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion ; but , rightly judging that one of the charms of tea is the fact of drinking it together , [she]109-lily proceeded to give the last touch to [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s enjoyment by smiling at [him]127-mr. gryce across [her]109-lily lifted cup . “ Is it quite right — [I]109-lily have n’t made it too strong ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily asked solicitously ; and [he]127-mr. gryce replied with conviction that [he]127-mr. gryce had never tasted better tea . “ [I]109-lily daresay it is true , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily reflected ; and [her]109-lily imagination was fired by the thought that [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , who might have sounded the depths of the most complex self - indulgence , was perhaps actually taking [his]127-mr. gryce first journey alone with [a pretty woman]446-a pretty woman . It struck [her]109-lily as providential that [she]109-lily should be the instrument of [his]127-mr. gryce initiation . [Some girls]447-some girls would not have known how to manage [him]127-mr. gryce . [They]447-some girls would have over - emphasized the novelty of the adventure , trying to make [him]127-mr. gryce feel in it the zest of an escapade . But [Lily]109-lily ’s methods were more delicate . [She]109-lily remembered that [[her]109-lily cousin]448-her cousin [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney had once defined [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce as [the young man who had promised [[his]127-mr. gryce mother]2809-his mother never to go out in the rain without [his]127-mr. gryce overshoes]449-the young man who had promised his mother never to go out in the rain without his overshoes ; and acting on this hint , [she]109-lily resolved to impart a gently domestic air to the scene , in the hope that [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion , instead of feeling that [he]127-mr. gryce was doing something reckless or unusual , would merely be led to dwell on the advantage of always having [a companion]452-a companion to make one ’s tea in [the train]2843-the train . But in spite of [her]109-lily efforts , conversation flagged after the tray had been removed , and [she]109-lily was driven to take a fresh measurement of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s limitations . It was not , after all , opportunity but imagination that [he]127-mr. gryce lacked : [he]127-mr. gryce had a mental palate which would never learn to distinguish between railway tea and nectar . There was , however , one topic [she]109-lily could rely on : one spring that [she]109-lily had only to touch to set [his]127-mr. gryce simple machinery in motion . [She]109-lily had refrained from touching it because it was a last resource , and [she]109-lily had relied on other arts to stimulate other sensations ; but as a settled look of dulness began to creep over [his]127-mr. gryce candid features , [she]109-lily saw that extreme measures were necessary . “ And how , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said , leaning forward , “ are [you]127-mr. gryce getting on with [your]127-mr. gryce Americana ? ”[109-lily] [His]127-mr. gryce eye became a degree less opaque : it was as though an incipient film had been removed from it , and [she]109-lily felt the pride of [a skilful operator]454-a skilful operator . “ [I]127-mr. gryce ’ve got a few new things , ”[127-mr. gryce] [he]127-mr. gryce said , suffused with pleasure , but lowering [his]127-mr. gryce voice as though [he]127-mr. gryce feared [[his]127-mr. gryce fellow - passengers]444-his fellow - passengers might be in league to despoil [him]127-mr. gryce . [She]109-lily returned a sympathetic enquiry , and gradually [he]127-mr. gryce was drawn on to talk of [his]127-mr. gryce latest purchases . It was the one subject which enabled [him]127-mr. gryce to forget [himself]127-mr. gryce , or allowed [him]127-mr. gryce , rather , to remember [himself]127-mr. gryce without constraint , because [he]127-mr. gryce was at [home]400-home in it , and could assert a superiority that there were few to dispute . [Hardly any of [[his]127-mr. gryce acquaintances]458-his acquaintances]457-hardly any of his acquaintances cared for [Americana]117-americana , or knew anything about [them]458-his acquaintances ; and the consciousness of this ignorance threw [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s knowledge into agreeable relief . The only difficulty was to introduce the topic and to keep it to the front ; [most people]459-most people showed no desire to have [their]459-most people ignorance dispelled , and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was like [a merchant whose warehouses are crammed with an unmarketable commodity]460-a merchant whose warehouses are crammed with an unmarketable commodity . But [Miss Bart]109-lily , it appeared , really did want to know about [Americana]117-americana ; and moreover , [she]109-lily was already sufficiently informed to make the task of farther instruction as easy as it was agreeable . [She]109-lily questioned [him]127-mr. gryce intelligently , [she]109-lily heard [him]127-mr. gryce submissively ; and , prepared for the look of lassitude which usually crept over [[his]127-mr. gryce listeners]461-his listeners ’ faces , [he]127-mr. gryce grew eloquent under [her]109-lily receptive gaze . The “ points ”[127-mr. gryce] [she]109-lily had had the presence of mind to glean from [Selden]108-selden , in anticipation of this very contingency , were serving [her]109-lily to such good purpose that [she]109-lily began to think [her]109-lily visit to [him]127-mr. gryce had been the luckiest incident of the day . [She]109-lily had once more shown [her]109-lily talent for profiting by the unexpected , and dangerous theories as to the advisability of yielding to impulse were germinating under the surface of smiling attention which [she]109-lily continued to present to [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s sensations , if less definite , were equally agreeable . [He]127-mr. gryce felt the confused titillation with which [the lower organisms]463-the lower organisms welcome the gratification of [their]463-the lower organisms needs , and all [his]127-mr. gryce senses floundered in a vague well - being , through which [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s personality was dimly but pleasantly perceptible . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s interest in [Americana]117-americana had not originated with [himself]127-mr. gryce : it was impossible to think of [him]127-mr. gryce as evolving any taste of [his]127-mr. gryce own . [An uncle]464-an uncle had left [him]127-mr. gryce a collection already noted among [bibliophiles]465-bibliophiles ; the existence of the collection was the only fact that had ever shed glory on the name of [Gryce]127-mr. gryce , and [the nephew]466-the nephew took as much pride in [his]466-the nephew inheritance as though it had been [his]466-the nephew own work . Indeed , [he]127-mr. gryce gradually came to regard it as such , and to feel a sense of personal complacency when [he]127-mr. gryce chanced on any reference to [the Gryce Americana]117-americana . Anxious as [he]127-mr. gryce was to avoid personal notice , [he]127-mr. gryce took , in the printed mention of [his]127-mr. gryce name , a pleasure so exquisite and excessive that it seemed a compensation for [his]127-mr. gryce shrinking from publicity . To enjoy the sensation as often as possible , [he]127-mr. gryce subscribed to all the reviews dealing with book - collecting in general , and American history in particular , and as allusions to [[his]127-mr. gryce library]467-his library abounded in the pages of these journals , which formed [his]127-mr. gryce only reading , [he]127-mr. gryce came to regard [himself]127-mr. gryce as figuring prominently in the public eye , and to enjoy the thought of the interest which would be excited if [the persons [he]127-mr. gryce met in [the street]310-the street]468-the persons he met in the street , or sat among in travelling , were suddenly to be told that [he]127-mr. gryce was [the possessor of the Gryce Americana]470-the possessor of the gryce americana . Most timidities have such secret compensations , and [Miss Bart]109-lily was discerning enough to know that the inner vanity is generally in proportion to the outer self - depreciation . With [a more confident person]471-a more confident person [she]109-lily would not have dared to dwell so long on one topic , or to show such exaggerated interest in it ; but [she]109-lily had rightly guessed that [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s egoism was a thirsty soil , requiring constant nurture from without . [Miss Bart]109-lily had the gift of following an undercurrent of thought while [she]109-lily appeared to be sailing on the surface of conversation ; and in this case [her]109-lily mental excursion took the form of a rapid survey of [Mr. Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s future as combined with [her]109-lily own . [The Gryces]128-the gryces were from [Albany]17-albany , and but lately introduced to [the metropolis]472-the metropolis , where [the mother]473-the mother and [son]474-son had come , after [old Jefferson Gryce]118-old jefferson gryce ’s death , to take possession of [[his]127-mr. gryce house in [Madison Avenue]7-madison avenue]475-his house in madison avenue — [an appalling house]476-an appalling house , all brown stone without and black walnut within , with [the Gryce library]477-the gryce library in [a fire - proof annex that looked like [a mausoleum]479-a mausoleum]478-a fire - proof annex that looked like a mausoleum . [Lily]109-lily , however , knew all about [them]480-them : [young Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s arrival had fluttered the maternal breasts of [New York]6-new york , and when [a girl]2828-a girl has [no mother]482-no mother to palpitate for [her]2828-a girl [she]2828-a girl must needs be on the alert for [herself]2828-a girl . [Lily]109-lily , therefore , had not only contrived to put [herself]109-lily in [the young man]483-the young man ’s way , but had made the acquaintance of [Mrs. Gryce]129-mrs. gryce , [a monumental woman with the voice of a pulpit orator]484-a monumental woman with the voice of a pulpit orator and a mind preoccupied with the iniquities of [[her]129-mrs. gryce servants]485-her servants , who came sometimes to sit with [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston and learn from [that lady]486-that lady how [she]129-mrs. gryce managed to prevent [the kitchen - maid]487-the kitchen - maid ’s smuggling groceries out of [the house]488-the house . [Mrs. Gryce]129-mrs. gryce had a kind of impersonal benevolence : cases of individual need [she]129-mrs. gryce regarded with suspicion , but [she]129-mrs. gryce subscribed to [Institutions]489-institutions when [their]489-institutions annual reports showed an impressive surplus . [Her]129-mrs. gryce domestic duties were manifold , for they extended from furtive inspections of [[the servants]490-the servants ’ bedrooms]491-the servants ’ bedrooms to unannounced descents to [the cellar]492-the cellar ; but [she]129-mrs. gryce had never allowed [herself]129-mrs. gryce many pleasures . Once , however , [she]129-mrs. gryce had had a special edition of the Sarum Rule printed in rubric and presented to [every clergyman in [the diocese]494-the diocese]493-every clergyman in the diocese ; and the gilt album in which [their]493-every clergyman in the diocese letters of thanks were pasted formed the chief ornament of [[her]129-mrs. gryce drawing - room table]495-her drawing - room table . [Percy]129-mrs. gryce had been brought up in the principles which so excellent [a woman]2771-a woman was sure to inculcate . Every form of prudence and suspicion had been grafted on a nature originally reluctant and cautious , with the result that it would have seemed hardly needful for [Mrs. Gryce]129-mrs. gryce to extract [his]497-his promise about the overshoes , so little likely was [he]497-his to hazard [himself]497-his abroad in the rain . After attaining [his]497-his majority , and coming into the fortune which [the late Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce had made out of a patent device for excluding fresh air from [hotels]498-hotels , [the young man]483-the young man continued to live with [[his]497-his mother]2809-his mother in [Albany]17-albany ; but on [Jefferson Gryce]118-old jefferson gryce ’s death , when [another large property]501-another large property passed into [[her]2809-his mother son]502-her son ’s hands , [Mrs. Gryce]129-mrs. gryce thought that what [she]129-mrs. gryce called [his]497-his “ interests ”[129-mrs. gryce] demanded [his]497-his presence in [New York]6-new york . [She]129-mrs. gryce accordingly installed [herself]129-mrs. gryce in [the Madison Avenue house]503-the madison avenue house , and [Percy]129-mrs. gryce , whose sense of duty was not inferior to [[his]497-his mother]2809-his mother ’s , spent all [his]497-his week days in [the handsome Broad Street office where a batch of [pale men on small salaries]506-pale men on small salaries had grown grey in the management of [the Gryce estate]507-the gryce estate]505-the handsome broad street office where a batch of pale men on small salaries had grown grey in the management of the gryce estate , and where [he]497-his was initiated with becoming reverence into every detail of the art of accumulation . As far as [Lily]109-lily could learn , this had hitherto been [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s only occupation , and [she]109-lily might have been pardoned for thinking it not too hard a task to interest [a young man who had been kept on such low diet]508-a young man who had been kept on such low diet . At any rate , [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily so completely in command of the situation that [she]109-lily yielded to a sense of security in which all fear of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , and of the difficulties on which that fear was contingent , vanished beyond the edge of thought . The stopping of [the train]2843-the train at [Garrisons]18-garrisons would not have distracted [her]109-lily from these thoughts , had [she]109-lily not caught a sudden look of distress in [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion ’s eye . [His]445-her companion seat faced toward the door , and [she]109-lily guessed that [he]445-her companion had been perturbed by the approach of [an acquaintance]511-an acquaintance ; a fact confirmed by the turning of heads and general sense of commotion which [her]109-lily own entrance into [a railway - carriage]512-a railway - carriage was apt to produce . [She]109-lily knew the symptoms at once , and was not surprised to be hailed by the high notes of [a pretty woman]446-a pretty woman , who entered [the train]2843-the train accompanied by [a maid]515-a maid , [a bull - terrier]516-a bull - terrier , and [a footman staggering under a load of bags and dressing - cases]517-a footman staggering under a load of bags and dressing - cases . “ Oh , [Lily]109-lily — are [you]109-lily going to [Bellomont]3-bellomont ? Then [you]109-lily ca n’t let [me]446-a pretty woman have [your]109-lily seat , [I]446-a pretty woman suppose ? But [I]446-a pretty woman MUST have a seat in [this carriage]2856-this carriage — [porter]2857-porter , [you]109-lily must find [me]446-a pretty woman a place at once . Ca n’t some one be put somewhere else ? [I]446-a pretty woman want to be with [[my]446-a pretty woman friends]2827-my friends . Oh , how do [you]109-lily do , [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ? Do please make [him]127-mr. gryce understand that [I]446-a pretty woman must have a seat next to [you]109-lily and [Lily]109-lily . ”[446-a pretty woman] [Mrs. George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , regardless of the mild efforts of [a traveller with a carpet - bag , who was doing [his]518-a traveller with a carpet - bag , who was doing his best to make room for her by getting out of the train best to make room for [her]131-mrs. dorset by getting out of [the train]2843-the train]518-a traveller with a carpet - bag , who was doing his best to make room for her by getting out of the train , stood in the middle of [the aisle]435-the aisle , diffusing about [her]131-mrs. dorset that general sense of exasperation which [a pretty woman on [her]131-mrs. dorset travels]521-a pretty woman on her travels not infrequently creates . [She]131-mrs. dorset was smaller and thinner than [Lily Bart]109-lily , with a restless pliability of pose , as if [she]131-mrs. dorset could have been crumpled up and run through a ring , like the sinuous draperies [she]131-mrs. dorset affected . [Her]131-mrs. dorset small pale face seemed the mere setting of a pair of dark exaggerated eyes , of which the visionary gaze contrasted curiously with [her]131-mrs. dorset self - assertive tone and gestures ; so that , as one of [[her]131-mrs. dorset friends]406-her friends observed , [she]131-mrs. dorset was like [a disembodied spirit who took up a great deal of room]523-a disembodied spirit who took up a great deal of room . Having finally discovered that the seat adjoining [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s was at [her]131-mrs. dorset disposal , [she]131-mrs. dorset possessed [herself]131-mrs. dorset of it with a farther displacement of [her]131-mrs. dorset surroundings , explaining meanwhile that [she]131-mrs. dorset had come across from [Mount Kisco]132-mount kisco in [[her]131-mrs. dorset [motor - car]525-motor - car]524-her motor - car that morning , and had been kicking [her]131-mrs. dorset heels for an hour at [Garrisons]18-garrisons , without even the alleviation of a cigarette , [her]131-mrs. dorset brute of [a husband]526-a husband having neglected to replenish [her]131-mrs. dorset case before [they]527-they parted that morning . “ And at this hour of the day [I]131-mrs. dorset do n’t suppose [you]2859-you ’ve a single one left , have [you]2859-you , [Lily]109-lily ? ”[131-mrs. dorset] [she]131-mrs. dorset plaintively concluded . [Miss Bart]109-lily caught the startled glance of [Mr. Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce , whose own lips were never defiled by tobacco . “ What an absurd question , [Bertha]133-bertha ! ”[131-mrs. dorset] [she]131-mrs. dorset exclaimed , blushing at the thought of [the store [she]131-mrs. dorset had laid in at [Lawrence Selden ’s]108-selden]528-the store she had laid in at lawrence selden ’s . “ Why , do n’t [you]133-bertha smoke ? Since when have [you]133-bertha given it up ? What — [you]133-bertha never — — And [you]133-bertha do n’t either , [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ? Ah , of course — how stupid of [me]131-mrs. dorset — [I]131-mrs. dorset understand . ”[131-mrs. dorset] And [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset leaned back against [her]131-mrs. dorset travelling cushions with a smile which made [Lily]109-lily wish there had been no vacant seat beside [her]109-lily own . Chapter 3 Bridge at [Bellomont]3-bellomont usually lasted till the small hours ; and when [Lily]109-lily went to bed that night [she]109-lily had played too long for [her]109-lily own good . Feeling no desire for the self - communion which awaited [her]109-lily in [[her]109-lily room]529-her room , [she]109-lily lingered on the broad stairway , looking down into [the hall below]530-the hall below , where [the last card - players]531-the last card - players were grouped about the tray of tall glasses and silver - collared decanters which [the butler]532-the butler had just placed on a low table near the fire . [The hall]533-the hall was arcaded , with a gallery supported on columns of pale yellow marble . Tall clumps of flowering plants were grouped against a background of dark foliage in the angles of the walls . On the crimson carpet a deer - hound and [two or three spaniels]534-two or three spaniels dozed luxuriously before the fire , and the light from the great central lantern overhead shed a brightness on [the women]2741-the women ’s hair and struck sparks from [their]2741-the women jewels as [they]2741-the women moved . There were moments when such scenes delighted [Lily]109-lily , when [they]2741-the women gratified [her]109-lily sense of beauty and [her]109-lily craving for the external finish of life ; there were others when [they]2741-the women gave a sharper edge to the meagreness of [her]109-lily own opportunities . This was one of the moments when the sense of contrast was uppermost , and [she]109-lily turned away impatiently as [Mrs. George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , glittering in serpentine spangles , drew [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce in [her]131-mrs. dorset wake to [a confidential nook beneath [the gallery]537-the gallery]536-a confidential nook beneath the gallery . It was not that [Miss Bart]109-lily was afraid of losing [her]109-lily newly - acquired hold over [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset might startle or dazzle [him]127-mr. gryce , but [she]131-mrs. dorset had neither the skill nor the patience to effect [his]127-mr. gryce capture . [She]131-mrs. dorset was too self - engrossed to penetrate the recesses of [his]127-mr. gryce shyness , and besides , why should [she]131-mrs. dorset care to give [herself]131-mrs. dorset the trouble ? At most it might amuse [her]131-mrs. dorset to make sport of [his]127-mr. gryce simplicity for an evening — after that [he]127-mr. gryce would be merely a burden to [her]131-mrs. dorset , and knowing this , [she]131-mrs. dorset was far too experienced to encourage [him]127-mr. gryce . But the mere thought of [that other woman , who could take [a man]2811-a man up and toss [him]2811-a man aside as [she]131-mrs. dorset willed , without having to regard [him]2811-a man as a possible factor in [her]131-mrs. dorset plans]538-that other woman , who could take a man up and toss him aside as she willed , without having to regard him as a possible factor in her plans , filled [Lily Bart]109-lily with envy . [She]109-lily had been bored all the afternoon by [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce — the mere thought seemed to waken an echo of [his]127-mr. gryce droning voice — but [she]109-lily could not ignore [him]127-mr. gryce on the morrow , [she]109-lily must follow up [her]109-lily success , must submit to more boredom , must be ready with fresh compliances and adaptabilities , and all on the bare chance that [he]127-mr. gryce might ultimately decide to do [her]109-lily the honour of boring [her]109-lily for life . It was a hateful fate — but how escape from it ? What choice had [she]109-lily ? To be [herself]109-lily , or [a Gerty Farish]112-gerty . As [she]109-lily entered [[her]109-lily bedroom]540-her bedroom , with [its]540-her bedroom softly - shaded lights , [her]109-lily lace dressing - gown lying across the silken bedspread , [her]109-lily little embroidered slippers before the fire , a vase of carnations filling the air with perfume , and the last novels and magazines lying uncut on a table beside the reading - lamp , [she]109-lily had a vision of [[Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s cramped flat]541-miss farish ’s cramped flat , with [its]540-her bedroom cheap conveniences and hideous wall - papers . No ; [she]109-lily was not made for mean and shabby surroundings , for the squalid compromises of poverty . [Her]109-lily whole being dilated in an atmosphere of luxury ; it was the background [she]109-lily required , the only climate [she]109-lily could breathe in . But the luxury of others was not what [she]109-lily wanted . A few years ago it had sufficed [her]109-lily : [she]109-lily had taken [her]109-lily daily meed of pleasure without caring who provided it . Now [she]109-lily was beginning to chafe at the obligations it imposed , to feel [herself]109-lily [a mere pensioner]542-a mere pensioner on the splendour which had once seemed to belong to [her]109-lily . There were even moments when [she]109-lily was conscious of having to pay [her]109-lily way . For a long time [she]109-lily had refused to play bridge . [She]109-lily knew [she]109-lily could not afford it , and [she]109-lily was afraid of acquiring so expensive a taste . [She]109-lily had seen the danger exemplified in [more than one of [[her]109-lily associates]544-her associates]543-more than one of her associates — in [young Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton , for instance , [the charming fair boy now seated in abject rapture at the elbow of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher]545-the charming fair boy now seated in abject rapture at the elbow of mrs. fisher , [a striking divorcee with eyes and gowns as emphatic as the head]546-a striking divorcee with eyes and gowns as emphatic as the head - lines of [her]135-mrs. fisher “ case . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily could remember when [young Silverton]134-ned silverton had stumbled into [their]547-their circle , with the air of [a strayed Arcadian who has published charming sonnets in [his]134-ned silverton college journal]548-a strayed arcadian who has published charming sonnets in his college journal . Since then [he]134-ned silverton had developed a taste for [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher and bridge , and the latter at least had involved [him]134-ned silverton in expenses from which [he]134-ned silverton had been more than once rescued by [harassed maiden sisters]549-harassed maiden sisters , who treasured the sonnets , and went without sugar in [their]549-harassed maiden sisters tea to keep [their]549-harassed maiden sisters darling afloat . [Ned]134-ned silverton ’s case was familiar to [Lily]109-lily : [she]109-lily had seen [his]134-ned silverton charming eyes — which had a good deal more poetry in them than the sonnets — change from surprise to amusement , and from amusement to anxiety , as [he]134-ned silverton passed under the spell of [the terrible god of chance]550-the terrible god of chance ; and [she]109-lily was afraid of discovering the same symptoms in [her]109-lily own case . For in the last year [she]109-lily had found that [[her]109-lily hostesses]551-her hostesses expected [her]109-lily to take a place at the card - table . It was one of the taxes [she]109-lily had to pay for [their]551-her hostesses prolonged hospitality , and for the dresses and trinkets which occasionally replenished [her]109-lily insufficient wardrobe . And since [she]109-lily had played regularly the passion had grown on [her]109-lily . Once or twice of late [she]109-lily had won a large sum , and instead of keeping it against future losses , had spent it in dress or jewelry ; and the desire to atone for this imprudence , combined with the increasing exhilaration of the game , drove [her]109-lily to risk higher stakes at each fresh venture . [She]109-lily tried to excuse [herself]109-lily on the plea that , in the Trenor set , if [one]2737-one played at all [one]2737-one must either play high or be set down as priggish or stingy ; but [she]109-lily knew that the gambling passion was upon [her]109-lily , and that in [her]109-lily present surroundings there was small hope of resisting it . Tonight the luck had been persistently bad , and the little gold purse which hung among [her]109-lily trinkets was almost empty when [she]109-lily returned to [[her]109-lily room]529-her room . [She]109-lily unlocked [the wardrobe]555-the wardrobe , and taking out [her]109-lily jewel - case , looked under the tray for the roll of bills from which [she]109-lily had replenished the purse before going down to dinner . Only twenty dollars were left : the discovery was so startling that for a moment [she]109-lily fancied [she]109-lily must have been robbed . Then [she]109-lily took paper and pencil , and seating [herself]109-lily at the writing - table , tried to reckon up what [she]109-lily had spent during the day . [Her]109-lily head was throbbing with fatigue , and [she]109-lily had to go over the figures again and again ; but at last it became clear to [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily had lost three hundred dollars at cards . [She]109-lily took out [her]109-lily cheque - book to see if [her]109-lily balance was larger than [she]109-lily remembered , but found [she]109-lily had erred in the other direction . Then [she]109-lily returned to [her]109-lily calculations ; but figure as [she]109-lily would , [she]109-lily could not conjure back the vanished three hundred dollars . It was the sum [she]109-lily had set aside to pacify [[her]109-lily dress - maker]556-her dress - maker — unless [she]109-lily should decide to use it as a sop to [the jeweller]557-the jeweller . At any rate , [she]109-lily had so many uses for it that its very insufficiency had caused [her]109-lily to play high in the hope of doubling it . But of course [she]109-lily had lost — [she]109-lily who needed every penny , while [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , whose husband showered money on [her]109-lily , must have pocketed at least five hundred , and [Judy Trenor]126-judy [, who could have afforded to lose a thousand a night]558-, who could have afforded to lose a thousand a night , had left the table clutching such a heap of bills that [she]109-lily had been unable to shake hands with [[her]109-lily guests]559-her guests when [they]559-her guests bade [her]109-lily good night . A world in which such things could be seemed [a miserable place to [Lily Bart]109-lily]560-a miserable place to lily bart ; but then [she]109-lily had never been able to understand the laws of [a universe which was so ready to leave [her]109-lily out of its calculations]561-a universe which was so ready to leave her out of its calculations . [She]109-lily began to undress without ringing for [[her]109-lily maid , whom [she]109-lily had sent to bed]562-her maid , whom she had sent to bed . [She]109-lily had been long enough in bondage to [other people]563-other people ’s pleasure to be considerate of [those who depended on [hers]109-lily]564-those who depended on hers , and in [her]109-lily bitter moods it sometimes struck [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily and [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid were in the same position , except that [the latter]566-the latter received [her]109-lily wages more regularly . As [she]109-lily sat before the mirror brushing [her]109-lily hair , [her]109-lily face looked hollow and pale , and [she]109-lily was frightened by two little lines near [her]109-lily mouth , faint flaws in the smooth curve of the cheek . “ Oh , [I]109-lily must stop worrying ! ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily exclaimed . “ Unless it ’s the electric light — — ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily reflected , springing up from [her]109-lily seat and lighting the candles on the dressing - table . [She]109-lily turned out the wall - lights , and peered at [herself]109-lily between the candle - flames . The white oval of [her]109-lily face swam out waveringly from a background of shadows , the uncertain light blurring it like a haze ; but the two lines about the mouth remained . [Lily]109-lily rose and undressed in haste . “ It is only because [I]109-lily am tired and have such odious things to think about , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily kept repeating ; and it seemed an added injustice that petty cares should leave a trace on the beauty which was [her]109-lily only defence against [them]567-them . But the odious things were there , and remained with [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily returned wearily to the thought of [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce , as [a wayfarer]568-a wayfarer picks up a heavy load and toils on after a brief rest . [She]109-lily was almost sure [she]109-lily had “ landed ”[109-lily] [him]127-mr. gryce : a few days ’ work and [she]109-lily would win [her]109-lily reward . But the reward itself seemed unpalatable just then : [she]109-lily could get no zest from the thought of victory . It would be a rest from worry , no more — and how little that would have seemed to [her]109-lily a few years earlier ! [Her]109-lily ambitions had shrunk gradually in the desiccating air of failure . But why had [she]109-lily failed ? Was it [her]109-lily own fault or that of destiny ? [She]109-lily remembered how [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother , after [they]570-they had lost [their]570-they money , used to say to [her]109-lily with a kind of fierce vindictiveness : “ But [you]109-lily ’ll get it all back — [you’ll]109-lily get it all back , with [your]109-lily face . ”[569-her mother] ... The remembrance roused a whole train of association , and [she]109-lily lay in the darkness reconstructing the past out of which [her]109-lily present had grown . [A house in which [no one]2766-no one ever dined at [home]400-home unless there was “ [company ”]2861-company ”]2860-a house in which no one ever dined at home unless there was “ company ”[569-her mother] ; a door - bell perpetually ringing ; a hall - table showered with square envelopes which were opened in haste , and oblong envelopes which were allowed to gather dust in the depths of a bronze jar ; a series of French and English maids giving warning amid a chaos of hurriedly - ransacked wardrobes and dress - closets ; an equally changing dynasty of [nurses]573-nurses and [footmen]574-footmen ; quarrels in [the pantry]575-the pantry , [the kitchen]576-the kitchen and [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room ; precipitate trips to [Europe]21-europe , and returns with gorged trunks and days of interminable unpacking ; semi - annual discussions as to where the summer should be spent , grey interludes of economy and brilliant reactions of expense — such was the setting of [Lily Bart]109-lily ’s first memories . Ruling the turbulent element called [home]400-home was the vigorous and determined figure of [a mother]579-a mother still young enough to dance [her]579-a mother ball - dresses to rags , while the hazy outline of [a neutral - tinted father]580-a neutral - tinted father filled an intermediate space between [the butler]532-the butler and [the man who came to wind the clocks]582-the man who came to wind the clocks . Even to the eyes of infancy , [Mrs. Hudson Bart]136-mrs. bart had appeared young ; but [Lily]109-lily could not recall the time when [[her]109-lily father]583-her father had not been bald and slightly stooping , with streaks of grey in [his]583-her father hair , and a tired walk . It was a shock to [her]109-lily to learn afterward that [he]583-her father was but two years older than [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother . [Lily]109-lily seldom saw [[her]109-lily father]583-her father by daylight . All day [he]583-her father was “ downtown ”[583-her father] ; and in winter it was long after nightfall when [she]109-lily heard [his]583-her father fagged step on the stairs and [his]583-her father hand on [the school - room]586-the school - room door . [He]583-her father would kiss [her]109-lily in silence , and ask one or two questions of [the nurse]587-the nurse or [the governess]588-the governess ; then [[Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s maid]589-mrs. bart ’s maid would come to remind [him]583-her father that [he]583-her father was dining out , and [he]583-her father would hurry away with a nod to [Lily]109-lily . In summer , when [he]583-her father joined [them]590-them for a Sunday at [Newport]22-newport or [Southampton]23-southampton , [he]583-her father was even more effaced and silent than in winter . It seemed to tire [him]583-her father to rest , and [he]583-her father would sit for hours staring at the sea - line from a quiet corner of [the verandah]591-the verandah , while the clatter of [[his]583-her father wife]592-his wife ’s existence went on unheeded a few feet off . Generally , however , [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart and [Lily]109-lily went to [Europe]21-europe for the summer , and before [the steamer]593-the steamer was half way over [Mr. Bart]137-mr. bart had dipped below the horizon . Sometimes [[his]583-her father daughter]594-his daughter heard [him]583-her father denounced for having neglected to forward [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s remittances ; but for the most part [he]583-her father was never mentioned or thought of till [his]583-her father patient stooping figure presented [itself]595-itself on [the [New York]6-new york dock]596-the new york dock as a buffer between the magnitude of [[his]583-her father wife]592-his wife ’s luggage and the restrictions of [the American custom - house]598-the american custom - house . In this desultory yet agitated fashion life went on through [Lily]109-lily ’s teens : a zig - zag broken course down which [the family]599-the family craft glided on a rapid current of amusement , tugged at by the underflow of a perpetual need — the need of more money . [Lily]109-lily could not recall the time when there had been money enough , and in some vague way [[her]109-lily father]583-her father seemed always to blame for the deficiency . It could certainly not be the fault of [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart , who was spoken of by [[her]136-mrs. bart friends]406-her friends as [a “ wonderful manager . ”]2862-a “ wonderful manager . ”[136-mrs. bart] [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart was famous for the unlimited effect [she]136-mrs. bart produced on limited means ; and to [the lady]602-the lady and [[her]136-mrs. bart acquaintances]603-her acquaintances there was something heroic in living as though [one]2737-one were much richer than [one]2737-one ’s bank - book denoted . [Lily]109-lily was naturally proud of [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother ’s aptitude in this line : [she]109-lily had been brought up in the faith that , whatever it cost , [one]2737-one must have [a good cook]608-a good cook , and be what [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart called “ decently dressed . ”[136-mrs. bart] [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s worst reproach to [[her]136-mrs. bart husband]609-her husband was to ask [him]609-her husband if [he]609-her husband expected [her]109-lily to “ live like a pig ”[609-her husband] ; and [his]609-her husband replying in the negative was always regarded as a justification for cabling to [Paris]24-paris for an extra dress or two , and telephoning to [the jeweller]557-the jeweller that [he]609-her husband might , after all , send home the turquoise bracelet which [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart had looked at that morning . [Lily]109-lily knew [people who “ lived like pigs]2863-people who “ lived like pigs , ”[2863-people who “ lived like pigs] and [their]611-their appearance and surroundings justified [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother ’s repugnance to that form of existence . [They]611-their were mostly [cousins]613-cousins , who inhabited [dingy houses]614-dingy houses with engravings from [Cole]138-cole ’s Voyage of Life on the drawing - room walls , and [slatternly parlour - maids who said “ [I]615-slatternly parlour - maids who said “ i ’ll go and see ” to visitors calling at an hour when all right - minded persons are conventionally if not actually out ’ll go and see ”[615-slatternly parlour - maids who said “ i ’ll go and see ” to visitors calling at an hour when all right - minded persons are conventionally if not actually out] to [visitors]616-visitors calling at an hour when [all right - minded persons]617-all right - minded persons are conventionally if not actually out]615-slatternly parlour - maids who said “ i ’ll go and see ” to visitors calling at an hour when all right - minded persons are conventionally if not actually out . The disgusting part of it was that [many of [these cousins]619-these cousins]618-many of these cousins were rich , so that [Lily]109-lily imbibed the idea that if [people]2804-people lived like pigs it was from choice , and through the lack of any proper standard of conduct . This gave [her]109-lily a sense of reflected superiority , and [she]109-lily did not need [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s comments on the family frumps and [misers]621-misers to foster [her]109-lily naturally lively taste for splendour . [Lily]109-lily was nineteen when circumstances caused [her]109-lily to revise [her]109-lily view of [the universe]622-the universe . The previous year [she]109-lily had made a dazzling debut fringed by a heavy thunder - cloud of bills . The light of the debut still lingered on the horizon , but the cloud had thickened ; and suddenly it broke . The suddenness added to the horror ; and there were still times when [Lily]109-lily relived with painful vividness every detail of the day on which the blow fell . [She]109-lily and [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother had been seated at the luncheon - table , over the CHAUFROIX and cold salmon of the previous night ’s dinner : it was one of [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s few economies to consume in private the expensive remnants of [her]136-mrs. bart hospitality . [Lily]109-lily was feeling the pleasant languor which is [youth]624-youth ’s penalty for dancing till dawn ; but [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother , in spite of a few lines about the mouth , and under the yellow waves on [her]569-her mother temples , was as alert , determined and high in colour as if [she]569-her mother had risen from an untroubled sleep . In the centre of the table , between the melting MARRONS GLACES and candied cherries , a pyramid of American Beauties lifted [their]626-their vigorous stems ; [they]626-their held [their]626-their heads as high as [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart , but [their]626-their rose - colour had turned to a dissipated purple , and [Lily]109-lily ’s sense of fitness was disturbed by [their]626-their reappearance on the luncheon - table . “ [I]109-lily really think , [mother]2864-mother , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said reproachfully , “ [we]2865-we might afford a few fresh flowers for luncheon . Just some jonquils or lilies - of - [the - valley]2866-the - valley — ”[109-lily] [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart stared . [Her]136-mrs. bart own fastidiousness had its eye fixed on [the world]354-the world , and [she]136-mrs. bart did not care how the luncheon - table looked when there was [no one present at]628-no one present at [it]629-it but [the family]599-the family . But [she]136-mrs. bart smiled at [[her]136-mrs. bart daughter]631-her daughter ’s innocence . “ Lilies - of - [the - valley]2866-the - valley , ”[136-mrs. bart] [she]136-mrs. bart said calmly , “ cost two dollars a dozen at this season . ”[136-mrs. bart] [Lily]109-lily was not impressed . [She]109-lily knew very little of the value of money . “ It would not take more than six dozen to fill that bowl , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily argued . “ Six dozen what ? ”[583-her father] asked [[her]109-lily father]583-her father ’s voice in the doorway . [The two women]633-the two women looked up in surprise ; though it was a Saturday , the sight of [Mr. Bart]137-mr. bart at luncheon was an unwonted one . But neither [[his]137-mr. bart wife]592-his wife nor [[his]137-mr. bart daughter]594-his daughter was sufficiently interested to ask an explanation . [Mr. Bart]137-mr. bart dropped into a chair , and sat gazing absently at the fragment of jellied salmon which [the butler]532-the butler had placed before [him]137-mr. bart . “ [I]109-lily was only saying , ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily began , “ that [I]109-lily hate to see faded flowers at luncheon ; and [mother]2864-mother says a bunch of lilies - of - [the - valley]2866-the - valley would not cost more than twelve dollars . May n’t [I]109-lily tell [the florist]2870-the florist to send a few every day ? ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily leaned confidently toward [[her]109-lily father]583-her father : [he]137-mr. bart seldom refused [her]109-lily anything , and [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart had taught [her]109-lily to plead with [him]137-mr. bart when [her]109-lily own entreaties failed . [Mr. Bart]137-mr. bart sat motionless , [his]137-mr. bart gaze still fixed on the salmon , and [his]137-mr. bart lower jaw dropped ; [he]137-mr. bart looked even paler than usual , and [his]137-mr. bart thin hair lay in untidy streaks on [his]137-mr. bart forehead . Suddenly [he]137-mr. bart looked at [[his]137-mr. bart daughter]594-his daughter and laughed . The laugh was so strange that [Lily]109-lily coloured under it : [she]109-lily disliked being ridiculed , and [[her]109-lily father]583-her father seemed to see something ridiculous in the request . Perhaps [he]137-mr. bart thought it foolish that [she]109-lily should trouble [him]137-mr. bart about such a trifle . “ Twelve dollars — twelve dollars a day for flowers ? Oh , certainly , [[my]137-mr. bart dear]2871-my dear — give [him]137-mr. bart an order for twelve hundred . ”[137-mr. bart] [He]137-mr. bart continued to laugh . [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart gave [him]137-mr. bart a quick glance . “ [You]137-mr. bart need n’t wait , [Poleworth]139-poleworth — [I]109-lily will ring for [you]137-mr. bart , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said to [the butler]532-the butler . [The butler]532-the butler withdrew with an air of silent disapproval , leaving the remains of the CHAUFROIX on the sideboard . “ What is the matter , [Hudson]136-mrs. bart ? Are [you]136-mrs. bart ill ? ”[136-mrs. bart] said [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart severely . [She]136-mrs. bart had no tolerance for scenes which were not of [her]136-mrs. bart own making , and it was odious to [her]136-mrs. bart that [[her]136-mrs. bart husband]609-her husband should make a show of [himself]609-her husband before [the servants]490-the servants . “ Are [you]609-her husband ill ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily repeated . “ Ill ? — — No , [I]609-her husband ’m ruined , ”[609-her husband] [he]609-her husband said . [Lily]109-lily made a frightened sound , and [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart rose to [her]136-mrs. bart feet . “ Ruined — — ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily cried ; but controlling [herself]109-lily instantly , [she]109-lily turned a calm face to [Lily]109-lily . “ Shut the pantry door , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said . [Lily]109-lily obeyed , and when [she]109-lily turned back into [the room]351-the room [[her]109-lily father]583-her father was sitting with both elbows on the table , the plate of salmon between [them]646-them , and [his]583-her father head bowed on [his]583-her father hands . [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart stood over [him]583-her father with a white face which made [her]136-mrs. bart hair unnaturally yellow . [She]136-mrs. bart looked at [Lily]109-lily as [the latter]566-the latter approached : [her]136-mrs. bart look was terrible , but [her]136-mrs. bart voice was modulated to a ghastly cheerfulness . “ [[Your]109-lily father]2872-your father is not well — [he]583-her father does n’t know what [he]583-her father is saying . It is nothing — but [you]109-lily had better go [upstairs]2873-upstairs ; and do n’t talk to [the servants]490-the servants , ”[136-mrs. bart] [she]136-mrs. bart added . [Lily]109-lily obeyed ; [she]109-lily always obeyed when [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother spoke in that voice . [She]109-lily had not been deceived by [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s words : [she]109-lily knew at once that they were ruined . In the dark hours which followed , that awful fact overshadowed even [[her]109-lily father]583-her father ’s slow and difficult dying . To [[his]583-her father wife]592-his wife [he]583-her father no longer counted : [he]583-her father had become extinct when [he]583-her father ceased to fulfil [his]583-her father purpose , and [she]592-his wife sat at [his]583-her father side with the provisional air of [a traveller who waits for a belated train to start]651-a traveller who waits for a belated train to start . [Lily]109-lily ’s feelings were softer : [she]109-lily pitied [him]583-her father in a frightened ineffectual way . But the fact that [he]583-her father was for the most part unconscious , and that [his]583-her father attention , when [she]592-his wife stole into [the room]351-the room , drifted away from [her]592-his wife after a moment , made [him]583-her father even more of [a stranger]653-a stranger than in the nursery days when [he]583-her father had never come [home]400-home till after dark . [She]592-his wife seemed always to have seen [him]583-her father through a blur — first of sleepiness , then of distance and indifference — and now the fog had thickened till [he]583-her father was almost indistinguishable . If [she]592-his wife could have performed any little services for [him]583-her father , or have exchanged with [him]583-her father a few of those affecting words which an extensive perusal of fiction had led [her]592-his wife to connect with such occasions , the filial instinct might have stirred in [her]592-his wife ; but [her]592-his wife pity , finding no active expression , remained in a state of spectatorship , overshadowed by [[her]592-his wife mother]569-her mother ’s grim unflagging resentment . Every look and act of [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s seemed to say : “ [You]109-lily are sorry for [him]583-her father now — but [you]109-lily will feel differently when [you]109-lily see what [he]583-her father has done to [us]2875-us . ”[136-mrs. bart] It was a relief to [Lily]109-lily when [[her]592-his wife father]583-her father died . Then a long winter set in . There was a little money left , but to [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart it seemed worse than nothing — the mere mockery of what [she]592-his wife was entitled to . What was the use of living if [one]2737-one had to live like a pig ? [She]592-his wife sank into a kind of furious apathy , a state of inert anger against fate . [Her]592-his wife faculty for “ managing ”[592-his wife] deserted [her]592-his wife , or [she]592-his wife no longer took sufficient pride in it to exert it . It was well enough to “ manage ”[592-his wife] when by so doing [one]2737-one could keep [[one]2737-one ’s own carriage]660-one ’s own carriage ; but when [one]2737-one ’s best contrivance did not conceal the fact that [one]2737-one had to go on foot , the effort was no longer worth making . [Lily]109-lily and [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother wandered from place to place , now paying long visits to [relations whose house - keeping [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart criticized]664-relations whose house - keeping mrs. bart criticized , and who deplored the fact that [she]136-mrs. bart let [Lily]109-lily breakfast in bed when [the girl]665-the girl had no prospects before [her]136-mrs. bart , and now vegetating in [cheap continental refuges]666-cheap continental refuges , where [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart held [herself]136-mrs. bart fiercely aloof from the frugal tea - tables of [[her]136-mrs. bart companions]667-her companions in misfortune . [She]592-his wife was especially careful to avoid [[her]592-his wife old friends]668-her old friends and the scenes of [her]592-his wife former successes . To be poor seemed to [her]592-his wife such a confession of failure that it amounted to disgrace ; and [she]592-his wife detected a note of condescension in the friendliest advances . Only one thought consoled [her]592-his wife , and that was the contemplation of [Lily]109-lily ’s beauty . [She]592-his wife studied it with a kind of passion , as though it were some weapon [she]592-his wife had slowly fashioned for [her]592-his wife vengeance . It was the last asset in [their]669-their fortunes , the nucleus around which [their]669-their life was to be rebuilt . [She]592-his wife watched it jealously , as though it were [[her]592-his wife own property]670-her own property and [Lily]109-lily [its mere custodian]671-its mere custodian ; and [she]592-his wife tried to instil into the latter a sense of the responsibility that such a charge involved . [She]592-his wife followed in imagination the career of other beauties , pointing out to [[her]592-his wife daughter]631-her daughter what might be achieved through such a gift , and dwelling on the awful warning of [those who , in spite of it , had failed to get what [they]673-those who , in spite of it , had failed to get what they wanted wanted]673-those who , in spite of it , had failed to get what they wanted : to [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart , only stupidity could explain the lamentable denouement of some of [her]592-his wife examples . [She]592-his wife was not above the inconsistency of charging fate , rather than [herself]592-his wife , with [her]592-his wife own misfortunes ; but [she]592-his wife inveighed so acrimoniously against love - matches that [Lily]109-lily would have fancied [her]109-lily own marriage had been of that nature , had not [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart frequently assured [her]109-lily that [she]592-his wife had been “ talked into it”—by[592-his wife] whom , [she]592-his wife never made clear . [Lily]109-lily was duly impressed by the magnitude of [her]109-lily opportunities . The dinginess of [her]109-lily present life threw into enchanting relief the existence to which [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily entitled . To a less illuminated intelligence [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s counsels might have been dangerous ; but [Lily]109-lily understood that beauty is only the raw material of conquest , and that to convert it into success other arts are required . [She]109-lily knew that to betray any sense of superiority was a subtler form of the stupidity [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother denounced , and it did not take [her]109-lily long to learn that [a beauty]675-a beauty needs more tact than [the possessor of an average set of features]676-the possessor of an average set of features . [Her]109-lily ambitions were not as crude as [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart ’s . It had been among [that lady]486-that lady ’s grievances that [[her]486-that lady husband]609-her husband — in the early days , before [he]609-her husband was too tired — had wasted [his]609-her husband evenings in what [she]486-that lady vaguely described as “ reading poetry ”[486-that lady] ; and among the effects packed off to auction after [his]609-her husband death were a score or two of dingy volumes which had struggled for existence among the boots and medicine bottles of [his]609-her husband dressing - room shelves . There was in [Lily]109-lily a vein of sentiment , perhaps transmitted from this source , which gave an idealizing touch to [her]109-lily most prosaic purposes . [She]109-lily liked to think of [her]109-lily beauty as a power for good , as giving [her]109-lily the opportunity to attain a position where [she]109-lily should make [her]109-lily influence felt in the vague diffusion of refinement and good taste . [She]109-lily was fond of pictures and flowers , and of sentimental fiction , and [she]109-lily could not help thinking that the possession of such tastes ennobled [her]109-lily desire for worldly advantages . [She]109-lily would not indeed have cared to marry [a man who was merely rich]679-a man who was merely rich : [she]109-lily was secretly ashamed of [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother ’s crude passion for money . [Lily]109-lily ’s preference would have been for [an English nobleman with political ambitions and vast estates]681-an english nobleman with political ambitions and vast estates ; or , for second choice , [an Italian prince with [a castle in [the Apennines]25-the apennines and an hereditary office in [the Vatican]684-the vatican]683-a castle in the apennines and an hereditary office in the vatican]682-an italian prince with a castle in the apennines and an hereditary office in the vatican . Lost causes had a romantic charm for [her]109-lily , and [she]109-lily liked to picture [herself]109-lily as standing aloof from the vulgar press of [the Quirinal]140-the quirinal , and sacrificing [her]109-lily pleasure to the claims of an immemorial tradition .... How long ago and how far off it all seemed ! Those ambitions were hardly more futile and childish than the earlier ones which had centred about the possession of [a French jointed doll with real hair]685-a french jointed doll with real hair . Was it only ten years since [she]109-lily had wavered in imagination between [the English earl]686-the english earl and [the Italian prince]687-the italian prince ? Relentlessly [her]109-lily mind travelled on over the dreary interval .... After two years of hungry roaming [Mrs. Bart]136-mrs. bart had died —— died of a deep disgust . [She]109-lily had hated dinginess , and it was [her]109-lily fate to be dingy . [Her]109-lily visions of a brilliant marriage for [Lily]109-lily had faded after the first year . “ [People]2804-people ca n’t marry [you]2877-you if [they]2804-people do n’t see [you]2877-you — and how can [they]2804-people see [you]2877-you in these holes where [we]2878-we ’re stuck ? ”[109-lily] That was the burden of [her]109-lily lament ; and [her]109-lily last adjuration to [[her]109-lily daughter]631-her daughter was to escape from dinginess if [she]109-lily could . “ Do n’t let it creep up on [you]2877-you and drag [you]2877-you down . Fight [your]2877-you way out of it somehow — [you’re]2877-you young and can do it , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily insisted . [She]109-lily had died during one of [their]689-their brief visits to [New York]6-new york , and [there]2755-there [Lily]109-lily at once became the centre of [a family council composed of [the wealthy relatives whom [she]109-lily had been taught to despise for living like pigs]692-the wealthy relatives whom she had been taught to despise for living like pigs]691-a family council composed of the wealthy relatives whom she had been taught to despise for living like pigs .
