There ’s nothing [I]123-mrs. trenor would n’t do , [you]109-lily poor duck , to see [you]109-lily happy ! ”[123-mrs. trenor] And [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , glowing with [her]123-mrs. trenor sex ’s eagerness to smooth the course of true love , enveloped [Lily]109-lily in a long embrace . “ [You]109-lily ’re quite sure , ”[123-mrs. trenor] [she]123-mrs. trenor added solicitously , as [the latter]566-the latter extricated [herself]123-mrs. trenor , “ that [you]109-lily would n’t like [me]123-mrs. trenor to telephone for [Lawrence Selden]108-selden ? ”[123-mrs. trenor] “ Quite sure , ”[109-lily] said [Lily]109-lily . * * * * * The next three days demonstrated to [her]109-lily own complete satisfaction [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s ability to manage [her]109-lily affairs without extraneous aid . As [she]109-lily sat , on the Saturday afternoon , on [the terrace]760-the terrace at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , [she]109-lily smiled at [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s fear that [she]109-lily might go too fast . If such a warning had ever been needful , the years had taught [her]109-lily a salutary lesson , and [she]109-lily flattered [herself]109-lily that [she]109-lily now knew how to adapt [her]109-lily pace to the object of pursuit . In the case of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce [she]109-lily had found it well to flutter ahead , losing [herself]109-lily elusively and luring [him]127-mr. gryce on from depth to depth of unconscious intimacy . The surrounding atmosphere was propitious to this scheme of courtship . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , true to [her]123-mrs. trenor word , had shown no signs of expecting [Lily]109-lily at the bridge - table , and had even hinted to [the other card - players]761-the other card - players that [they]761-the other card - players were to betray no surprise at [her]109-lily unwonted defection . In consequence of this hint , [Lily]109-lily found [herself]109-lily the centre of that feminine solicitude which envelops [a young woman in the mating season]762-a young woman in the mating season . A solitude was tacitly created for [her]109-lily in the crowded existence of [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends could not have shown a greater readiness for self - effacement had [her]109-lily wooing been adorned with all the attributes of romance . In [Lily]109-lily ’s set this conduct implied a sympathetic comprehension of [her]109-lily motives , and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce rose in [her]109-lily esteem as [she]109-lily saw the consideration [he]127-mr. gryce inspired . [The terrace at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]764-the terrace at bellomont on a September afternoon was a spot propitious to sentimental musings , and as [Miss Bart]109-lily stood leaning against the balustrade above [the sunken garden]765-the sunken garden , at a little distance from the animated group about the tea - table , [she]109-lily might have been lost in the mazes of an inarticulate happiness . In reality , [her]109-lily thoughts were finding definite utterance in the tranquil recapitulation of the blessings in store for [her]109-lily . From where [she]109-lily stood [she]109-lily could see [them]766-them embodied in the form of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , who , in a light overcoat and muffler , sat somewhat nervously on the edge of [his]127-mr. gryce chair , while [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , with all the energy of eye and gesture with which nature and art had combined to endow [her]146-carry fisher , pressed on [him]127-mr. gryce the duty of taking part in the task of municipal reform . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s latest hobby was municipal reform . It had been preceded by an equal zeal for socialism , which had in turn replaced an energetic advocacy of Christian Science . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher was small , fiery and dramatic ; and [her]135-mrs. fisher hands and eyes were admirable instruments in the service of whatever causes [she]135-mrs. fisher happened to espouse . [She]109-lily had , however , the fault common to enthusiasts of ignoring any slackness of response on the part of [[her]109-lily hearers]767-her hearers , and [Lily]109-lily was amused by [her]109-lily unconsciousness of the resistance displayed in every angle of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s attitude . [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily knew that [his]127-mr. gryce mind was divided between the dread of catching cold if [he]127-mr. gryce remained out of doors too long at that hour , and the fear that , if [he]127-mr. gryce retreated to [the house]488-the house , [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher might follow [him]127-mr. gryce up with a paper to be signed . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce had a constitutional dislike to what [he]127-mr. gryce called “ committing [himself]127-mr. gryce , ”[127-mr. gryce] and tenderly as [he]127-mr. gryce cherished [his]127-mr. gryce health , [he]127-mr. gryce evidently concluded that it was safer to stay out of reach of pen and ink till chance released [him]127-mr. gryce from [[Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s toils]769-mrs. fisher ’s toils . Meanwhile [he]127-mr. gryce cast agonized glances in the direction of [Miss Bart]109-lily [, whose only response was to sink into an attitude of more graceful abstraction]770-, whose only response was to sink into an attitude of more graceful abstraction . [She]109-lily had learned the value of contrast in throwing [her]109-lily charms into relief , and was fully aware of the extent to which [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s volubility was enhancing [her]109-lily own repose . [She]109-lily was roused from [her]109-lily musings by the approach of [[her]109-lily cousin]448-her cousin [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney who , at [Gwen Van Osburgh]119-gwen ’s side , was returning across [the garden]772-the garden from [the tennis court]773-the tennis court . [The couple in question]774-the couple in question were engaged in the same kind of romance in which [Lily]109-lily figured , and [the latter]566-the latter felt a certain annoyance in contemplating what seemed to [her]109-lily a caricature of [her]109-lily own situation . [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh was [a large girl with flat surfaces and no high lights]776-a large girl with flat surfaces and no high lights : [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney had once said of [her]159-miss van osburgh that [she]159-miss van osburgh was as reliable as roast mutton . [His]448-her cousin own taste was in the line of less solid and more highly - seasoned diet ; but hunger makes any fare palatable , and there had been times when [Mr. Stepney]160-mr. stepney had been reduced to a crust . [Lily]109-lily considered with interest the expression of [their]774-the couple in question faces : [the girl]665-the girl ’s turned toward [[her]665-the girl companion]445-her companion ’s like an empty plate held up to be filled , while [the man lounging at [her]665-the girl side]779-the man lounging at her side already betrayed the encroaching boredom which would presently crack the thin veneer of [his]779-the man lounging at her side smile . “ How impatient [men]2795-men are ! ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily reflected . “ All [Jack]125-jack stepney has to do to get everything [he]779-the man lounging at her side wants is to keep quiet and let [that girl]2954-that girl marry [him]779-the man lounging at her side ; whereas [I]109-lily have to calculate and contrive , and retreat and advance , as if [I]109-lily were going through an intricate dance , where one misstep would throw [me]109-lily hopelessly out of time . ”[109-lily] As [they]774-the couple in question drew nearer [she]109-lily was whimsically struck by a kind of family likeness between [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh and [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce . There was no resemblance of feature . [Gryce]127-mr. gryce was handsome in a didactic way — [he]127-mr. gryce looked like [a clever pupil]780-a clever pupil ’s drawing from a plaster - cast — while [Gwen]119-gwen ’s countenance had no more modelling than a face painted on a toy balloon . But the deeper affinity was unmistakable : [the two]781-the two had the same prejudices and ideals , and the same quality of making other standards non - existent by ignoring [them]781-the two . This attribute was common to [most of [Lily]109-lily ’s set]782-most of lily ’s set : [they]782-most of lily ’s set had a force of negation which eliminated everything beyond [their]782-most of lily ’s set own range of perception . [Gryce]127-mr. gryce and [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh were , in short , made for each other by every law of moral and physical correspondence——“Yet [they]781-the two would n’t look at [each other]2955-each other , ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily mused , “ [they]781-the two never do . [Each of [them]781-the two]2956-each of them wants a creature of a different race , of [Jack]125-jack stepney ’s race and [mine]109-lily , with all sorts of intuitions , sensations and perceptions that [they]781-the two do n’t even guess the existence of . And [they]781-the two always get what [they]781-the two want . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily stood talking with [[her]109-lily cousin]448-her cousin and [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh , till a slight cloud on [the latter]566-the latter ’s brow advised [her]109-lily that even cousinly amenities were subject to suspicion , and [Miss Bart]109-lily , mindful of the necessity of not exciting enmities at this crucial point of [her]109-lily career , dropped aside while [the happy couple]785-the happy couple proceeded toward the tea - table . Seating [herself]109-lily on the upper step of [the terrace]760-the terrace , [Lily]109-lily leaned [her]109-lily head against the honeysuckles wreathing the balustrade . The fragrance of the late blossoms seemed an emanation of the tranquil scene , a landscape tutored to the last degree of rural elegance . In the foreground glowed the warm tints of [the gardens]787-the gardens . Beyond [the lawn]788-the lawn , with [its]788-the lawn pyramidal pale - gold maples and velvety firs , sloped pastures dotted with cattle ; and through [a long glade]789-a long glade [the river]790-the river widened like a lake under the silver light of September . [Lily]109-lily did not want to join the circle about the tea - table . [They]791-they represented the future [she]109-lily had chosen , and [she]109-lily was content with it , but in no haste to anticipate its joys . The certainty that [she]109-lily could marry [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce when [she]109-lily pleased had lifted a heavy load from [her]109-lily mind , and [her]109-lily money troubles were too recent for their removal not to leave a sense of relief which a less discerning intelligence might have taken for happiness . [Her]109-lily vulgar cares were at an end . [She]109-lily would be able to arrange [her]109-lily life as [she]109-lily pleased , to soar into that empyrean of security where [creditors can not penetrate]792-creditors can not penetrate . [She]109-lily would have smarter gowns than [Judy Trenor]126-judy , and far , far more jewels than [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha . [She]109-lily would be free forever from the shifts , the expedients , the humiliations of [the relatively poor]793-the relatively poor . Instead of having to flatter , [she]109-lily would be flattered ; instead of being grateful , [she]109-lily would receive thanks . There were old scores [she]109-lily could pay off as well as old benefits [she]109-lily could return . And [she]109-lily had no doubts as to the extent of [her]109-lily power . [She]109-lily knew that [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was of [the small chary type most inaccessible to impulses and emotions]794-the small chary type most inaccessible to impulses and emotions . [He]127-mr. gryce had the kind of character in which prudence is a vice , and good advice the most dangerous nourishment . But [Lily]109-lily had known the species before : [she]109-lily was aware that such a guarded nature must find one huge outlet of egoism , and [she]109-lily determined to be to [him]127-mr. gryce what [his]127-mr. gryce Americana had hitherto been : the one possession in which [he]127-mr. gryce took sufficient pride to spend money on it . [She]109-lily knew that this generosity to self is one of the forms of meanness , and [she]109-lily resolved so to identify [herself]109-lily with [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband ’s vanity that to gratify [her]109-lily wishes would be to [him]127-mr. gryce the most exquisite form of self - indulgence . The system might at first necessitate a resort to some of the very shifts and expedients from which [she]109-lily intended it should free [her]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily felt sure that in a short time [she]109-lily would be able to play the game in [her]109-lily own way . How should [she]109-lily have distrusted [her]109-lily powers ? [Her]109-lily beauty itself was not the mere ephemeral possession it might have been in the hands of inexperience : [her]109-lily skill in enhancing it , the care [she]109-lily took of it , the use [she]109-lily made of it , seemed to give it a kind of permanence . [She]109-lily felt [she]109-lily could trust it to carry [her]109-lily through to the end . And the end , on the whole , was worthwhile . Life was not the mockery [she]109-lily had thought it three days ago . There was room for [her]109-lily , after all , in this crowded selfish world of pleasure whence , so short a time since , [her]109-lily poverty had seemed to exclude [her]109-lily . [These people whom [she]109-lily had ridiculed and yet envied]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied were glad to make a place for [her]109-lily in the charmed circle about which all [her]109-lily desires revolved . [They]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied were not as brutal and self - engrossed as [she]109-lily had fancied — or rather , since it would no longer be necessary to flatter and humour [them]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied , that side of [their]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied nature became less conspicuous . Society is a revolving body which is apt to be judged according to its place in [each man]797-each man ’s heaven ; and at present it was turning [its]798-its illuminated face to [Lily]109-lily . In the rosy glow it diffused [[her]109-lily companions]667-her companions seemed full of amiable qualities . [She]109-lily liked [their]667-her companions elegance , [their]667-her companions lightness , [their]667-her companions lack of emphasis : even the self - assurance which at times was so like obtuseness now seemed the natural sign of social ascendency . [They]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied were lords of [the only world [she]109-lily cared for]800-the only world she cared for , and [they]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied were ready to admit [her]109-lily to [their]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied ranks and let [her]109-lily lord it with [them]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied . Already [she]109-lily felt within [her]109-lily a stealing allegiance to [their]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied standards , an acceptance of [their]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied limitations , a disbelief in the things [they]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied did not believe in , a contemptuous pity for [the people who were not able to live as [they]796-these people whom she had ridiculed and yet envied lived]801-the people who were not able to live as they lived . The early sunset was slanting across [the park]747-the park . Through the boughs of [the long avenue beyond [the gardens]787-the gardens]803-the long avenue beyond the gardens [she]109-lily caught the flash of wheels , and divined that [more visitors]805-more visitors were approaching . There was a movement behind [her]109-lily , a scattering of steps and voices : it was evident that [the party about the tea - table]806-the party about the tea - table was breaking up . Presently [she]109-lily heard a tread behind [her]109-lily on [the terrace]760-the terrace . [She]109-lily supposed that [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce had at last found means to escape from [his]127-mr. gryce predicament , and [she]109-lily smiled at the significance of [his]127-mr. gryce coming to join [her]109-lily instead of beating an instant retreat to the fireside . [She]109-lily turned to give [him]127-mr. gryce the welcome which such gallantry deserved ; but [her]109-lily greeting wavered into a blush of wonder , for [the man who had approached [her]109-lily]808-the man who had approached her was [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . “ [You]109-lily see [I]808-the man who had approached her came after all , ”[808-the man who had approached her] [he]808-the man who had approached her said ; but before [she]109-lily had time to answer , [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , breaking away from a lifeless colloquy with [[her]131-mrs. dorset host]809-her host , had stepped between [them]810-them with a little gesture of appropriation . Chapter 5 The observance of Sunday at [Bellomont]3-bellomont was chiefly marked by the punctual appearance of [the smart omnibus destined to convey [the household]812-the household to [the little church at the gates]813-the little church at the gates]811-the smart omnibus destined to convey the household to the little church at the gates . Whether [any one]442-any one got into [the omnibus]815-the omnibus or not was a matter of secondary importance , since by standing there it not only bore witness to the orthodox intentions of [the family]599-the family , but made [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor feel , when [she]123-mrs. trenor finally heard it drive away , that [she]123-mrs. trenor had somehow vicariously made use of it . It was [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s theory that [[her]123-mrs. trenor daughters]817-her daughters actually did go to [church]818-church every Sunday ; but [[their]817-her daughters French governess]819-their french governess ’s convictions calling [her]819-their french governess to [the rival fane]820-the rival fane , and the fatigues of the week keeping [[their]817-her daughters mother]821-their mother in [[her]819-their french governess room]529-her room till luncheon , there was seldom any one present to verify the fact . Now and then , in a spasmodic burst of virtue — when [the house]488-the house had been too uproarious over night — [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor forced [his]161-gus trenor genial bulk into a tight frock - coat and routed [[his]161-gus trenor daughters]824-his daughters from [their]824-his daughters slumbers ; but habitually , as [Lily]109-lily explained to [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , this parental duty was forgotten till the church bells were ringing across [the park]747-the park , and the omnibus had driven away empty . [Lily]109-lily had hinted to [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce that this neglect of religious observances was repugnant to [her]109-lily early traditions , and that during [her]109-lily visits to [Bellomont]3-bellomont [she]109-lily regularly accompanied [Muriel]162-muriel and [Hilda]163-hilda to [church]818-church . This tallied with the assurance , also confidentially imparted , that , never having played bridge before , [she]109-lily had been “ dragged into it ”[109-lily] on the night of [her]109-lily arrival , and had lost an appalling amount of money in consequence of [her]109-lily ignorance of the game and of the rules of betting . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was undoubtedly enjoying [Bellomont]3-bellomont . [He]127-mr. gryce liked the ease and glitter of the life , and the lustre conferred on [him]127-mr. gryce by being [a member of [this group of rich and conspicuous people]828-this group of rich and conspicuous people]827-a member of this group of rich and conspicuous people . But [he]127-mr. gryce thought [it]829-it [a very materialistic society]830-a very materialistic society ; there were times when [he]127-mr. gryce was frightened by the talk of [the men]831-the men and the looks of [the ladies]832-the ladies , and [he]127-mr. gryce was glad to find that [Miss Bart]109-lily , for all [her]109-lily ease and self - possession , was not at [home]400-home in so ambiguous an atmosphere . For this reason [he]127-mr. gryce had been especially pleased to learn that [she]109-lily would , as usual , attend [the young Trenors]834-the young trenors to [church]818-church on Sunday morning ; and as [he]127-mr. gryce paced the gravel sweep before the door , [his]127-mr. gryce light overcoat on [his]127-mr. gryce arm and [his]127-mr. gryce prayer - book in one carefully - gloved hand , [he]127-mr. gryce reflected agreeably on the strength of character which kept [her]109-lily true to [her]109-lily early training in surroundings so subversive to religious principles . For a long time [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce and [the omnibus]815-the omnibus had the gravel sweep to [themselves]837-themselves ; but , far from regretting this deplorable indifference on the part of [the other guests]838-the other guests , [he]127-mr. gryce found [himself]127-mr. gryce nourishing the hope that [Miss Bart]109-lily might be unaccompanied . The precious minutes were flying , however ; the big chestnuts pawed the ground and flecked [their]839-their impatient sides with foam ; [the coachman]840-the coachman seemed to be slowly petrifying on the box , and [the groom]841-the groom on the doorstep ; and still [the lady]602-the lady did not come . Suddenly , however , there was a sound of voices and a rustle of skirts in the doorway , and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , restoring [his]127-mr. gryce watch to [his]127-mr. gryce pocket , turned with a nervous start ; but it was only to find [himself]127-mr. gryce handing [Mrs. Wetherall]164-mrs. wetherall into [the carriage]420-the carriage . [The Wetheralls]120-the wetheralls always went to [church]818-church . [They]120-the wetheralls belonged to [the vast group of human automata who go through life without neglecting to perform a single one of the gestures executed by [the surrounding puppets]846-the surrounding puppets]845-the vast group of human automata who go through life without neglecting to perform a single one of the gestures executed by the surrounding puppets . It is true that [the Bellomont puppets]847-the bellomont puppets did not go to [church]818-church ; but [others equally important]849-others equally important did — and [Mr.]850-mr. and [Mrs. Wetherall]164-mrs. wetherall ’s circle was so large that [God]165-god was included in [their]120-the wetheralls visiting - list . [They]120-the wetheralls appeared , therefore , punctual and resigned , with the air of [people]2804-people bound for a dull “ At [Home]400-home , ”[120-the wetheralls] and after [them]120-the wetheralls [Hilda]163-hilda and [Muriel]162-muriel straggled , yawning and pinning [each other]2955-each other ’s veils and ribbons as [they]120-the wetheralls came . [They]120-the wetheralls had promised [Lily]109-lily to go to [church]818-church with [her]109-lily , [they]120-the wetheralls declared , and [Lily]109-lily was such [a dear old duck]854-a dear old duck that [they]120-the wetheralls did n’t mind doing it to please [her]109-lily , though [they]120-the wetheralls could n’t fancy what had put the idea in [her]109-lily head , and though for [their]120-the wetheralls own part [they]120-the wetheralls would much rather have played lawn tennis with [Jack]125-jack stepney and [Gwen]119-gwen , if [she]109-lily had n’t told [them]120-the wetheralls [she]109-lily was coming . [The Misses Trenor]166-the misses trenor were followed by [Lady Cressida Raith]121-lady cressida , [a weather - beaten person in Liberty silk and ethnological trinkets , who , on seeing [the omnibus]815-the omnibus]855-a weather - beaten person in liberty silk and ethnological trinkets , who , on seeing the omnibus , expressed [her]121-lady cressida surprise that [they]120-the wetheralls were not to walk across [the park]747-the park ; but at [Mrs. Wetherall]164-mrs. wetherall ’s horrified protest that [the church]858-the church was a mile away , [[her]164-mrs. wetherall ladyship]859-her ladyship , after a glance at the height of the other ’s heels , acquiesced in the necessity of driving , and poor [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce found [himself]127-mr. gryce rolling off between [four ladies]860-four ladies for whose spiritual welfare [he]127-mr. gryce felt not the least concern . It might have afforded [him]127-mr. gryce some consolation could [he]127-mr. gryce have known that [Miss Bart]109-lily had really meant to go to [church]818-church . [She]109-lily had even risen earlier than usual in the execution of [her]109-lily purpose . [She]109-lily had an idea that the sight of [her]109-lily in a grey gown of devotional cut , with [her]109-lily famous lashes drooped above a prayer - book , would put the finishing touch to [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s subjugation , and render inevitable a certain incident which [she]109-lily had resolved should form a part of the walk [they]862-they were to take together after luncheon . [Her]109-lily intentions in short had never been more definite ; but poor [Lily]109-lily , for all the hard glaze of [her]109-lily exterior , was inwardly as malleable as wax . [Her]109-lily faculty for adapting [herself]109-lily , for entering into [other people]563-other people ’s feelings , if it served [her]109-lily now and then in small contingencies , hampered [her]109-lily in the decisive moments of life . [She]109-lily was like a water - plant in the flux of the tides , and today the whole current of [her]109-lily mood was carrying [her]109-lily toward [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . Why had [he]108-selden come ? Was it to see [herself]109-lily or [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ? It was the last question which , at that moment , should have engaged [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily might better have contented [herself]109-lily with thinking that [he]108-selden had simply responded to the despairing summons of [[his]108-selden hostess]864-his hostess , anxious to interpose [him]108-selden between [herself]109-lily and the ill - humour of [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . But [Lily]109-lily had not rested till [she]109-lily learned from [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor that [Selden]108-selden had come of [his]108-selden own accord . “ [He]108-selden did n’t even wire [me]123-mrs. trenor — [he]108-selden just happened to find the trap at [the station]319-the station . Perhaps it ’s not over with [Bertha]133-bertha after all , ”[123-mrs. trenor] [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor musingly concluded ; and went away to arrange [her]123-mrs. trenor dinner - cards accordingly . Perhaps it was not , [Lily]109-lily reflected ; but it should be soon , unless [she]109-lily had lost [her]109-lily cunning . If [Selden]108-selden had come at [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s call , it was at [her]131-mrs. dorset own that [he]108-selden would stay . So much the previous evening had told [her]109-lily . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , true to [her]123-mrs. trenor simple principle of making [[her]123-mrs. trenor married friends]865-her married friends happy , had placed [Selden]108-selden and [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset next to [each other]2955-each other at dinner ; but , in obedience to the time - honoured traditions of [the match - maker]867-the match - maker , [she]123-mrs. trenor had separated [Lily]109-lily and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce , sending in the former with [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , while [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was coupled with [Gwen Van Osburgh]119-gwen . [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s talk did not interfere with the range of [[his]108-selden neighbour]868-his neighbour ’s thoughts . [He]108-selden was [a mournful dyspeptic , intent on finding out the deleterious ingredients of every dish]869-a mournful dyspeptic , intent on finding out the deleterious ingredients of every dish and diverted from this care only by the sound of [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife ’s voice . On this occasion , however , [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset took no part in the general conversation . [She]123-mrs. trenor sat talking in low murmurs with [Selden]108-selden , and turning a contemptuous and denuded shoulder toward [[her]123-mrs. trenor host , who , far from resenting [his]108-selden exclusion , plunged into the excesses of the MENU with the joyous irresponsibility of [a free man]872-a free man]871-her host , who , far from resenting his exclusion , plunged into the excesses of the menu with the joyous irresponsibility of a free man . To [Mr. Dorset]167-mr. dorset , however , [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife ’s attitude was a subject of such evident concern that , when [he]108-selden was not scraping the sauce from [his]108-selden fish , or scooping the moist bread - crumbs from the interior of [his]108-selden roll , [he]108-selden sat straining [his]108-selden thin neck for a glimpse of [her]592-his wife between the lights . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , as it chanced , had placed [the husband and wife]874-the husband and wife on opposite sides of the table , and [Lily]109-lily was therefore able to observe [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset also , and by carrying [her]109-lily glance a few feet farther , to set up a rapid comparison between [Lawrence Selden]108-selden and [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce . It was that comparison which was [her]109-lily undoing . Why else had [she]109-lily suddenly grown interested in [Selden]108-selden ? [She]109-lily had known [him]108-selden for eight years or more : ever since [her]109-lily return to [America]29-america [he]108-selden had formed a part of [her]109-lily background . [She]109-lily had always been glad to sit next to [him]108-selden at dinner , had found [him]108-selden more agreeable than [most men]875-most men , and had vaguely wished that [he]108-selden possessed the other qualities needful to fix [her]109-lily attention ; but till now [she]109-lily had been too busy with [her]109-lily own affairs to regard [him]108-selden as more than one of the pleasant accessories of life . [Miss Bart]109-lily was [a keen reader of [her]109-lily own heart]876-a keen reader of her own heart , and [she]109-lily saw that [her]109-lily sudden preoccupation with [Selden]108-selden was due to the fact that [his]108-selden presence shed a new light on [her]109-lily surroundings . Not that [he]108-selden was notably brilliant or exceptional ; in [his]108-selden own profession [he]108-selden was surpassed by [more than one man who had bored [Lily]109-lily through many a weary dinner]877-more than one man who had bored lily through many a weary dinner . It was rather that [he]108-selden had preserved a certain social detachment , a happy air of viewing the show objectively , of having points of contact outside the great gilt cage in which [they]878-they were all huddled for [the mob]879-the mob to gape at . How alluring [the world]354-the world outside the cage appeared to [Lily]109-lily , as [she]109-lily heard its door clang on [her]109-lily ! In reality , as [she]109-lily knew , the door never clanged : it stood always open ; but [most of [the captives]882-the captives]881-most of the captives were like flies in a bottle , and having once flown in , could never regain [their]881-most of the captives freedom . It was [Selden]108-selden ’s distinction that [he]108-selden had never forgotten the way out . That was the secret of [his]108-selden way of readjusting [her]109-lily vision . [Lily]109-lily , turning [her]109-lily eyes from [him]108-selden , found [herself]109-lily scanning [her]109-lily little world through [his]108-selden retina : it was as though the pink lamps had been shut off and the dusty daylight let in . [She]109-lily looked down the long table , studying its occupants one by one , from [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor , with [his]161-gus trenor heavy carnivorous head sunk between [his]161-gus trenor shoulders , as [he]161-gus trenor preyed on [a jellied plover]883-a jellied plover , to [[his]161-gus trenor wife]592-his wife , at the opposite end of the long bank of orchids , suggestive , with [her]592-his wife glaring good - looks , of [a jeweller]885-a jeweller ’s window lit by electricity . And between [the two]781-the two , what a long stretch of vacuity ! How dreary and trivial [these people]887-these people were ! [Lily]109-lily reviewed [them]887-these people with a scornful impatience : [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , with [her]146-carry fisher shoulders , [her]146-carry fisher eyes , [her]146-carry fisher divorces , [her]146-carry fisher general air of embodying a “ spicy paragraph ”[146-carry fisher] ; [young Silverton , who had meant to live on proof - reading and write an epic , and who now lived on [[his]888-young silverton , who had meant to live on proof - reading and write an epic , and who now lived on his friends and had become critical of truffles friends]889-his friends and had become critical of truffles]888-young silverton , who had meant to live on proof - reading and write an epic , and who now lived on his friends and had become critical of truffles ; [Alice Wetherall]147-alice wetherall , [an animated visiting - list , whose most fervid convictions turned on the wording of invitations]890-an animated visiting - list , whose most fervid convictions turned on the wording of invitations and the engraving of dinner - cards ; [Wetherall]147-alice wetherall , with [his]147-alice wetherall perpetual nervous nod of acquiescence , [his]147-alice wetherall air of agreeing with [people]2804-people before [he]147-alice wetherall knew what [they]2804-people were saying ; [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney , with [his]147-alice wetherall confident smile and anxious eyes , half way between [the sheriff]892-the sheriff and [an heiress]893-an heiress ; [Gwen Van Osburgh]119-gwen , with all the guileless confidence of [a young girl who has always been told that there is no one richer than [[her]119-gwen father]583-her father]894-a young girl who has always been told that there is no one richer than her father . [Lily]109-lily smiled at [her]109-lily classification of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends . How different [they]406-her friends had seemed to [her]109-lily a few hours ago ! Then [they]406-her friends had symbolized what [she]109-lily was gaining , now [they]406-her friends stood for what [she]109-lily was giving up . That very afternoon [they]406-her friends had seemed full of brilliant qualities ; now [she]109-lily saw that they were merely dull in a loud way . Under the glitter of [their]406-her friends opportunities [she]109-lily saw the poverty of [their]406-her friends achievement . It was not that [she]109-lily wanted [them]406-her friends to be more disinterested ; but [she]109-lily would have liked [them]406-her friends to be more picturesque . And [she]109-lily had a shamed recollection of the way in which , a few hours since , [she]109-lily had felt the centripetal force of [their]406-her friends standards . [She]109-lily closed [her]109-lily eyes an instant , and the vacuous routine of the life [she]109-lily had chosen stretched before [her]109-lily like [a long white road]897-a long white road without dip or turning : it was true [she]109-lily was to roll over it in [a carriage]898-a carriage instead of trudging [it]898-a carriage on foot , but sometimes [the pedestrian]899-the pedestrian enjoys the diversion of a short cut which is denied to [those on wheels]900-those on wheels . [She]109-lily was roused by a chuckle which [Mr. Dorset]167-mr. dorset seemed to eject from the depths of [his]167-mr. dorset lean throat . “ [I]167-mr. dorset say , do look at [her]109-lily , ”[167-mr. dorset] [he]167-mr. dorset exclaimed , turning to [Miss Bart]109-lily with lugubrious merriment—“I beg [your]109-lily pardon , but do just look at [[my]167-mr. dorset wife]2959-my wife making a fool of [that poor devil over there]2960-that poor devil over there ! [One]2737-one would really suppose [she]109-lily was gone on [him]167-mr. dorset — and it ’s all the other way round , [I]167-mr. dorset assure [you]109-lily . ”[167-mr. dorset] Thus adjured , [Lily]109-lily turned [her]109-lily eyes on the spectacle which was affording [Mr. Dorset]167-mr. dorset such legitimate mirth . It certainly appeared , as [he]167-mr. dorset said , that [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was [the more active participant in the scene]901-the more active participant in the scene : [[her]131-mrs. dorset neighbour]902-her neighbour seemed to receive [her]131-mrs. dorset advances with a temperate zest which did not distract [him]167-mr. dorset from [his]167-mr. dorset dinner . The sight restored [Lily]109-lily ’s good humour , and knowing the peculiar disguise which [Mr. Dorset]167-mr. dorset ’s marital fears assumed , [she]109-lily asked gaily : “ Are n’t [you]167-mr. dorset horribly jealous of [her]903-the sally ? ”[109-lily] [Dorset]167-mr. dorset greeted [the sally]903-the sally with delight . “ Oh , abominably — [you’ve]109-lily just hit it — keeps [me]167-mr. dorset awake at night . [The doctors]2962-the doctors tell [me]167-mr. dorset that ’s what has knocked [my]167-mr. dorset digestion out — being so infernally jealous of her.—I ca n’t eat a mouthful of this stuff , [you]109-lily know , ”[167-mr. dorset] [he]167-mr. dorset added suddenly , pushing back [his]167-mr. dorset plate with a clouded countenance ; and [Lily]109-lily , unfailingly adaptable , accorded [her]109-lily radiant attention to [his]167-mr. dorset prolonged denunciation of [other people]563-other people ’s cooks , with a supplementary tirade on the toxic qualities of melted butter . It was not often that [he]167-mr. dorset found so ready an ear ; and , being [a man]2811-a man as well as [a dyspeptic]906-a dyspeptic , it may be that as [he]167-mr. dorset poured [his]167-mr. dorset grievances into it [he]167-mr. dorset was not insensible to its rosy symmetry . At any rate [he]167-mr. dorset engaged [Lily]109-lily so long that the sweets were being handed when [she]109-lily caught a phrase on [her]109-lily other side , where [Miss Corby]168-miss corby , [the comic woman of the company]907-the comic woman of the company , was bantering [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney on [his]167-mr. dorset approaching engagement . [Miss Corby]168-miss corby ’s role was jocularity : [she]168-miss corby always entered the conversation with a handspring . “ And of course [you]167-mr. dorset ’ll have [Sim Rosedale]124-rosedale as [best man]2963-best man ! ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily heard [her]109-lily fling out as the climax of [her]109-lily prognostications ; and [Stepney]125-jack stepney responded , as if struck : “ [Jove]169-jove , that ’s an idea . What a thumping present [I]125-jack stepney ’d get out of [him]124-rosedale ! ”[125-jack stepney] [SIM ROSEDALE]124-rosedale ! The name , made more odious by its diminutive , obtruded itself on [Lily]109-lily ’s thoughts like a leer . It stood for one of the many hated possibilities hovering on the edge of life . If [she]109-lily did not marry [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce , the day might come when [she]109-lily would have to be civil to [such men as [Rosedale]124-rosedale]908-such men as rosedale . IF [SHE]109-lily DID NOT MARRY [HIM]127-mr. gryce ? But [she]109-lily meant to marry [him]127-mr. gryce — [she]109-lily was sure of [him]127-mr. gryce and sure of [herself]109-lily . [She]109-lily drew back with a shiver from the pleasant paths in which [her]109-lily thoughts had been straying , and set [her]109-lily feet once more in the middle of [the long white road]909-the long white road .... When [she]109-lily went [upstairs]2873-upstairs that night [she]109-lily found that the late post had brought [her]109-lily a fresh batch of bills . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , who was [a conscientious woman]911-a conscientious woman , had forwarded them all to [Bellomont]3-bellomont . * * * * * [Miss Bart]109-lily , accordingly , rose the next morning with the most earnest conviction that it was [her]109-lily duty to go to [church]818-church . [She]109-lily tore [herself]109-lily betimes from the lingering enjoyment of [her]109-lily breakfast tray , rang to have [her]109-lily grey gown laid out , and despatched [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid to borrow a prayer - book from [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor . But [her]109-lily course was too purely reasonable not to contain the germs of rebellion . No sooner were [her]109-lily preparations made than they roused a smothered sense of resistance . A small spark was enough to kindle [Lily]109-lily ’s imagination , and the sight of the grey dress and the borrowed prayer - book flashed a long light down the years . [She]109-lily would have to go to [church]818-church with [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce every Sunday . [They]915-they would have a front pew in [the most expensive church in [New York]6-new york]916-the most expensive church in new york , and [his]127-mr. gryce name would figure handsomely in the list of [parish charities]917-parish charities . In a few years , when [he]127-mr. gryce grew stouter , [he]127-mr. gryce would be made [a warden]918-a warden . Once in the winter [the rector]919-the rector would come to dine , and [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband would beg [her]109-lily to go over the list and see that [no DIVORCEES]921-no divorcees were included , except [those who had showed signs of penitence by being re - married to [the very wealthy]923-the very wealthy]922-those who had showed signs of penitence by being re - married to the very wealthy . There was nothing especially arduous in this round of religious obligations ; but it stood for a fraction of that great bulk of boredom which loomed across [her]109-lily path . And who could consent to be bored on such a morning ? [Lily]109-lily had slept well , and [her]109-lily bath had filled [her]109-lily with a pleasant glow , which was becomingly reflected in the clear curve of [her]109-lily cheek . No lines were visible this morning , or else the glass was at a happier angle . And the day was the accomplice of [her]109-lily mood : it was a day for impulse and truancy . The light air seemed full of powdered gold ; below the dewy bloom of the lawns the woodlands blushed and smouldered , and [the hills across [the river]790-the river]924-the hills across the river swam in molten blue . Every drop of blood in [Lily]109-lily ’s veins invited [her]109-lily to happiness . The sound of wheels roused [her]109-lily from these musings , and leaning behind [her]109-lily shutters [she]109-lily saw [the omnibus]815-the omnibus take up its freight . [She]109-lily was too late , then — but the fact did not alarm [her]109-lily . A glimpse of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s crestfallen face even suggested that [she]109-lily had done wisely in absenting [herself]109-lily , since the disappointment [he]127-mr. gryce so candidly betrayed would surely whet [his]127-mr. gryce appetite for the afternoon walk . [That walk]927-that walk [she]109-lily did not mean to miss ; one glance at the bills on [her]109-lily writing - table was enough to recall its necessity . But meanwhile [she]109-lily had the morning to [herself]109-lily , and could muse pleasantly on the disposal of its hours . [She]109-lily was familiar enough with the habits of [Bellomont]3-bellomont to know that [she]109-lily was likely to have [a free field till luncheon]928-a free field till luncheon . [She]109-lily had seen [the Wetheralls]120-the wetheralls , [[the Trenor]170-the trenor girls]929-the trenor girls and [Lady Cressida]121-lady cressida packed safely into [the omnibus]815-the omnibus ; [Judy Trenor]126-judy was sure to be having [her]126-judy hair shampooed ; [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher had doubtless carried off [[her]146-carry fisher host]809-her host for a drive ; [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton was probably smoking the cigarette of young despair in [[his]134-ned silverton bedroom]932-his bedroom ; and [Kate Corby]171-kate corby was certain to be playing tennis with [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney and [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh . Of [the ladies]832-the ladies , this left only [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset unaccounted for , and [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset never came down till luncheon : [[her]131-mrs. dorset doctors]934-her doctors , [she]131-mrs. dorset averred , had forbidden [her]131-mrs. dorset to expose [herself]131-mrs. dorset to the crude air of the morning . To [the remaining members of [the party]436-the party]935-the remaining members of the party [Lily]109-lily gave no special thought ; wherever [they]935-the remaining members of the party were , [they]935-the remaining members of the party were not likely to interfere with [her]109-lily plans . These , for the moment , took the shape of assuming a dress somewhat more rustic and summerlike in style than the garment [she]109-lily had first selected , and rustling [downstairs]937-downstairs , sunshade in hand , with the disengaged air of [a lady in quest of exercise]938-a lady in quest of exercise . [The great hall]939-the great hall was empty but for the knot of dogs by the fire , who , taking in at a glance the outdoor aspect of [Miss Bart]109-lily , were upon [her]109-lily at once with lavish offers of companionship . [She]109-lily put aside the ramming paws which conveyed these offers , and assuring the joyous volunteers that [she]109-lily might presently have a use for [their]935-the remaining members of the party company , sauntered on through [the empty drawing - room]940-the empty drawing - room to [the library]941-the library at the end of [the house]488-the house . [The library]941-the library was almost [the only surviving portion of [the old manor - house of [Bellomont]3-bellomont]945-the old manor - house of bellomont]944-the only surviving portion of the old manor - house of bellomont : [a long spacious room]946-a long spacious room , revealing the traditions of [the mother - country]947-the mother - country in [its]945-the old manor - house of bellomont classically - cased doors , the Dutch tiles of the chimney , and the elaborate hob - grate with [its]945-the old manor - house of bellomont shining brass urns . A few family portraits of [lantern - jawed gentlemen in tie - wigs]948-lantern - jawed gentlemen in tie - wigs , and [ladies with large head - dresses and small bodies]949-ladies with large head - dresses and small bodies , hung between the shelves lined with pleasantly - shabby books : books mostly contemporaneous with [the ancestors in question]950-the ancestors in question , and to which [the subsequent Trenors]951-the subsequent trenors had made no perceptible additions . [The library at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]952-the library at bellomont was in fact never used for reading , though [it]952-the library at bellomont had a certain popularity as [a smoking room]953-a smoking room or [a quiet retreat for flirtation]954-a quiet retreat for flirtation . It had occurred to [Lily]109-lily , however , that it might on this occasion have been resorted to by [the only member of [the party]436-the party in the least likely to put it to its original use]955-the only member of the party in the least likely to put it to its original use . [She]109-lily advanced noiselessly over the dense old rug scattered with easy - chairs , and before [she]109-lily reached the middle of [the room]351-the room [she]109-lily saw that [she]109-lily had not been mistaken . [Lawrence Selden]108-selden was in fact seated at [its]945-the old manor - house of bellomont farther end ; but though a book lay on [his]108-selden knee , [his]108-selden attention was not engaged with it , but directed to [a lady whose lace - clad figure , as [she]958-a lady whose lace - clad figure , as she leaned back in an adjoining chair leaned back in an adjoining chair]958-a lady whose lace - clad figure , as she leaned back in an adjoining chair , detached itself with exaggerated slimness against the dusky leather upholstery . [Lily]109-lily paused as [she]109-lily caught sight of [the group]959-the group ; for a moment [she]109-lily seemed about to withdraw , but thinking better of this , [she]109-lily announced [her]109-lily approach by a slight shake of [her]109-lily skirts which made [the couple]960-the couple raise [their]960-the couple heads , [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset with a look of frank displeasure , and [Selden]108-selden with [his]108-selden usual quiet smile . The sight of [his]108-selden composure had a disturbing effect on [Lily]109-lily ; but to be disturbed was in [her]109-lily case to make a more brilliant effort at self - possession . “ Dear [me]109-lily , am [I]109-lily late ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily asked , putting a hand in [his]108-selden as [he]108-selden advanced to greet [her]109-lily . “ Late for what ? ”[131-mrs. dorset] enquired [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset tartly . “ Not for luncheon , certainly — but perhaps [you]108-selden had an earlier engagement ? ”[131-mrs. dorset] “ Yes , [I]109-lily had , ”[109-lily] said [Lily]109-lily confidingly . “ Really ? Perhaps [I]109-lily am in the way , then ? But [Mr. Selden]108-selden is entirely at [your]108-selden disposal . ”[109-lily] [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was pale with temper , and [[her]131-mrs. dorset antagonist]961-her antagonist felt a certain pleasure in prolonging [her]131-mrs. dorset distress . “ Oh , [dear]2964-dear , no — do stay , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said good - humouredly . “ [I]109-lily do n’t in the least want to drive [you]108-selden away . ”[109-lily] “ [You]108-selden ’re awfully good , [dear]2964-dear , but [I]961-her antagonist never interfere with [Mr. Selden]108-selden ’s engagements . ”[961-her antagonist] The remark was uttered with a little air of proprietorship not lost on its object , who concealed a faint blush of annoyance by stooping to pick up the book [he]961-her antagonist had dropped at [Lily]109-lily ’s approach . [The latter]566-the latter ’s eyes widened charmingly and [she]109-lily broke into a light laugh . “ But [I]109-lily have no engagement with [Mr. Selden]108-selden ! [My]109-lily engagement was to go to [church]818-church ; and [I]109-lily ’m afraid [the omnibus]815-the omnibus has started without [me]109-lily . HAS it started , do [you]108-selden know ? ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily turned to [Selden]108-selden , who replied that [he]108-selden had heard it drive away some time since . “ Ah , then [I]108-selden shall have to walk ; [I]108-selden promised [Hilda]163-hilda and [Muriel]162-muriel to go to [church]818-church with [them]963-the couple on whom she had intruded . It ’s too late to walk [there]2755-there , [you]108-selden say ? Well , [I]108-selden shall have the credit of trying , at any rate — and the advantage of escaping part of the service . [I]108-selden ’m not so sorry for [myself]108-selden , after all ! ”[108-selden] And with a bright nod to [the couple on whom [she]109-lily had intruded]963-the couple on whom she had intruded , [Miss Bart]109-lily strolled through the glass doors and carried [her]109-lily rustling grace down the long perspective of [the garden walk]964-the garden walk . [She]109-lily was taking [her]109-lily way churchward , but at no very quick pace ; a fact not lost on [one of [[her]109-lily observers]966-her observers , who stood in the doorway looking after [her]109-lily with an air of puzzled amusement]965-one of her observers , who stood in the doorway looking after her with an air of puzzled amusement . The truth is that [she]109-lily was conscious of a somewhat keen shock of disappointment . All [her]109-lily plans for the day had been built on the assumption that it was to see [her]109-lily that [Selden]108-selden had come to [Bellomont]3-bellomont . [She]109-lily had expected , when [she]109-lily came [downstairs]937-downstairs , to find [him]108-selden on the watch for [her]109-lily ; and [she]109-lily had found [him]108-selden , instead , in a situation which might well denote that [he]108-selden had been on the watch for [another lady]968-another lady . Was it possible , after all , that [he]108-selden had come for [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ? [The latter]566-the latter had acted on the assumption to the extent of appearing at an hour when [she]133-bertha never showed [herself]133-bertha to [ordinary mortals]970-ordinary mortals , and [Lily]109-lily , for the moment , saw no way of putting [her]133-bertha in the wrong . It did not occur to [her]109-lily that [Selden]108-selden might have been actuated merely by the desire to spend a Sunday out of [town]305-town : [women]2772-women never learn to dispense with the sentimental motive in [their]2772-women judgments of [men]2795-men . But [Lily]109-lily was not easily disconcerted ; competition put [her]109-lily on [her]109-lily mettle , and [she]109-lily reflected that [Selden]108-selden ’s coming , if it did not declare [him]108-selden to be still in [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s toils , showed [him]108-selden to be so completely free from [them]974-them that [he]108-selden was not afraid of [her]109-lily proximity . These thoughts so engaged [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily fell into a gait hardly likely to carry [her]109-lily to [church]818-church before the sermon , and at length , having passed from [the gardens]787-the gardens to [the wood - path beyond]977-the wood - path beyond , so far forgot [her]109-lily intention as to sink into a rustic seat at a bend of [the walk]978-the walk . [The spot]979-the spot was charming , and [Lily]109-lily was not insensible to the charm , or to the fact that [her]109-lily presence enhanced it ; but [she]109-lily was not accustomed to taste the joys of solitude except in company , and the combination of [a handsome girl]980-a handsome girl and a romantic scene struck [her]109-lily as too good to be wasted . [No one]2766-no one , however , appeared to profit by the opportunity ; and after a half hour of fruitless waiting [she]109-lily rose and wandered on . [She]109-lily felt a stealing sense of fatigue as [she]109-lily walked ; the sparkle had died out of [her]109-lily , and the taste of life was stale on [her]109-lily lips . [She]109-lily hardly knew what [she]109-lily had been seeking , or why the failure to find it had so blotted the light from [her]109-lily sky : [she]109-lily was only aware of a vague sense of failure , of an inner isolation deeper than the loneliness about [her]109-lily . [Her]109-lily footsteps flagged , and [she]109-lily stood gazing listlessly ahead , digging the ferny edge of the path with the tip of [her]109-lily sunshade . As [she]109-lily did so a step sounded behind [her]109-lily , and [she]109-lily saw [Selden]108-selden at [her]109-lily side . “ How fast [you]109-lily walk ! ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden remarked . “ [I]108-selden thought [I]108-selden should never catch up with [you]108-selden . ”[108-selden] [She]109-lily answered gaily : “ [You]108-selden must be quite breathless ! [I]109-lily ’ve been sitting under that tree for an hour . ”[109-lily] “ Waiting for [me]108-selden , [I]108-selden hope ? ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden rejoined ; and [she]109-lily said with a vague laugh : “ Well — waiting to see if [you]108-selden would come . ”[109-lily] “ [I]109-lily seize the distinction , but [I]109-lily do n’t mind it , since doing the one involved doing the other . But were n’t [you]108-selden sure that [I]109-lily should come ? ”[109-lily] “ If [I]109-lily waited long enough — but [you]108-selden see [I]109-lily had only a limited time to give to the experiment . ”[109-lily] “ Why limited ? Limited by luncheon ? ”[109-lily] “ No ; by [my]109-lily other engagement . ”[109-lily] “ [Your]108-selden engagement to go to [church]818-church with [Muriel]162-muriel and [Hilda]163-hilda ? ”[109-lily] “ No ; but to come [home]400-home from [church]818-church with [another person]2973-another person . ”[109-lily] “ Ah , [I]109-lily see ; [I]109-lily might have known [you]108-selden were fully provided with alternatives . And is [the other person]2974-the other person coming [home]400-home this way ? ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily laughed again . “ That ’s just what [I]109-lily do n’t know ; and to find out , it is [my]109-lily business to get to [church]818-church before the service is over . ”[109-lily] “ Exactly ; and it is [my]109-lily business to prevent [your]108-selden doing so ; in which case [the other person]2974-the other person , piqued by [your]108-selden absence , will form the desperate resolve of driving back in [the omnibus]815-the omnibus . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily received this with fresh appreciation ; [his]982-his nonsense was like the bubbling of [her]109-lily inner mood . “ Is that what [you]982-his would do in such an emergency ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily enquired . [Selden]108-selden looked at [her]109-lily with solemnity . “ [I]108-selden am here to prove to [you]109-lily , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden cried , “ what [I]108-selden am capable of doing in an emergency ! ”[108-selden] “ Walking a mile in an hour — [you]109-lily must own that [the omnibus]815-the omnibus would be quicker ! ”[109-lily] “ Ah — but will [he]982-his find [you]109-lily in the end ? That ’s the only test of success . ”[983-they] [They]983-they looked at [each other]2955-each other with the same luxury of enjoyment that [they]983-they had felt in exchanging absurdities over [his]982-his tea - table ; but suddenly [Lily]109-lily ’s face changed , and [she]109-lily said : “ Well , if it is , [he]982-his has succeeded . ”[109-lily] [Selden]108-selden , following [her]109-lily glance , perceived [a party of people]985-a party of people advancing toward [them]985-a party of people from the farther bend of the path . [Lady Cressida]121-lady cressida had evidently insisted on walking [home]400-home , and [the rest of [the church - goers]988-the church - goers]987-the rest of the church - goers had thought it [their]987-the rest of the church - goers duty to accompany [her]121-lady cressida . [[Lily]109-lily ’s companion]989-lily ’s companion looked rapidly from one to [the other of [the two men of the party]991-the two men of the party]990-the other of the two men of the party ; [Wetherall]147-alice wetherall walking respectfully at [Lady Cressida]121-lady cressida ’s side with [his]147-alice wetherall little sidelong look of nervous attention , and [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce bringing - up the rear with [Mrs. Wetherall]164-mrs. wetherall and [the Trenors]111-gus . “ Ah — now [I]108-selden see why [you]109-lily were getting up [your]109-lily Americana ! ”[108-selden] [Selden]108-selden exclaimed with a note of the freest admiration but the blush with which the sally was received checked whatever amplifications [he]108-selden had meant to give it . That [Lily Bart]109-lily should object to being bantered about [[her]109-lily suitors]992-her suitors , or even about [her]109-lily means of attracting [them]992-her suitors , was so new to [Selden]108-selden that [he]108-selden had a momentary flash of surprise , which lit up a number of possibilities ; but [she]109-lily rose gallantly to the defence of [her]109-lily confusion , by saying , as its object approached : “ That was why [I]109-lily was waiting for [you]108-selden — to thank [you]108-selden for having given [me]109-lily so many points ! ”[109-lily] “ Ah , [you]108-selden can hardly do justice to the subject in such a short time , ”[108-selden] said [Selden]108-selden , as [the Trenor girls]929-the trenor girls caught sight of [Miss Bart]109-lily ; and while [she]109-lily signalled a response to [their]929-the trenor girls boisterous greeting , [he]108-selden added quickly : “ Wo n’t [you]108-selden devote [your]108-selden afternoon to it ? [You]108-selden know [I]109-lily must be off tomorrow morning . [We]2980-we ’ll take a walk , and [you]108-selden can thank [me]109-lily at [your]108-selden leisure . ”[109-lily] Chapter 6 The afternoon was perfect . A deeper stillness possessed the air , and the glitter of the American autumn was tempered by a haze which diffused the brightness without dulling it . In the woody hollows of [the park]747-the park there was already a faint chill ; but as the ground rose the air grew lighter , and ascending the long slopes beyond [the high - road]995-the high - road , [Lily]109-lily and [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion reached a zone of lingering summer . [The path]997-the path wound across [a meadow with scattered trees]998-a meadow with scattered trees ; then [it]997-the path dipped into [a lane plumed with asters and purpling sprays of bramble]999-a lane plumed with asters and purpling sprays of bramble , whence , through the light quiver of ash - leaves , [the country]304-the country unrolled itself in pastoral distances . Higher up , [the lane]1001-the lane showed thickening tufts of fern and of the creeping glossy verdure of shaded slopes ; trees began to overhang it , and the shade deepened to the checkered dusk of a beech - grove . The boles of the trees stood well apart , with only a light feathering of undergrowth ; the path wound along the edge of the wood , now and then looking out on [a sunlit pasture]1002-a sunlit pasture or on [an orchard spangled with fruit]1003-an orchard spangled with fruit . [Lily]109-lily had no real intimacy with nature , but [she]109-lily had a passion for the appropriate and could be keenly sensitive to a scene which was the fitting background of [her]109-lily own sensations . [The landscape outspread below [her]109-lily]1004-the landscape outspread below her seemed an enlargement of [her]109-lily present mood , and [she]109-lily found something of [herself]109-lily in its calmness , its breadth , its long free reaches . On the nearer slopes the sugar - maples wavered like pyres of light ; lower down was a massing of [grey orchards]1005-grey orchards , and here and there the lingering green of [an oak - grove]1006-an oak - grove . [Two or three red farm - houses]1007-two or three red farm - houses dozed under the apple - trees , and the white wooden spire of [a village church]1008-a village church showed beyond the shoulder of [the hill]1009-the hill ; while far below , in a haze of dust , [the high - road]995-the high - road ran between [the fields]1011-the fields . “ Let [us]1012-us sit here , ”[108-selden] [Selden]108-selden suggested , as [they]1012-us reached an open ledge of rock above which the beeches rose steeply between mossy boulders . [Lily]109-lily dropped down on [the rock]1013-the rock , glowing with [her]109-lily long climb . [She]109-lily sat quiet , [her]109-lily lips parted by the stress of the ascent , [her]109-lily eyes wandering peacefully over the broken ranges of the landscape . [Selden]108-selden stretched [himself]108-selden on the grass at [her]109-lily feet , tilting [his]108-selden hat against the level sun - rays , and clasping [his]108-selden hands behind [his]108-selden head , which rested against the side of the rock . [He]108-selden had no wish to make [her]109-lily talk ; [her]109-lily quick - breathing silence seemed a part of the general hush and harmony of things . In [his]108-selden own mind there was only a lazy sense of pleasure , veiling the sharp edges of sensation as the September haze veiled the scene at [their]1012-us feet . But [Lily]109-lily , though [her]109-lily attitude was as calm as [his]108-selden , was throbbing inwardly with a rush of thoughts . There were in [her]109-lily at the moment [two beings]1014-two beings , [one drawing deep breaths of freedom and exhilaration]1015-one drawing deep breaths of freedom and exhilaration , [the other gasping for air in a little black prison - house of fears]1016-the other gasping for air in a little black prison - house of fears . But gradually [the captive]1017-the captive ’s gasps grew fainter , or the other paid less heed to them : the horizon expanded , the air grew stronger , and the free spirit quivered for flight . [She]109-lily could not [herself]109-lily have explained the sense of buoyancy which seemed to lift and swing [her]109-lily above the sun - suffused world at [her]109-lily feet . Was it love , [she]109-lily wondered , or a mere fortuitous combination of happy thoughts and sensations ? How much of it was owing to the spell of the perfect afternoon , the scent of [the fading woods]1018-the fading woods , the thought of the dulness [she]109-lily had fled from ? [Lily]109-lily had no definite experience by which to test the quality of [her]109-lily feelings . [She]109-lily had several times been in love with fortunes or [careers]1019-careers , but only once with [a man]2811-a man . That was years ago , when [she]109-lily first came out , and had been smitten with a romantic passion for [a young gentleman named [Herbert Melson]172-herbert melson , who had blue eyes and a little wave in [his]1021-a young gentleman named herbert melson , who had blue eyes and a little wave in his hair hair]1021-a young gentleman named herbert melson , who had blue eyes and a little wave in his hair . [Mr. Melson]173-mr. melson , who was possessed of no other negotiable securities , had hastened to employ these in capturing the eldest [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh : since then [he]173-mr. melson had grown stout and wheezy , and was given to telling anecdotes about [[his]173-mr. melson children]1022-his children . If [Lily]109-lily recalled this early emotion it was not to compare it with that which now possessed [her]109-lily ; the only point of comparison was the sense of lightness , of emancipation , which [she]109-lily remembered feeling , in the whirl of a waltz or the seclusion of [a conservatory]1023-a conservatory , during the brief course of [her]109-lily youthful romance . [She]109-lily had not known again till today that lightness , that glow of freedom ; but now it was something more than a blind groping of the blood . The peculiar charm of [her]109-lily feeling for [Selden]108-selden was that [she]109-lily understood it ; [she]109-lily could put [her]109-lily finger on every link of the chain that was drawing them together . Though [his]108-selden popularity was of the quiet kind , felt rather than actively expressed among [[his]108-selden friends]889-his friends , [she]109-lily had never mistaken [his]108-selden inconspicuousness for obscurity . [His]108-selden reputed cultivation was generally regarded as a slight obstacle to easy intercourse , but [Lily]109-lily , who prided [herself]109-lily on [her]109-lily broad - minded recognition of literature , and always carried an Omar [Khayam]174-khayam in [her]109-lily travelling - bag , was attracted by this attribute , which [she]109-lily felt would have had its distinction in [an older society]1025-an older society . It was , moreover , one of [his]108-selden gifts to look [his]108-selden part ; to have a height which lifted [his]108-selden head above [the crowd]308-the crowd , and the keenly - modelled dark features which , in a land of amorphous types , gave [him]108-selden the air of belonging to [a more specialized race]1027-a more specialized race , of carrying the impress of a concentrated past . [Expansive persons]1028-expansive persons found [him]108-selden a little dry , and [very young girls]1029-very young girls thought [him]108-selden sarcastic ; but this air of friendly aloofness , as far removed as possible from any assertion of personal advantage , was the quality which piqued [Lily]109-lily ’s interest . Everything about [him]108-selden accorded with the fastidious element in [her]109-lily taste , even to the light irony with which [he]108-selden surveyed what seemed to [her]109-lily most sacred . [She]109-lily admired [him]108-selden most of all , perhaps , for being able to convey as distinct a sense of superiority as [the richest man [she]109-lily had ever met]1030-the richest man she had ever met . It was the unconscious prolongation of this thought which led [her]109-lily to say presently , with a laugh : “ [I]109-lily have broken two engagements for [you]108-selden today . How many have [you]108-selden broken for [me]109-lily ? ”[109-lily] “ None , ”[108-selden] said [Selden]108-selden calmly . “ [My]108-selden only engagement at [Bellomont]3-bellomont was with [you]109-lily . ”[108-selden] [She]109-lily glanced down at [him]108-selden , faintly smiling . “ Did [you]108-selden really come to [Bellomont]3-bellomont to see [me]109-lily ? ”[109-lily] “ Of course [I]109-lily did . ”[109-lily] [Her]109-lily look deepened meditatively . “ Why ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily murmured , with an accent which took all tinge of coquetry from the question . “ Because [you]108-selden ’re such a wonderful spectacle : [I]109-lily always like to see what [you]108-selden are doing . ”[109-lily] “ How do [you]109-lily know what [I]108-selden should be doing if [you]109-lily were not [here]2763-here ? ”[108-selden] [Selden]108-selden smiled . “ [I]108-selden do n’t flatter [myself]108-selden that [my]108-selden coming has deflected [your]109-lily course of action by a hair ’s breadth . ”[108-selden] “ That ’s absurd — since , if [you]109-lily were not [here]2763-here , [I]109-lily could obviously not be taking a walk with [you]109-lily . ”[109-lily] “ No ; but [your]109-lily taking a walk with [me]109-lily is only another way of making use of [your]109-lily material . [You]109-lily are [an artist]2983-an artist and [I]109-lily happen to be the bit of colour [you]109-lily are using today . It ’s a part of [your]109-lily cleverness to be able to produce premeditated effects extemporaneously . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily smiled also : [his]108-selden words were too acute not to strike [her]109-lily sense of humour . It was true that [she]109-lily meant to use the accident of [his]108-selden presence as part of a very definite effect ; or that , at least , was the secret pretext [she]109-lily had found for breaking [her]109-lily promise to walk with [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce . [She]109-lily had sometimes been accused of being too eager — even [Judy Trenor]126-judy had warned [her]109-lily to go slowly . Well , [she]109-lily would not be too eager in this case ; [she]109-lily would give [[her]109-lily suitor]1031-her suitor a longer taste of suspense . Where duty and inclination jumped together , it was not in [Lily]109-lily ’s nature to hold [them]1032-them asunder . [She]109-lily had excused [herself]109-lily from the walk on the plea of a headache : the horrid headache which , in the morning , had prevented [her]109-lily venturing to [church]818-church . [Her]109-lily appearance at luncheon justified the excuse . [She]109-lily looked languid , full of a suffering sweetness ; [she]109-lily carried a scent - bottle in [her]109-lily hand . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was new to such manifestations ; [he]127-mr. gryce wondered rather nervously if [she]109-lily were delicate , having far - reaching fears about the future of [[his]127-mr. gryce progeny]1034-his progeny . But sympathy won the day , and [he]127-mr. gryce besought [her]109-lily not to expose [herself]109-lily : [he]127-mr. gryce always connected the outer air with ideas of exposure . [Lily]109-lily had received [his]127-mr. gryce sympathy with languid gratitude , urging [him]127-mr. gryce , since [she]109-lily should be such poor company , to join [the rest of the party who , after luncheon , were starting in [automobiles]1036-automobiles on a visit to [the Van Osburghs]150-the van osburghs at [Peekskill]32-peekskill]1035-the rest of the party who , after luncheon , were starting in automobiles on a visit to the van osburghs at peekskill . [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce was touched by [her]109-lily disinterestedness , and , to escape from the threatened vacuity of the afternoon , had taken [her]109-lily advice and departed mournfully , in a dust - hood and goggles : as [the motor - car]1037-the motor - car plunged down [the avenue]1038-the avenue [she]109-lily smiled at [his]127-mr. gryce resemblance to a baffled beetle . [Selden]108-selden had watched [her]109-lily manoeuvres with lazy amusement . [She]109-lily had made no reply to [his]127-mr. gryce suggestion that [they]1039-they should spend the afternoon together , but as [her]109-lily plan unfolded itself [he]127-mr. gryce felt fairly confident of being included in it . [The house]488-the house was empty when at length [he]127-mr. gryce heard [her]109-lily step on the stair and strolled out of [the billiard - room]1041-the billiard - room to join [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily had on a hat and walking - dress , and the dogs were bounding at [her]109-lily feet . “ [I]109-lily thought , after all , the air might do [me]109-lily good , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily explained ; and [he]127-mr. gryce agreed that so simple a remedy was worth trying . [The excursionists]1042-the excursionists would be gone at least four hours ; [Lily]109-lily and [Selden]108-selden had the whole afternoon before [them]1042-the excursionists , and the sense of leisure and safety gave the last touch of lightness to [her]109-lily spirit . With so much time to talk , and no definite object to be led up to , [she]109-lily could taste the rare joys of mental vagrancy . [She]109-lily felt so free from ulterior motives that [she]109-lily took up [his]127-mr. gryce charge with a touch of resentment . “ [I]109-lily do n’t know , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said , “ why [you]127-mr. gryce are always accusing [me]109-lily of premeditation . ”[109-lily] “ [I]108-selden thought [you]127-mr. gryce confessed to it : [you]127-mr. gryce told [me]108-selden the other day that [you]127-mr. gryce had to follow a certain line — and if [one]2737-one does a thing at all it is a merit to do it thoroughly . ”[108-selden] “ If [you]127-mr. gryce mean that [a girl who has [no one]2766-no one to think for [her]2985-a girl who has no one to think for her]2985-a girl who has no one to think for her is obliged to think for [herself]2985-a girl who has no one to think for her , [I]108-selden am quite willing to accept the imputation . But [you]127-mr. gryce must find [me]108-selden [a dismal kind of person]2987-a dismal kind of person if [you]127-mr. gryce suppose that [I]108-selden never yield to an impulse . ”[108-selden] “ Ah , but [I]109-lily do n’t suppose that : have n’t [I]109-lily told [you]127-mr. gryce that [your]127-mr. gryce genius lies in converting impulses into intentions ? ”[109-lily] “ [My]1043-her genius ? ”[1043-her] [she]1043-her echoed with a sudden note of weariness . “ Is there any final test of genius but success ? And [I]1043-her certainly have n’t succeeded . ”[1043-her] [Selden]108-selden pushed [his]108-selden hat back and took a side - glance at [her]1043-her . “ Success — what is success ? [I]108-selden shall be interested to have [your]127-mr. gryce definition . ”[108-selden] “ Success ? ”[1043-her] [She]1043-her hesitated . “ Why , to get as much as [one]2988-one can out of life , [I]1043-her suppose . It ’s a relative quality , after all . Is n’t that [your]127-mr. gryce idea of it ? ”[1043-her] “ [My]108-selden idea of it ? God forbid ! ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden sat up with sudden energy , resting [his]108-selden elbows on [his]108-selden knees and staring out upon [the mellow fields]1044-the mellow fields . “ [My]108-selden idea of success , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said , “ is personal freedom . ”[108-selden] “ Freedom ? Freedom from worries ? ”[1043-her] “ From everything — from money , from poverty , from ease and anxiety , from all the material accidents . To keep a kind of republic of the spirit — that ’s what [I]1043-her call success . ”[1043-her] [She]1043-her leaned forward with a responsive flash . “ [I]108-selden know — [I]108-selden know — it ’s strange ; but that ’s just what [I]108-selden ’ve been feeling today . ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden met [her]1043-her eyes with the latent sweetness of [his]108-selden . “ Is the feeling so rare with [you]1043-her ? ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said . Hitherto [he]108-selden had found , in [her]1043-her presence and [her]1043-her talk , the aesthetic amusement which [a reflective man]1045-a reflective man is apt to seek in desultory intercourse with [pretty women]1046-pretty women . [His]108-selden attitude had been one of admiring spectatorship , and [he]108-selden would have been almost sorry to detect in [her]1043-her any emotional weakness which should interfere with the fulfilment of [her]1043-her aims . But now the hint of this weakness had become the most interesting thing about [her]1043-her . [He]108-selden had come on [her]1043-her that morning in a moment of disarray ; [her]1043-her face had been pale and altered , and the diminution of [her]1043-her beauty had lent [her]1043-her a poignant charm . THAT IS HOW [SHE]1043-her LOOKS WHEN [SHE]1043-her IS ALONE ! had been [his]108-selden first thought ; and the second was to note in [her]1043-her the change which [his]108-selden coming produced . But [you]108-selden will marry [some one very rich]3000-some one very rich , and it ’s as hard for [rich people]3001-rich people to get into as [the kingdom of heaven]3002-the kingdom of heaven . ”[108-selden] “ That ’s unjust , [I]108-selden think , because , as [I]108-selden understand it , one of the conditions of citizenship is not to think too much about money , and the only way not to think about money is to have a great deal of it . ”[108-selden] “ [You]108-selden might as well say that the only way not to think about air is to have enough to breathe . And so it is with [[your]108-selden rich people]3003-your rich people — [they]3003-your rich people may not be thinking of money , but [they]3003-your rich people ’re breathing it all the while ; take [them]3003-your rich people into another element and see how [they]3003-your rich people squirm and gasp ! ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily sat gazing absently through the blue rings of [her]109-lily cigarette - smoke . “ It seems to [me]109-lily , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said at length , “ that [you]108-selden spend a good deal of [your]108-selden time in the element [you]108-selden disapprove of . ”[109-lily] [Selden]108-selden received this thrust without discomposure . “ Yes ; but [I]109-lily have tried to remain amphibious : it ’s all right as long as [one]2737-one ’s lungs can work in another air . It ’s just the other way with most shows — [the audience]3012-the audience may be under the illusion , but [the actors]3013-the actors know that real life is on the other side of the footlights . [The people who take society as an escape from work]3014-the people who take society as an escape from work are putting it to its proper use ; but when it becomes the thing worked for it distorts all the relations of life . ”[108-selden] [Selden]108-selden raised [himself]108-selden on [his]108-selden elbow . “ Good heavens ! ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden went on , “ [I]108-selden do n’t underrate the decorative side of life . The reflection steadied [his]108-selden voice as [he]108-selden asked , between pity and irony : “ Is n’t it natural that [I]108-selden should try to belittle all the things [I]108-selden ca n’t offer [you]1053-she ? ”[108-selden] [Her]1053-she face brightened at this , but [she]1053-she drew [her]1053-she hand away , not with a gesture of coquetry , but as though renouncing something to which [she]1053-she had no claim . “ But [you]108-selden belittle [ME]1053-she , do n’t [you]108-selden , ”[1053-she] [she]1053-she returned gently , “ in being so sure they are the only things [I]1053-she care for ? ”[1053-she] [Selden]108-selden felt an inner start ; but it was only the last quiver of [his]108-selden egoism .
