[Selden]108-selden ’s voice was under better control . “ Why not ? ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden returned . “ [You]1053-she see [I]108-selden took no risks in being so . ”[108-selden] And as [she]1053-she continued to stand before [him]108-selden , a little pale under the retort , [he]108-selden added quickly : “ Let [us]3047-us go down . ”[108-selden] Chapter 7 [It]1068-it spoke much for the depth of [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s friendship that [her]1053-she voice , in admonishing [Miss Bart]109-lily , took the same note of personal despair as if [she]1053-she had been lamenting the collapse of a house - party . “ All [I]1053-she can say is , [Lily]109-lily , that [I]1053-she ca n’t make [you]109-lily out ! ”[1053-she] [She]1053-she leaned back , sighing , in the morning abandon of lace and muslin , turning an indifferent shoulder to the heaped - up importunities of [her]1053-she desk , while [she]1053-she considered , with the eye of [a physician who has given up the case]1069-a physician who has given up the case , the erect exterior of [the patient]1070-the patient confronting [her]1053-she . “ If [you]109-lily had n’t told [me]1053-she [you]109-lily were going in for [him]108-selden seriously — but [I]1053-she ’m sure [you]109-lily made that plain enough from the beginning ! And [I]1053-she ’m sure [everybody]2995-everybody played fair ! [They]2995-everybody all wanted to help it along . [I]1053-she told [you]109-lily [Bertha]133-bertha was dangerous . Oh , [Lily]109-lily , [you]109-lily ’ll never do anything if [you]109-lily ’re not serious ! ”[1053-she] [Miss Bart]109-lily accepted this exhortation in a spirit of the purest impartiality . Why should [she]109-lily have been angry ? It was the voice of [her]109-lily own conscience which spoke to [her]109-lily through [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s reproachful accents . But even to [her]109-lily own conscience [she]109-lily must trump up a semblance of defence . “ [I]123-mrs. trenor only took a day off — [I]123-mrs. trenor thought [he]108-selden meant to stay on all this week , and [I]123-mrs. trenor knew [Mr. Selden]108-selden was leaving this morning . ”[123-mrs. trenor] [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor brushed aside the plea with a gesture which laid bare its weakness . “ [He]108-selden did mean to stay — that ’s the worst of it . It shows that [he]108-selden ’s run away from [you]123-mrs. trenor ; that [Bertha]133-bertha ’s done [her]133-bertha work and poisoned [him]108-selden thoroughly . ”[123-mrs. trenor] [Lily]109-lily gave a slight laugh . “ Oh , if [he]108-selden ’s running [I]109-lily ’ll overtake [him]108-selden ! ”[109-lily] [[Her]109-lily friend]754-her friend threw out an arresting hand . “ Whatever [you]109-lily do , [Lily]109-lily , do nothing ! ”[754-her friend] [Miss Bart]109-lily received the warning with a smile . “ [I]109-lily do n’t mean , literally , to take [the next train]3052-the next train . [They]3056-they ’re all alike , [you]123-mrs. trenor know : [they]3056-they hold [their]3056-they tongues for years , and [you]123-mrs. trenor think [you]123-mrs. trenor ’re safe , but when [their]3056-they opportunity comes [they]3056-they remember everything . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily had grown pale : [her]109-lily voice had a harsh note in it . “ It was some money [I]109-lily lost at bridge at [the Van Osburghs ’]3057-the van osburghs ’ . [Miss Bart]109-lily listened with admirable equanimity . [Her]109-lily naturally good temper had been disciplined by years of enforced compliance , since [she]109-lily had almost always had to attain [her]109-lily ends by the circuitous path of [other people]563-other people ’s ; and , being naturally inclined to face unpleasant facts as soon as they presented [themselves]1075-themselves , [she]109-lily was not sorry to hear an impartial statement of what [her]109-lily folly was likely to cost , the more so as [her]109-lily own thoughts were still insisting on the other side of the case . Presented in the light of [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s vigorous comments , the reckoning was certainly a formidable one , and [Lily]109-lily , as [she]109-lily listened , found [herself]109-lily gradually reverting to [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s view of the situation . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s words were moreover emphasized for [[her]123-mrs. trenor hearer]1077-her hearer by anxieties which [she]123-mrs. trenor [herself]123-mrs. trenor could scarcely guess . Affluence , unless stimulated by a keen imagination , forms but the vaguest notion of the practical strain of poverty . [Judy]126-judy knew it must be “ horrid ”[1077-her hearer] for poor [Lily]109-lily to have to stop to consider whether [she]109-lily could afford real lace on [her]109-lily petticoats , and not to have [a motor - car]1078-a motor - car and [a steam - yacht]1079-a steam - yacht at [her]109-lily orders ; but the daily friction of unpaid bills , the daily nibble of small temptations to expenditure , were trials as far out of [her]109-lily experience as the domestic problems of [the char - woman]1080-the char - woman . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s unconsciousness of the real stress of the situation had the effect of making it more galling to [Lily]109-lily . While [[her]123-mrs. trenor friend]754-her friend reproached [her]123-mrs. trenor for missing the opportunity to eclipse [[her]123-mrs. trenor rivals]316-her rivals , [she]123-mrs. trenor was once more battling in imagination with the mounting tide of indebtedness from which [she]123-mrs. trenor had so nearly escaped . What wind of folly had driven [her]123-mrs. trenor out again on [those dark seas]1083-those dark seas ? If anything was needed to put the last touch to [her]123-mrs. trenor self - abasement it was the sense of the way [her]123-mrs. trenor old life was opening its ruts again to receive [her]123-mrs. trenor . Yesterday [her]123-mrs. trenor fancy had fluttered free pinions above a choice of occupations ; now [she]123-mrs. trenor had to drop to the level of the familiar routine , in which moments of seeming brilliancy and freedom alternated with long hours of subjection . [She]123-mrs. trenor laid a deprecating hand on [[her]123-mrs. trenor friend]754-her friend ’s . “ [Dear Judy]178-dear judy ! [I]123-mrs. trenor ’m sorry to have been such a bore , and [you]178-dear judy are very good to [me]123-mrs. trenor . But [you]178-dear judy must have some letters for [me]123-mrs. trenor to answer — let [me]123-mrs. trenor at least be useful . ”[123-mrs. trenor] [She]123-mrs. trenor settled [herself]123-mrs. trenor at the desk , and [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor accepted [her]123-mrs. trenor resumption of the morning ’s task with a sigh which implied that , after all , [she]123-mrs. trenor had proved [herself]123-mrs. trenor unfit for higher uses . The luncheon - table showed a depleted circle . Comfortable ! At that moment the word was more eloquent to [Lily Bart]109-lily than any other in the language . [She]159-miss van osburgh could not even pause to smile over [the heiress]1096-the heiress ’s view of a colossal fortune as a mere shelter against want : [her]159-miss van osburgh mind was filled with the vision of what that shelter might have been to [her]159-miss van osburgh . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s pin - pricks did not smart , for [her]159-miss van osburgh own irony cut deeper : [no one]2766-no one could hurt [her]159-miss van osburgh as much as [she]159-miss van osburgh was hurting [herself]159-miss van osburgh , for [no one else]703-no one else — not even [Judy Trenor]126-judy — knew the full magnitude of [her]159-miss van osburgh folly . [He]111-gus will be back at four , and [I]123-mrs. trenor know [she]146-carry fisher has it in [her]146-carry fisher mind to meet [him]111-gus . It seems to [me]123-mrs. trenor , ”[123-mrs. trenor] [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor feelingly concluded , “ that most of [her]146-carry fisher alimony is paid by [[other women]3085-other women ’s husbands]3086-other women ’s husbands ! ”[123-mrs. trenor] [Miss Bart]109-lily , on [her]109-lily way to [the station]319-the station , had leisure to muse over [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s words , and their peculiar application to [herself]109-lily . Why should [she]109-lily have to suffer for having once , for a few hours , borrowed money of [an elderly cousin]1103-an elderly cousin , when [a woman like [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher]1104-a woman like carry fisher could make a living unrebuked from the good - nature of [[her]109-lily men friends]1105-her men friends and the tolerance of [[their]1105-her men friends wives]1106-their wives ? It all turned on the tiresome distinction between what [a married woman]1107-a married woman might , and [a girl]2828-a girl might not , do . Of course it was shocking for [a married woman]1107-a married woman to borrow money — and [Lily]109-lily was expertly aware of the implication involved — but still , it was the mere MALUM PROHIBITUM which [the world]354-the world decries but condones , and which , though it may be punished by private vengeance , does not provoke the collective disapprobation of [society]3024-society . To [Miss Bart]109-lily , in short , no such opportunities were possible . [She]109-lily could of course borrow from [[her]109-lily women friends]1112-her women friends — a hundred here or there , at the utmost — but [they]1112-her women friends were more ready to give a gown or a trinket , and looked a little askance when [she]109-lily hinted [her]109-lily preference for a cheque . [Women]2772-women are [not generous lenders]1114-not generous lenders , and [those among whom [her]109-lily lot was cast]1115-those among whom her lot was cast were either in the same case as [herself]109-lily , or else too far removed from it to understand its necessities . The result of [her]109-lily meditations was the decision to join [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt at [Richfield]33-richfield . [She]109-lily could not remain at [Bellomont]3-bellomont without playing bridge , and being involved in other expenses ; and to continue [her]109-lily usual series of autumn visits would merely prolong the same difficulties . [She]109-lily had reached a point where abrupt retrenchment was necessary , and the only cheap life was a dull life . [She]109-lily would start the next morning for [Richfield]33-richfield . At [the station]319-the station [she]109-lily thought [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor seemed surprised , and not wholly unrelieved , to see [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily yielded up the reins of the light runabout in which [she]109-lily had driven over , and as [he]161-gus trenor climbed heavily to [her]109-lily side , crushing [her]109-lily into a scant third of the seat , [he]161-gus trenor said : “ Halloo ! It is n’t often [you]109-lily honour [me]161-gus trenor . [You]109-lily must have been uncommonly hard up for something to do . ”[161-gus trenor] The afternoon was warm , and propinquity made [her]109-lily more than usually conscious that [he]161-gus trenor was red and massive , and that beads of moisture had caused the dust of [the train]2843-the train to adhere unpleasantly to the broad expanse of cheek and neck which [he]161-gus trenor turned to [her]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily was aware also , from the look in [his]161-gus trenor small dull eyes , that the contact with [her]109-lily freshness and slenderness was as agreeable to [him]161-gus trenor as the sight of a cooling beverage . The perception of this fact helped [her]109-lily to answer gaily : “ It ’s not often [I]109-lily have the chance . Let [me]1120-i light a cigar , will [you]109-lily ? [I]1120-i ’ve had a beastly day of it . ”[1120-i] [He]1120-i drew up in the shade of [the village street]1121-the village street , and passed the reins to [her]109-lily while [he]1120-i held a match to [his]1120-i cigar . And yet [some women]1122-some women thought [him]1120-i handsome ! As [she]109-lily handed back the reins , [she]109-lily said sympathetically : “ Did [you]1120-i have such a lot of tiresome things to do ? ”[109-lily] “ [I]109-lily should say so — rather ! ”[109-lily] [Trenor]126-judy , who was seldom listened to , either by [[his]1120-i wife]592-his wife or [[her]592-his wife friends]406-her friends , settled down into the rare enjoyment of a confidential talk . “ [You]109-lily do n’t know how [a fellow]3096-a fellow has to hustle to keep this kind of thing going . ”[1120-i] [He]1120-i waved [his]1120-i whip in the direction of [the Bellomont acres]1125-the bellomont acres , which lay outspread before [them]1126-them in opulent undulations . “ [Judy]126-judy has no idea of what [she]126-judy spends — not that there is n’t plenty to keep the thing going , ”[1120-i] [he]1120-i interrupted [himself]1120-i , “ but [a man]2811-a man has got to keep [his]2811-a man eyes open and pick up all the tips [he]2811-a man can . [[My]1120-i father]3098-my father and [mother]2864-mother used to live like fighting - cocks on [their]1126-them income , and put by a good bit of it too — luckily for [me]1120-i — but at the pace [we]1126-them go now , [I]1120-i do n’t know where [I]1120-i should be if it were n’t for taking a flyer now and then . [The women]2741-the women all think — [I]1120-i mean [Judy]126-judy thinks — [I’ve]1120-i nothing to do but to go [downtown]3101-downtown once a month and cut off coupons , but the truth is it takes a devilish lot of hard work to keep the machinery running . [He]3103-that chap ’s going to be rich enough to buy [us]1126-them all out one of these days , and if [she]126-judy ’d only ask [him]3103-that chap to dine now and then [I]1120-i could get almost anything out of [him]3103-that chap . [She]109-lily had often heard of [women]2772-women making money in this way through [[their]2772-women friends]1129-their friends : [she]109-lily had no more notion than most of [her]109-lily sex of the exact nature of the transaction , and its vagueness seemed to diminish its indelicacy . Twenty - four hours earlier , if [[his]1144-he wife]592-his wife had consulted [him]1144-he on the subject of [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s future , [he]1144-he would have said that [a girl with extravagant tastes and no money]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money had better marry [the first rich man [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money could get]1147-the first rich man she could get ; but with the subject of discussion at [his]1144-he side , turning to [him]1144-he for sympathy , making [him]1144-he feel that [he]1144-he understood [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money better than [[her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money dearest friends]1148-her dearest friends , and confirming the assurance by the appeal of [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money exquisite nearness , [he]1144-he was ready to swear that such a marriage was a desecration , and that , as [a man of honour]1149-a man of honour , [he]1144-he was bound to do all [he]1144-he could to protect [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money from the results of [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money disinterestedness . [Trenor]126-judy and [Miss Bart]109-lily prolonged [their]1154-their drive till long after sunset ; and before it was over [he]1144-he had tried , with some show of success , to prove to [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money that , if [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money would only trust [him]1144-he , [he]1144-he could make a handsome sum of money for [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money without endangering the small amount [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money possessed . [She]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money was too genuinely ignorant of the manipulations of the stock - market to understand [his]1144-he technical explanations , or even perhaps to perceive that certain points in them were slurred ; the haziness enveloping the transaction served as a veil for [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money embarrassment , and through the general blur [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money hopes dilated like lamps in a fog . Again [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money felt the lightening of [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money load , and with it the release of repressed activities . [Her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money immediate worries conjured , it was easy to resolve that [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money would never again find [herself]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money in such straits , and as the need of economy and self - denial receded from [her]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money foreground [she]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money felt [herself]1146-a girl with extravagant tastes and no money ready to meet any other demand which life might make . Chapter 8 The first thousand dollar cheque which [Lily]109-lily received with a blotted scrawl from [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor strengthened [her]109-lily self - confidence in the exact degree to which it effaced [her]109-lily debts . The transaction had justified itself by its results : [she]109-lily saw now how absurd it would have been to let any primitive scruple deprive [her]109-lily of this easy means of appeasing [[her]109-lily creditors]1159-her creditors . [Lily]109-lily felt really virtuous as [she]109-lily dispensed the sum in sops to [[her]109-lily tradesmen]1160-her tradesmen , and the fact that a fresh order accompanied each payment did not lessen [her]109-lily sense of disinterestedness . How many women , in [her]109-lily place , would have given the orders without making the payment ! [She]109-lily had found it reassuringly easy to keep [Trenor]161-gus trenor in a good humour . To listen to [his]161-gus trenor stories , to receive [his]161-gus trenor confidences and laugh at [his]161-gus trenor jokes , seemed for the moment all that was required of [her]109-lily , and the complacency with which [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess regarded these attentions freed [them]1162-them of the least hint of ambiguity . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor evidently assumed that [Lily]109-lily ’s growing intimacy with [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband was simply an indirect way of returning [her]109-lily own kindness . “ [I]109-lily ’m so glad [you]609-her husband and [Gus]161-gus trenor have become such [good friends]3136-good friends , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said approvingly . “ It ’s too delightful of [you]609-her husband to be so nice to [him]161-gus trenor , and put up with all [his]161-gus trenor tiresome stories . [I]109-lily know what they are , because [I]109-lily had to listen to [them]1162-them when [we]3137-we were engaged — [I’m]109-lily sure [he]161-gus trenor is telling the same ones still . And now [I]109-lily sha n’t always have to be asking [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher here to keep [him]161-gus trenor in a good humour . [She]146-carry fisher ’s [a perfect vulture]3138-a perfect vulture , [you]609-her husband know ; and [she]146-carry fisher has n’t the least moral sense . [She]146-carry fisher is always getting [Gus]161-gus trenor to speculate for [her]146-carry fisher , and [I]109-lily ’m sure [she]146-carry fisher never pays when [she]146-carry fisher loses . ”[109-lily] [Miss Bart]109-lily could shudder at this state of things without the embarrassment of a personal application . [Her]109-lily own position was surely quite different . There could be no question of [her]109-lily not paying when [she]109-lily lost , since [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor had assured [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily was certain not to lose . In sending [her]109-lily the cheque [he]1164-he had explained that [he]1164-he had made five thousand for [her]109-lily out of [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s “ tip , ”[1164-he] and had put four thousand back in the same venture , as there was the promise of another “ big rise ”[1164-he] ; [she]109-lily understood therefore that [he]1164-he was now speculating with [her]109-lily own money , and that [she]109-lily consequently owed [him]1164-he no more than the gratitude which such a trifling service demanded . [She]109-lily vaguely supposed that , to raise the first sum , [he]1164-he had borrowed on [her]109-lily securities ; but this was a point over which [her]109-lily curiosity did not linger . It was concentrated , for the moment , on the probable date of the next “ big rise . ”[1164-he] The news of this event was received by [her]109-lily some weeks later , on the occasion of [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney ’s marriage to [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh . As [a cousin of [the bridegroom]1166-the bridegroom]1165-a cousin of the bridegroom , [Miss Bart]109-lily had been asked to act as [bridesmaid]1167-bridesmaid ; but [she]109-lily had declined on the plea that , since [she]109-lily was much taller than [the other attendant virgins]1168-the other attendant virgins , [her]109-lily presence might mar the symmetry of [the group]959-the group . The truth was , [she]109-lily had attended [too many brides]1170-too many brides to the altar : when next seen there [she]109-lily meant to be [the chief figure in the ceremony]1171-the chief figure in the ceremony . [She]109-lily knew the pleasantries made at the expense of [young girls who have been too long before the public]1172-young girls who have been too long before the public , and [she]109-lily was resolved to avoid such assumptions of youthfulness as might lead [people]2804-people to think [her]109-lily older than [she]109-lily really was . The Van [Osburgh]35-osburgh marriage was celebrated in [the village church near [the paternal estate]1175-the paternal estate on [the Hudson]136-mrs. bart]1174-the village church near the paternal estate on the hudson . It was the “ simple country wedding ”[1180-the police] to which [guests]1176-guests are convoyed in [special trains]1177-special trains , and from which [the hordes of [the uninvited]1179-the uninvited]1178-the hordes of the uninvited have to be fended off by the intervention of [the police]1180-the police . While these sylvan rites were taking place , in [a church packed with fashion and festooned with orchids]1181-a church packed with fashion and festooned with orchids , [the representatives of the press]1182-the representatives of the press were threading [their]1182-the representatives of the press way , note - book in hand , through the labyrinth of wedding presents , and [the agent of a cinematograph syndicate]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate was setting up [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate apparatus at the church door . It was the kind of scene in which [Lily]109-lily had often pictured [herself]109-lily as taking the principal part , and on this occasion the fact that [she]109-lily was once more merely [a casual spectator]1184-a casual spectator , instead of [the mystically veiled figure occupying the centre of attention]1185-the mystically veiled figure occupying the centre of attention , strengthened [her]109-lily resolve to assume the latter part before the year was over . The fact that [her]109-lily immediate anxieties were relieved did not blind [her]109-lily to a possibility of [their]1186-their recurrence ; it merely gave [her]109-lily enough buoyancy to rise once more above [her]109-lily doubts and feel a renewed faith in [her]109-lily beauty , [her]109-lily power , and [her]109-lily general fitness to attract a brilliant destiny . It could not be that [one conscious of such aptitudes for mastery and enjoyment]1187-one conscious of such aptitudes for mastery and enjoyment was doomed to a perpetuity of failure ; and [her]109-lily mistakes looked easily reparable in the light of [her]109-lily restored self - confidence . A special appositeness was given to these reflections by the discovery , in a neighbouring pew , of the serious profile and neatly - trimmed beard of [Mr. Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce . There was something almost bridal in [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate own aspect : [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate large white gardenia had a symbolic air that struck [Lily]109-lily as a good omen . After all , seen in an assemblage of [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate kind [he]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate was not ridiculous - looking : [a friendly critic]1188-a friendly critic might have called [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate heaviness weighty , and [he]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate was at [his]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate best in the attitude of vacant passivity which brings out the oddities of the restless . [She]109-lily fancied [he]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate was [the kind of man whose sentimental associations would be stirred by the conventional imagery of a wedding]1189-the kind of man whose sentimental associations would be stirred by the conventional imagery of a wedding , and [she]109-lily pictured [herself]109-lily , in the seclusion of [the Van Osburgh conservatories]1190-the van osburgh conservatories , playing skillfully upon sensibilities thus prepared for [her]109-lily touch . In fact , when [she]109-lily looked at [the other women about [her]109-lily]1191-the other women about her , and recalled the image [she]109-lily had brought away from [her]109-lily own glass , it did not seem as though any special skill would be needed to repair [her]109-lily blunder and bring [him]1183-the agent of a cinematograph syndicate once more to [her]109-lily feet . The sight of [Selden]108-selden ’s dark head , in a pew almost facing [her]109-lily , disturbed for a moment the balance of [her]109-lily complacency . The rise of [her]109-lily blood as [their]1192-their eyes met was succeeded by a contrary motion , a wave of resistance and withdrawal . [She]109-lily did not wish to see [him]108-selden again , not because [she]109-lily feared [his]108-selden influence , but because [his]108-selden presence always had the effect of cheapening [her]109-lily aspirations , of throwing [her]109-lily whole world out of focus . Besides , [he]108-selden was a living reminder of the worst mistake in [her]109-lily career , and the fact that [he]108-selden had been its cause did not soften [her]109-lily feelings toward [him]108-selden . [She]109-lily could still imagine an ideal state of existence in which , all else being superadded , intercourse with [Selden]108-selden might be the last touch of luxury ; but in [the world]354-the world as it was , such a privilege was likely to cost more than it was worth . “ [Lily]109-lily , [dear]2964-dear , [I]1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend never saw [you]2964-dear look so lovely ! [You]2964-dear look as if something delightful had just happened to [you]2964-dear ! ”[1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend] [The young lady who thus formulated [her]1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend admiration of [[her]1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend brilliant friend]1195-her brilliant friend]1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend did not , in [her]1194-the young lady who thus formulated her admiration of her brilliant friend own person , suggest such happy possibilities . [Miss Gertrude Farish]113-miss farish , in fact , typified the mediocre and the ineffectual . If there were compensating qualities in [her]113-miss farish wide frank glance and the freshness of [her]113-miss farish smile , these were qualities which only [the sympathetic observer]1196-the sympathetic observer would perceive before noticing that [her]113-miss farish eyes were of a workaday grey and [her]113-miss farish lips without haunting curves . [Lily]109-lily ’s own view of [her]113-miss farish wavered between pity for [her]113-miss farish limitations and impatience at [her]113-miss farish cheerful acceptance of them . To [Miss Bart]109-lily , as to [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother , acquiescence in dinginess was evidence of stupidity ; and there were moments when , in the consciousness of [her]109-lily own power to look and to be so exactly what the occasion required , [she]109-lily almost felt that [other girls]1198-other girls were plain and inferior from choice . Certainly [no one]2766-no one need have confessed such acquiescence in [her]109-lily lot as was revealed in the “ useful ”[109-lily] colour of [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s gown and the subdued lines of [her]109-lily hat : it is almost as stupid to let [your]1200-you clothes betray that [you]1200-you know [you]1200-you are ugly as to have [them]1201-them proclaim that [you]1200-you think [you]1200-you are beautiful . Of course , being fatally poor and dingy , it was wise of [Gerty]112-gerty to have taken up philanthropy and symphony concerts ; but there was something irritating in [her]112-gerty assumption that existence yielded no higher pleasures , and that [one]2737-one might get as much interest and excitement out of life in [a cramped flat]1203-a cramped flat as in the splendours of [the Van Osburgh establishment]1204-the van osburgh establishment . Today , however , [her]112-gerty chirping enthusiasms did not irritate [Lily]109-lily . [They]1205-they seemed only to throw [her]109-lily own exceptionalness into becoming relief , and give a soaring vastness to [her]109-lily scheme of life . “ Do let [us]3140-us go and take a peep at the presents before [everyone else]3141-everyone else leaves [the dining - room]3142-the dining - room ! ”[113-miss farish] suggested [Miss Farish]113-miss farish , linking [her]113-miss farish arm in [[her]113-miss farish friend]754-her friend ’s . It was characteristic of [her]113-miss farish to take a sentimental and unenvious interest in all the details of a wedding : [she]113-miss farish was the kind of person who always kept [her]113-miss farish handkerchief out during the service , and departed clutching a box of wedding - cake . “ Is n’t everything beautifully done ? ”[113-miss farish] [she]113-miss farish pursued , as [they]1207-they entered [the distant drawing - room]1208-the distant drawing - room assigned to the display of [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh ’s bridal spoils . “ [I]113-miss farish always say [no one]2766-no one does things better than [cousin Grace]179-cousin grace ! Did [you]3144-you ever taste anything more delicious than that MOUSSE of lobster with champagne sauce ? [I]113-miss farish made up [my]113-miss farish mind weeks ago that [I]113-miss farish would n’t miss this wedding , and just fancy how delightfully it all came about . When [Lawrence Selden]108-selden heard [I]113-miss farish was coming , [he]108-selden insisted on fetching [me]113-miss farish [himself]108-selden and driving [me]113-miss farish to [the station]319-the station , and when [we]3146-we go back this evening [I]113-miss farish am to dine with [him]108-selden at [Sherry ’s]5-sherry ’s . [I]113-miss farish really feel as excited as if [I]113-miss farish were getting married [myself]113-miss farish ! ”[113-miss farish] [Lily]109-lily smiled : [she]109-lily knew that [Selden]108-selden had always been kind to [[his]108-selden dull cousin]1209-his dull cousin , and [she]109-lily had sometimes wondered why [he]108-selden wasted so much time in such an unremunerative manner ; but now the thought gave [her]109-lily a vague pleasure . “ Do [you]108-selden see [him]108-selden often ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily asked . “ Yes ; [he]108-selden is very good about dropping in on Sundays . And now and then [we]3146-we do a play together ; but lately [I]109-lily have n’t seen much of [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden does n’t look well , and [he]108-selden seems nervous and unsettled . [The dear fellow]3147-the dear fellow ! [I]109-lily do wish [he]108-selden would marry [some nice girl]3148-some nice girl . [I]109-lily told [him]108-selden so today , but [he]108-selden said [he]108-selden did n’t care for [the really nice ones]3149-the really nice ones , and the other kind did n’t care for [him]108-selden — but that was just [his]108-selden joke , of course . [He]108-selden could never marry a girl who WASN’T nice . Oh , [[my]109-lily dear]2871-my dear , did [you]2871-my dear ever see such pearls ? ”[109-lily] [They]1210-they had paused before the table on which [the bride]1211-the bride ’s jewels were displayed , and [Lily]109-lily ’s heart gave an envious throb as [she]109-lily caught the refraction of light from their surfaces — the milky gleam of perfectly matched pearls , the flash of rubies relieved against contrasting velvet , the intense blue rays of sapphires kindled into light by surrounding diamonds : all these precious tints enhanced and deepened by the varied art of their setting . The glow of the stones warmed [Lily]109-lily ’s veins like wine . More completely than any other expression of wealth [they]1212-they symbolized the life [she]109-lily longed to lead , the life of fastidious aloofness and refinement in which every detail should have the finish of a jewel , and the whole form a harmonious setting to [her]109-lily own jewel - like rareness . “ Oh , [Lily]109-lily , do look at this diamond pendant — it ’s as big as a dinner - plate ! Who can have given it ? ”[113-miss farish] [Miss Farish]113-miss farish bent short - sightedly over the accompanying card . “ [MR . SIMON ROSEDALE]124-rosedale . [The youngest , dumpiest , dullest of the four dull and dumpy daughters whom [Mrs. Van Osburgh]110-mrs. van osburgh]1215-the youngest , dumpiest , dullest of the four dull and dumpy daughters whom mrs. van osburgh , with unsurpassed astuteness , had “ placed ”[180-evie van osburgh] one by one in enviable niches of existence ! Ah , [lucky girls who grow up in the shelter of [a mother]579-a mother ’s love]1216-lucky girls who grow up in the shelter of a mother ’s love — [a mother who knows how to contrive opportunities without conceding favours , how to take advantage of propinquity without allowing appetite to be dulled by habit]1218-a mother who knows how to contrive opportunities without conceding favours , how to take advantage of propinquity without allowing appetite to be dulled by habit ! [The cleverest girl]1219-the cleverest girl may miscalculate where [her]1219-the cleverest girl own interests are concerned , may yield too much at one moment and withdraw too far at the next : it takes [a mother]579-a mother ’s unerring vigilance and foresight to land [[her]579-a mother daughters]817-her daughters safely in the arms of wealth and suitability . [Lily]109-lily ’s passing light - heartedness sank beneath a renewed sense of failure . Life was too stupid , too blundering ! Why should [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s millions be joined to another great fortune , why should [this clumsy girl]1222-this clumsy girl be put in possession of powers [she]1222-this clumsy girl would never know how to use ? [She]109-lily was roused from these speculations by a familiar touch on [her]109-lily arm , and turning saw [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor beside [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily felt a thrill of vexation : what right had [he]161-gus trenor to touch [her]109-lily ? [Luckily Gerty Farish]112-gerty had wandered off to the next table , and [they]1223-they were alone . [Trenor]161-gus trenor , looking stouter than ever in [his]161-gus trenor tight frock - coat , and unbecomingly flushed by the bridal libations , gazed at [her]109-lily with undisguised approval . “ By [Jove]169-jove , [Lily]109-lily , [you]109-lily do look [a stunner]3158-a stunner ! ”[161-gus trenor] [He]161-gus trenor had slipped insensibly into the use of [her]109-lily Christian name , and [she]109-lily had never found the right moment to correct [him]161-gus trenor . Besides , in [her]109-lily set all [the men]831-the men and [women]2772-women called [each other]2955-each other by [their]2955-each other Christian names ; it was only on [Trenor]161-gus trenor ’s lips that the familiar address had an unpleasant significance . “ Well , ”[161-gus trenor] [he]161-gus trenor continued , still jovially impervious to [her]109-lily annoyance , “ have [you]109-lily made up [your]109-lily mind which of these little trinkets [you]109-lily mean to duplicate at [Tiffany]182-tiffany ’s tomorrow ? [I]161-gus trenor ’ve got a cheque for [you]109-lily in [my]161-gus trenor pocket that will go a long way in that line ! ”[161-gus trenor] [Lily]109-lily gave [him]161-gus trenor a startled look : [his]161-gus trenor voice was louder than usual , and [the room]351-the room was beginning to fill with [people]2804-people . But as [her]109-lily glance assured [her]109-lily that [they]1229-they were still beyond ear - shot a sense of pleasure replaced [her]109-lily apprehension . “ Another dividend ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily asked , smiling and drawing near [him]161-gus trenor in the desire not to be overheard . “ Well , not exactly : [I]109-lily sold out on the rise and [I]109-lily ’ve pulled off four thou ’ for [you]161-gus trenor . The news filled [her]109-lily with the glow produced by a sudden cessation of physical pain . [The world]354-the world was not so stupid and blundering after all : now and then a stroke of luck came to the unluckiest . At the thought [her]109-lily spirits began to rise : it was characteristic of [her]109-lily that one trifling piece of good fortune should give wings to all [her]109-lily hopes . Instantly came the reflection that [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce was not irretrievably lost ; and [she]109-lily smiled to think of the excitement of recapturing [him]127-mr. gryce from [Evie Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh . What chance could [such a simpleton]1232-such a simpleton have against [her]109-lily if [she]109-lily chose to exert [herself]109-lily ? [She]109-lily glanced about , hoping to catch a glimpse of [Gryce]127-mr. gryce ; but [her]109-lily eyes lit instead on the glossy countenance of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , who was slipping through [the crowd]308-the crowd with an air half obsequious , half obtrusive , as though , the moment [his]124-rosedale presence was recognized , it would swell to the dimensions of [the room]351-the room . Not wishing to be the means of effecting this enlargement , [Lily]109-lily quickly transferred [her]109-lily glance to [Trenor]161-gus trenor , to whom the expression of [her]109-lily gratitude seemed not to have brought the complete gratification [she]109-lily had meant it to give . “ Hang thanking [me]161-gus trenor — [I]161-gus trenor do n’t want to be thanked , but [I]161-gus trenor SHOULD like the chance to say two words to [you]109-lily now and then , ”[161-gus trenor] [he]161-gus trenor grumbled . “ [I]161-gus trenor thought [you]109-lily were going to spend the whole autumn with [us]3164-us , and [I]161-gus trenor ’ve hardly laid eyes on [you]109-lily for the last month . If [you]109-lily say yes [I]161-gus trenor ’ll run [you]109-lily over in [the motor]3166-the motor , and [you]109-lily can telephone [[your]109-lily maid]3167-your maid to bring [your]109-lily traps from [town]305-town by [the next train]3052-the next train . ”[161-gus trenor] [Lily]109-lily shook [her]109-lily head with a charming semblance of regret . “ [I]109-lily wish [I]109-lily could — but it ’s quite impossible . [[My]109-lily aunt]2743-my aunt has come back to [town]305-town , and [I]109-lily must be with [her]2743-my aunt for the next few days . ”[109-lily] “ Well , [I]1235-i ’ve seen a good deal less of [you]109-lily since [we]3172-we ’ve got to be such pals than [I]1235-i used to when [you]109-lily were [[Judy]126-judy ’s friend]3173-judy ’s friend , ”[1235-i] [he]1235-i continued with unconscious penetration . “ When [I]1235-i was [[Judy]126-judy ’s friend]3173-judy ’s friend ? If [I]1235-i were always at [Bellomont]3-bellomont [you]109-lily would tire of [me]1235-i much sooner than [Judy]126-judy — but come and see [me]1235-i at [[my]1235-i aunt]2743-my aunt ’s the next afternoon [you]109-lily are in [town]305-town ; then [we]3178-we can have a nice quiet talk , and [you]109-lily can tell [me]1235-i how [I]1235-i had better invest [my]1235-i fortune . ”[1235-i] It was true that , during the last three or four weeks , [she]1236-she had absented [herself]1236-she from [Bellomont]3-bellomont on the pretext of having other visits to pay ; but [she]1236-she now began to feel that the reckoning [she]1236-she had thus contrived to evade had rolled up interest in the interval . The prospect of the nice quiet talk did not appear as all - sufficing to [Trenor]126-judy as [she]1236-she had hoped , and [his]1237-him brows continued to lower as [he]1237-him said : “ Oh , [I]1237-him do n’t know that [I]1237-him can promise [you]109-lily a fresh tip every day . [I]1237-him do n’t believe [two women]3181-two women have spoken to [him]1237-him this afternoon , and [I]1237-him can tell [you]109-lily [he]1237-him ’s a chap it pays to be decent to . ”[1237-him] [Miss Bart]109-lily made an impatient movement , but suppressed the words which seemed about to accompany it . After all , this was an unexpectedly easy way of acquitting [her]109-lily debt ; and had [she]109-lily not reasons of [her]109-lily own for wishing to be civil to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ? “ Oh , bring [him]1237-him by all means , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said smiling ; “ perhaps [I]109-lily can get a tip out of [him]1237-him on [my]109-lily own account . ”[109-lily] [Trenor]126-judy paused abruptly , and [his]124-rosedale eyes fixed [themselves]1238-themselves on [hers]109-lily with a look which made [her]109-lily change colour . “ [I]124-rosedale say , [you]109-lily know — [you’ll]109-lily please remember [he]1237-him ’s [a blooming bounder]3182-a blooming bounder , ”[124-rosedale] [he]124-rosedale said ; and with a slight laugh [she]109-lily turned toward the open window near which [they]1239-they had been standing . The throng in [the room]351-the room had increased , and [she]109-lily felt a desire for space and fresh air . Both of these [she]109-lily found on [the terrace]760-the terrace , where [only a few men]1242-only a few men were lingering over cigarettes and liqueur , while [scattered couples]1243-scattered couples strolled across [the lawn]788-the lawn to the autumn - tinted borders of [the flower - garden]1245-the flower - garden . As [she]109-lily emerged , [a man]2811-a man moved toward [her]109-lily from the knot of [smokers]1247-smokers , and [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily face to face with [Selden]108-selden . The stir of the pulses which [his]108-selden nearness always caused was increased by a slight sense of constraint . [They]1239-they had not met since [their]1239-they Sunday afternoon walk at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and that episode was still so vivid to [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily could hardly believe [him]108-selden to be less conscious of it . But [his]108-selden greeting expressed no more than the satisfaction which [every pretty woman]1248-every pretty woman expects to see reflected in masculine eyes ; and the discovery , if distasteful to [her]109-lily vanity , was reassuring to [her]109-lily nerves . Between the relief of [her]109-lily escape from [Trenor]126-judy , and the vague apprehension of [her]109-lily meeting with [Rosedale]124-rosedale , it was pleasant to rest a moment on the sense of complete understanding which [Lawrence Selden]108-selden ’s manner always conveyed . “ This is luck , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said smiling . “ [I]108-selden was wondering if [I]108-selden should be able to have a word with [you]109-lily before the special snatches [us]1239-they away . [I]108-selden came with [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , and promised not to let [her]112-gerty miss [the train]2843-the train , but [I]108-selden am sure [she]112-gerty is still extracting sentimental solace from the wedding presents . [She]112-gerty appears to regard their number and value as evidence of the disinterested affection of [the contracting parties]3184-the contracting parties . ”[108-selden] There was not the least trace of embarrassment in [his]108-selden voice , and as [he]108-selden spoke , leaning slightly against the jamb of the window , and letting [his]108-selden eyes rest on [her]109-lily in the frank enjoyment of [her]109-lily grace , [she]109-lily felt with a faint chill of regret that [he]108-selden had gone back without an effort to the footing on which [they]1249-they had stood before [their]1249-they last talk together . [Her]109-lily vanity was stung by the sight of [his]108-selden unscathed smile . [She]109-lily longed to be to [him]108-selden something more than a piece of sentient prettiness , a passing diversion to [his]108-selden eye and brain ; and the longing betrayed itself in [her]109-lily reply . “ Ah , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said , “ [I]109-lily envy [Gerty]112-gerty that power [she]112-gerty has of dressing up with romance all [our]1249-they ugly and prosaic arrangements ! [I]109-lily have never recovered [my]109-lily self - respect since [you]108-selden showed [me]109-lily how poor and unimportant [my]109-lily ambitions were . ”[109-lily] The words were hardly spoken when [she]109-lily realized their infelicity . It seemed to be [her]109-lily fate to appear at [her]109-lily worst to [Selden]108-selden . “ [I]108-selden thought , on the contrary , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden returned lightly , “ that [I]108-selden had been the means of proving they were more important to [you]109-lily than anything else . ”[108-selden] It was as if the eager current of [her]109-lily being had been checked by a sudden obstacle which drove it back upon itself . [She]109-lily looked at [him]108-selden helplessly , like [a hurt or frightened child]1250-a hurt or frightened child : this real self of [hers]109-lily , which [he]108-selden had the faculty of drawing out of the depths , was so little accustomed to go alone ! The appeal of [her]109-lily helplessness touched in [him]108-selden , as it always did , a latent chord of inclination . It would have meant nothing to [him]108-selden to discover that [his]108-selden nearness made [her]109-lily more brilliant , but this glimpse of a twilight mood to which [he]108-selden alone had the clue seemed once more to set [him]108-selden in a world apart with [her]109-lily . “ At least [you]108-selden ca n’t think worse things of [me]109-lily than [you]108-selden say ! ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily exclaimed with a trembling laugh ; but before [he]108-selden could answer , the flow of comprehension between [them]1251-them was abruptly stayed by the reappearance of [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor , who advanced with [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale in [his]161-gus trenor wake . “ Hang it , [Lily]109-lily , [I]108-selden thought [you]108-selden ’d given [me]108-selden the slip : [Rosedale]124-rosedale and [I]108-selden have been hunting all over for [you]108-selden ! ”[108-selden] [His]108-selden voice had a note of conjugal familiarity : [Miss Bart]109-lily fancied [she]109-lily detected in [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s eye a twinkling perception of the fact , and the idea turned [her]109-lily dislike of [him]108-selden to repugnance . [She]109-lily returned [his]108-selden profound bow with a slight nod , made more disdainful by the sense of [Selden]108-selden ’s surprise that [she]109-lily should number [Rosedale]124-rosedale among [[her]109-lily acquaintances]603-her acquaintances . [Trenor]161-gus trenor had turned away , and [[his]161-gus trenor companion]1066-his companion continued to stand before [Miss Bart]109-lily , alert and expectant , [his]108-selden lips parted in a smile at whatever [she]109-lily might be about to say , and [his]108-selden very back conscious of the privilege of being seen with [her]109-lily . It was the moment for tact ; for the quick bridging over of gaps ; but [Selden]108-selden still leaned against the window , [a detached observer of the scene]1254-a detached observer of the scene , and under the spell of [his]108-selden observation [Lily]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily powerless to exert [her]109-lily usual arts . The dread of [Selden]108-selden ’s suspecting that there was any need for [her]109-lily to propitiate [such a man]1255-such a man as [Rosedale]124-rosedale checked the trivial phrases of politeness . [Rosedale]124-rosedale still stood before [her]109-lily in an expectant attitude , and [she]109-lily continued to face [him]108-selden in silence , [her]109-lily glance just level with [his]108-selden polished baldness . The look put the finishing touch to what [her]109-lily silence implied . [He]108-selden reddened slowly , shifting from one foot to the other , fingered the plump black pearl in [his]108-selden tie , and gave a nervous twist to [his]108-selden moustache ; then , running [his]108-selden eye over [her]109-lily , [he]108-selden drew back , and said , with a side - glance at [Selden]108-selden : “ Upon [my]108-selden soul , [I]108-selden never saw a more ripping get - up . Is that the last creation of [the dress - maker]2851-the dress - maker [you]109-lily go to see at [the Benedick]8-the benedick ? If so , [I]108-selden wonder [all the other women]3186-all the other women do n’t go to [her]109-lily too ! ”[108-selden] The words were projected sharply against [Lily]109-lily ’s silence , and [she]109-lily saw in a flash that [her]109-lily own act had given [them]1256-them their emphasis . In ordinary talk [they]1256-them might have passed unheeded ; but following on [her]109-lily prolonged pause they acquired a special meaning . [She]109-lily felt , without looking , that [Selden]108-selden had immediately seized it , and would inevitably connect the allusion with [her]109-lily visit to [himself]108-selden . The consciousness increased [her]109-lily irritation against [Rosedale]124-rosedale , but also [her]109-lily feeling that now , if ever , was the moment to propitiate [him]124-rosedale , hateful as it was to do so in [Selden]108-selden ’s presence . “ How do [you]108-selden know [the other women]2802-the other women do n’t go to [[my]109-lily dress - maker]2842-my dress - maker ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily returned . “ [You]108-selden see [I]109-lily ’m not afraid to give [her]2842-my dress - maker address to [[my]109-lily friends]2827-my friends ! ”[109-lily] [Her]109-lily glance and accent so plainly included [Rosedale]124-rosedale in this privileged circle that [his]124-rosedale small eyes puckered with gratification , and a knowing smile drew up [his]124-rosedale moustache . “ By [Jove]169-jove , [you]109-lily need n’t be ! ”[124-rosedale] [he]124-rosedale declared . “ [You]109-lily could give [’em]109-lily the whole outfit and win at a canter ! ”[124-rosedale] “ Ah , that ’s nice of [you]124-rosedale ; and it would be nicer still if [you]124-rosedale would carry [me]109-lily off to [a quiet corner]3190-a quiet corner , and get [me]109-lily a glass of lemonade or some innocent drink before [we]3191-we all have to rush for [the train]2843-the train . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily turned away as [she]109-lily spoke , letting [him]124-rosedale strut at [her]109-lily side through [the gathering groups on [the terrace]760-the terrace]1257-the gathering groups on the terrace , while every nerve in [her]109-lily throbbed with the consciousness of what [Selden]108-selden must have thought of the scene . But under [her]109-lily angry sense of the perverseness of things , and the light surface of [her]109-lily talk with [Rosedale]124-rosedale , a third idea persisted : [she]109-lily did not mean to leave without an attempt to discover the truth about [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce . [Chance]183-chance , or perhaps [his]127-mr. gryce own resolve , had kept [them]1259-their apart since [his]127-mr. gryce hasty withdrawal from [Bellomont]3-bellomont ; but [Miss Bart]109-lily was [an expert in making the most of the unexpected]1260-an expert in making the most of the unexpected , and the distasteful incidents of the last few minutes — the revelation to [Selden]108-selden of precisely that part of [her]109-lily life which [she]109-lily most wished [him]108-selden to ignore — increased [her]109-lily longing for shelter , for escape from such humiliating contingencies . Any definite situation would be more tolerable than this buffeting of chances , which kept [her]109-lily in an attitude of uneasy alertness toward every possibility of life . Indoors there was a general sense of dispersal in the air , as of an audience gathering itself up for departure after [the principal actors]1261-the principal actors had left the stage ; but among the remaining groups , [Lily]109-lily could discover neither [Gryce]127-mr. gryce nor the youngest [Miss Van Osburgh]159-miss van osburgh . That both should be missing struck [her]109-lily with foreboding ; and [she]109-lily charmed [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale by proposing that [they]1259-their should make [their]1259-their way to [the conservatories at the farther end of [the house]488-the house]1262-the conservatories at the farther end of the house . There were [just enough [people]2804-people left in [the long suite of rooms]1266-the long suite of rooms]1264-just enough people left in the long suite of rooms to make [their]1259-their progress conspicuous , and [Lily]109-lily was aware of being followed by looks of amusement and interrogation , which glanced off as harmlessly from [her]109-lily indifference as from [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion ’s self - satisfaction . [She]109-lily cared very little at that moment about being seen with [Rosedale]124-rosedale : all [her]109-lily thoughts were centred on the object of [her]109-lily search . [The latter]566-the latter , however , was not discoverable in [the conservatories]1269-the conservatories , and [Lily]109-lily , oppressed by a sudden conviction of failure , was casting about for a way to rid [herself]109-lily of [[her]109-lily now superfluous companion]1270-her now superfluous companion , when [they]1271-they came upon [Mrs. Van Osburgh]110-mrs. van osburgh , flushed and exhausted , but beaming with the consciousness of duty performed . [She]109-lily glanced at [them]1271-they a moment with the benign but vacant eye of [the tired hostess , to whom [[her]109-lily guests]559-her guests have become mere whirling spots in a kaleidoscope of fatigue]1272-the tired hostess , to whom her guests have become mere whirling spots in a kaleidoscope of fatigue ; then [her]109-lily attention became suddenly fixed , and [she]109-lily seized on [Miss Bart]109-lily with a confidential gesture . “ [[My]109-lily dear]2871-my dear [Lily]109-lily , [I]109-lily have n’t had time for a word with [you]109-lily , and now [I]109-lily suppose [you]109-lily are just off . Have [you]109-lily seen [Evie]180-evie van osburgh ? [She]180-evie van osburgh ’s been looking everywhere for [you]109-lily : [she]180-evie van osburgh wanted to tell [you]109-lily [her]180-evie van osburgh little secret ; but [I]109-lily daresay [you]109-lily have guessed it already . The engagement is not to be announced till next week — but [you]109-lily are such [a friend of [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce ’s]3194-a friend of mr. gryce ’s that [they]1277-their both wished [you]109-lily to be the first to know of [their]1277-their happiness . ”[109-lily] Chapter 9 In [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s youth , fashion had returned to [town]305-town in October ; therefore on the tenth day of the month the blinds of [[her]114-mrs. peniston Fifth Avenue residence]1275-her fifth avenue residence were drawn up , and the eyes of [the Dying Gladiator in bronze who occupied the drawing - room window]1276-the dying gladiator in bronze who occupied the drawing - room window resumed [their]1277-their survey of [that deserted thoroughfare]1278-that deserted thoroughfare . The first two weeks after [her]114-mrs. peniston return represented to [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston the domestic equivalent of [a religious retreat]1279-a religious retreat . [She]114-mrs. peniston “ went through ”[114-mrs. peniston] the linen and blankets in the precise spirit of [the penitent]1280-the penitent exploring the inner folds of conscience ; [she]114-mrs. peniston sought for moths as the stricken soul seeks for lurking infirmities . The topmost shelf of [every closet]1281-every closet was made to yield up [its]1281-every closet secret , [cellar]1282-cellar and [coal - bin]1283-coal - bin were probed to their darkest depths and , as a final stage in the lustral rites , [the entire house]1284-the entire house was swathed in penitential white and deluged with expiatory soapsuds . It was on this phase of the proceedings that [Miss Bart]109-lily entered on the afternoon of [her]109-lily return from the [Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh wedding . The journey back to [town]305-town had not been calculated to soothe [her]109-lily nerves . Though [Evie Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh ’s engagement was still officially a secret , it was one of which [the innumerable intimate friends of [the family]599-the family]1286-the innumerable intimate friends of the family were already possessed ; and the trainful of [returning guests]1288-returning guests buzzed with allusions and anticipations . [Lily]109-lily was acutely aware of [her]109-lily own part in this drama of innuendo : [she]109-lily knew the exact quality of the amusement the situation evoked . The crude forms in which [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends took [their]406-her friends pleasure included a loud enjoyment of such complications : the zest of surprising destiny in the act of playing a practical joke . [Lily]109-lily knew well enough how to bear [herself]109-lily in difficult situations . [She]109-lily had , to a shade , the exact manner between victory and defeat : every insinuation was shed without an effort by the bright indifference of [her]109-lily manner . But [she]109-lily was beginning to feel the strain of the attitude ; the reaction was more rapid , and [she]109-lily lapsed to a deeper self - disgust . As was always the case with [her]109-lily , this moral repulsion found a physical outlet in a quickened distaste for [her]109-lily surroundings . [She]109-lily revolted from the complacent ugliness of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s black walnut , from the slippery gloss of the vestibule tiles , and the mingled odour of sapolio and furniture - polish that met [her]109-lily at the door . [The stairs]1290-the stairs were still carpetless , and on the way up to [[her]109-lily room]529-her room [she]109-lily was arrested on [the landing]360-the landing by an encroaching tide of soapsuds . Gathering up [her]109-lily skirts , [she]109-lily drew aside with an impatient gesture ; and as [she]109-lily did so [she]109-lily had the odd sensation of having already found [herself]109-lily in the same situation but in different surroundings . It seemed to [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily was again descending the staircase from [[Selden]108-selden ’s rooms]1293-selden ’s rooms ; and looking down to remonstrate with the dispenser of the soapy flood , [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily met by a lifted stare which had once before confronted [her]109-lily under similar circumstances . It was [the char - woman of [the Benedick]8-the benedick]1294-the char - woman of the benedick who , resting on crimson elbows , examined [her]109-lily with the same unflinching curiosity , the same apparent reluctance to let [her]109-lily pass . On this occasion , however , [Miss Bart]109-lily was on [her]109-lily own ground . “ Do n’t [you]109-lily see that [I]109-lily wish to go by ? Please move [your]109-lily pail , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said sharply . [The woman]366-the woman at first seemed not to hear ; then , without a word of excuse , [she]366-the woman pushed back [her]366-the woman pail and dragged a wet floor - cloth across [the landing]360-the landing , keeping [her]366-the woman eyes fixed on [Lily]109-lily while [the latter swept by]1297-the latter swept by . It was insufferable that [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston should have such creatures about [the house]488-the house ; and [Lily]109-lily entered [[her]109-lily room]529-her room resolved that [the woman]366-the woman should be dismissed that evening . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , however , was at the moment inaccessible to remonstrance : since early morning [she]114-mrs. peniston had been shut up with [[her]114-mrs. peniston maid]565-her maid , going over [her]114-mrs. peniston furs , a process which formed the culminating episode in the drama of household renovation . In the evening also [Lily]109-lily found [herself]109-lily alone , for [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt , who rarely dined out , had responded to the summons of [a Van Alstyne cousin who was passing through [town]305-town]1303-a van alstyne cousin who was passing through town . [The house]488-the house , in [its]488-the house state of unnatural immaculateness and order , was as dreary as [a tomb]1306-a tomb , and as [Lily]109-lily , turning from [her]109-lily brief repast between shrouded sideboards , wandered into the newly - uncovered glare of [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room [she]109-lily felt as though [she]109-lily were buried alive in the stifling limits of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s existence . [She]109-lily usually contrived to avoid being at [home]400-home during the season of domestic renewal . On the present occasion , however , a variety of reasons had combined to bring [her]109-lily to [town]305-town ; and foremost among them was the fact that [she]109-lily had fewer invitations than usual for the autumn . [She]109-lily had so long been accustomed to pass from [one country - house]1310-one country - house to another , till the close of the holidays brought [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends to [town]305-town , that the unfilled gaps of time confronting [her]109-lily produced a sharp sense of waning popularity . It was as [she]109-lily had said to [Selden]108-selden — [people]2804-people were tired of [her]109-lily . [They]2804-people would welcome [her]109-lily in a new character , but as [Miss Bart]109-lily [they]2804-people knew [her]109-lily by heart . [She]109-lily knew [herself]109-lily by heart too , and was sick of the old story . There were moments when [she]109-lily longed blindly for anything different , anything strange , remote and untried ; but the utmost reach of [her]109-lily imagination did not go beyond picturing [her]109-lily usual life in a new setting . [She]109-lily could not figure [herself]109-lily as anywhere but in [a drawing - room]1314-a drawing - room , diffusing elegance as a flower sheds perfume . Meanwhile , as [October]185-october advanced [she]109-lily had to face the alternative of returning to [the Trenors]111-gus or joining [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt in [town]305-town . Even the desolating dulness of [New York]6-new york in October , and the soapy discomforts of [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s interior]1317-mrs. peniston ’s interior , seemed preferable to what might await [her]109-lily at [Bellomont]3-bellomont ; and with an air of heroic devotion [she]109-lily announced [her]109-lily intention of remaining with [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt till the holidays . Sacrifices of this nature are sometimes received with feelings as mixed as those which actuate them ; and [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston remarked to [[her]114-mrs. peniston confidential maid]1319-her confidential maid that , if [any of [the family]599-the family]1320-any of the family were to be with [her]114-mrs. peniston at such a crisis ( though for forty years [she]114-mrs. peniston had been thought competent to see to the hanging of [her]114-mrs. peniston own curtains ) , [she]114-mrs. peniston would certainly have preferred [Miss Grace]186-miss grace to [Miss Lily]109-lily . [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney was [an obscure cousin , of adaptable manners and vicarious interests]1322-an obscure cousin , of adaptable manners and vicarious interests , who “ ran in ”[187-grace stepney] to sit with [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston when [Lily]109-lily dined out too continuously ; who played bezique , picked up dropped stitches , read out the deaths from the Times , and sincerely admired the purple satin drawing - room curtains , the Dying Gladiator in the window , and the seven - by - five painting of [Niagara]188-niagara which represented the one artistic excess of [Mr. Peniston]143-mr. peniston ’s temperate career . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , under ordinary circumstances , was as much bored by [[her]114-mrs. peniston excellent cousin]1323-her excellent cousin as [the recipient of such services]1324-the recipient of such services usually is by [the person who performs them]1325-the person who performs them . [She]114-mrs. peniston greatly preferred [the brilliant and unreliable Lily , who did not know one end of a crochet - needle from the other]1326-the brilliant and unreliable lily , who did not know one end of a crochet - needle from the other , and had frequently wounded [her]114-mrs. peniston susceptibilities by suggesting that [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room should be “ done over . ”[114-mrs. peniston] But when it came to hunting for missing napkins , or helping to decide whether the backstairs needed re - carpeting , [Grace]187-grace stepney ’s judgment was certainly sounder than [Lily]109-lily ’s : not to mention the fact that [the latter]566-the latter resented the smell of beeswax and brown soap , and behaved as though [she]114-mrs. peniston thought [a house]1329-a house ought to keep clean of [itself]1329-a house , without extraneous assistance . Seated under the cheerless blaze of [the drawing - room chandelier]1330-the drawing - room chandelier — [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston never lit the lamps unless there was “ [company”—Lily]3195-company”—lily[114-mrs. peniston] seemed to watch [her]114-mrs. peniston own figure retreating down vistas of neutral - tinted dulness to a middle - age like [[Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney ’s]1331-grace stepney ’s . When [she]109-lily ceased to amuse [Judy Trenor]126-judy and [[her]126-judy friends]406-her friends [she]109-lily would have to fall back on amusing [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ; whichever way [she]109-lily looked [she]109-lily saw only a future of servitude to the whims of [others]1333-others , never the possibility of asserting [her]109-lily own eager individuality . A ring at the door - bell , sounding emphatically through [the empty house]1334-the empty house , roused [her]109-lily suddenly to the extent of [her]109-lily boredom . It was as though all the weariness of the past months had culminated in the vacuity of that interminable evening . If only the ring meant a summons from [the outer world]1335-the outer world — a token that [she]109-lily was still remembered and wanted ! After some delay [a parlour - maid]1336-a parlour - maid presented [herself]1336-a parlour - maid with the announcement that there was [a person outside who was asking to see [Miss Bart]109-lily]1337-a person outside who was asking to see miss bart ; and on [Lily]109-lily ’s pressing for a more specific description , [she]1336-a parlour - maid added : “ It ’s [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen , [Miss]3196-miss ; [she]1338-a woman in a battered bonnet , who stood firmly planted under the hall - light wo n’t say what [she]1338-a woman in a battered bonnet , who stood firmly planted under the hall - light wants . ”[1336-a parlour - maid] [Lily]109-lily , to whom the name conveyed nothing , opened the door upon [a woman in a battered bonnet , who stood firmly planted under the hall - light]1338-a woman in a battered bonnet , who stood firmly planted under the hall - light . [Lily]109-lily looked at [the char - woman]1080-the char - woman in surprise . “ Do [you]1080-the char - woman wish to see [me]109-lily ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily asked . “ [I]109-lily should like to say a word to [you]1080-the char - woman , [Miss.]3197-miss. ”[109-lily] The tone was neither aggressive nor conciliatory : it revealed nothing of [the speaker]1340-the speaker ’s errand . [The char - woman]1080-the char - woman , after the manner of [her]1080-the char - woman kind , stood with [her]1080-the char - woman arms folded in [her]1080-the char - woman shawl . [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen drew back . “ Well , if it comes to that , [I]1080-the char - woman guess it ’s mine as much as [anybody]361-anybody ’s , ”[1080-the char - woman] [she]1080-the char - woman returned .
