[She]109-lily felt , however , that it must be ended as promptly as possible . “ [I]366-the woman do n’t understand ; if this parcel is not [mine]366-the woman , why have [you]366-the woman asked for [me]366-the woman ? ”[366-the woman] [The woman]366-the woman was unabashed by the question . [She]366-the woman was evidently prepared to answer it , but like all [her]366-the woman class [she]366-the woman had to go a long way back to make a beginning , and it was only after a pause that [she]366-the woman replied : “ [[My]366-the woman husband]3199-my husband was [janitor]3200-janitor to the [Benedick]8-the benedick till the first of the month ; since then [he]3199-my husband ca n’t get nothing to do . ”[366-the woman] [Lily]109-lily remained silent and [she]366-the woman continued : “ It was n’t no fault of [our]3201-we own , neither : [the agent]3202-the agent had [another man [he]3202-the agent wanted [the place]3204-the place for]3203-another man he wanted the place for , and [we]3201-we was put out , bag and baggage , just to suit [his]3202-the agent fancy . [I]366-the woman had a long sickness last winter , and an operation that ate up all [we]3201-we ’d put by ; and it ’s hard for [me]366-the woman and [the children]3205-the children , [Haffen]189-mrs. haffen being so long out of a job . ”[366-the woman] After all , then , [she]109-lily had come only to ask [Miss Bart]109-lily to find a place for [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband ; or , more probably , to seek [the young lady]1349-the young lady ’s intervention with [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston . [Lily]109-lily had such an air of always getting what [she]109-lily wanted that [she]109-lily was used to being appealed to as [an intermediary]1350-an intermediary , and , relieved of [her]109-lily vague apprehension , [she]109-lily took refuge in the conventional formula . “ [I]109-lily am sorry [you]1349-the young lady have been in trouble , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said . “ Oh , that [we]3206-we have , [Miss]3207-miss , and it ’s on’y just beginning . If on’y [we]3206-we ’d ’ a got another situation — but [the agent]3202-the agent , [he]3202-the agent ’s dead against [us]3206-we . It ai n’t no fault of [ours]3206-we , neither , but — — ”[109-lily] At this point [Lily]109-lily ’s impatience overcame [her]109-lily . “ If [you]1349-the young lady have anything to say to [me]109-lily — — ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily interposed . [The woman]366-the woman ’s resentment of the rebuff seemed to spur [her]109-lily lagging ideas . “ Yes , [Miss]3209-miss ; [I]109-lily ’m coming to that , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said . [She]109-lily paused again , with [her]109-lily eyes on [Lily]109-lily , and then continued , in a tone of diffuse narrative : “ When [we]3206-we was at [the Benedick]3210-the benedick [I]109-lily had charge of some of [[the gentlemen]3211-the gentlemen ’s rooms]3212-the gentlemen ’s rooms ; leastways , [I]109-lily swep ’ ’em out on [Saturdays]40-saturdays . [Some of [the gentlemen]3211-the gentlemen]3213-some of the gentlemen got the greatest sight of letters : [I]109-lily never saw the like of it . [Their]3213-some of the gentlemen waste - paper baskets ’d be fairly brimming , and papers falling over on the floor . Maybe havin’ so many is how [they]3213-some of the gentlemen get so careless . [Some of ’em]3215-some of ’em is worse than others . [Mr. Selden]108-selden , [Mr. Lawrence Selden]108-selden , [he]108-selden was always [one of the carefullest]3216-one of the carefullest : burnt [his]108-selden letters in winter , and tore ’em in little bits in summer . But sometimes [he]108-selden ’d have so many [he]108-selden ’d just bunch ’em together , the way [the others]3217-the others did , and tear the lot through once — like this . ”[109-lily] While [she]1352-she spoke [she]1352-she had loosened the string from the parcel in [her]1352-she hand , and now [she]1352-she drew forth a letter which [she]1352-she laid on the table between [Miss Bart]109-lily and [herself]1352-she . As [she]1352-she had said , the letter was torn in two ; but with a rapid gesture [she]1352-she laid the torn edges together and smoothed out the page . A wave of indignation swept over [Lily]109-lily . [She]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily in the presence of something vile , as yet but dimly conjectured — the kind of vileness of which [people]2804-people whispered , but which [she]109-lily had never thought of as touching [her]109-lily own life . [She]109-lily drew back with a motion of disgust , but [her]109-lily withdrawal was checked by a sudden discovery : under the glare of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s chandelier [she]109-lily had recognized the hand - writing of the letter . It was a large disjointed hand , with a flourish of masculinity which but slightly disguised its rambling weakness , and the words , scrawled in heavy ink on pale - tinted notepaper , smote on [Lily]109-lily ’s ear as though [she]109-lily had heard [them]1354-them spoken . At first [she]109-lily did not grasp the full import of the situation . [She]109-lily understood only that before [her]109-lily lay a letter written by [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , and addressed , presumably , to [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . There was no date , but the blackness of the ink proved the writing to be comparatively recent . The packet in [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen ’s hand doubtless contained more letters of the same kind — a dozen , [Lily]109-lily conjectured from its thickness . The letter before [her]109-lily was short , but its few words , which had leapt into [her]109-lily brain before [she]109-lily was conscious of reading them , told a long history — a history over which , for the last four years , [the friends of [the writer]1356-the writer]1355-the friends of the writer had smiled and shrugged , viewing it merely as one among the countless “ good situations ”[3024-society] of the mundane comedy . Now the other side presented itself to [Lily]109-lily , the volcanic nether side of the surface over which conjecture and innuendo glide so lightly till the first fissure turns [their]1357-their whisper to a shriek . [Lily]109-lily knew that there is nothing [society]3024-society resents so much as having given its protection to [those who have not known how to profit by it]1359-those who have not known how to profit by it : it is for having betrayed [its]3024-society connivance that the body social punishes [the offender who is found out]1360-the offender who is found out . And in this case there was no doubt of the issue . The code of [[Lily]109-lily ’s world]1361-lily ’s world decreed that [[a woman]2771-a woman ’s husband]1363-a woman ’s husband should be the only judge of [her]2771-a woman conduct : [she]2771-a woman was technically above suspicion while [she]2771-a woman had the shelter of [his]1363-a woman ’s husband approval , or even of [his]1363-a woman ’s husband indifference . But with [a man of [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset]1364-a man of george dorset ’s temper there could be no thought of condonation — [the possessor of [[his]1363-a woman ’s husband wife]592-his wife ’s letters]1365-the possessor of his wife ’s letters could overthrow with a touch the whole structure of [her]2771-a woman existence . And into what hands [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s secret had been delivered ! For a moment the irony of the coincidence tinged [Lily]109-lily ’s disgust with a confused sense of triumph . But the disgust prevailed — all [her]109-lily instinctive resistances , of taste , of training , of blind inherited scruples , rose against the other feeling . [Her]109-lily strongest sense was one of personal contamination . [She]109-lily moved away , as though to put as much distance as possible between [herself]109-lily and [[her]109-lily visitor]1346-her visitor . “ [I]109-lily know nothing of these letters , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said ; “ [I]109-lily have no idea why [you]1346-her visitor have brought them [here]2763-here . ”[109-lily] [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen faced [her]109-lily steadily . “ [I]189-mrs. haffen ’ll tell [you]109-lily why , [Miss.]190-miss. [I]189-mrs. haffen brought [’em]3219-’em to [you]109-lily to sell , because [I]189-mrs. haffen ai n’t got no other way of raising money , and if [we]3220-we do n’t pay [our]3220-we rent by tomorrow night [we]3220-we ’ll be put out . [I]189-mrs. haffen never done anythin ’ of the kind before , and if [you]109-lily ’d speak to [Mr. Selden]108-selden or to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale about getting [Haffen]189-mrs. haffen taken on again at [the Benedick]8-the benedick — [I]189-mrs. haffen seen [you]109-lily talking to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale on the steps that day [you]109-lily come out of [[Mr. Selden]108-selden ’s rooms]3221-mr. selden ’s rooms — — ”[189-mrs. haffen] The blood rushed to [Lily]109-lily ’s forehead . [She]109-lily understood now — [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen supposed [her]109-lily to be [the writer of the letters]1368-the writer of the letters . In the first leap of [her]109-lily anger [she]109-lily was about to ring and order [the woman]366-the woman out ; but an obscure impulse restrained [her]109-lily . The mention of [Selden]108-selden ’s name had started a new train of thought . [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s letters were nothing to [her]109-lily — they might go where the current of chance carried them ! But [Selden]108-selden was inextricably involved in [their]1370-their fate . [Men]2795-men do not , at worst , suffer much from such exposure ; and in this instance the flash of divination which had carried the meaning of the letters to [Lily]109-lily ’s brain had revealed also that they were appeals — repeated and therefore probably unanswered — for the renewal of a tie which time had evidently relaxed . Nevertheless , the fact that the correspondence had been allowed to fall into strange hands would convict [Selden]108-selden of negligence in a matter where [the world]354-the world holds it least pardonable ; and there were graver risks to consider where [a man of [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset]1373-a man of dorset ’s ticklish balance was concerned . If [she]109-lily weighed all these things it was unconsciously : [she]109-lily was aware only of feeling that [Selden]108-selden would wish the letters rescued , and that therefore [she]109-lily must obtain possession of them . Beyond that [her]109-lily mind did not travel . [She]109-lily had , indeed , a quick vision of returning the packet to [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , and of the opportunities the restitution offered ; but this thought lit up abysses from which [she]109-lily shrank back ashamed . Meanwhile [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen , prompt to perceive [her]109-lily hesitation , had already opened the packet and ranged its contents on the table . All the letters had been pieced together with strips of thin paper . Some were in small fragments , the others merely torn in half . Though there were not many , thus spread out they nearly covered the table . [Lily]109-lily ’s glance fell on a word here and there — then [she]189-mrs. haffen said in a low voice : “ What do [you]189-mrs. haffen wish [me]189-mrs. haffen to pay [you]189-mrs. haffen ? ”[189-mrs. haffen] [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen ’s face reddened with satisfaction . It was clear that [the young lady]1349-the young lady was badly frightened , and [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen was [the woman to make the most of such fears]1375-the woman to make the most of such fears . Anticipating an easier victory than [she]189-mrs. haffen had foreseen , [she]189-mrs. haffen named an exorbitant sum . But [Miss Bart]109-lily showed [herself]109-lily a less ready prey than might have been expected from [her]109-lily imprudent opening . [She]109-lily refused to pay the price named , and after a moment ’s hesitation , met it by a counter - offer of half the amount . [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen immediately stiffened . [Her]189-mrs. haffen hand travelled toward the outspread letters , and folding them slowly , [she]189-mrs. haffen made as though to restore them to their wrapping . “ [I]189-mrs. haffen guess they ’re worth more to [you]189-mrs. haffen than to [me]189-mrs. haffen , [Miss]3222-miss , but [the poor]3223-the poor has got to live as well as [the rich]3224-the rich , ”[189-mrs. haffen] [she]189-mrs. haffen observed sententiously . [Lily]109-lily was throbbing with fear , but the insinuation fortified [her]109-lily resistance . “ [You]189-mrs. haffen are mistaken , ”[189-mrs. haffen] [she]189-mrs. haffen said indifferently . “ [I]189-mrs. haffen have offered all [I]189-mrs. haffen am willing to give for the letters ; but there may be other ways of getting them . ”[189-mrs. haffen] [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen raised a suspicious glance : [she]189-mrs. haffen was too experienced not to know that the traffic [she]189-mrs. haffen was engaged in had perils as great as its rewards , and [she]189-mrs. haffen had a vision of the elaborate machinery of revenge which a word of [this commanding young lady]1376-this commanding young lady ’s might set in motion . [She]189-mrs. haffen applied the corner of [her]189-mrs. haffen shawl to [her]189-mrs. haffen eyes , and murmured through it that no good came of bearing too hard on [the poor]3223-the poor , but that for [her]189-mrs. haffen part [she]189-mrs. haffen had never been mixed up in such a business before , and that on [her]189-mrs. haffen honour as [a Christian]1378-a christian all [she]189-mrs. haffen and [Haffen]189-mrs. haffen had thought of was that the letters must n’t go any farther . [Lily]109-lily stood motionless , keeping between [herself]109-lily and [the char - woman]1080-the char - woman the greatest distance compatible with the need of speaking in low tones . The idea of bargaining for the letters was intolerable to [her]109-lily , but [she]109-lily knew that , if [she]109-lily appeared to weaken , [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen would at once increase [her]109-lily original demand . [She]109-lily could never afterward recall how long the duel lasted , or what was the decisive stroke which finally , after a lapse of time recorded in minutes by the clock , in hours by the precipitate beat of [her]109-lily pulses , put [her]109-lily in possession of the letters ; [she]109-lily knew only that the door had finally closed , and that [she]109-lily stood alone with the packet in [her]109-lily hand . [She]109-lily had no idea of reading the letters ; even to unfold [Mrs. Haffen]189-mrs. haffen ’s dirty newspaper would have seemed degrading . But what did [she]109-lily intend to do with its contents ? [The recipient of the letters]1380-the recipient of the letters had meant to destroy them , and it was [her]109-lily duty to carry out [his]1380-the recipient of the letters intention . [She]109-lily had no right to keep them — to do so was to lessen whatever merit lay in having secured [their]1381-their possession . But how destroy [them]1381-their so effectually that there should be no second risk of [their]1381-their falling in such hands ? [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s icy drawing - room grate shone with a forbidding lustre : the fire , like the lamps , was never lit except when there was company . [Miss Bart]109-lily was turning to carry the letters [upstairs]2873-upstairs when [she]109-lily heard the opening of the outer door , and [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt entered [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston was [a small plump woman , with a colourless skin lined with trivial wrinkles]1385-a small plump woman , with a colourless skin lined with trivial wrinkles . [Her]114-mrs. peniston grey hair was arranged with precision , and [her]114-mrs. peniston clothes looked excessively new and yet slightly old - fashioned . They were always black and tightly fitting , with an expensive glitter : [she]114-mrs. peniston was [the kind of woman who wore jet at breakfast]1386-the kind of woman who wore jet at breakfast . [Lily]109-lily had never seen [her]114-mrs. peniston when [she]114-mrs. peniston was not cuirassed in shining black , with small tight boots , and an air of being packed and ready to start ; yet [she]114-mrs. peniston never started . [She]114-mrs. peniston looked about [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room with an expression of minute scrutiny . “ [I]114-mrs. peniston saw a streak of light under one of the blinds as [I]114-mrs. peniston drove up : it ’s extraordinary that [I]114-mrs. peniston can never teach [that woman]3225-that woman to draw them down evenly . ”[114-mrs. peniston] Having corrected the irregularity , [she]114-mrs. peniston seated [herself]114-mrs. peniston on one of the glossy purple arm - chairs ; [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston always sat on a chair , never in it . When [I]114-mrs. peniston was [a girl]2828-a girl [I]114-mrs. peniston used to keep the MENU of every dinner [I]114-mrs. peniston went to , and write the names of [the people on the back]3233-the people on the back ; and [I]114-mrs. peniston never threw away [my]114-mrs. peniston cotillion favours till after [[your]109-lily uncle]3234-your uncle ’s death , when it seemed unsuitable to have so many coloured things about [the house]488-the house . [I]114-mrs. peniston had a whole closet - full , [I]114-mrs. peniston remember ; and [I]114-mrs. peniston can tell to this day what balls [I]114-mrs. peniston got them at . [Molly Van Alstyne]195-molly reminds [me]114-mrs. peniston of what [I]114-mrs. peniston was at that age ; it ’s wonderful how [she]195-molly notices . But [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset told [Molly]195-molly about it [herself]131-mrs. dorset : [she]131-mrs. dorset said [the villa]3245-the villa was full of the most exquisite things and [she]131-mrs. dorset was really sorry to leave . [Molly]195-molly said [she]195-molly never saw [her]131-mrs. dorset looking better ; [she]131-mrs. dorset was in tremendous spirits , and said [she]131-mrs. dorset had made a match between [Evie Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh and [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce . Well , as [I]114-mrs. peniston was saying , [Evie]180-evie van osburgh is really engaged : [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset had [her]180-evie van osburgh to stay with [Percy Gryce]127-mr. gryce , and managed it all , and [Grace Van Osburgh]179-cousin grace is in [the seventh heaven]3248-the seventh heaven — [she]131-mrs. dorset had almost despaired of marrying [Evie]180-evie van osburgh . ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston again paused , but this time [her]114-mrs. peniston scrutiny addressed itself , not to the furniture , but to [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece . “ [Cornelia Van Alstyne]142-cornelia van alstyne was so surprised : [she]131-mrs. dorset had heard that [you]114-mrs. peniston were to marry [young Gryce]127-mr. gryce . [She]131-mrs. dorset saw [the Wetheralls]120-the wetheralls just after [they]120-the wetheralls had stopped with [you]114-mrs. peniston at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and [Alice Wetherall]147-alice wetherall was quite sure there was an engagement . [She]131-mrs. dorset said that when [Mr. Gryce]127-mr. gryce left unexpectedly one morning , [they]120-the wetheralls all thought [he]127-mr. gryce had rushed to [town]305-town for the ring . ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Lily]109-lily rose and moved toward the door . “ [I]109-lily believe [I]109-lily AM tired : [I]109-lily think [I]109-lily will go to bed , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said ; and [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , suddenly distracted by the discovery that the easel sustaining [the late Mr. Peniston]143-mr. peniston ’s crayon - portrait was not exactly in line with the sofa in front of it , presented an absent - minded brow to [her]109-lily kiss . In [[her]109-lily own room]1393-her own room [Lily]109-lily turned up the gas - jet and glanced toward [the grate]1394-the grate . [It]1394-the grate was as brilliantly polished as the one below , but here at least [she]109-lily could burn a few papers with less risk of incurring [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s disapproval . [She]109-lily made no immediate motion to do so , however , but dropping into a chair looked wearily about [her]109-lily . [[Her]109-lily room]529-her room was large and comfortably - furnished — it was the envy and admiration of [poor Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , who boarded ; but , contrasted with the light tints and luxurious appointments of [the guest - rooms where so many weeks of [Lily]109-lily ’s existence were spent]1397-the guest - rooms where so many weeks of lily ’s existence were spent , it seemed as dreary as [a prison]1398-a prison . The monumental wardrobe and bedstead of black walnut had migrated from [[Mr. Peniston]143-mr. peniston ’s bedroom]1399-mr. peniston ’s bedroom , and the magenta “ flock ”[143-mr. peniston] wall - paper , of a pattern dear to the early ’ sixties , was hung with large steel engravings of an anecdotic character . [Lily]109-lily had tried to mitigate this charmless background by a few frivolous touches , in the shape of a lace - decked toilet table and a little painted desk surmounted by photographs ; but the futility of the attempt struck [her]109-lily as [she]109-lily looked about [the room]351-the room . What a contrast to the subtle elegance of the setting [she]109-lily had pictured for [herself]109-lily — [an apartment which should surpass the complicated luxury of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends ’ surroundings]1401-an apartment which should surpass the complicated luxury of her friends ’ surroundings by the whole extent of that artistic sensibility which made [her]109-lily feel [herself]109-lily [their]406-her friends superior ; in which every tint and line should combine to enhance [her]109-lily beauty and give distinction to [her]109-lily leisure ! Once more the haunting sense of physical ugliness was intensified by [her]109-lily mental depression , so that each piece of the offending furniture seemed to thrust forth its most aggressive angle . [[Her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s words had told [her]109-lily nothing new ; but [they]1404-they had revived the vision of [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , smiling , flattered , victorious , holding [her]109-lily up to ridicule by insinuations intelligible to [every member of [their]406-her friends little group]1405-every member of their little group . The thought of the ridicule struck deeper than any other sensation : [Lily]109-lily knew every turn of the allusive jargon which could flay its victims without the shedding of blood . [Her]109-lily cheek burned at the recollection , and [she]109-lily rose and caught up the letters . [She]109-lily no longer meant to destroy them : that intention had been effaced by the quick corrosion of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s words . Instead , [she]109-lily approached [her]109-lily desk , and lighting a taper , tied and sealed the packet ; then [she]109-lily opened the wardrobe , drew out a despatch - box , and deposited the letters within it . As [she]109-lily did so , it struck [her]109-lily with a flash of irony that [she]109-lily was indebted to [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor for the means of buying them . Chapter 10 The autumn dragged on monotonously . [Miss Bart]109-lily had received one or two notes from [Judy Trenor]126-judy , reproaching [her]126-judy for not returning to [Bellomont]3-bellomont ; but [she]126-judy replied evasively , alleging the obligation to remain with [[her]126-judy aunt]345-her aunt . In truth , however , [she]109-lily was fast wearying of [her]109-lily solitary existence with [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , and only the excitement of spending [her]109-lily newly - acquired money lightened the dulness of the days . All [her]109-lily life [Lily]109-lily had seen money go out as quickly as it came in , and whatever theories [she]109-lily cultivated as to the prudence of setting aside a part of [her]109-lily gains , [she]109-lily had unhappily no saving vision of the risks of the opposite course . It was a keen satisfaction to feel that , for a few months at least , [she]109-lily would be independent of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends ’ bounty , that [she]109-lily could show [herself]109-lily abroad without wondering whether some penetrating eye would detect in [her]109-lily dress the traces of [Judy Trenor]126-judy ’s refurbished splendour . The fact that the money freed [her]109-lily temporarily from all minor obligations obscured [her]109-lily sense of the greater one it represented , and having never before known what it was to command so large a sum , [she]109-lily lingered delectably over the amusement of spending it . It was on one of these occasions that , leaving [a shop where [she]109-lily had spent an hour of deliberation over a dressing - case of the most complicated elegance]1408-a shop where she had spent an hour of deliberation over a dressing - case of the most complicated elegance , [she]109-lily ran across [Miss Farish]113-miss farish , who had entered [the same establishment]1409-the same establishment with the modest object of having [her]113-miss farish watch repaired . [Lily]109-lily was feeling unusually virtuous . [She]109-lily had decided to defer the purchase of the dressing - case till [she]109-lily should receive the bill for [her]109-lily new opera cloak , and the resolve made [her]109-lily feel much richer than when [she]109-lily had entered [the shop]1410-the shop . In this mood of self - approval [she]109-lily had a sympathetic eye for [others]1333-others , and [she]109-lily was struck by [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s air of dejection . [Miss Farish]113-miss farish , it appeared , had just left the committee - meeting of [a struggling charity in which [she]113-miss farish was interested]1413-a struggling charity in which she was interested . The object of the association was to provide [comfortable lodgings]1414-comfortable lodgings , with [a reading - room]1415-a reading - room and other modest distractions , where [young women of the class employed in [downtown offices]1417-downtown offices]1416-young women of the class employed in downtown offices might find a [home]400-home when out of work , or in need of rest , and the first year ’s financial report showed so deplorably small a balance that [Miss Farish]113-miss farish [, who was convinced of the urgency of the work]1419-, who was convinced of the urgency of the work , felt proportionately discouraged by the small amount of interest it aroused . The other - regarding sentiments had not been cultivated in [Lily]109-lily , and [she]109-lily was often bored by the relation of [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s philanthropic efforts , but today [her]109-lily quick dramatizing fancy seized on the contrast between [her]109-lily own situation and that represented by some of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s “ cases . ”[1421-young girls] These were [young girls]1421-young girls , like [herself]109-lily ; some perhaps pretty , some not without a trace of [her]109-lily finer sensibilities . [She]109-lily pictured [herself]109-lily leading such a life as [theirs]1422-theirs — a life in which achievement seemed as squalid as failure — and the vision made [her]109-lily shudder sympathetically . The price of the dressing - case was still in [her]109-lily pocket ; and drawing out [her]109-lily little gold purse [she]109-lily slipped a liberal fraction of the amount into [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s hand . The satisfaction derived from this act was all that [the most ardent moralist]1423-the most ardent moralist could have desired . [Lily]109-lily felt a new interest in [herself]109-lily as [a person of charitable instincts]1424-a person of charitable instincts : [she]109-lily had never before thought of doing good with the wealth [she]109-lily had so often dreamed of possessing , but now [her]109-lily horizon was enlarged by the vision of a prodigal philanthropy . Moreover , by some obscure process of logic , [she]109-lily felt that [her]109-lily momentary burst of generosity had justified all previous extravagances , and excused any in which [she]109-lily might subsequently indulge . [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s surprise and gratitude confirmed this feeling , and [Lily]109-lily parted from [her]113-miss farish with a sense of self - esteem which [she]109-lily naturally mistook for the fruits of altruism . About this time [she]109-lily was farther cheered by an invitation to spend the Thanksgiving week at [a camp in [the Adirondacks]43-the adirondacks]1425-a camp in the adirondacks . The invitation was one which , a year earlier , would have provoked a less ready response , for the party , though organized by [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , was ostensibly given by [a lady of obscure origin and indomitable social ambitions]1426-a lady of obscure origin and indomitable social ambitions , whose acquaintance [Lily]109-lily had hitherto avoided . Now , however , [she]109-lily was disposed to coincide with [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s view , that it did n’t matter who gave [the party]436-the party , as long as things were well done ; and doing things well ( under competent direction ) was [Mrs. Wellington Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s strong point . [The lady]602-the lady ( whose consort was known as “ [Welly ”[602-the lady] Bry]198-mrs. bry on [the Stock Exchange]1429-the stock exchange and in sporting circles ) had already sacrificed [one husband]1430-one husband , and sundry minor considerations , to [her]602-the lady determination to get on ; and , having obtained a hold on [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , [she]109-lily was astute enough to perceive the wisdom of committing [herself]109-lily entirely to [that lady]486-that lady ’s guidance . Everything , accordingly , was well done , for there was no limit to [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s prodigality when [she]135-mrs. fisher was not spending [her]135-mrs. fisher own money , and as [she]135-mrs. fisher remarked to [[her]135-mrs. fisher pupil]1432-her pupil , [a good cook]608-a good cook was the best introduction to society . If [the company]1434-the company was not as select as [the CUISINE]1435-the cuisine , [the Welly Brys]199-the brys at least had the satisfaction of figuring for the first time in the society columns in company with [one or two noticeable names]1436-one or two noticeable names ; and foremost among these was of course [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s . [The young lady]1349-the young lady was treated by [[her]1349-the young lady hosts]1438-her hosts with corresponding deference ; and [she]1349-the young lady was in the mood when such attentions are acceptable , whatever [their]1438-her hosts source . [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s admiration was a mirror in which [Lily]109-lily ’s self - complacency recovered its lost outline . No insect hangs its nest on threads as frail as those which will sustain the weight of human vanity ; and the sense of being of importance among [the insignificant]1439-the insignificant was enough to restore to [Miss Bart]109-lily the gratifying consciousness of power . If [these people]887-these people paid court to [her]1349-the young lady it proved that [she]1349-the young lady was still conspicuous in the world to which [they]887-these people aspired ; and [she]1349-the young lady was not above a certain enjoyment in dazzling [them]887-these people by [her]1349-the young lady fineness , in developing [their]887-these people puzzled perception of [her]1349-the young lady superiorities . Perhaps , however , [her]1349-the young lady enjoyment proceeded more than [she]1349-the young lady was aware from the physical stimulus of the excursion , the challenge of crisp cold and hard exercise , the responsive thrill of [her]1349-the young lady body to the influences of [the winter woods]1441-the winter woods . [She]1349-the young lady returned to [town]305-town in a glow of rejuvenation , conscious of a clearer colour in [her]1349-the young lady cheeks , a fresh elasticity in [her]1349-the young lady muscles . The future seemed full of a vague promise , and all [her]1349-the young lady apprehensions were swept out of sight on the buoyant current of [her]1349-the young lady mood . A few days after [her]1349-the young lady return to [town]305-town [she]1349-the young lady had the unpleasant surprise of a visit from [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale . [He]124-rosedale came late , at the confidential hour when the tea - table still lingers by the fire in friendly expectancy ; and [his]124-rosedale manner showed a readiness to adapt itself to the intimacy of the occasion . [Lily]109-lily , who had a vague sense of [his]124-rosedale being somehow connected with [her]109-lily lucky speculations , tried to give [him]124-rosedale the welcome [he]124-rosedale expected ; but there was something in the quality of [his]124-rosedale geniality which chilled [her]109-lily own , and [she]109-lily was conscious of marking each step in [their]1444-their acquaintance by a fresh blunder . [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale — making [himself]124-rosedale promptly at [home]400-home in an adjoining easy - chair , and sipping [his]124-rosedale tea critically , with the comment : “ [You]109-lily ought to go to [[my]124-rosedale man]3250-my man for something really good”—appeared[124-rosedale] totally unconscious of the repugnance which kept [her]109-lily in frozen erectness behind the urn . It was perhaps [her]109-lily very manner of holding [herself]109-lily aloof that appealed to [[his]124-rosedale collector]1446-his collector ’s passion for the rare and unattainable . [He]124-rosedale gave , at any rate , no sign of resenting it and seemed prepared to supply in [his]124-rosedale own manner all the ease that was lacking in [hers]109-lily . [His]124-rosedale object in calling was to ask [her]109-lily to go to the opera in [his]124-rosedale box on the opening night , and seeing [her]109-lily hesitate [he]124-rosedale said persuasively : “ [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher is coming , and [I]124-rosedale ’ve secured [a tremendous admirer of yours]3251-a tremendous admirer of yours , who ’ll never forgive [me]124-rosedale if [you]109-lily do n’t accept . ”[124-rosedale] As [Lily]109-lily ’s silence left [him]124-rosedale with this allusion on [his]124-rosedale hands , [he]124-rosedale added with a confidential smile : “ [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor has promised to come to [town]305-town on purpose . [I]124-rosedale fancy [he]161-gus trenor ’d go a good deal farther for the pleasure of seeing [you]109-lily . ”[124-rosedale] [Miss Bart]109-lily felt an inward motion of annoyance : it was distasteful enough to hear [her]109-lily name coupled with [Trenor]161-gus trenor ’s , and on [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s lips the allusion was peculiarly unpleasant . “ [The Trenors]111-gus are [[my]109-lily best friends]2803-my best friends — [I]109-lily think [we]3254-we should all go a long way to see [each other]2955-each other , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said , absorbing [herself]109-lily in the preparation of fresh tea . [[Her]109-lily visitor]1346-her visitor ’s smile grew increasingly intimate . “ Well , [I]124-rosedale was n’t thinking of [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor at the moment — [they]3256-they say [Gus]111-gus does n’t always , [you]124-rosedale know . ”[124-rosedale] Then , dimly conscious that [he]124-rosedale had not struck the right note , [he]124-rosedale added , with a well - meant effort at diversion : “ How ’s [your]124-rosedale luck been going in [Wall Street]44-wall street , by the way ? [I]124-rosedale hear [Gus]111-gus pulled off a nice little pile for [you]124-rosedale last month . ”[124-rosedale] [Lily]109-lily put down the tea - caddy with an abrupt gesture . [She]109-lily felt that [her]109-lily hands were trembling , and clasped them on [her]109-lily knee to steady them ; but [her]109-lily lip trembled too , and for a moment [she]109-lily was afraid the tremor might communicate itself to [her]109-lily voice . When [she]109-lily spoke , however , it was in a tone of perfect lightness . “ Ah , yes — [I]109-lily had a little bit of money to invest , and [Mr. Trenor]145-mr. trenor , who helps [me]109-lily about such matters , advised [my]109-lily putting it in stocks instead of a mortgage , as [[my]109-lily aunt]2743-my aunt ’s agent wanted [me]109-lily to do ; and as it happened , [I]109-lily made a lucky ‘ turn’—is that what [you]1448-his call it ? For [you]1448-his make a great many [yourself]1448-his , [I]109-lily believe . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily was smiling back at [him]1448-his now , relaxing the tension of [her]109-lily attitude , and admitting [him]1448-his , by imperceptible gradations of glance and manner , a step farther toward intimacy . The protective instinct always nerved [her]109-lily to successful dissimulation , and it was not the first time [she]109-lily had used [her]109-lily beauty to divert attention from an inconvenient topic . When [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale took leave , [he]1448-his carried with [him]1448-his , not only [her]109-lily acceptance of [his]1448-his invitation , but a general sense of having comported [himself]1448-his in a way calculated to advance [his]1448-his cause . [He]1448-his had always believed [he]1448-his had a light touch and a knowing way with [women]2772-women , and the prompt manner in which [Miss Bart]109-lily ( as [he]1448-his would have phrased it ) had “ come into line , ”[109-lily] confirmed [his]1448-his confidence in [his]1448-his powers of handling this skittish sex . [Her]109-lily way of glossing over the transaction with [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor [he]1448-his regarded at once as a tribute to [his]1448-his own acuteness , and a confirmation of [his]1448-his suspicions . [The girl]665-the girl was evidently nervous , and [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , if [he]124-rosedale saw no other means of advancing [his]124-rosedale acquaintance with [her]665-the girl , was not above taking advantage of [her]665-the girl nervousness . [He]124-rosedale left [Lily]109-lily to a passion of disgust and fear . It seemed incredible that [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor should have spoken of [her]109-lily to [Rosedale]124-rosedale . With all [his]161-gus trenor faults , [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor had the safeguard of [his]161-gus trenor traditions , and was the less likely to overstep them because they were so purely instinctive . But [Lily]109-lily recalled with a pang that there were convivial moments when , as [Judy]126-judy had confided to [her]109-lily , [Gus]161-gus trenor “ talked foolishly ”[161-gus trenor] : in one of these , no doubt , the fatal word had slipped from [him]161-gus trenor . As for [Rosedale]124-rosedale , [she]109-lily did not , after the first shock , greatly care what conclusions [he]124-rosedale had drawn . Though usually adroit enough where [her]109-lily own interests were concerned , [she]109-lily made the mistake , not uncommon to [persons in whom the social habits are instinctive , of supposing that the inability to acquire them]1451-persons in whom the social habits are instinctive , of supposing that the inability to acquire them quickly implies a general dulness . Because a blue - bottle bangs irrationally against a window - pane , [the drawing - room naturalist]1452-the drawing - room naturalist may forget that under less artificial conditions it is capable of measuring distances and drawing conclusions with all the accuracy needful to its welfare ; and the fact that [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s drawing - room manner lacked perspective made [Lily]109-lily class [him]124-rosedale with [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor and [the other dull men [she]109-lily knew]1453-the other dull men she knew , and assume that a little flattery , and the occasional acceptance of [his]124-rosedale hospitality , would suffice to render [him]124-rosedale innocuous . However , there could be no doubt of the expediency of showing [herself]109-lily in [his]124-rosedale box on the opening night of the opera ; and after all , since [Judy Trenor]126-judy had promised to take [him]124-rosedale up that winter , it was as well to reap the advantage of being first in [the field]741-the field . For a day or two after [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s visit , [Lily]109-lily ’s thoughts were dogged by the consciousness of [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s shadowy claim , and [she]109-lily wished [she]109-lily had a clearer notion of the exact nature of the transaction which seemed to have put [her]109-lily in [his]124-rosedale power ; but [her]109-lily mind shrank from any unusual application , and [she]109-lily was always helplessly puzzled by figures . Moreover [she]109-lily had not seen [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor since the day of [the Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh wedding , and in [his]124-rosedale continued absence the trace of [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s words was soon effaced by other impressions . When the opening night of the opera came , [her]109-lily apprehensions had so completely vanished that the sight of [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s ruddy countenance in the back of [[Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s box]1455-mr. rosedale ’s box filled [her]109-lily with a sense of pleasant reassurance . [Lily]109-lily had not quite reconciled [herself]109-lily to the necessity of appearing as [[Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s guest]1456-rosedale ’s guest on so conspicuous an occasion , and it was a relief to find [herself]109-lily supported by any one of [her]109-lily own set — for [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s social habits were too promiscuous for [her]109-lily presence to justify [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s . To [Lily]109-lily , always inspirited by the prospect of showing [her]109-lily beauty in public , and conscious tonight of all the added enhancements of dress , the insistency of [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s gaze merged itself in the general stream of admiring looks of which [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily the centre . Ah , it was good to be young , to be radiant , to glow with the sense of slenderness , strength and elasticity , of well - poised lines and happy tints , to feel [one]2737-one ’s self lifted to a height apart by that incommunicable grace which is the bodily counterpart of genius ! All means seemed justifiable to attain such an end , or rather , by a happy shifting of lights with which practice had familiarized [Miss Bart]109-lily , the cause shrank to a pin - point in the general brightness of the effect . But [brilliant young ladies]1458-brilliant young ladies , a little blinded by [their]1458-brilliant young ladies own effulgence , are apt to forget that the modest satellite drowned in [their]1458-brilliant young ladies light is still performing its own revolutions and generating heat at its own rate . If [Lily]109-lily ’s poetic enjoyment of the moment was undisturbed by the base thought that [her]109-lily gown and opera cloak had been indirectly paid for by [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor , [the latter]566-the latter had not sufficient poetry in [his]161-gus trenor composition to lose sight of these prosaic facts . [He]161-gus trenor knew only that [he]161-gus trenor had never seen [Lily]109-lily look smarter in [her]109-lily life , that there was n’t [a woman in [the house]488-the house who showed off good clothes as [she]109-lily did , and that hitherto [he]161-gus trenor , to whom [she]109-lily owed the opportunity of making this display , had reaped no return beyond that of gazing at [her]109-lily in company with several hundred other pairs of eyes]1460-a woman in the house who showed off good clothes as she did , and that hitherto he , to whom she owed the opportunity of making this display , had reaped no return beyond that of gazing at her in company with several hundred other pairs of eyes . It came to [Lily]109-lily therefore as a disagreeable surprise when , in the back of the box , where [they]1462-they found [themselves]1462-they alone between two acts , [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor said , without preamble , and in a tone of sulky authority : “ Look here , [Lily]109-lily , how is [a fellow]3096-a fellow ever to see anything of [you]109-lily ? [I]123-mrs. trenor ’m in [town]305-town three or four days in the week , and [you]109-lily know a line to [the club]3260-the club will always find [me]123-mrs. trenor , but [you]109-lily do n’t seem to remember [my]123-mrs. trenor existence nowadays unless [you]109-lily want to get a tip out of [me]123-mrs. trenor . ”[123-mrs. trenor] The fact that the remark was in distinctly bad taste did not make it any easier to answer , for [Lily]109-lily was vividly aware that it was not the moment for that drawing up of [her]109-lily slim figure and surprised lifting of the brows by which [she]109-lily usually quelled incipient signs of familiarity . “ [I]109-lily ’m very much flattered by [your]123-mrs. trenor wanting to see [me]109-lily , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily returned , essaying lightness instead , “ but , unless [you]123-mrs. trenor have mislaid [my]109-lily address , it would have been easy to find [me]109-lily any afternoon at [[my]109-lily aunt’s]3261-my aunt’s — in fact , [I]109-lily rather expected [you]123-mrs. trenor to look [me]109-lily up there . ”[109-lily] If [she]109-lily hoped to mollify [him]1463-he by this last concession the attempt was a failure , for [he]1463-he only replied , with the familiar lowering of the brows that made [him]1463-he look [his]1463-he dullest when [he]1463-he was angry : “ Hang going to [[your]109-lily aunt]3262-your aunt ’s , and wasting the afternoon listening to a lot of [other chaps]3263-other chaps talking to [you]109-lily ! [You]109-lily know [I]1463-he ’m not the kind to sit in [a crowd]3264-a crowd and jaw — [I’d]1463-he always rather clear out when that sort of circus is going on . But why ca n’t [we]3265-we go off somewhere on a little lark together — [a nice quiet little expedition like that drive at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]3266-a nice quiet little expedition like that drive at bellomont , the day [you]109-lily met [me]1463-he at [the station]319-the station ? ”[1463-he] [He]1463-he leaned unpleasantly close in order to convey this suggestion , and [she]1464-you fancied [she]1464-you caught a significant aroma which explained the dark flush on [his]1463-he face and the glistening dampness of [his]1463-he forehead . The idea that any rash answer might provoke an unpleasant outburst tempered [her]1464-you disgust with caution , and [she]1464-you answered with a laugh : “ [I]1464-you do n’t see how one can very well take country drives in [town]305-town , but [I]1464-you am not always surrounded by [an admiring throng]3269-an admiring throng , and if [you]1463-he will let [me]1464-you know what afternoon [you]1463-he are coming [I]1464-you will arrange things so that [we]3270-we can have a nice quiet talk . ”[1464-you] “ Hang talking ! That ’s what [you]1464-you always say , ”[123-mrs. trenor] returned [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , whose expletives lacked variety . “ [You]1464-you put [me]1465-me off with that at the [Van Osburgh]119-gwen wedding — but the plain English of it is that , now [you]1464-you ’ve got what [you]1464-you wanted out of [me]1465-me , [you]1464-you ’d rather have [any other fellow]3271-any other fellow about . ”[1465-me] [His]1465-me voice had risen sharply with the last words , and [Lily]109-lily flushed with annoyance , but [she]109-lily kept command of the situation and laid a persuasive hand on [his]1465-me arm . “ Do n’t be foolish , [Gus]161-gus trenor ; [I]109-lily ca n’t let [you]161-gus trenor talk to [me]109-lily in that ridiculous way . If [you]161-gus trenor really want to see [me]109-lily , why should n’t [we]3272-we take a walk in [the Park]747-the park some afternoon ? [I]109-lily agree with [you]161-gus trenor that it ’s amusing to be rustic in [town]305-town , and if [you]161-gus trenor like [I]109-lily ’ll meet [you]161-gus trenor [there]2755-there , and [we]3272-we ’ll go and feed the squirrels , and [you]161-gus trenor shall take [me]109-lily out on [the lake]3276-the lake in the steam - gondola . ”[109-lily] [She]1466-her smiled as [she]1466-her spoke , letting [her]1466-her eyes rest on [his]1467-i in a way that took the edge from [her]1466-her banter and made [him]1467-i suddenly malleable to [her]1466-her will . “ All right , then : that ’s a go . Will [you]161-gus trenor come tomorrow ? Tomorrow at three o’clock , at the end of [the Mall]3277-the mall . [I]1466-her ’ll be there sharp , remember ; [you]161-gus trenor wo n’t go back on [me]1466-her , [Lily]109-lily ? ”[1466-her] But to [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s relief the repetition of [her]1466-her promise was cut short by the opening of the box door to admit [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor sulkily yielded [his]1467-i place , and [Lily]109-lily turned a brilliant smile on [the newcomer]1468-the newcomer . [She]109-lily had not talked with [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset since [their]1469-we visit at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , but something in [his]1467-i look and manner told [her]109-lily that [he]1467-i recalled the friendly footing on which [they]1469-we had last met . [He]1467-i was not [a man to whom the expression of admiration came easily]1470-a man to whom the expression of admiration came easily : [his]1467-i long sallow face and distrustful eyes seemed always barricaded against the expansive emotions . But , where [her]109-lily own influence was concerned , [Lily]109-lily ’s intuitions sent out thread - like feelers , and as [she]109-lily made room for [him]1467-i on the narrow sofa [she]109-lily was sure [he]1467-i found a dumb pleasure in being near [her]109-lily . [Few women]1471-few women took the trouble to make [themselves]1471-few women agreeable to [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , and [Lily]109-lily had been kind to [him]1467-i at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and was now smiling on [him]1467-i with a divine renewal of kindness . “ Well , here [we]1469-we are , in for another six months of caterwauling , ”[1467-i] [he]1467-i began complainingly . “ Not a shade of difference between this year and last , except that [the women]2741-the women have got new clothes and [the singers]3279-the singers have n’t got new voices . [[My]1467-i wife]2959-my wife ’s musical , [you]3281-you know — puts [me]1467-i through a course of this every winter . It is n’t so bad on Italian nights — then [she]2959-my wife comes late , and there ’s time to digest . But when [they]3282-they give [Wagner]200-wagner [we]1469-we have to rush dinner , and [I]1467-i pay up for it . And the draughts are damnable — asphyxia in front and pleurisy in the back . There ’s [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor leaving the box without drawing the curtain ! With a hide like that draughts do n’t make any difference . Did [you]3281-you ever watch [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor eat ? If [you]3281-you did , [you]3281-you ’d wonder why [he]1467-i ’s alive ; [I]1467-i suppose [he]1467-i ’s leather inside too.—But [I]1467-i came to say that [[my]1467-i wife]2959-my wife wants [you]3281-you to come down to [[our]1469-we place]3284-our place next Sunday . Do for heaven ’s sake say yes . [She]2959-my wife ’s got a lot of bores coming — [intellectual ones]3285-intellectual ones , [I]1467-i mean ; that ’s [her]2959-my wife new line , [you]3281-you know , and [I]1467-i ’m not sure it ai n’t worse than the music . Some of [’em]3286-’em have long hair , and [they]3287-they start an argument with the soup , and do n’t notice when things are handed to [them]3287-they . The consequence is the dinner gets cold , and [I]1467-i have dyspepsia . That silly ass [Silverton]134-ned silverton brings [them]3288-them to [the house]488-the house — [he]134-ned silverton writes poetry , [you]3281-you know , and [Bertha]133-bertha and [he]134-ned silverton are getting tremendously thick . [She]2959-my wife could write better than any of [’em]3286-’em if [she]2959-my wife chose , and [I]1467-i do n’t blame [her]2959-my wife for wanting [clever fellows]3290-clever fellows about ; all [I]1467-i say is : ‘ Do n’t let [me]1467-i see [’em]3286-’em eat ! ’ ”[1467-i] The gist of this strange communication gave [Lily]109-lily a distinct thrill of pleasure . Under ordinary circumstances , there would have been nothing surprising in an invitation from [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ; but since [the Bellomont]3-bellomont episode an unavowed hostility had kept [the two women]633-the two women apart . Now , with a start of inner wonder , [Lily]109-lily felt that [her]109-lily thirst for retaliation had died out . IF [YOU]1473-you WOULD FORGIVE [[YOUR]1473-you ENEMY]1474-your enemy , says the Malay proverb , FIRST INFLICT A HURT ON [HIM]1474-your enemy ; and [Lily]109-lily was experiencing the truth of the apothegm . If [she]109-lily had destroyed [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s letters , [she]109-lily might have continued to hate [her]131-mrs. dorset ; but the fact that they remained in [her]109-lily possession had fed [her]109-lily resentment to satiety . [She]109-lily uttered a smiling acceptance , hailing in the renewal of the tie an escape from [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s importunities . Chapter 11 Meanwhile the holidays had gone by and the season was beginning . [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue had become a nightly torrent of [carriages surging upward]1475-carriages surging upward to [the fashionable quarters about [the Park]747-the park]1476-the fashionable quarters about the park , where illuminated windows and outspread awnings betokened the usual routine of hospitality . Other tributary currents crossed the mainstream , bearing [their]1478-their freight to [the theatres]1479-the theatres , [restaurants]1480-restaurants or opera ; and [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , from the secluded watch - tower of [her]114-mrs. peniston upper window , could tell to a nicety just when the chronic volume of sound was increased by the sudden influx setting toward a Van Osburgh ball , or when the multiplication of wheels meant merely that the opera was over , or that there was a big supper at [Sherry ’s]5-sherry ’s . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston followed the rise and culmination of the season as keenly as [the most active sharer in its gaieties]1481-the most active sharer in its gaieties ; and , as [a looker - on]1482-a looker - on , [she]114-mrs. peniston enjoyed opportunities of comparison and generalization such as [those who take part]1483-those who take part must proverbially forego . [No one]2766-no one could have kept a more accurate record of social fluctuations , or have put a more unerring finger on the distinguishing features of each season : its dulness , its extravagance , its lack of balls or excess of divorces . [She]114-mrs. peniston had a special memory for the vicissitudes of [the “ new people ”[114-mrs. peniston] who rose to the surface with each recurring tide]1485-the “ new people ” who rose to the surface with each recurring tide , and were either submerged beneath its rush or landed triumphantly beyond the reach of [envious breakers]1486-envious breakers ; and [she]114-mrs. peniston was apt to display a remarkable retrospective insight into [their]1485-the “ new people ” who rose to the surface with each recurring tide ultimate fate , so that , when [they]1485-the “ new people ” who rose to the surface with each recurring tide had fulfilled [their]1485-the “ new people ” who rose to the surface with each recurring tide destiny , [she]114-mrs. peniston was almost always able to say to [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney — the recipient of [her]114-mrs. peniston prophecies — that [she]114-mrs. peniston had known exactly what would happen . This particular season [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston would have characterized as that in which [everybody]2995-everybody “ felt poor ”[114-mrs. peniston] except [the Welly Brys]199-the brys and [Mr. Simon Rosedale]124-rosedale . It had been a bad autumn in [Wall Street]44-wall street , where prices fell in accordance with that peculiar law which proves railway stocks and bales of cotton to be more sensitive to the allotment of executive power than [many estimable citizens trained to all the advantages of self - government]1488-many estimable citizens trained to all the advantages of self - government . Even fortunes supposed to be independent of the market either betrayed a secret dependence on it , or suffered from a sympathetic affection : fashion sulked in [[its]1489-its country houses]1490-its country houses , or came to [town incognito]1491-town incognito , general entertainments were discountenanced , and informality and short dinners became the fashion . But society , amused for a while at playing [Cinderella]201-cinderella , soon wearied of the hearthside role , and welcomed [the Fairy Godmother]1492-the fairy godmother in the shape of any magician powerful enough to turn the shrunken pumpkin back again into [the golden coach]1493-the golden coach . The mere fact of growing richer at a time when [most people]459-most people ’s investments are shrinking , is calculated to attract envious attention ; and according to [Wall Street]44-wall street rumours , [Welly Bry and Rosedale]202-welly bry and rosedale had found the secret of performing this miracle . [Rosedale]202-welly bry and rosedale , in particular , was said to have doubled [his]202-welly bry and rosedale fortune , and there was talk of [his]202-welly bry and rosedale buying [the newly - finished house of]1495-the newly - finished house of [one of [the victims of the crash , who , in the space of twelve short months , had made the same number of millions]1497-the victims of the crash , who , in the space of twelve short months , had made the same number of millions , built [a house in [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue]1498-a house in fifth avenue]1496-one of the victims of the crash , who , in the space of twelve short months , had made the same number of millions , built a house in fifth avenue , filled [a picture gallery]1499-a picture gallery with [old masters]1500-old masters , entertained all [New York]6-new york in [it]1499-a picture gallery , and been smuggled out of [the country]304-the country between [a trained nurse]1502-a trained nurse and [a doctor]1503-a doctor , while [[his]202-welly bry and rosedale creditors]1504-his creditors mounted guard over [the old masters]1505-the old masters , and [[his]202-welly bry and rosedale guests]1506-his guests explained to [each other]2955-each other that [they]1506-his guests had dined with [him]202-welly bry and rosedale only because [they]1506-his guests wanted to see the pictures . [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale meant to have a less meteoric career . [He]124-rosedale knew [he]124-rosedale should have to go slowly , and the instincts of [[his]124-rosedale race]1508-his race fitted [him]124-rosedale to suffer rebuffs and put up with delays . But [he]124-rosedale was prompt to perceive that the general dulness of the season afforded [him]124-rosedale an unusual opportunity to shine , and [he]124-rosedale set about with patient industry to form a background for [his]124-rosedale growing glory . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher was of immense service to [him]124-rosedale at this period . [She]135-mrs. fisher had set off [so many newcomers]1509-so many newcomers on the social stage that [she]135-mrs. fisher was like one of those pieces of stock scenery which tell [the experienced spectator]1510-the experienced spectator exactly what is going to take place . But [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale wanted , in the long run , a more individual environment . [He]124-rosedale was sensitive to shades of difference which [Miss Bart]109-lily would never have credited [him]124-rosedale with perceiving , because [he]124-rosedale had no corresponding variations of manner ; and it was becoming more and more clear to [him]124-rosedale that [Miss Bart]109-lily [herself]109-lily possessed precisely the complementary qualities needed to round off [his]124-rosedale social personality . Such details did not fall within the range of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s vision . Like many minds of panoramic sweep , [hers]109-lily was apt to overlook the MINUTIAE of the foreground , and [she]109-lily was much more likely to know where [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher had found [the Welly Brys]199-the brys ’ CHEF for [them]1511-them , than what was happening to [[her]109-lily own niece]1512-her own niece . [She]109-lily was not , however , without purveyors of information ready to supplement [her]109-lily deficiencies . [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney ’s mind was like a kind of moral fly - paper , to which the buzzing items of gossip were drawn by a fatal attraction , and where they hung fast in the toils of an inexorable memory . [Lily]109-lily would have been surprised to know how many trivial facts concerning [herself]109-lily were lodged in [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney ’s head . [She]109-lily was quite aware that [she]109-lily was of interest to [dingy people]1513-dingy people , but [she]109-lily assumed that there is only one form of dinginess , and that admiration for brilliancy is the natural expression of its inferior state . [She]109-lily knew that [Gerty Farish]112-gerty admired [her]109-lily blindly , and therefore supposed that [she]109-lily inspired the same sentiments in [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , whom [she]109-lily classified as [a Gerty Farish without the saving traits of youth and enthusiasm]1514-a gerty farish without the saving traits of youth and enthusiasm . In reality , [the two]781-the two differed from each other as much as [they]781-the two differed from the object of [their]781-the two mutual contemplation . [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s heart was a fountain of tender illusions , [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney ’s a precise register of facts as manifested in [their]781-the two relation to [herself]113-miss farish . [She]113-miss farish had sensibilities which , to [Lily]109-lily , would have seemed comic in [a person with a freckled nose and red eyelids]1516-a person with a freckled nose and red eyelids , who lived in [a boarding - house]1517-a boarding - house and admired [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s drawing - room]716-mrs. peniston ’s drawing - room ; but [poor Grace]187-grace stepney ’s limitations gave [them]1519-them a more concentrated inner life , as poor soil starves certain plants into intenser efflorescence . [She]113-miss farish had in truth no abstract propensity to malice : [she]113-miss farish did not dislike [Lily]109-lily because [the latter was brilliant and predominant]1520-the latter was brilliant and predominant , but because [she]113-miss farish thought that [Lily]109-lily disliked [her]113-miss farish . It is less mortifying to believe [one]2737-one ’s self unpopular than insignificant , and vanity prefers to assume that indifference is a latent form of unfriendliness . Even such scant civilities as [Lily]109-lily accorded to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale would have made [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney [[her]113-miss farish friend]754-her friend for life ; but how could [she]113-miss farish foresee that [such a friend]1523-such a friend was worth cultivating ? How , moreover , can [a young woman who has never been ignored measure the pang which this injury inflicts]1524-a young woman who has never been ignored measure the pang which this injury inflicts ? And , lastly , how could [Lily]109-lily , accustomed to choose between a pressure of engagements , guess that [she]109-lily had mortally offended [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney by causing [her]109-lily to be excluded from one of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s infrequent dinner - parties ? [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston disliked giving dinners , but [she]114-mrs. peniston had a high sense of family obligation , and on the [Jack Stepneys]204-the stepneys ’ return from [their]204-the stepneys honeymoon [she]114-mrs. peniston felt it incumbent upon [her]114-mrs. peniston to light the drawing - room lamps and extract [her]114-mrs. peniston best silver from [the Safe Deposit vaults]1525-the safe deposit vaults . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s rare entertainments were preceded by days of heart - rending vacillation as to every detail of the feast , from the seating of [the guests]1526-the guests to the pattern of the table - cloth , and in the course of one of these preliminary discussions [she]114-mrs. peniston had imprudently suggested to [[her]114-mrs. peniston cousin]448-her cousin [Grace]187-grace stepney that , as the dinner was a family affair , [she]114-mrs. peniston might be included in it . For a week the prospect had lighted up [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney ’s colourless existence ; then [she]114-mrs. peniston had been given to understand that it would be more convenient to have [her]114-mrs. peniston another day . [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney knew exactly what had happened . [Lily]109-lily , to whom family reunions were occasions of unalloyed dulness , had persuaded [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt that a dinner of [“ smart ”[109-lily] people]3291-“ smart ” people would be much more to the taste of [the young couple]1529-the young couple , and [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , who leaned helplessly on [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece in social matters , had been prevailed upon to pronounce [Grace]187-grace stepney ’s exile . After all , [Grace]187-grace stepney could come any other day ; why should [she]187-grace stepney mind being put off ? [She]114-mrs. peniston was aware that [she]114-mrs. peniston had [Lily]109-lily to thank for it ; and dull resentment was turned to active animosity . [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney , when [her]203-miss stepney first fright had subsided , began to feel the superiority that greater breadth of mind confers . [Mrs. Gryce]129-mrs. gryce told [me]187-grace stepney [herself]129-mrs. gryce that it was [her]109-lily gambling that frightened [Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce — it seems [he]3313-he was really taken with [her]109-lily at first . In fact , [people]2804-people are inclined to excuse [her]109-lily on that account — — ”[187-grace stepney] “ To excuse [her]109-lily for what ? ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ For being hard up — and accepting attentions from [men like [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor]3317-men like gus trenor — and [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset — — ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston gave another cry . “ [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ? [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston disliked scenes , and [her]114-mrs. peniston determination to avoid them had always led [her]114-mrs. peniston to hold [herself]114-mrs. peniston aloof from the details of [Lily]109-lily ’s life . In [her]114-mrs. peniston youth , [girls]2776-girls had not been supposed to require close supervision . [They]2776-girls were generally assumed to be taken up with the legitimate business of courtship and marriage , and interference in such affairs on the part of [[their]2776-girls natural guardians]1549-their natural guardians was considered as unwarrantable as [a spectator]321-a spectator ’s suddenly joining in a game . There had of course been [“ fast ”[321-a spectator] girls]3321-“ fast ” girls even in [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s early experience ; but [their]2776-girls fastness , at worst , was understood to be a mere excess of animal spirits , against which there could be no graver charge than that of being “ unladylike . ”[321-a spectator] The modern fastness appeared synonymous with immorality , and the mere idea of immorality was as offensive to [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston as a smell of cooking in [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room : it was one of the conceptions [her]114-mrs. peniston mind refused to admit . [She]114-mrs. peniston had no immediate intention of repeating to [Lily]109-lily what [she]114-mrs. peniston had heard , or even of trying to ascertain its truth by means of discreet interrogation . To do so might be to provoke a scene ; and a scene , in the shaken state of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s nerves , with the effects of [her]114-mrs. peniston dinner not worn off , and [her]114-mrs. peniston mind still tremulous with new impressions , was a risk [she]114-mrs. peniston deemed it [her]114-mrs. peniston duty to avoid . But there remained in [her]114-mrs. peniston thoughts a settled deposit of resentment against [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece , all the denser because it was not to be cleared by explanation or discussion . It was horrible of [a young girl]1537-a young girl to let [herself]1537-a young girl be talked about ; however unfounded the charges against [her]1537-a young girl , [she]1537-a young girl must be to blame for [their]1554-their having been made . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston felt as if there had been a contagious illness in [the house]488-the house , and [she]114-mrs. peniston was doomed to sit shivering among [her]114-mrs. peniston contaminated furniture . Chapter 12 [Miss Bart]109-lily had in fact been treading a devious way , and [none of [her]109-lily critics]1556-none of her critics could have been more alive to the fact than [herself]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily had a fatalistic sense of being drawn from one wrong turning to another , without ever perceiving the right road till it was too late to take it . [Lily]109-lily , who considered [herself]109-lily above narrow prejudices , had not imagined that the fact of letting [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor make a little money for [her]109-lily would ever disturb [her]109-lily self - complacency . And the fact in itself still seemed harmless enough ; only it was a fertile source of harmful complications . As [she]109-lily exhausted the amusement of spending the money these complications became more pressing , and [Lily]109-lily , whose mind could be severely logical in tracing the causes of [her]109-lily ill - luck to [others]1333-others , justified [herself]109-lily by the thought that [she]109-lily owed all [her]109-lily troubles to the enmity of [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha . This enmity , however , had apparently expired in a renewal of friendliness between [the two women]633-the two women . [Lily]109-lily ’s visit to [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets had resulted , for both , in the discovery that [they]633-the two women could be of use to [each other]2955-each other ; and the civilized instinct finds a subtler pleasure in making use of [its antagonist]1560-its antagonist than in confounding [him]1560-its antagonist . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was , in fact , engaged in a new sentimental experiment , of which [[Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s late property]1561-mrs. fisher ’s late property , [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton , was [the rosy victim]1562-the rosy victim ; and at such moments , as [Judy Trenor]126-judy had once remarked , [she]126-judy felt a peculiar need of distracting [[her]126-judy husband]609-her husband ’s attention . [Dorset]133-bertha was as difficult to amuse as [a savage]1564-a savage ; but even [his]609-her husband self - engrossment was not proof against [Lily]109-lily ’s arts , or rather these were especially adapted to soothe an uneasy egoism . [Her]109-lily experience with [Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce stood [her]109-lily in good stead in ministering to [Dorset]133-bertha ’s humours , and if the incentive to please was less urgent , the difficulties of [her]109-lily situation were teaching [her]109-lily to make much of minor opportunities . Intimacy with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets was not likely to lessen such difficulties on the material side . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset had none of [Judy Trenor]126-judy ’s lavish impulses , and [Dorset]133-bertha ’s admiration was not likely to express itself in financial “ tips , ”[131-mrs. dorset] even had [Lily]109-lily cared to renew [her]109-lily experiences in that line . What [she]109-lily required , for the moment , of [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets ’ friendship , was simply its social sanction . [She]109-lily knew that [people]2804-people were beginning to talk of [her]109-lily ; but this fact did not alarm [her]109-lily as it had alarmed [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston . In [her]109-lily set such gossip was not unusual , and [a handsome girl who flirted with [a married man]1538-a married man]1566-a handsome girl who flirted with a married man was merely assumed to be pressing to the limit of [her]109-lily opportunities . It was [Trenor]126-judy [himself]126-judy who frightened [her]109-lily . [Their]1568-their walk in [the Park]747-the park had not been a success . [Trenor]126-judy had married young , and since [his]1538-a married man marriage [his]1538-a married man intercourse with [women]2772-women had not taken the form of the sentimental small - talk which doubles upon itself like the paths in [a maze]1571-a maze . [He]1538-a married man was first puzzled and then irritated to find [himself]1538-a married man always led back to the same starting - point , and [Lily]109-lily felt that [she]109-lily was gradually losing control of the situation . [Trenor]126-judy was in truth in an unmanageable mood .
