[Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor was still at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , keeping [the town - house]1572-the town - house open , and descending on [it]1572-the town - house now and then for a taste of [the world]354-the world , but preferring the recurrent excitement of week - end parties to the restrictions of a dull season . Since the holidays [she]123-mrs. trenor had not urged [Lily]109-lily to return to [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and the first time [they]1574-they met in [town]305-town [Lily]109-lily fancied there was a shade of coldness in [her]123-mrs. trenor manner . Was it merely the expression of [her]123-mrs. trenor displeasure at [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s neglect , or had disquieting rumours reached [her]123-mrs. trenor ? The latter contingency seemed improbable , yet [Lily]109-lily was not without a sense of uneasiness . If [her]109-lily roaming sympathies had struck root anywhere , it was in [her]109-lily friendship with [Judy Trenor]126-judy . [She]109-lily believed in the sincerity of [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s affection , though it sometimes showed itself in self - interested ways , and [she]109-lily shrank with peculiar reluctance from any risk of estranging it . But , aside from this , [she]109-lily was keenly conscious of the way in which such an estrangement would react on [herself]109-lily . The fact that [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor was [[Judy]126-judy ’s husband]1577-judy ’s husband was at times [Lily]109-lily ’s strongest reason for disliking [him]161-gus trenor , and for resenting the obligation under which [he]161-gus trenor had placed [her]109-lily . To set [her]123-mrs. trenor doubts at rest , [Miss Bart]109-lily , soon after the New Year , “ proposed ”[123-mrs. trenor] [herself]123-mrs. trenor for a week - end at [Bellomont]3-bellomont . [She]123-mrs. trenor had learned in advance that the presence of [a large party]1578-a large party would protect [her]123-mrs. trenor from too great assiduity on [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s part , and [[his]161-gus trenor wife]592-his wife ’s telegraphic “ come by all means ”[592-his wife] seemed to assure [her]123-mrs. trenor of [her]123-mrs. trenor usual welcome . [Judy]126-judy received [her]123-mrs. trenor amicably . The cares of [a large party]1578-a large party always prevailed over personal feelings , and [Lily]109-lily saw no change in [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess ’s manner . Nevertheless , [she]109-lily was soon aware that the experiment of coming to [Bellomont]3-bellomont was destined not to be successful . The party was made up of what [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor called “ poky people”—her[123-mrs. trenor] generic name for [persons who did not play bridge]1582-persons who did not play bridge — and , it being [her]123-mrs. trenor habit to group [all such obstructionists]1583-all such obstructionists in one class , [she]123-mrs. trenor usually invited [them]1583-all such obstructionists together , regardless of [their]1583-all such obstructionists other characteristics . The result was apt to be an irreducible combination of persons having no other quality in common than [their]1583-all such obstructionists abstinence from bridge , and the antagonisms developed in [a group lacking the one taste which might have amalgamated]1584-a group lacking the one taste which might have amalgamated [them]1584-a group lacking the one taste which might have amalgamated , were in this case aggravated by bad weather , and by the ill - concealed boredom of [[their]1584-a group lacking the one taste which might have amalgamated host and [hostess]1586-hostess]1585-their host and hostess . In such emergencies , [Judy]126-judy would usually have turned to [Lily]109-lily to fuse the discordant elements ; and [Miss Bart]109-lily , assuming that such a service was expected of [her]109-lily , threw [herself]109-lily into it with [her]109-lily accustomed zeal . But at the outset [she]109-lily perceived a subtle resistance to [her]109-lily efforts . If [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s manner toward [her]109-lily was unchanged , there was certainly a faint coldness in that of [the other ladies]1587-the other ladies . An occasional caustic allusion to “ [[your]109-lily friends]3005-your friends [the Wellington Brys]207-the wellington brys , ”[109-lily] or to “ [the little Jew who has bought [the Greiner house]3324-the greiner house]3323-the little jew who has bought the greiner house — [some one]2889-some one told [us]3326-us [you]109-lily knew [him]3323-the little jew who has bought the greiner house , [Miss Bart,”—showed[109-lily] Lily]109-lily that [she]109-lily was in disfavour with that portion of society which , while contributing least to [its]1588-its amusement , has assumed the right to decide what forms that amusement shall take . The indication was a slight one , and a year ago [Lily]109-lily would have smiled at it , trusting to the charm of [her]109-lily personality to dispel any prejudice against [her]109-lily . But now [she]109-lily had grown more sensitive to criticism and less confident in [her]109-lily power of disarming it . [She]109-lily knew , moreover , that if [the ladies at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]1589-the ladies at bellomont permitted [themselves]1589-the ladies at bellomont to criticize [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends openly , it was a proof that [they]1589-the ladies at bellomont were not afraid of subjecting [her]109-lily to the same treatment behind [her]109-lily back . The nervous dread lest anything in [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s manner should seem to justify [their]1589-the ladies at bellomont disapproval made [her]109-lily seek every pretext for avoiding [him]1591-him , and [she]109-lily left [Bellomont]3-bellomont conscious of having failed in every purpose which had taken [her]109-lily [there]2755-there . In [town]305-town [she]109-lily returned to preoccupations which , for the moment , had the happy effect of banishing troublesome thoughts . [The Welly Brys]199-the brys , after much debate , and anxious counsel with [[their]199-the brys newly - acquired friends]1594-their newly - acquired friends , had decided on the bold move of giving a general entertainment . To attack society collectively , when one ’s means of approach are limited to [a few acquaintances]1595-a few acquaintances , is like advancing into [a strange country]1596-a strange country with [an insufficient number of scouts]1597-an insufficient number of scouts ; but such rash tactics have sometimes led to brilliant victories , and [the Brys]199-the brys had determined to put [their]199-the brys fate to the touch . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , to whom [they]1589-the ladies at bellomont had entrusted the conduct of the affair , had decided that [TABLEAUX VIVANTS and expensive music]1598-tableaux vivants and expensive music were the two baits most likely to attract the desired prey , and after prolonged negotiations , and the kind of wire - pulling in which [she]109-lily was known to excel , [she]109-lily had induced [a dozen fashionable women]1599-a dozen fashionable women to exhibit [themselves]1599-a dozen fashionable women in a series of pictures which , by a farther miracle of persuasion , [the distinguished portrait painter]1600-the distinguished portrait painter , [Paul Morpeth]208-paul morpeth , had been prevailed upon to organize . [Lily]109-lily was in [her]109-lily element on such occasions . Under [Morpeth]208-paul morpeth ’s guidance [her]109-lily vivid plastic sense , hitherto nurtured on no higher food than dress - making and upholstery , found eager expression in the disposal of draperies , the study of attitudes , the shifting of lights and shadows . [Her]109-lily dramatic instinct was roused by the choice of subjects , and the gorgeous reproductions of historic dress stirred an imagination which only visual impressions could reach . But keenest of all was the exhilaration of displaying [her]109-lily own beauty under a new aspect : of showing that [her]109-lily loveliness was no mere fixed quality , but an element shaping all emotions to fresh forms of grace . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s measures had been well - taken , and [society]3024-society , surprised in a dull moment , succumbed to the temptation of [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s hospitality . [The protesting minority]1602-the protesting minority were forgotten in the throng which abjured and came ; and [the audience]3012-the audience was almost as brilliant as the show . [Lawrence Selden]108-selden was among [those who had yielded to the proffered inducements]1604-those who had yielded to the proffered inducements . If [he]108-selden did not often act on the accepted social axiom that [a man]2811-a man may go where [he]2811-a man pleases , it was because [he]108-selden had long since learned that [his]108-selden pleasures were mainly to be found in [a small group of the like - minded]1606-a small group of the like - minded . But [he]108-selden enjoyed spectacular effects , and was not insensible to the part money plays in [their]1607-their production : all [he]108-selden asked was that [the very rich]1608-the very rich should live up to [their]1608-the very rich calling as [stage - managers]1609-stage - managers , and not spend [their]1608-the very rich money in a dull way . This [the Brys]199-the brys could certainly not be charged with doing . [[Their]199-the brys recently built house]1610-their recently built house , whatever [it]1610-their recently built house might lack as a frame for domesticity , was almost as well - designed for the display of a festal assemblage as one of [those airy pleasure - halls which [the Italian architects]1612-the italian architects improvised to set off the hospitality of [princes]1613-princes]1611-those airy pleasure - halls which the italian architects improvised to set off the hospitality of princes . The air of improvisation was in fact strikingly present : so recent , so rapidly - evoked was the whole MISE - EN - SCENE that [one]2737-one had to touch the marble columns to learn they were not of cardboard , to seat [[one]2737-one ’s self]1616-one ’s self in one of the damask - and - gold arm - chairs to be sure it was not painted against the wall . [Selden]108-selden , who had put one of these seats to the test , found [himself]108-selden , from an angle of [the ball - room]1617-the ball - room , surveying the scene with frank enjoyment . [The company]1434-the company , in obedience to the decorative instinct which calls for fine clothes in fine surroundings , had dressed rather with an eye to [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s background than to [herself]198-mrs. bry . [The seated throng]1619-the seated throng , filling [the immense room]1620-the immense room without undue crowding , presented a surface of rich tissues and jewelled shoulders in harmony with the festooned and gilded walls , and the flushed splendours of the Venetian ceiling . At the farther end of [the room]351-the room a stage had been constructed behind a proscenium arch curtained with folds of old damask ; but in the pause before the parting of the folds there was little thought of what they might reveal , for [every woman who had accepted [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s invitation]1622-every woman who had accepted mrs. bry ’s invitation was engaged in trying to find out how many of [[her]1622-every woman who had accepted mrs. bry ’s invitation friends]406-her friends had done the same . [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , seated next to [Selden]108-selden , was lost in that indiscriminate and uncritical enjoyment so irritating to [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s finer perceptions . Of course it would never have occurred to [Carry Fisher]135-mrs. fisher to put [me]113-miss farish on the list , and [I]113-miss farish should have been so sorry to miss seeing it all — and especially [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily . [Some one]2889-some one told [me]113-miss farish the ceiling was by [Veronese]209-veronese — [you]3328-you would know , of course , [Lawrence]108-selden . [I]113-miss farish suppose it ’s very beautiful , but [[his]108-selden women]3329-his women are so dreadfully fat . [Goddesses]3330-goddesses ? Well , [I]113-miss farish can only say that if [they]3330-goddesses ’d been [mortals]3331-mortals and had to wear corsets , it would have been better for [them]3330-goddesses . [I]113-miss farish think [[our]3332-our women]3333-our women are much handsomer . And [this room]3334-this room is wonderfully becoming — [every one]693-every one looks so well ! Did [you]3328-you ever see such jewels ? Do look at [Mrs. George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s pearls — [I]113-miss farish suppose the smallest of [them]3333-our women would pay the rent of [[our]3332-our Girls]3336-our girls ’ Club for a year . Not that [I]113-miss farish ought to complain about [the club]3260-the club ; [every one]693-every one has been so wonderfully kind . [I]113-miss farish wish [Lily]109-lily were not so nice to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , but [she]109-lily says it ’s no use being rude to [him]124-rosedale , because [he]124-rosedale does n’t see the difference . [She]109-lily really ca n’t bear to hurt [people]2804-people ’s feelings — it makes [me]113-miss farish so angry when [I]113-miss farish hear [her]109-lily called cold and conceited ! [The girls at [the club]3260-the club]3341-the girls at the club do n’t call [her]109-lily that . [One of [them]3341-the girls at the club]3344-one of them said it was as good as a day in [the country]304-the country just to look at [her]109-lily . And [she]109-lily sat there , and laughed and talked with [them]3341-the girls at the club — not a bit as if [she]109-lily were being CHARITABLE , [you]3343-you know , but as if [she]109-lily liked it as much as [they]3341-the girls at the club did . [They]3341-the girls at the club ’ve been asking ever since when [she]109-lily ’s coming back ; and [she]109-lily ’s promised [me]113-miss farish —— oh ! ”[113-miss farish] [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s confidences were cut short by the parting of the curtain on the first TABLEAU — [a group of nymphs dancing across flower - strewn sward in the rhythmic postures of [Botticelli]210-botticelli ’s Spring]1625-a group of nymphs dancing across flower - strewn sward in the rhythmic postures of botticelli ’s spring . TABLEAUX VIVANTS depend for [their]1626-their effect not only on the happy disposal of lights and the delusive interposition of layers of gauze , but on a corresponding adjustment of the mental vision . To unfurnished minds [they]1626-their remain , in spite of every enhancement of art , only a superior kind of wax - works ; but to the responsive fancy they may give magic glimpses of the boundary world between fact and imagination . [Selden]108-selden ’s mind was of this order : [he]108-selden could yield to vision - making influences as completely as [a child to the spell of a fairy - tale]1627-a child to the spell of a fairy - tale . [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s TABLEAUX wanted none of the qualities which go to the producing of such illusions , and under [Morpeth]208-paul morpeth ’s organizing hand the pictures succeeded each other with the rhythmic march of some splendid frieze , in which the fugitive curves of living flesh and the wandering light of young eyes have been subdued to plastic harmony without losing the charm of life . The scenes were taken from old pictures , and [the participators]1628-the participators had been cleverly fitted with characters suited to [their]1628-the participators types . [No one]2766-no one , for instance , could have made [a more typical Goya]1630-a more typical goya than [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , with [her]146-carry fisher short dark - skinned face , the exaggerated glow of [her]146-carry fisher eyes , the provocation of [her]146-carry fisher frankly - painted smile . A brilliant [Miss Smedden]211-miss smedden from [Brooklyn]45-brooklyn showed to perfection the sumptuous curves of [[Titian]212-titian ’s Daughter]1631-titian ’s daughter , lifting [her]1631-titian ’s daughter gold salver laden with grapes above the harmonizing gold of rippled hair and rich brocade , and [a young Mrs. Van Alstyne , who showed [the frailer Dutch type , with high blue - veined forehead and pale eyes and lashes]1632-the frailer dutch type , with high blue - veined forehead and pale eyes and lashes]213-a young mrs. van alstyne , who showed the frailer dutch type , with high blue - veined forehead and pale eyes and lashes , made a characteristic Vandyck , in black satin , against a curtained archway . Then there were [Kauffmann]214-kauffmann nymphs garlanding the altar of Love ; a Veronese supper , all sheeny textures , pearl - woven heads and marble architecture ; and a Watteau group of [lute - playing comedians]1633-lute - playing comedians , lounging by a fountain in a sunlit glade . Each evanescent picture touched [the vision - building faculty in [Selden]108-selden]1634-the vision - building faculty in selden , leading [him]1634-the vision - building faculty in selden so far down the vistas of fancy that even [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s running commentary—“Oh , how lovely [Lulu Melson]215-louisa looks ! ”[112-gerty] or : “ That must be [Kate Corby]171-kate corby , to the right there , in purple”—did[112-gerty] not break the spell of the illusion . Indeed , so skilfully had the personality of [the actors]3013-the actors been subdued to the scenes [they]3013-the actors figured in that even [the least imaginative of [the audience]3012-the audience]1636-the least imaginative of the audience must have felt a thrill of contrast when the curtain suddenly parted on a picture which was simply and undisguisedly the portrait of [Miss Bart]109-lily . Here there could be no mistaking the predominance of personality — the unanimous “ Oh ! ”[1638-the spectators] of [the spectators]1638-the spectators was a tribute , not to the brush - work of [Reynolds]216-reynolds ’s “ [Mrs. Lloyd]217-mrs. lloyd ”[109-lily] but to the flesh and blood loveliness of [Lily Bart]109-lily . [She]109-lily had shown [her]109-lily artistic intelligence in selecting a type so like [her]109-lily own that [she]109-lily could embody [the person represented]1639-the person represented without ceasing to be [herself]109-lily . It was as though [she]109-lily had stepped , not out of , but into , [Reynolds]216-reynolds ’s canvas , banishing the phantom of [his]216-reynolds dead beauty by the beams of [her]109-lily living grace . The impulse to show [herself]109-lily in a splendid setting — [she]109-lily had thought for a moment of representing [Tiepolo]218-tiepolo ’s Cleopatra — had yielded to the truer instinct of trusting to [her]109-lily unassisted beauty , and [she]109-lily had purposely chosen a picture without distracting accessories of dress or surroundings . [Her]109-lily pale draperies , and the background of foliage against which [she]109-lily stood , served only to relieve the long dryad - like curves that swept upward from [her]109-lily poised foot to [her]109-lily lifted arm . The noble buoyancy of [her]109-lily attitude , its suggestion of soaring grace , revealed the touch of poetry in [her]109-lily beauty that [Selden]108-selden always felt in [her]109-lily presence , yet lost the sense of when [he]108-selden was not with [her]109-lily . Its expression was now so vivid that for the first time [he]108-selden seemed to see before [him]108-selden the real [Lily Bart]109-lily , divested of the trivialities of [[her]109-lily little world]705-her little world , and catching for a moment a note of that eternal harmony of which [her]109-lily beauty was a part . “ Deuced bold thing to show [herself]109-lily in that get - up ; but , gad , there is n’t a break in the lines anywhere , and [I]1641-that experienced connoisseur suppose [she]109-lily wanted [us]1643-us to know it ! ”[1641-that experienced connoisseur] These words , uttered by [that experienced connoisseur]1641-that experienced connoisseur , [Mr. Ned Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne , whose scented white moustache had brushed [Selden]108-selden ’s shoulder whenever the parting of the curtains presented any exceptional opportunity for the study of [the female outline]1642-the female outline , affected [[their]1643-us hearer]1644-their hearer in an unexpected way . It was not the first time that [Selden]108-selden had heard [Lily]109-lily ’s beauty lightly remarked on , and hitherto the tone of the comments had imperceptibly coloured [his]108-selden view of [her]109-lily . But now it woke only a motion of indignant contempt . This was [the world]354-the world [she]109-lily lived in , these were the standards by which [she]109-lily was fated to be measured ! Does one go to [Caliban]219-caliban for a judgment on [Miranda]220-miranda ? In the long moment before the curtain fell , [he]108-selden had time to feel the whole tragedy of [her]109-lily life . It was as though [her]109-lily beauty , thus detached from all that cheapened and vulgarized it , had held out suppliant hands to [him]108-selden from [the world in which [he]108-selden and [she]109-lily had once met]1646-the world in which he and she had once met for a moment , and where [he]108-selden felt an overmastering longing to be with [her]109-lily again . [He]108-selden was roused by the pressure of ecstatic fingers . “ Was n’t [she]109-lily too beautiful , [Lawrence]108-selden ? Do n’t [you]108-selden like [her]109-lily best in that simple dress ? It makes [her]109-lily look like [the real Lily]3346-the real lily — the Lily [I]108-selden know . ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden met [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s brimming gaze . “ [The Lily [we]3348-we know]3347-the lily we know , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden corrected ; and [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin , beaming at the implied understanding , exclaimed joyfully : “ [I]340-his cousin ’ll tell [her]109-lily that ! [She]109-lily always says [you]108-selden dislike [her]109-lily . ”[340-his cousin] * * * * * The performance over , [Selden]108-selden ’s first impulse was to seek [Miss Bart]109-lily . During the interlude of music which succeeded the TABLEAUX , [the actors]3013-the actors had seated [themselves]3013-the actors here and there in [the audience]3012-the audience , diversifying its conventional appearance by the varied picturesqueness of [their]3013-the actors dress . [Lily]109-lily , however , was not among [them]3013-the actors , and [her]109-lily absence served to protract the effect [she]109-lily had produced on [Selden]108-selden : it would have broken the spell to see [her]109-lily too soon in the surroundings from which accident had so happily detached [her]109-lily . [They]1650-they had not met since the day of the [Van Osburgh]180-evie van osburgh wedding , and on [his]108-selden side the avoidance had been intentional . Tonight , however , [he]108-selden knew that , sooner or later , [he]108-selden should find [himself]108-selden at [her]109-lily side ; and though [he]108-selden let [the dispersing crowd]1651-the dispersing crowd drift [him]108-selden whither it would , without making an immediate effort to reach [her]109-lily , [his]108-selden procrastination was not due to any lingering resistance , but to the desire to luxuriate a moment in the sense of complete surrender . [Lily]109-lily had not an instant ’s doubt as to the meaning of the murmur greeting [her]109-lily appearance . No other tableau had been received with that precise note of approval : it had obviously been called forth by [herself]109-lily , and not by the picture [she]109-lily impersonated . [She]109-lily had feared at the last moment that [she]109-lily was risking too much in dispensing with the advantages of a more sumptuous setting , and the completeness of [her]109-lily triumph gave [her]109-lily an intoxicating sense of recovered power . Not caring to diminish the impression [she]109-lily had produced , [she]109-lily held [herself]109-lily aloof from [the audience]3012-the audience till the movement of dispersal before supper , and thus had a second opportunity of showing [herself]109-lily to advantage , as [the throng]1653-the throng poured slowly into [the empty drawing - room where [she]109-lily was standing]1654-the empty drawing - room where she was standing . [She]109-lily was soon the centre of [a group which increased and renewed itself as the circulation became general]1655-a group which increased and renewed itself as the circulation became general , and the individual comments on [her]109-lily success were a delightful prolongation of the collective applause . At such moments [she]109-lily lost something of [her]109-lily natural fastidiousness , and cared less for the quality of the admiration received than for its quantity . Differences of personality were merged in a warm atmosphere of praise , in which [her]109-lily beauty expanded like a flower in sunlight ; and if [Selden]108-selden had approached a moment or two sooner [he]108-selden would have seen [her]109-lily turning on [Ned Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne and [George]131-mrs. dorset Dorset the look [he]108-selden had dreamed of capturing for [himself]108-selden . [Fortune]221-fortune willed , however , that the hurried approach of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , as [whose aide - de - camp]1656-whose aide - de - camp [Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne was acting , should break up [the group]959-the group before [Selden]108-selden reached the threshold of [the room]351-the room . [One or two of [the men]831-the men]1659-one or two of the men wandered off in search of [[their]1659-one or two of the men partners]1661-their partners for supper , and [the others]3217-the others , noticing [Selden]108-selden ’s approach , gave way to [him]108-selden in accordance with the tacit freemasonry of [the ball - room]1617-the ball - room . [Lily]109-lily was therefore standing alone when [he]108-selden reached [her]109-lily ; and finding the expected look in [her]109-lily eye , [he]108-selden had the satisfaction of supposing [he]108-selden had kindled it . The look did indeed deepen as it rested on [him]108-selden , for even in that moment of self - intoxication [Lily]109-lily felt the quicker beat of life that [his]108-selden nearness always produced . [She]109-lily read , too , in [his]108-selden answering gaze the delicious confirmation of [her]109-lily triumph , and for the moment it seemed to [her]109-lily that it was for [him]108-selden only [she]109-lily cared to be beautiful . [Selden]108-selden had given [her]109-lily [his]108-selden arm without speaking . [She]109-lily took it in silence , and [they]1664-they moved away , not toward [the supper - room]1665-the supper - room , but against the tide which was setting thither . The faces about [her]109-lily flowed by like the streaming images of sleep : [she]109-lily hardly noticed where [Selden]108-selden was leading [her]109-lily , till [they]1664-they passed through a glass doorway at the end of [the long suite of rooms]1266-the long suite of rooms and stood suddenly in the fragrant hush of [a garden]1667-a garden . Gravel grated beneath [their]1664-they feet , and about [them]1664-they was the transparent dimness of a midsummer night . Hanging lights made emerald caverns in the depths of foliage , and whitened the spray of a fountain falling among lilies . [The magic place]1668-the magic place was deserted : there was no sound but the splash of the water on the lily - pads , and a distant drift of music that might have been blown across [a sleeping lake]1669-a sleeping lake . [Selden]108-selden and [Lily]109-lily stood still , accepting the unreality of the scene as a part of [their]1664-they own dream - like sensations . It would not have surprised [them]1664-they to feel a summer breeze on [their]1664-they faces , or to see the lights among the boughs reduplicated in the arch of a starry sky . The strange solitude about [them]1664-they was no stranger than the sweetness of being alone in [it]1670-it together . At length [Lily]109-lily withdrew [her]109-lily hand , and moved away a step , so that [her]109-lily white - robed slimness was outlined against the dusk of the branches . [Selden]108-selden followed [her]109-lily , and still without speaking [they]1664-they seated [themselves]1664-they on a bench beside [the fountain]1671-the fountain . Suddenly [she]109-lily raised [her]109-lily eyes with the beseeching earnestness of [a child]348-a child . “ [You]108-selden never speak to [me]109-lily — [you]108-selden think hard things of [me]109-lily , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily murmured . “ [I]108-selden think of [you]109-lily at any rate , [God]165-god knows ! ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden said . “ Then why do [we]1664-they never see [each other]2955-each other ? Why ca n’t [we]1664-they be [friends]3163-friends ? [You]108-selden promised once to help [me]109-lily , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily continued in the same tone , as though the words were drawn from [her]109-lily unwillingly . “ The only way [I]108-selden can help [you]109-lily is by loving [you]109-lily , ”[108-selden] [Selden]108-selden said in a low voice . [She]109-lily made no reply , but [her]109-lily face turned to [him]108-selden with the soft motion of a flower . [His]108-selden own met it slowly , and [their]1673-their lips touched . [She]109-lily drew back and rose from [her]109-lily seat . [Selden]108-selden rose too , and [they]1673-their stood facing [each other]2955-each other . Suddenly [she]109-lily caught [his]108-selden hand and pressed it a moment against [her]109-lily cheek . “ Ah , love [me]109-lily , love [me]109-lily — but do n’t tell [me]109-lily so ! ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily sighed with [her]109-lily eyes in [his]108-selden ; and before [he]108-selden could speak [she]109-lily had turned and slipped through the arch of boughs , disappearing in the brightness of [the room beyond]1675-the room beyond . [Selden]108-selden stood where [she]109-lily had left [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden knew too well the transiency of exquisite moments to attempt to follow [her]109-lily ; but presently [he]108-selden reentered [the house]488-the house and made [his]108-selden way through [the deserted rooms]1677-the deserted rooms to the door . [A few sumptuously - cloaked ladies]1678-a few sumptuously - cloaked ladies were already gathered in the marble vestibule , and in [the coat - room]1679-the coat - room [he]108-selden found [Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne and [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor . [[My]161-gus trenor wife]2959-my wife was dead right to stay away : [she]2959-my wife says life ’s too short to spend it in breaking in [new people]3367-new people . ”[161-gus trenor] Chapter 13 [Lily]109-lily woke from happy dreams to find two notes at [her]109-lily bed - side . One was from [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , who announced that [she]123-mrs. trenor was coming to [town]305-town that afternoon for a flying visit , and hoped [Miss Bart]109-lily would be able to dine with [her]123-mrs. trenor . [The other]367-the other was from [Selden]108-selden . [He]108-selden wrote briefly that an important case called [him]108-selden to [Albany]17-albany , whence [he]108-selden would be unable to return till the evening , and asked [Lily]109-lily to let [him]108-selden know at what hour on the following day [she]109-lily would see [him]108-selden . [Lily]109-lily , leaning back among [her]109-lily pillows , gazed musingly at [his]108-selden letter . The scene in [the Brys]199-the brys ’ conservatory had been like a part of [her]109-lily dreams ; [she]109-lily had not expected to wake to such evidence of its reality . [Her]109-lily first movement was one of annoyance : this unforeseen act of [Selden]108-selden ’s added another complication to life . It was so unlike [him]108-selden to yield to such an irrational impulse ! Did [he]108-selden really mean to ask [her]109-lily to marry [him]108-selden ? [She]109-lily had once shown [him]108-selden the impossibility of such a hope , and [his]108-selden subsequent behaviour seemed to prove that [he]108-selden had accepted the situation with a reasonableness somewhat mortifying to [her]109-lily vanity . It was all the more agreeable to find that this reasonableness was maintained only at the cost of not seeing [her]109-lily ; but , though nothing in life was as sweet as the sense of [her]109-lily power over [him]108-selden , [she]109-lily saw the danger of allowing the episode of the previous night to have a sequel . Since [she]109-lily could not marry [him]108-selden , it would be kinder to [him]108-selden , as well as easier for [herself]109-lily , to write a line amicably evading [his]108-selden request to see [her]109-lily : [he]108-selden was not [the man to mistake such a hint]1683-the man to mistake such a hint , and when next [they]1684-they met it would be on [their]1684-they usual friendly footing . [Lily]109-lily sprang out of bed , and went straight to [her]109-lily desk . [She]109-lily wanted to write at once , while [she]109-lily could trust to the strength of [her]109-lily resolve . [She]109-lily was still languid from [her]109-lily brief sleep and the exhilaration of the evening , and the sight of [Selden]108-selden ’s writing brought back the culminating moment of [her]109-lily triumph : the moment when [she]109-lily had read in [his]108-selden eyes that no philosophy was proof against [her]109-lily power . It would be pleasant to have that sensation again . . . [no one else]703-no one else could give it to [her]109-lily in its fulness ; and [she]109-lily could not bear to mar [her]109-lily mood of luxurious retrospection by an act of definite refusal . [She]109-lily took up [her]109-lily pen and wrote hastily : “ TOMORROW AT FOUR ; ”[109-lily] murmuring to [herself]109-lily , as [she]109-lily slipped the sheet into its envelope : “ [I]109-lily can easily put [him]3368-him off when tomorrow comes . ”[109-lily] * * * * * [Judy Trenor]126-judy ’s summons was very welcome to [Lily]109-lily . It was the first time [she]109-lily had received a direct communication from [Bellomont]3-bellomont since the close of [her]109-lily last visit [there]2755-there , and [she]109-lily was still visited by the dread of having incurred [Judy]126-judy ’s displeasure . But this characteristic command seemed to reestablish [their]1687-their former relations ; and [Lily]109-lily smiled at the thought that [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend had probably summoned [her]109-lily in order to hear about [the Brys]199-the brys ’ entertainment . [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor had absented [herself]123-mrs. trenor from the feast , perhaps for the reason so frankly enunciated by [[her]123-mrs. trenor husband]609-her husband , perhaps because , as [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher somewhat differently put it , [she]123-mrs. trenor “ could n’t bear [new people]3367-new people when [she]123-mrs. trenor had n’t discovered [them]3367-new people [herself]123-mrs. trenor . ”[109-lily] At any rate , though [she]109-lily remained haughtily at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , [Lily]109-lily suspected in [her]109-lily a devouring eagerness to hear of what [she]109-lily had missed , and to learn exactly in what measure [Mrs. Wellington Bry]198-mrs. bry had surpassed all previous competitors for social recognition . [Lily]109-lily was quite ready to gratify this curiosity , but it happened that [she]109-lily was dining out . [She]109-lily determined , however , to see [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor for a few moments , and ringing for [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid [she]109-lily despatched a telegram to say that [she]109-lily would be with [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend that evening at ten . [She]109-lily was dining with [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , who had gathered at an informal feast [a few of [the performers of the previous evening]1693-the performers of the previous evening]1692-a few of the performers of the previous evening . [Lily]109-lily was reluctant to leave , for the dinner was amusing , and [she]109-lily would have liked to lounge over a cigarette and hear a few songs ; but [she]109-lily could not break [her]109-lily engagement with [Judy]126-judy , and shortly after ten [she]109-lily asked [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess to ring for a hansom , and drove up [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue to [[the Trenors]111-gus ’]2836-the trenors ’ . [She]109-lily waited long enough on [the doorstep]1699-the doorstep to wonder that [Judy]126-judy ’s presence in [town]305-town was not signalized by a greater promptness in admitting [her]126-judy ; and [her]109-lily surprise was increased when , instead of [the expected footman]1701-the expected footman , pushing [his]1701-the expected footman shoulders into a tardy coat , [a shabby care - taking person in calico]1702-a shabby care - taking person in calico let [her]109-lily into [the shrouded hall]1703-the shrouded hall . [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , however , appeared at once on the threshold of [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room , welcoming [her]109-lily with unusual volubility while [he]111-gus relieved [her]109-lily of [her]109-lily cloak and drew [her]109-lily into [the room]351-the room . “ Come along to [the den]3370-the den ; it ’s [the only comfortable place in [the house]488-the house]3371-the only comfortable place in the house . Does n’t [this room]3334-this room look as if it was waiting for the body to be brought down ? Ca n’t see why [Judy]126-judy keeps [the house]488-the house wrapped up in this awful slippery white stuff — it ’s enough to give [a fellow]3096-a fellow pneumonia to walk through [these rooms]3376-these rooms on a cold day . [You]109-lily look a little pinched [yourself]109-lily , by the way : it ’s rather a sharp night out . [I]1706-i noticed it walking up from [the club]3260-the club . Come along , and [I]1706-i ’ll give [you]109-lily a nip of brandy , and [you]109-lily can toast [yourself]109-lily over the fire and try some of [my]1706-i new Egyptians — [that little Turkish chap at [the Embassy]3379-the embassy]3378-that little turkish chap at the embassy put [me]1706-i on to a brand that [I]1706-i want [you]109-lily to try , and if [you]109-lily like ’em [I]1706-i ’ll get out a lot for [you]109-lily : [they]3380-they do n’t have ’em [here]2763-here yet , but [I]1706-i ’ll cable . ”[1706-i] [He]1706-i led [her]1707-her through [the house]488-the house to [the large room at the back , where [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor usually sat , and where , even in [her]1707-her absence]1709-the large room at the back , where mrs. trenor usually sat , and where , even in her absence , there was an air of occupancy . [Here]2763-here , as usual , were flowers , newspapers , a littered writing - table , and a general aspect of lamp - lit familiarity , so that it was a surprise not to see [Judy]126-judy ’s energetic figure start up from the arm - chair near the fire . It was apparently [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor [himself]123-mrs. trenor who had been occupying the seat in question , for it was overhung by a cloud of cigar smoke , and near it stood one of those intricate folding tables which British ingenuity has devised to facilitate the circulation of tobacco and spirits . The sight of such appliances in [a drawing - room]1314-a drawing - room was not unusual in [Lily]109-lily ’s set , where smoking and drinking were unrestricted by considerations of time and place , and [her]109-lily first movement was to help [herself]109-lily to one of the cigarettes recommended by [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , while [she]109-lily checked [his]1706-i loquacity by asking , with a surprised glance : “ Where ’s [Judy]126-judy ? ”[109-lily] [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , a little heated by [his]1706-i unusual flow of words , and perhaps by prolonged propinquity with the decanters , was bending over the latter to decipher their silver labels . “ Here , now , [Lily]109-lily , just a drop of cognac in a little fizzy water — [you]109-lily do look pinched , [you]109-lily know : [I]1706-i swear the end of [your]109-lily nose is red . [I]1706-i ’ll take another glass to keep [you]109-lily company — Judy?—Why , [you]109-lily see , [Judy]126-judy ’s got a devil of a head ache — quite knocked out with it , poor thing — [she]126-judy asked [me]1706-i to explain — make it all right , [you]109-lily know — Do come up to the fire , though ; [you]109-lily look dead - beat , really . Now do let [me]1706-i make [you]109-lily comfortable , there ’s [a good girl]3382-a good girl . ”[1706-i] [He]1706-i had taken [her]1712-i hand , half - banteringly , and was drawing [her]1712-i toward a low seat by the hearth ; but [she]1712-i stopped and freed [herself]1712-i quietly . “ Do [you]1706-i mean to say that [Judy]126-judy ’s not well enough to see [me]1712-i ? Does n’t [she]126-judy want [me]1712-i to go [upstairs]2873-upstairs ? ”[1712-i] [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor drained the glass [he]1706-i had filled for [himself]1706-i , and paused to set it down before [he]1706-i answered . “ Why , no — the fact is , [she]126-judy ’s not up to seeing [anybody]361-anybody . It came on suddenly , [you]109-lily know , and [she]126-judy asked [me]1706-i to tell [you]109-lily how awfully sorry [she]126-judy was — if [she]126-judy ’d known where [you]109-lily were dining [she]126-judy ’d have sent [you]109-lily word . ”[1706-i] “ [She]126-judy did know where [I]1712-i was dining ; [I]1712-i mentioned it in [my]1712-i telegram . But it does n’t matter , of course . [I]1712-i suppose if [she]126-judy ’s so poorly [she]126-judy wo n’t go back to [Bellomont]3-bellomont in the morning , and [I]1712-i can come and see [her]126-judy then . ”[1712-i] “ Yes : exactly — that ’s capital . [I]1706-i ’ll tell [her]126-judy [you]109-lily ’ll pop in tomorrow morning . And now do sit down a minute , there ’s [a dear]3385-a dear , and let ’s have a nice quiet jaw together . [You]109-lily wo n’t take a drop , just for sociability ? Tell [me]1706-i what [you]109-lily think of that cigarette . Why , do n’t [you]109-lily like it ? What are [you]109-lily chucking it away for ? ”[1706-i] “ [I]109-lily am chucking it away because [I]109-lily must go , if [you]123-mrs. trenor ’ll have the goodness to call [a cab]378-a cab for [me]109-lily , ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily returned with a smile . [She]109-lily did not like [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s unusual excitability , with its too evident explanation , and the thought of being alone with [him]1713-him , with [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend out of reach [upstairs]2873-upstairs , at [the other end of [the great empty house]1717-the great empty house]1716-the other end of the great empty house , did not conduce to a desire to prolong [their]1718-their TETE - A - TETE . But [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , with a promptness which did not escape [her]109-lily , had moved between [herself]109-lily and the door . “ Why must [you]109-lily go , [I]1719-you should like to know ? If [Judy’d]223-judy’d been [here]2763-here [you]109-lily ’d have sat gossiping till all hours — and [you]109-lily ca n’t even give [me]1719-you five minutes ! It ’s always the same story . Last night [I]1719-you could n’t get near [you]109-lily — [I]1719-you went to that damned vulgar party just to see [you]109-lily , and there was [everybody]2995-everybody talking about [you]109-lily , and asking [me]1719-you if [I]1719-you ’d ever seen anything so stunning , and when [I]1719-you tried to come up and say a word , [you]109-lily never took any notice , but just went on laughing and joking with [a lot of asses who only wanted to be able to swagger about afterward]3389-a lot of asses who only wanted to be able to swagger about afterward , and look knowing when [you]109-lily were mentioned . ”[1719-you] [He]1719-you paused , flushed by [his]1719-you diatribe , and fixing on [her]1720-her a look in which resentment was the ingredient [she]1720-her least disliked . But [she]1720-her had regained [her]1720-her presence of mind , and stood composedly in the middle of [the room]351-the room , while [her]1720-her slight smile seemed to put an ever increasing distance between [herself]1720-her and [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor . Across it [she]1720-her said : “ Do n’t be absurd , [Gus]111-gus . It ’s past eleven , and [I]1720-her must really ask [you]1719-you to ring for [a cab]378-a cab . ”[1720-her] [He]1719-you remained immovable , with the lowering forehead [she]1720-her had grown to detest . “ And supposing [I]1720-her wo n’t ring for one — what’ll [you]1719-you do then ? ”[1720-her] “ [I]1719-you shall go [upstairs]2873-upstairs to [Judy]126-judy if [you]1719-you force [me]1719-you to disturb [her]126-judy . ”[1719-you] [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor drew a step nearer and laid [his]1719-you hand on [her]1720-her arm . “ Look here , [Lily]109-lily : wo n’t [you]1719-you give [me]1719-you five minutes of [your]1719-you own accord ? ”[1719-you] “ Not tonight , [Gus]111-gus : [you]111-gus — — ”[1719-you] “ Very good , then : [I]1719-you ’ll take [’em]3392-’em . And as many more as [I]1719-you want . ”[1719-you] [He]1719-you had squared [himself]1719-you on the threshold , [his]1719-you hands thrust deep in [his]1719-you pockets . [He]1719-you nodded toward the chair on the hearth . “ Go and sit down there , please : [I]1719-you ’ve got a word to say to [you]1719-you . ”[1719-you] [Lily]109-lily ’s quick temper was getting the better of [her]109-lily fears . [She]109-lily drew [herself]109-lily up and moved toward the door . “ If [you]1719-you have anything to say to [me]109-lily , [you]1719-you must say it another time . [She]126-judy ai n’t [there]2755-there . ”[1719-you] [Lily]109-lily cast a startled look upon [him]1719-you . “ Do [you]1719-you mean that [Judy]126-judy is not in [the house]488-the house — not in [town]305-town ? ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily exclaimed . “ That ’s just what [I]1719-you do mean , ”[1719-you] returned [Trenor]126-judy , [his]1719-you bluster sinking to sullenness under [her]109-lily look . “ Nonsense — [I]109-lily do n’t believe [you]1719-you . [I]109-lily am going [upstairs]2873-upstairs , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said impatiently . [He]1719-you drew unexpectedly aside , letting [her]109-lily reach the threshold unimpeded . “ Go up and welcome ; but [[my]1719-you wife]2959-my wife is at [Bellomont]3-bellomont . ”[1719-you] But [Lily]109-lily had a flash of reassurance . “ If [she]2959-my wife had n’t come [she]2959-my wife would have sent [me]109-lily word — — ”[109-lily] “ [She]2959-my wife did ; [she]2959-my wife telephoned [me]1719-you this afternoon to let [you]1719-you know . ”[1719-you] “ [I]109-lily received no message . ”[109-lily] “ [I]781-the two did n’t send any . ”[781-the two] [The two]781-the two measured [each other]2955-each other for a moment , but [Lily]109-lily still saw [[her]109-lily opponent]1724-her opponent through a blur of scorn that made all other considerations indistinct . “ [I]1724-her opponent ca n’t imagine [your]1719-you object in playing such a stupid trick on [me]1724-her opponent ; but if [you]1719-you have fully gratified [your]1719-you peculiar sense of humour [I]1724-her opponent must again ask [you]1719-you to send for [a cab]378-a cab . ”[1724-her opponent] It was the wrong note , and [she]109-lily knew it as [she]109-lily spoke . To be stung by irony it is not necessary to understand it , and the angry streaks on [Trenor]126-judy ’s face might have been raised by an actual lash . “ Look here , [Lily]109-lily , do n’t take that high and mighty tone with [me]1724-her opponent . ”[1724-her opponent] [He]1724-her opponent had again moved toward the door , and in [her]109-lily instinctive shrinking from [him]1724-her opponent [she]109-lily let [him]1724-her opponent regain command of the threshold . “ [I]109-lily DID play a trick on [you]1719-you ; [I]109-lily own up to it ; but if [you]1719-you think [I]109-lily ’m ashamed [you]1719-you ’re mistaken . [Lord]3402-lord knows [I]109-lily ’ve been patient enough — [I’ve]109-lily hung round and looked like [an ass]3403-an ass . [I]109-lily can tell fast enough when [I]109-lily ’m made a fool of .... ”[109-lily] “ Ah , [I]109-lily should n’t have thought that ! ”[109-lily] flashed from [Lily]109-lily ; but [her]109-lily laugh dropped to silence under [his]1725-you look . “ No ; [you]109-lily would n’t have thought it ; but [you]109-lily ’ll know better now . That ’s what [you]109-lily ’re here for tonight . [I]109-lily ’ve been waiting for a quiet time to talk things over , and now [I]109-lily ’ve got it [I]109-lily mean to make [you]109-lily hear [me]109-lily out . ”[109-lily] [His]1725-you first rush of inarticulate resentment had been followed by a steadiness and concentration of tone more disconcerting to [Lily]109-lily than the excitement preceding it . For a moment [her]109-lily presence of mind forsook [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily had more than once been in situations where a quick sword - play of wit had been needful to cover [her]109-lily retreat ; but [her]109-lily frightened heart - throbs told [her]109-lily that here such skill would not avail . To gain time [she]109-lily repeated : “ [I]109-lily do n’t understand what [you]1725-you want . ”[109-lily] [Trenor]126-judy had pushed a chair between [herself]109-lily and the door . [He]1725-you threw [himself]1725-you in it , and leaned back , looking up at [her]109-lily . “ [I]1725-you ’ll tell [you]109-lily what [I]1725-you want : [I]1725-you want to know just where [you]109-lily and [I]1725-you stand . Hang it , [the man who pays for the dinner]3408-the man who pays for the dinner is generally allowed to have a seat at table . ”[1725-you] [She]109-lily flamed with anger and abasement , and the sickening need of having to conciliate where [she]109-lily longed to humble . “ [I]109-lily do n’t know what [you]1725-you mean — but [you]1725-you must see , [Gus]111-gus , that [I]109-lily ca n’t stay here talking to [you]1725-you at this hour — — ”[109-lily] “ [Gad]222-gad , [you]1725-you go to [[men]2795-men ’s houses]3410-men ’s houses fast enough in broad day light — strikes [me]124-rosedale [you]1725-you ’re not always so deuced careful of appearances . ”[124-rosedale] The brutality of the thrust gave [her]109-lily the sense of dizziness that follows on a physical blow . [Rosedale]124-rosedale had spoken then — this was the way [men]2795-men talked of [her]109-lily — [She]109-lily felt suddenly weak and defenceless : there was a throb of self - pity in [her]109-lily throat . But all the while [another self]1727-another self was sharpening [her]109-lily to vigilance , whispering the terrified warning that every word and gesture must be measured . “ If [you]126-judy have brought [me]109-lily here to say insulting things — — ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily began . [Trenor]126-judy laughed . “ Do n’t talk stage - rot . [I]126-judy do n’t want to insult [you]1725-you . But [a man]2811-a man ’s got [his]2811-a man feelings — and [you]1725-you ’ve played with [mine]126-judy too long . [I]126-judy did n’t begin this business — kept out of the way , and left the track clear for [the other chaps]3412-the other chaps , till [you]1725-you rummaged [me]126-judy out and set to work to make an ass of [me]126-judy — and an easy job [you]1725-you had of it , too . That ’s the trouble — it was too easy for [you]1725-you — [you]1725-you got reckless — thought [you]1725-you could turn [me]126-judy inside out , and chuck [me]126-judy in the gutter like an empty purse . But , by gad , that ai n’t playing fair : that ’s dodging the rules of the game . Of course [I]126-judy know now what [you]1725-you wanted — it was n’t [my]126-judy beautiful eyes [you]1725-you were after — but [I]126-judy tell [you]1725-you what , [Miss Lily]109-lily , [you]1725-you ’ve got to pay up for making [me]126-judy think so — — ”[126-judy] [He]1728-you rose , squaring [his]1728-you shoulders aggressively , and stepped toward [her]1729-her with a reddening brow ; but [she]1729-her held [her]1729-her footing , though every nerve tore at [her]1729-her to retreat as [he]1728-you advanced . “ Pay up ? ”[1729-her] [she]1729-her faltered . “ Do [you]1728-you mean that [I]1728-you owe [you]1728-you money ? ”[1728-you] [He]1728-you laughed again . “ Oh , [I]1728-you ’m not asking for payment in kind . But there ’s such a thing as fair play — and interest on one ’s money — and hang [me]1728-you if [I]1728-you ’ve had as much as a look from [you]1728-you — — ”[1728-you] “ [Your]1728-you money ? What have [I]1728-you to do with [your]1728-you money ? [You]1728-you advised [me]1728-you how to invest [mine]1728-you . . . [you]1728-you must have seen [I]1728-you knew nothing of business . . . [I]1728-you ’m only asking for a word of thanks from [you]109-lily . ”[1728-you] [He]1728-you was closer still , with a hand that grew formidable ; and the frightened self in [her]1730-you was dragging the other down . “ [I]126-judy HAVE thanked [you]109-lily ; [I]126-judy ’ve shown [I]126-judy was grateful . What more have [you]109-lily done than [any friend]3413-any friend might do , or [any one]442-any one accept from [a friend]2800-a friend ? ”[126-judy] [Trenor]126-judy caught [her]1730-you up with a sneer . “ [I]126-judy do n’t doubt [you]1730-you ’ve accepted as much before — and chucked [the other chaps]3412-the other chaps as [you]1730-you ’d like to chuck [me]126-judy . [I]126-judy do n’t care how [you]1730-you settled [your]1730-you score with [them]3412-the other chaps — if [you]1730-you fooled ’em [I]126-judy ’m that much to the good . Do n’t stare at [me]126-judy like that — [I]126-judy know [I]126-judy ’m not talking the way [a man]2811-a man is supposed to talk to [a girl]2828-a girl — but , hang it , if [you]1730-you do n’t like it [you]1730-you can stop [me]126-judy quick enough — [you]1730-you know [I]126-judy ’m mad about [you]1730-you — damn the money , there ’s plenty more of it — if THAT bothers [you]1730-you .... [I]126-judy was [a brute]3419-a brute , [Lily]109-lily — [Lily!—just]224-lily!—just look at [me]126-judy — — ”[126-judy] Over and over [her]1731-her the sea of humiliation broke — wave crashing on wave so close that the moral shame was one with the physical dread . It seemed to [her]1731-her that self - esteem would have made [her]1731-her invulnerable — that it was [her]1731-her own dishonour which put a fearful solitude about [her]1731-her . [His]1732-you touch was a shock to [her]1731-her drowning consciousness . [She]1731-her drew back from [him]1732-you with a desperate assumption of scorn . “ [I]1731-her ’ve told [you]1732-you [I]1731-her do n’t understand — but if [I]1731-her owe [you]1732-you money [you]1732-you shall be paid — — ”[1731-her] [Trenor]126-judy ’s face darkened to rage : [her]1731-her recoil of abhorrence had called out [the primitive man]1733-the primitive man . “ Ah — [you’ll]3420-you’ll borrow from [Selden]108-selden or [Rosedale]124-rosedale — and take [your]1732-you chances of fooling [them]3421-them as [you]1732-you ’ve fooled [me]1731-her ! Unless — unless [you]1732-you ’ve settled [your]1732-you other scores already — and [I]1731-her ’m [the only one left out in the cold]3422-the only one left out in the cold ! ”[1731-her] [She]1731-her stood silent , frozen to [her]1731-her place . The words — the words were worse than the touch ! [Her]1731-her heart was beating all over [her]1731-her body — in [her]1731-her throat , [her]1731-her limbs , [her]1731-her helpless useless hands . [Her]1731-her eyes travelled despairingly about [the room]351-the room — they lit on the bell , and [she]1731-her remembered that help was in call . Yes , but scandal with it — a hideous mustering of tongues . No , [she]1731-her must fight [her]1731-her way out alone . It was enough that [the servants]490-the servants knew [her]1731-her to be in [the house]488-the house with [Trenor]126-judy — there must be nothing to excite conjecture in [her]1731-her way of leaving it . [She]1731-her raised [her]1731-her head , and achieved a last clear look at [him]1737-him . “ [I]1731-her am here alone with [you]1737-him , ”[1731-her] [she]1731-her said . “ What more have [you]1737-him to say ? ”[1731-her] To [her]1731-her surprise , [Trenor]126-judy answered the look with a speechless stare . With [his]1737-him last gust of words the flame had died out , leaving [him]1737-him chill and humbled . It was as though a cold air had dispersed the fumes of [his]1737-him libations , and the situation loomed before [him]1737-him black and naked as the ruins of a fire . Old habits , old restraints , the hand of inherited order , plucked back the bewildered mind which passion had jolted from its ruts . [Trenor]126-judy ’s eye had the haggard look of [the sleep - walker waked on a deathly ledge]1738-the sleep - walker waked on a deathly ledge . “ Go [home]400-home ! Go away from here”——he[1737-him] stammered , and turning [his]1737-him back on [her]1731-her walked toward the hearth . The sharp release from [her]1731-her fears restored [Lily]109-lily to immediate lucidity . The collapse of [Trenor]126-judy ’s will left [her]1731-her in control , and [she]1731-her heard [herself]1731-her , in a voice that was [her]1731-her own yet outside [herself]1731-her , bidding [him]1737-him ring for [the servant]1739-the servant , bidding [him]1737-him give the order for [a hansom]381-a hansom , directing [him]1737-him to put [her]1731-her in [it]381-a hansom when it came . Whence the strength came to [her]1731-her [she]1731-her knew not ; but an insistent voice warned [her]1731-her that [she]1731-her must leave [the house]488-the house openly , and nerved [her]1731-her , in [the hall]533-the hall before [the hovering care taker]1743-the hovering care taker , to exchange light words with [Trenor]126-judy , and charge [him]1737-him with the usual messages for [Judy]126-judy , while all the while [she]1731-her shook with inward loathing . On [the doorstep]1699-the doorstep , with [the street]310-the street before [her]1731-her , [she]1731-her felt a mad throb of liberation , intoxicating as [the prisoner]1746-the prisoner ’s first draught of free air ; but the clearness of brain continued , and [she]1731-her noted the mute aspect of [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue , guessed at the lateness of the hour , and even observed [a man]2811-a man ’s figure — was there something half - familiar in its outline?—which , as [she]1731-her entered [the hansom]390-the hansom , turned from the opposite corner and vanished in the obscurity of [the side street]1749-the side street . But with the turn of the wheels reaction came , and shuddering darkness closed on [her]1731-her . “ [I]1731-her ca n’t think — [I]1731-her ca n’t think , ”[1731-her] [she]1731-her moaned , and leaned [her]1731-her head against the rattling side of [the cab]1750-the cab . [She]1731-her seemed [a stranger to [herself]1731-her]1751-a stranger to herself , or rather there were two selves in [her]1731-her , the one [she]1731-her had always known , and a new abhorrent being to which it found itself chained . [She]1731-her had once picked up , in [a house where [she]1731-her was staying , a translation of [the EUMENIDES]225-the eumenides]1752-a house where she was staying , a translation of the eumenides , and [her]1731-her imagination had been seized by the high terror of the scene where [Orestes]226-orestes , in [the cave of [the oracle]1754-the oracle]1753-the cave of the oracle , finds [his]226-orestes implacable huntresses asleep , and snatches an hour ’s repose . Yes , [the Furies]227-the furies might sometimes sleep , but [they]227-the furies were there , always there in the dark corners , and now [they]227-the furies were awake and the iron clang of [their]227-the furies wings was in [her]1731-her brain .... [She]1731-her opened [her]1731-her eyes and saw [the streets]1755-the streets passing — [the familiar alien streets]1756-the familiar alien streets . All [she]1731-her looked on was the same and yet changed . There was a great gulf fixed between today and yesterday . Everything in the past seemed simple , natural , full of daylight — and [she]1731-her was alone in [a place of darkness and pollution.—Alone]1757-a place of darkness and pollution.—alone ! It was the loneliness that frightened [her]1731-her . [Her]1731-her eyes fell on an illuminated clock at [a street corner]1758-a street corner , and [she]1731-her saw that the hands marked the half hour after eleven . Only half - past eleven — there were hours and hours left of the night ! And [she]1731-her must spend them alone , shuddering sleepless on [her]1731-her bed . [Her]1731-her soft nature recoiled from this ordeal , which had none of the stimulus of conflict to goad [her]1731-her through it . Oh , the slow cold drip of the minutes on [her]1731-her head ! [She]1731-her had a vision of [herself]1731-her lying on the black walnut bed — and the darkness would frighten [her]1731-her , and if [she]1731-her left the light burning the dreary details of [the room]351-the room would brand themselves forever on [her]1731-her brain . [She]1731-her had always hated [[her]1731-her room at [Mrs. Peniston’s]228-mrs. peniston’s]1760-her room at mrs. peniston’s — its ugliness , its impersonality , the fact that nothing in [it]1760-her room at mrs. peniston’s was really [hers]1731-her . To a torn heart uncomforted by human nearness [a room]1761-a room may open almost human arms , and the being to whom no four walls mean more than any others , is , at such hours , expatriate everywhere . [Lily]109-lily had no heart to lean on . [Her]109-lily relation with [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt was as superficial as that of [chance lodgers who pass on the stairs]1763-chance lodgers who pass on the stairs . But even had [the two]781-the two been in closer contact , it was impossible to think of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s mind as offering shelter or comprehension to such misery as [Lily]109-lily ’s . As the pain that can be told is but half a pain , so the pity that questions has little healing in its touch . What [Lily]109-lily craved was the darkness made by enfolding arms , the silence which is not solitude , but compassion holding its breath . [She]1731-her started up and looked forth on [the passing streets]1765-the passing streets . [Gerty!—they]229-gerty!—they were nearing [[Gerty]112-gerty ’s corner]1766-gerty ’s corner . If only [she]1731-her could reach there before this labouring anguish burst from [her]1731-her breast to [her]1731-her lips — if only [she]1731-her could feel the hold of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s arms while [she]1731-her shook in the ague - fit of fear that was coming upon [her]1731-her ! [She]1731-her pushed up the door in the roof and called the address to [the driver]389-the driver . It was not so late — [Gerty]112-gerty might still be waking . And even if [she]1731-her were not , the sound of the bell would penetrate every recess of [[her]1731-her tiny apartment]1768-her tiny apartment , and rouse [her]1731-her to answer [[her]1731-her friend]754-her friend ’s call . Chapter 14 [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , the morning after [the Wellington Brys]207-the wellington brys ’ entertainment , woke from dreams as happy as [Lily]109-lily ’s . If they were less vivid in hue , more subdued to the half - tints of [her]109-lily personality and [her]109-lily experience , they were for that very reason better suited to [her]109-lily mental vision . Such flashes of joy as [Lily]109-lily moved in would have blinded [Miss Farish]113-miss farish , who was accustomed , in the way of happiness , to such scant light as shone through the cracks of [other people]563-other people ’s lives . Now [she]109-lily was the centre of a little illumination of [her]109-lily own : a mild but unmistakable beam , compounded of [Lawrence Selden]108-selden ’s growing kindness to [herself]109-lily and the discovery that [he]108-selden extended [his]108-selden liking to [Lily Bart]109-lily . If these two factors seem incompatible to [the student of feminine psychology]1771-the student of feminine psychology , it must be remembered that [Gerty]112-gerty had always been [a parasite in the moral order]1772-a parasite in the moral order , living on the crumbs of other tables , and content to look through the window at the banquet spread for [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends . Now that [she]109-lily was enjoying a little private feast of [her]109-lily own , it would have seemed incredibly selfish not to lay a plate for [a friend]2800-a friend ; and there was [no one with whom [she]109-lily would rather have shared [her]109-lily enjoyment than [Miss Bart]109-lily]1775-no one with whom she would rather have shared her enjoyment than miss bart . As to the nature of [Selden]108-selden ’s growing kindness , [Gerty]112-gerty would no more have dared to define it than [she]112-gerty would have tried to learn a butterfly ’s colours by knocking the dust from its wings . To seize on the wonder would be to brush off its bloom , and perhaps see it fade and stiffen in [her]112-gerty hand : better the sense of beauty palpitating out of reach , while [she]112-gerty held [her]112-gerty breath and watched where it would alight . Yet [Selden]108-selden ’s manner at [the Brys]207-the wellington brys ’ had brought the flutter of wings so close that they seemed to be beating in [her]112-gerty own heart . [She]112-gerty had never seen [him]108-selden so alert , so responsive , so attentive to what [she]112-gerty had to say . [His]108-selden habitual manner had an absent - minded kindliness which [she]112-gerty accepted , and was grateful for , as the liveliest sentiment [her]112-gerty presence was likely to inspire ; but [she]112-gerty was quick to feel in [him]108-selden a change implying that for once [she]112-gerty could give pleasure as well as receive it . And it was so delightful that this higher degree of sympathy should be reached through [their]1776-their interest in [Lily Bart]109-lily ! [Gerty]112-gerty ’s affection for [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend — a sentiment that had learned to keep itself alive on the scantiest diet — had grown to active adoration since [Lily]109-lily ’s restless curiosity had drawn [her]112-gerty into the circle of [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s work . [Lily]109-lily ’s taste of beneficence had wakened in [her]109-lily a momentary appetite for well - doing . [Her]112-gerty visit to [the Girls ’ Club]1778-the girls ’ club had first brought [her]112-gerty in contact with the dramatic contrasts of life . [She]112-gerty had always accepted with philosophic calm the fact that such existences as [hers]112-gerty were pedestalled on foundations of obscure humanity . The dreary limbo of dinginess lay all around and beneath that little illuminated circle in which life reached its finest efflorescence , as the mud and sleet of a winter night enclose a hot - house filled with tropical flowers . All this was in the natural order of things , and the orchid basking in [its]1779-its artificially created atmosphere could round the delicate curves of its petals undisturbed by the ice on the panes . But it is one thing to live comfortably with the abstract conception of poverty , another to be brought in contact with its human embodiments . [Lily]109-lily had never conceived of [these victims of fate otherwise than in the mass]1780-these victims of fate otherwise than in the mass . That the mass was composed of individual lives , innumerable separate centres of sensation , with [her]109-lily own eager reachings for pleasure , [her]109-lily own fierce revulsions from pain — that some of these bundles of feeling were clothed in shapes not so unlike [her]109-lily own , with eyes meant to look on gladness , and young lips shaped for love — this discovery gave [Lily]109-lily one of those sudden shocks of pity that sometimes decentralize a life . [Lily]109-lily ’s nature was incapable of such renewal : [she]109-lily could feel other demands only through [her]109-lily own , and no pain was long vivid which did not press on an answering nerve . But for the moment [she]109-lily was drawn out of [herself]109-lily by the interest of [her]109-lily direct relation with [a world so unlike [her]109-lily own]1781-a world so unlike her own . [She]109-lily had supplemented [her]109-lily first gift by personal assistance to one or two of [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s most appealing subjects , and the admiration and interest [her]109-lily presence excited among [the tired workers at [the club]3260-the club]1782-the tired workers at the club ministered in a new form to [her]109-lily insatiable desire to please . [Gerty Farish]112-gerty was not a close enough reader of character to disentangle the mixed threads of which [Lily]109-lily ’s philanthropy was woven . [She]112-gerty supposed [[her]112-gerty beautiful friend]1784-her beautiful friend to be actuated by the same motive as [herself]112-gerty — that sharpening of the moral vision which makes all human suffering so near and insistent that the other aspects of life fade into remoteness . [Gerty]112-gerty lived by such simple formulas that [she]112-gerty did not hesitate to class [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s state with the emotional “ change of heart ”[112-gerty] to which [her]112-gerty dealings with [the poor]3223-the poor had accustomed [her]112-gerty ; and [she]112-gerty rejoiced in the thought that [she]112-gerty had been the humble instrument of this renewal . Now [she]112-gerty had an answer to all criticisms of [Lily]109-lily ’s conduct : as [she]112-gerty had said , [she]112-gerty knew “ the real [Lily]109-lily , ”[112-gerty] and the discovery that [Selden]108-selden shared [her]112-gerty knowledge raised [her]112-gerty placid acceptance of life to a dazzled sense of its possibilities — a sense farther enlarged , in the course of the afternoon , by the receipt of a telegram from [Selden]108-selden asking if [he]108-selden might dine with [her]112-gerty that evening . While [Gerty]112-gerty was lost in the happy bustle which this announcement produced in [[her]112-gerty small household]1787-her small household , [Selden]108-selden was at one with [her]112-gerty in thinking with intensity of [Lily Bart]109-lily . The case which had called [him]108-selden to [Albany]17-albany was not complicated enough to absorb all [his]108-selden attention , and [he]108-selden had the professional faculty of keeping a part of [his]108-selden mind free when its services were not needed . This part — which at the moment seemed dangerously like the whole — was filled to the brim with the sensations of the previous evening . [Selden]108-selden understood the symptoms : [he]108-selden recognized the fact that [he]108-selden was paying up , as there had always been a chance of [his]108-selden having to pay up , for the voluntary exclusions of [his]108-selden past . [He]108-selden had meant to keep free from permanent ties , not from any poverty of feeling , but because , in a different way , [he]108-selden was , as much as [Lily]109-lily , [the victim of [his]108-selden environment]1788-the victim of his environment . There had been a germ of truth in [his]108-selden declaration to [Gerty Farish]112-gerty that [he]108-selden had never wanted to marry [a “ nice ”[108-selden] girl]1789-a “ nice ” girl : the adjective connoting , in [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin ’s vocabulary , certain utilitarian qualities which are apt to preclude the luxury of charm . Now it had been [Selden]108-selden ’s fate to have [a charming mother]1791-a charming mother : [her]1791-a charming mother graceful portrait , all smiles and Cashmere , still emitted a faded scent of the undefinable quality . [[His]108-selden father]1792-his father was [the kind of man who delights in [a charming woman]1794-a charming woman : who quotes [her]1794-a charming woman , stimulates [her]1794-a charming woman , and keeps [her]1794-a charming woman perennially charming]1793-the kind of man who delights in a charming woman : who quotes her , stimulates her , and keeps her perennially charming . [Neither one of [the couple]960-the couple]1795-neither one of the couple cared for money , but [their]960-the couple disdain of it took the form of always spending a little more than was prudent . If [[their]960-the couple house]1797-their house was shabby , [it]1797-their house was exquisitely kept ; if there were good books on the shelves there were also good dishes on the table . [Selden]108-selden senior had an eye for a picture , [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife an understanding of old lace ; and [both]1799-both were so conscious of restraint and discrimination in buying that [they]1799-both never quite knew how it was that the bills mounted up . Though [many of [[Selden]108-selden ’s friends]1801-selden ’s friends]1800-many of selden ’s friends would have called [[his]108-selden parents]1802-his parents poor , [he]108-selden had grown up in an atmosphere where restricted means were felt only as a check on aimless profusion : where the few possessions were so good that [their]1799-both rarity gave [them]1799-both a merited relief , and abstinence was combined with elegance in a way exemplified by [Mrs. Selden]230-selden ’s knack of wearing [her]230-selden old velvet as if it were new . [A man]2811-a man has the advantage of being delivered early from the home point of view , and before [Selden]230-selden left [college]1804-college [he]108-selden had learned that there are as many different ways of going without money as of spending it . Unfortunately , [he]108-selden found no way as agreeable as that practised at [home]400-home ; and [his]108-selden views of [womankind]1806-womankind in especial were tinged by the remembrance of [the one woman who had given [him]108-selden [his]108-selden sense of “ values]3424-the one woman who had given him his sense of “ values . ”[230-selden] It was from [her]230-selden that [he]108-selden inherited [his]108-selden detachment from the sumptuary side of life : the stoic ’s carelessness of material things , combined with [the Epicurean]1807-the epicurean ’s pleasure in them . Life shorn of either feeling appeared to [him]108-selden a diminished thing ; and nowhere was the blending of the two ingredients so essential as in the character of [a pretty woman]446-a pretty woman . It had always seemed to [Selden]230-selden that experience offered a great deal besides the sentimental adventure , yet [he]108-selden could vividly conceive of a love which should broaden and deepen till it became the central fact of life . What [he]108-selden could not accept , in [his]108-selden own case , was the makeshift alternative of a relation that should be less than this : that should leave some portions of [his]108-selden nature unsatisfied , while it put an undue strain on others . [He]108-selden would not , in other words , yield to the growth of an affection which might appeal to pity yet leave the understanding untouched : sympathy should no more delude [him]108-selden than a trick of the eyes , the grace of helplessness than a curve of the cheek . But now — that little BUT passed like a sponge over all [his]108-selden vows . [His]108-selden reasoned - out resistances seemed for the moment so much less important than the question as to when [Lily]109-lily would receive [his]108-selden note ! [He]108-selden yielded [himself]108-selden to the charm of trivial preoccupations , wondering at what hour [her]109-lily reply would be sent , with what words it would begin . As to its import [he]108-selden had no doubt — [he]108-selden was as sure of [her]109-lily surrender as of [his]108-selden own . And so [he]108-selden had leisure to muse on all its exquisite details , as [a hard worker , on a holiday morning]1809-a hard worker , on a holiday morning , might lie still and watch the beam of light travel gradually across [[his]108-selden room]1810-his room . But if the new light dazzled , it did not blind [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden could still discern the outline of facts , though [his]108-selden own relation to them had changed . [He]108-selden was no less conscious than before of what was said of [Lily Bart]109-lily , but [he]108-selden could separate [the woman [he]108-selden knew]1811-the woman he knew from the vulgar estimate of [her]109-lily . [His]108-selden mind turned to [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s words , and the wisdom of [the world]354-the world seemed a groping thing beside the insight of innocence . BLESSED ARE [THE PURE IN HEART]231-the pure in heart , FOR [THEY]231-the pure in heart SHALL SEE [GOD]165-god — even the hidden god in [[their]231-the pure in heart neighbour]1813-their neighbour ’s breast ! [Selden]230-selden was in the state of impassioned self - absorption that the first surrender to love produces . [His]108-selden craving was for the companionship of one whose point of view should justify [his]108-selden own , who should confirm , by deliberate observation , the truth to which [his]108-selden intuitions had leaped . [He]108-selden could not wait for the midday recess , but seized a moment ’s leisure in [court]1814-court to scribble [his]108-selden telegram to [Gerty Farish]112-gerty . [Selden]108-selden evinced an extraordinary interest in [her]112-gerty household arrangements : complimented [her]112-gerty on the ingenuity with which [she]112-gerty had utilized every inch of [[her]112-gerty small quarters]1830-her small quarters , asked how [[her]112-gerty servant]1831-her servant managed about afternoons out , learned that [one]2737-one may improvise delicious dinners in a chafing - dish , and uttered thoughtful generalizations on the burden of [a large establishment]1833-a large establishment . When [they]1828-they were in [the sitting - room]1834-the sitting - room again , where [they]1828-they fitted as snugly as bits in a puzzle , and [she]112-gerty had brewed the coffee , and poured it into [[her]112-gerty grandmother]715-her grandmother ’s egg - shell cups , [his]108-selden eye , as [he]108-selden leaned back , basking in the warm fragrance , lighted on a recent photograph of [Miss Bart]109-lily , and the desired transition was effected without an effort .
