[They]1842-their dwelt together on the fact that [Lily]109-lily had had no chance . [Gerty]112-gerty instanced [her]109-lily generous impulses — [her]109-lily restlessness and discontent . The fact that [her]109-lily life had never satisfied [her]109-lily proved that [she]109-lily was made for better things . [She]109-lily might have married more than once — the conventional rich marriage which [she]109-lily had been taught to consider the sole end of existence — but when the opportunity came [she]109-lily had always shrunk from it . [Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce , for instance , had been in love with [her]109-lily — [every one at [Bellomont]3-bellomont]1845-every one at bellomont had supposed [them]1842-their to be engaged , and [her]109-lily dismissal of [him]1846-him was thought inexplicable . This view of [the Gryce]129-mrs. gryce incident chimed too well with [Selden]108-selden ’s mood not to be instantly adopted by [him]108-selden , with a flash of retrospective contempt for what had once seemed the obvious solution . If rejection there had been — and [he]108-selden wondered now that [he]108-selden had ever doubted it!—then [he]108-selden held the key to the secret , and [the hillsides of [Bellomont]3-bellomont]1847-the hillsides of bellomont were lit up , not with sunset , but with dawn . It was [he]108-selden who had wavered and disowned the face of opportunity — and the joy now warming [his]108-selden breast might have been a familiar inmate if [he]108-selden had captured it in its first flight . It was at this point , perhaps , that a joy just trying its wings in [Gerty]112-gerty ’s heart dropped to earth and lay still . [She]109-lily sat facing [Selden]108-selden , repeating mechanically : “ No , [she]109-lily has never been understood — — ”[109-lily] and all the while [she]109-lily [herself]109-lily seemed to be sitting in the centre of a great glare of comprehension . [The little confidential room]1848-the little confidential room , where a moment ago [their]1849-their thoughts had touched elbows like [their]1849-their chairs , grew to unfriendly vastness , separating [her]109-lily from [Selden]108-selden by all the length of [her]109-lily new vision of the future — and that future stretched out interminably , with [her]109-lily lonely figure toiling down it , a mere speck on the solitude . “ [She]109-lily is [herself]109-lily with [a few people]3436-a few people only ; and [you]108-selden are [one of [them]3436-a few people]3344-one of them , ”[108-selden] [she]109-lily heard [Selden]108-selden saying . And again : “ Be good to [her]109-lily , [Gerty]112-gerty , wo n’t [you]112-gerty ? ”[108-selden] and : “ [She]109-lily has it in [her]109-lily to become whatever [she]109-lily is believed to be — [you’ll]108-selden help [her]109-lily by believing the best of [her]109-lily ? ”[108-selden] The words beat on [Gerty]112-gerty ’s brain like the sound of a language which has seemed familiar at a distance , but on approaching is found to be unintelligible . [He]1850-he had come to talk to [her]109-lily of [Lily]109-lily — that was all ! There had been a third at the feast [she]109-lily had spread for [him]1850-he , and that third had taken [her]109-lily own place . [She]109-lily tried to follow what [he]1850-he was saying , to cling to [her]109-lily own part in the talk — but it was all as meaningless as the boom of waves in a drowning head , and [she]109-lily felt , as the drowning may feel , that to sink would be nothing beside the pain of struggling to keep up . [Selden]108-selden rose , and [she]109-lily drew a deep breath , feeling that soon [she]109-lily could yield to the blessed waves . “ [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s ? [You]135-mrs. fisher say [she]109-lily was dining [there]2755-there ? There ’s music afterward ; [I]1850-he believe [I]1850-he had a card from [her]109-lily . ”[1850-he] [He]1850-he glanced at the foolish pink - faced clock that was drumming out this hideous hour . “ A quarter past ten ? Well , [he]108-selden had strength for both — it was [her]864-his hostess weakness which had put the strength in [him]108-selden . It was not , alas , a clean rush of waves [they]1865-they had to win through , but a clogging morass of old associations and habits , and for the moment its vapours were in [his]108-selden throat . [He]108-selden smiled at the whirl of metaphor with which [he]108-selden was trying to build up a defence against the influences of the last hour . It was pitiable that [he]108-selden , who knew the mixed motives on which social judgments depend , should still feel [himself]108-selden so swayed by them . The moral oppression had produced a physical craving for air , and [he]108-selden strode on , opening [his]108-selden lungs to the reverberating coldness of the night . At the corner of [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue [Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne hailed [him]108-selden with an offer of company . “ Walking ? A good thing to blow the smoke out of one ’s head . Now that [women]2772-women have taken to tobacco [we]3456-we live in a bath of nicotine . It would be a curious thing to study the effect of cigarettes on the relation of the sexes . Smoke is almost as great a solvent as divorce : both tend to obscure the moral issue . ”[177-van alstyne] Nothing could have been less consonant with [Selden]108-selden ’s mood than [Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne ’s after - dinner aphorisms , but as long as [the latter]566-the latter confined [himself]566-the latter to generalities [[his]566-the latter listener]1867-his listener ’s nerves were in control . [He]448-her cousin had kissed [her]1882-her before — but not with [another woman]1884-another woman on [his]448-her cousin lips . If [he]448-her cousin had spared [her]1882-her that [she]1882-her could have drowned quietly , welcoming the dark flood as it submerged [her]1882-her . But now the flood was shot through with glory , and it was harder to drown at sunrise than in darkness . [Gerty]112-gerty hid [her]112-gerty face from the light , but it pierced to the crannies of [her]112-gerty soul . [She]112-gerty had been so contented , life had seemed so simple and sufficient — why had [he]448-her cousin come to trouble [her]112-gerty with new hopes ? And [Lily]109-lily — [Lily]109-lily , [[her]112-gerty best friend]1885-her best friend ! [Woman]1886-woman - like , [she]112-gerty accused [the woman]366-the woman . Perhaps , had it not been for [Lily]109-lily , [her]109-lily fond imagining might have become truth . [Selden]108-selden had always liked [her]109-lily — had understood and sympathized with the modest independence of [her]109-lily life . [He]448-her cousin , who had the reputation of weighing all things in the nice balance of fastidious perceptions , had been uncritical and simple in [his]448-her cousin view of [her]109-lily : [his]448-her cousin cleverness had never overawed [her]109-lily because [she]109-lily had felt at [home]400-home in [his]448-her cousin heart . And now [she]109-lily was thrust out , and the door barred against [her]109-lily by [Lily]109-lily ’s hand ! [Lily]109-lily , for whose admission there [she]109-lily [herself]109-lily had pleaded ! The situation was lighted up by a dreary flash of irony . [She]109-lily knew [Selden]108-selden — [she]109-lily saw how the force of [her]109-lily faith in [Lily]109-lily must have helped to dispel [his]108-selden hesitations . [She]109-lily remembered , too , how [Lily]109-lily had talked of [him]108-selden — [she]109-lily saw [herself]109-lily bringing [the two]781-the two together , making [them]781-the two known to [each other]2955-each other . On [Selden]108-selden ’s part , no doubt , the wound inflicted was inconscient ; [he]108-selden had never guessed [her]109-lily foolish secret ; but [Lily]109-lily — [Lily]109-lily must have known ! When , in such matters , are [a woman]2771-a woman ’s perceptions at fault ? And if [she]109-lily knew , then [she]109-lily had deliberately despoiled [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend , and in mere wantonness of power , since , even to [Gerty]112-gerty ’s suddenly flaming jealousy , it seemed incredible that [Lily]109-lily should wish to be [[Selden]108-selden ’s wife]1893-selden ’s wife . [Lily]109-lily might be incapable of marrying for money , but [she]109-lily was equally incapable of living without it , and [Selden]108-selden ’s eager investigations into the small economies of [house - keeping]1539-house - keeping made [him]108-selden appear to [Gerty]112-gerty as tragically duped as [herself]109-lily . [She]109-lily remained long in [[her]109-lily sitting - room]1895-her sitting - room , where the embers were crumbling to cold grey , and the lamp paled under its gay shade . Just beneath it stood the photograph of [Lily Bart]109-lily , looking out imperially on the cheap gimcracks , the cramped furniture of [the little room]1896-the little room . Could [Selden]108-selden picture [her]109-lily in such an interior ? [Gerty]112-gerty felt the poverty , the insignificance of [her]109-lily surroundings : [she]112-gerty beheld [her]109-lily life as it must appear to [Lily]109-lily . And the cruelty of [Lily]109-lily ’s judgments smote upon [her]109-lily memory . [She]109-lily saw that [she]109-lily had dressed [[her]109-lily idol]1897-her idol with attributes of [her]109-lily own making . When had [Lily]109-lily ever really felt , or pitied , or understood ? All [she]109-lily wanted was the taste of new experiences : [she]109-lily seemed like some cruel creature experimenting in [a laboratory]1898-a laboratory . The pink - faced clock drummed out another hour , and [Gerty]112-gerty rose with a start . [She]112-gerty had an appointment early the next morning with [a district visitor on [the East side]1900-the east side]1899-a district visitor on the east side . [She]112-gerty put out [her]112-gerty lamp , covered the fire , and went into [[her]112-gerty bedroom]540-her bedroom to undress . In the little glass above [her]112-gerty dressing - table [she]112-gerty saw [her]112-gerty face reflected against the shadows of [the room]351-the room , and tears blotted the reflection . What right had [she]112-gerty to dream the dreams of loveliness ? A dull face invited a dull fate . [She]112-gerty cried quietly as [she]112-gerty undressed , laying aside [her]112-gerty clothes with [her]112-gerty habitual precision , setting everything in order for the next day , when the old life must be taken up as though there had been no break in its routine . [[Her]112-gerty servant]1831-her servant did not come till eight o’clock , and [she]112-gerty prepared [her]112-gerty own tea - tray and placed it beside the bed . Then [she]112-gerty locked the door of [the flat]1904-the flat , extinguished [her]112-gerty light and lay down . But on [her]112-gerty bed sleep would not come , and [she]112-gerty lay face to face with the fact that [she]112-gerty hated [Lily Bart]109-lily . It closed with [her]112-gerty in the darkness like some formless evil to be blindly grappled with . Reason , judgment , renunciation , [all the sane daylight forces]1905-all the sane daylight forces , were beaten back in the sharp struggle for self - preservation . [She]112-gerty wanted happiness — wanted it as fiercely and unscrupulously as [Lily]109-lily did , but without [Lily]109-lily ’s power of obtaining it . And in [her]112-gerty conscious impotence [she]112-gerty lay shivering , and hated [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend — — A ring at the door - bell caught [her]112-gerty to [her]112-gerty feet . [She]112-gerty struck a light and stood startled , listening . For a moment [her]112-gerty heart beat incoherently , then [she]112-gerty felt the sobering touch of fact , and remembered that such calls were not unknown in [her]112-gerty charitable work . [She]112-gerty flung on [her]112-gerty dressing - gown to answer the summons , and unlocking [her]112-gerty door , confronted the shining vision of [Lily Bart]109-lily . [Gerty]112-gerty ’s first movement was one of revulsion . [She]112-gerty shrank back as though [Lily]109-lily ’s presence flashed too sudden a light upon [her]112-gerty misery . Then [she]112-gerty heard [her]112-gerty name in a cry , had a glimpse of [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s face , and felt [herself]112-gerty caught and clung to . “ [Lily]109-lily — what is it ? ”[112-gerty] [she]112-gerty exclaimed . [Miss Bart]109-lily released [her]109-lily , and stood breathing brokenly , like [one who has gained shelter after a long flight]1908-one who has gained shelter after a long flight . “ [I]109-lily was so cold — [I]109-lily could n’t go [home]400-home . Have [you]112-gerty a fire ? ”[109-lily] [Gerty]112-gerty ’s compassionate instincts , responding to the swift call of habit , swept aside all [her]112-gerty reluctances . [Lily]109-lily was simply [some one who needed help]1909-some one who needed help — for what reason , there was no time to pause and conjecture : disciplined sympathy checked the wonder on [Gerty]112-gerty ’s lips , and made [her]112-gerty draw [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend silently into [the sitting - room]1834-the sitting - room and seat [her]754-her friend by the darkened hearth . “ There is kindling wood [here]2763-here : the fire will burn in a minute . ”[112-gerty] [She]112-gerty knelt down , and the flame leapt under [her]112-gerty rapid hands . It flashed strangely through the tears which still blurred [her]112-gerty eyes , and smote on the white ruin of [Lily]109-lily ’s face . [The girls]2901-the girls looked at [each other]2955-each other in silence ; then [Lily]109-lily repeated : “ [I]109-lily could n’t go [home]400-home . ”[109-lily] “ No — no — [you]754-her friend came here , [dear]2964-dear ! [You]754-her friend ’re cold and tired — sit quiet , and [I]112-gerty ’ll make [you]754-her friend some tea . ”[112-gerty] [Gerty]112-gerty had unconsciously adopted the soothing note of [her]109-lily trade : all personal feeling was merged in the sense of ministry , and experience had taught [her]109-lily that the bleeding must be stayed before the wound is probed . [Lily]109-lily sat quiet , leaning to the fire : the clatter of cups behind [her]109-lily soothed [her]109-lily as familiar noises hush [a child whom silence has kept wakeful]1914-a child whom silence has kept wakeful . But when [Gerty]112-gerty stood at [her]109-lily side with the tea [she]112-gerty pushed it away , and turned an estranged eye on [the familiar room]1915-the familiar room . “ [I]112-gerty came here because [I]112-gerty could n’t bear to be alone , ”[112-gerty] [she]112-gerty said . [Gerty]112-gerty set down the cup and knelt beside [her]109-lily . “ [Lily]109-lily ! Something has happened — can’t [you]109-lily tell [me]112-gerty ? ”[112-gerty] “ [I]109-lily could n’t bear to lie awake in [[my]109-lily room]3493-my room till morning . [I]109-lily hate [[my]109-lily room]3493-my room at [Aunt Julia’s]237-aunt julia’s — so [I]109-lily came [here]2763-here — — ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily stirred suddenly , broke from [her]109-lily apathy , and clung to [Gerty]112-gerty in a fresh burst of fear . “ Oh , [Gerty]112-gerty , [the furies]3496-the furies . . . [you]109-lily know the noise of [their]3496-the furies wings — alone , at night , in the dark ? But [you]109-lily do n’t know — there is nothing to make the dark dreadful to [you]109-lily — — ”[109-lily] The words , flashing back on [Gerty]112-gerty ’s last hours , struck from [her]109-lily a faint derisive murmur ; but [Lily]109-lily , in the blaze of [her]109-lily own misery , was blinded to everything outside it . “ [You]112-gerty ’ll let [me]113-miss farish stay ? [I]113-miss farish sha n’t mind when daylight comes — Is it late ? Is the night nearly over ? It must be awful to be sleepless — everything stands by the bed and stares — — ”[113-miss farish] [Miss Farish]113-miss farish caught [her]109-lily straying hands . “ [Lily]109-lily , look at [me]113-miss farish ! Something has happened — an accident ? [You]109-lily have been frightened — what has frightened [you]109-lily ? Tell [me]113-miss farish if [you]109-lily can — a word or two — so that [I]113-miss farish can help [you]109-lily . ”[113-miss farish] [Lily]109-lily shook [her]109-lily head . “ [I]109-lily am not frightened : that ’s not the word . Can [you]112-gerty imagine looking into [your]109-lily glass some morning and seeing a disfigurement — some hideous change that has come to [you]109-lily while [you]109-lily slept ? Well , [I]109-lily seem to [myself]109-lily like that — [I]109-lily ca n’t bear to see [myself]109-lily in [my]109-lily own thoughts — [I]109-lily hate ugliness , [you]112-gerty know — [I’ve]109-lily always turned from it — but [I]109-lily ca n’t explain to [you]112-gerty — [you]112-gerty would n’t understand . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily lifted [her]109-lily head and [her]109-lily eyes fell on the clock . “ How long the night is ! And [I]109-lily know [I]109-lily sha n’t sleep tomorrow . [Some one]2889-some one told [me]109-lily [[my]109-lily father]3098-my father used to lie sleepless and think of horrors . And [he]3098-my father was not wicked , only unfortunate — and [I]109-lily see now how [he]3098-my father must have suffered , lying alone with [his]3098-my father thoughts ! But [I]109-lily am bad — [a bad girl]3499-a bad girl — all [my]109-lily thoughts are bad — [I]109-lily have always had [bad people]3500-bad people about [me]109-lily . Is that any excuse ? [I]109-lily thought [I]109-lily could manage [my]109-lily own life — [I]109-lily was proud — proud ! but now [I]109-lily ’m on [their]1917-their level — — ”[109-lily] Sobs shook [her]1916-she , and [she]1916-she bowed to [them]1917-their like a tree in a dry storm . [Gerty]112-gerty knelt beside [her]1916-she , waiting , with the patience born of experience , till this gust of misery should loosen fresh speech . [She]1916-she had first imagined some physical shock , some peril of [the crowded streets]1918-the crowded streets , since [Lily]109-lily was presumably on [her]109-lily way [home]400-home from [[Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s]1920-carry fisher ’s ; but [she]1916-she now saw that other nerve - centres were smitten , and [her]1916-she mind trembled back from conjecture . [Lily]109-lily ’s sobs ceased , and [she]1916-she lifted [her]1916-she head . “ There are [bad girls in [[your]112-gerty slums]3502-your slums]3501-bad girls in your slums . Tell [me]1916-she — do [they]3501-bad girls in your slums ever pick [themselves]3501-bad girls in your slums up ? Ever forget , and feel as [they]3501-bad girls in your slums did before ? ”[1916-she] “ [Lily]109-lily ! [you]109-lily must n’t speak so — [you’re]109-lily dreaming . ”[1916-she] “ Do n’t [they]3501-bad girls in your slums always go from bad to worse ? There ’s no turning back — [[your]109-lily old self]3503-your old self rejects [you]109-lily , and shuts [you]109-lily out . ”[1916-she] [She]1916-she rose , stretching [her]1916-she arms as if in utter physical weariness . “ Go to bed , [dear]2964-dear ! [You]2964-dear work hard and get up early . [I]1916-she ’ll watch here by the fire , and [you]2964-dear ’ll leave the light , and [your]2964-dear door open . All [I]1916-she want is to feel that [you]2964-dear are near [me]1916-she . ”[1916-she] [She]1916-she laid both hands on [Gerty]112-gerty ’s shoulders , with a smile that was like sunrise on [a sea]1921-a sea strewn with wreckage . “ [I]112-gerty ca n’t leave [you]2964-dear , [Lily]109-lily . Come and lie on [my]112-gerty bed . [Your]2964-dear hands are frozen — [you]2964-dear must undress and be made warm . ”[112-gerty] [Gerty]112-gerty paused with sudden compunction . “ But [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston — it ’s past midnight ! What will [she]114-mrs. peniston think ? ”[112-gerty] “ [She]114-mrs. peniston goes to bed . [I]1916-she have a latchkey . It does n’t matter — [I]1916-she ca n’t go back [there]2755-there . ”[1916-she] “ There ’s no need to : [you]2964-dear shall stay here . But [you]2964-dear must tell [me]1922-me where [you]2964-dear have been . Listen , [Lily]109-lily — it will help [you]2964-dear to speak ! ”[1922-me] [She]1922-me regained [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s hands , and pressed them against [her]1922-me . “ Try to tell [me]112-gerty — it will clear [your]2964-dear poor head . Listen — [you]2964-dear were dining at [Carry Fisher ’s]146-carry fisher . ”[112-gerty] [Gerty]112-gerty paused and added with a flash of heroism : “ [Lawrence Selden]108-selden went from [here]2763-here to find [you]2964-dear . ”[112-gerty] At the word , [Lily]109-lily ’s face melted from locked anguish to the open misery of [a child]348-a child . [Her]1922-me lips trembled and [her]1922-me gaze widened with tears . “ [He]108-selden went to find [me]1922-me ? And [I]1922-me missed [him]108-selden ! Oh , [Gerty]112-gerty , [he]108-selden tried to help [me]1922-me . [He]108-selden told [me]1922-me — [he]108-selden warned [me]1922-me long ago — [he]108-selden foresaw that [I]1922-me should grow hateful to [myself]1922-me ! ”[1922-me] The name , as [Gerty]112-gerty saw with a clutch at the heart , had loosened the springs of self - pity in [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s dry breast , and tear by tear [Lily]109-lily poured out the measure of [her]109-lily anguish . [She]109-lily had dropped sideways in [Gerty]112-gerty ’s big arm - chair , [her]109-lily head buried where lately [Selden]108-selden ’s had leaned , in a beauty of abandonment that drove home to [Gerty]112-gerty ’s aching senses the inevitableness of [her]109-lily own defeat . Ah , it needed no deliberate purpose on [Lily]109-lily ’s part to rob [her]109-lily of [her]109-lily dream ! To look on that prone loveliness was to see in it a natural force , to recognize that love and power belong to such as [Lily]109-lily , as renunciation and service are the lot of those [they]1925-they despoil . But if [Selden]108-selden ’s infatuation seemed a fatal necessity , the effect that [his]108-selden name produced shook [Gerty]112-gerty ’s steadfastness with a last pang . [Men]2795-men pass through such superhuman loves and outlive [them]2795-men : [they]2795-men are [the probation subduing the heart to human joys]1927-the probation subduing the heart to human joys . How gladly [Gerty]112-gerty would have welcomed the ministry of healing : how willingly have soothed [the sufferer]1928-the sufferer back to tolerance of life ! But [Lily]109-lily ’s self - betrayal took this last hope from [her]109-lily . [The mortal maid on [the shore]1930-the shore]1929-the mortal maid on the shore is helpless against [the siren who loves [her]1929-the mortal maid on the shore prey]1931-the siren who loves her prey : [such victims]1932-such victims are floated back dead from [their]1932-such victims adventure . [Lily]109-lily sprang up and caught [her]109-lily with strong hands . “ [Gerty]112-gerty , [you]112-gerty know [him]108-selden — [you]112-gerty understand [him]108-selden — tell [me]109-lily ; if [I]109-lily went to [him]108-selden , if [I]109-lily told [him]108-selden everything — if [I]109-lily said : ‘ [I]109-lily am bad through and through — [I]109-lily want admiration , [I]109-lily want excitement , [I]109-lily want money — ’ yes , MONEY ! That ’s [my]109-lily shame , [Gerty]112-gerty — and it ’s known , it ’s said of [me]109-lily — it ’s what [men]2795-men think of [me]109-lily — If [I]109-lily said it all to [him]108-selden — told [him]108-selden the whole story — said plainly : ‘ [I]109-lily ’ve sunk lower than the lowest , for [I]109-lily ’ve taken what [they]2795-men take , and not paid as [they]2795-men pay’—oh , [Gerty]112-gerty , [you]112-gerty know [him]108-selden , [you]112-gerty can speak for [him]108-selden : if [I]109-lily told [him]108-selden everything would [he]108-selden loathe [me]109-lily ? Or would [he]108-selden pity [me]109-lily , and understand [me]109-lily , and save [me]109-lily from loathing [myself]109-lily ? ”[109-lily] [Gerty]112-gerty stood cold and passive . [She]112-gerty knew the hour of [her]112-gerty probation had come , and [her]112-gerty poor heart beat wildly against its destiny . As [a dark river]1933-a dark river sweeps by under a lightning flash , [she]112-gerty saw [her]112-gerty chance of happiness surge past under a flash of temptation . What prevented [her]112-gerty from saying : “ [He]1934-him is like [other men]3508-other men ? ”[112-gerty] [She]112-gerty was not so sure of [him]1934-him , after all ! But to do so would have been like blaspheming [her]112-gerty love . [She]112-gerty could not put [him]1934-him before [herself]112-gerty in any light but the noblest : [she]112-gerty must trust [him]1934-him to the height of [her]112-gerty own passion . “ Yes : [I]112-gerty know [him]1934-him ; [he]1934-him will help [you]1934-him , ”[112-gerty] [she]112-gerty said ; and in a moment [Lily]109-lily ’s passion was weeping itself out against [her]109-lily breast . There was but one bed in [the little flat]1935-the little flat , and [the two girls]1936-the two girls lay down on it side by side when [Gerty]112-gerty had unlaced [Lily]109-lily ’s dress and persuaded [her]109-lily to put [her]109-lily lips to the warm tea . The light extinguished , [they]1936-the two girls lay still in the darkness , [Gerty]112-gerty shrinking to the outer edge of the narrow couch to avoid contact with [her]112-gerty bed - fellow . Knowing that [Lily]109-lily disliked to be caressed , [she]109-lily had long ago learned to check [her]109-lily demonstrative impulses toward [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend . But tonight every fibre in [her]109-lily body shrank from [Lily]109-lily ’s nearness : it was torture to listen to [her]109-lily breathing , and feel the sheet stir with it . As [Lily]109-lily turned , and settled to completer rest , a strand of [her]109-lily hair swept [Gerty]112-gerty ’s cheek with its fragrance . Everything about [her]109-lily was warm and soft and scented : even the stains of [her]109-lily grief became [her]109-lily as rain - drops do the beaten rose . But as [Gerty]112-gerty lay with arms drawn down [her]109-lily side , in the motionless narrowness of an effigy , [she]109-lily felt a stir of sobs from the breathing warmth beside [her]109-lily , and [Lily]109-lily flung out [her]109-lily hand , groped for [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s , and held it fast . “ Hold [me]109-lily , [Gerty]112-gerty , hold [me]109-lily , or [I]109-lily shall think of things , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily moaned ; and [Gerty]112-gerty silently slipped an arm under [her]109-lily , pillowing [her]109-lily head in its hollow as [a mother]579-a mother makes a nest for [a tossing child]1940-a tossing child . In [the warm hollow]1941-the warm hollow [Lily]109-lily lay still and [her]109-lily breathing grew low and regular . [Her]109-lily hand still clung to [Gerty]112-gerty ’s as if to ward off evil dreams , but the hold of [her]109-lily fingers relaxed , [her]109-lily head sank deeper into its shelter , and [Gerty]112-gerty felt that [she]109-lily slept . Chapter 15 When [Lily]109-lily woke [she]109-lily had the bed to [herself]109-lily , and the winter light was in [the room]351-the room . [She]109-lily sat up , bewildered by the strangeness of [her]109-lily surroundings ; then memory returned , and [she]109-lily looked about [her]109-lily with a shiver . In the cold slant of light reflected from the back wall of [a neighbouring building]1943-a neighbouring building , [she]109-lily saw [her]109-lily evening dress and opera cloak lying in a tawdry heap on a chair . Finery laid off is as unappetizing as the remains of a feast , and it occurred to [Lily]109-lily that , at [home]400-home , [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid ’s vigilance had always spared [her]109-lily the sight of such incongruities . [Her]109-lily body ached with fatigue , and with the constriction of [her]109-lily attitude in [[Gerty]112-gerty ’s bed]1946-gerty ’s bed . All through [her]109-lily troubled sleep [she]109-lily had been conscious of having no space to toss in , and the long effort to remain motionless made [her]109-lily feel as if [she]109-lily had spent [her]109-lily night in [a train]306-a train . This sense of physical discomfort was the first to assert itself ; then [she]109-lily perceived , beneath it , a corresponding mental prostration , a languor of horror more insufferable than the first rush of [her]109-lily disgust . The thought of having to wake every morning with this weight on [her]109-lily breast roused [her]109-lily tired mind to fresh effort . [She]109-lily must find some way out of [the slough into which]1948-the slough into which [she]109-lily had stumbled : it was not so much compunction as the dread of [her]109-lily morning thoughts that pressed on [her]109-lily the need of action . But [she]109-lily was unutterably tired ; it was weariness to think connectedly . [She]109-lily lay back , looking about the poor slit of [a room]1761-a room with a renewal of physical distaste . The outer air , penned between [high buildings]1950-high buildings , brought no freshness through the window ; steam - heat was beginning to sing in a coil of dingy pipes , and a smell of cooking penetrated the crack of the door . The door opened , and [Gerty]112-gerty , dressed and hatted , entered with a cup of tea . [Her]112-gerty face looked sallow and swollen in the dreary light , and [her]112-gerty dull hair shaded imperceptibly into the tones of [her]112-gerty skin . [She]112-gerty glanced shyly at [Lily]109-lily , asking in an embarrassed tone how [she]109-lily felt ; [Lily]109-lily answered with the same constraint , and raised [herself]109-lily up to drink the tea . “ [I]109-lily must have been over - tired last night ; [I]109-lily think [I]109-lily had a nervous attack in [the carriage]420-the carriage , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said , as the drink brought clearness to [her]109-lily sluggish thoughts . “ [You]109-lily were not well ; [I]112-gerty am so glad [you]109-lily came here , ”[112-gerty] [Gerty]112-gerty returned . “ But how am [I]112-gerty to get [home]400-home ? And [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia — ? ”[112-gerty] “ [She]238-aunt julia knows ; [I]109-lily telephoned early , and [[your]109-lily maid]3167-your maid has brought [your]109-lily things . But wo n’t [you]109-lily eat something ? [I]109-lily scrambled the eggs [myself]109-lily . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily could not eat ; but the tea strengthened [her]109-lily to rise and dress under [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid ’s searching gaze . It was a relief to [her]109-lily that [Gerty]112-gerty was obliged to hasten away : [the two]781-the two kissed silently , but without a trace of the previous night ’s emotion . [Lily]109-lily found [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston in a state of agitation . [She]114-mrs. peniston had sent for [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney and was taking digitalis . [Lily]109-lily breasted the storm of enquiries as best [she]109-lily could , explaining that [she]109-lily had had an attack of faintness on [her]109-lily way back from [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s ; that , fearing [she]109-lily would not have strength to reach [home]400-home , [she]109-lily had gone to [[Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s]1954-miss farish ’s instead ; but that a quiet night had restored [her]109-lily , and that [she]109-lily had no need of [a doctor]1503-a doctor . This was a relief to [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , who could give [herself]114-mrs. peniston up to [her]114-mrs. peniston own symptoms , and [Lily]109-lily was advised to go and lie down , [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s panacea for all physical and moral disorders . In the solitude of [[her]109-lily own room]1393-her own room [she]109-lily was brought back to a sharp contemplation of facts . [Her]109-lily daylight view of them necessarily differed from the cloudy vision of the night . [The winged furies]1958-the winged furies were now prowling [gossips who dropped in on each other for tea]1959-gossips who dropped in on each other for tea . But [her]109-lily fears seemed the uglier , thus shorn of their vagueness ; and besides , [she]109-lily had to act , not rave . For the first time [she]109-lily forced [herself]109-lily to reckon up the exact amount of [her]109-lily debt to [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ; and the result of this hateful computation was the discovery that [she]109-lily had , in all , received nine thousand dollars from [him]1960-him . The flimsy pretext on which it had been given and received shrivelled up in the blaze of [her]109-lily shame : [she]109-lily knew that not a penny of it was [her]109-lily own , and that to restore [her]109-lily self - respect [she]109-lily must at once repay the whole amount . The inability thus to solace [her]109-lily outraged feelings gave [her]109-lily a paralyzing sense of insignificance . [She]109-lily was realizing for the first time that [a woman]2771-a woman ’s dignity may cost more to keep up than [her]2771-a woman carriage ; and that the maintenance of a moral attribute should be dependent on dollars and cents , made [the world]354-the world appear a more sordid place than [she]109-lily had conceived [it]354-the world . After luncheon , when [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney ’s prying eyes had been removed , [Lily]109-lily asked for a word with [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt . [The two ladies]1964-the two ladies went [upstairs]2873-upstairs to [the sitting - room]1834-the sitting - room , where [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston seated [herself]114-mrs. peniston in [her]114-mrs. peniston black satin arm - chair tufted with yellow buttons , beside a bead - work table bearing a bronze box with a miniature of [Beatrice Cenci]239-beatrice cenci in the lid . [Lily]109-lily felt for these objects the same distaste which [the prisoner]1746-the prisoner may entertain for the fittings of [the court - room]1968-the court - room . It was here that [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt received [her]345-her aunt rare confidences , and the pink - eyed smirk of [the turbaned Beatrice]1970-the turbaned beatrice was associated in [her]345-her aunt mind with the gradual fading of the smile from [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s lips . [That lady]486-that lady ’s dread of a scene gave [her]109-lily an inexorableness which the greatest strength of character could not have produced , since it was independent of all considerations of right or wrong ; and knowing this , [Lily]109-lily seldom ventured to assail it . [She]109-lily had never felt less like making the attempt than on the present occasion ; but [she]109-lily had sought in vain for any other means of escape from an intolerable situation . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston examined [her]109-lily critically . “ [You]109-lily ’re a bad colour , [Lily]109-lily : this incessant rushing about is beginning to tell on [you]109-lily , ”[114-mrs. peniston] [she]114-mrs. peniston said . [Miss Bart]109-lily saw an opening . “ [I]114-mrs. peniston do n’t think it ’s that , [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia ; [I]114-mrs. peniston ’ve had worries , ”[114-mrs. peniston] [she]114-mrs. peniston replied . “ Ah , ”[114-mrs. peniston] said [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , shutting [her]114-mrs. peniston lips with the snap of a purse closing against [a beggar]1972-a beggar . “ [I]109-lily ’m sorry to bother [you]114-mrs. peniston with them , ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily continued , “ but [I]109-lily really believe [my]109-lily faintness last night was brought on partly by anxious thoughts — ”[109-lily] “ [I]114-mrs. peniston should have said [[Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s cook]3512-carry fisher ’s cook was enough to account for it . [She]146-carry fisher has [a woman who was with [Maria Melson]240-maria melson in 1891 — the spring of the year [we]3514-we went to [Aix]50-aix]3513-a woman who was with maria melson in 1891 — the spring of the year we went to aix — and [I]114-mrs. peniston remember dining [there]2755-there two days before [we]3514-we sailed , and feeling SURE the coppers had n’t been scoured . ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ [I]109-lily do n’t think [I]109-lily ate much ; [I]109-lily ca n’t eat or sleep . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily paused , and then said abruptly : “ The fact is , [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia , [I]109-lily owe some money . ”[109-lily] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s face clouded perceptibly , but did not express the astonishment [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece had expected . [She]114-mrs. peniston was silent , and [Lily]109-lily was forced to continue : “ [I]114-mrs. peniston have been foolish — — ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ No doubt [you]109-lily have : extremely foolish , ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston interposed . “ [I]114-mrs. peniston fail to see how any one with [your]109-lily income , and no expenses — not to mention the handsome presents [I]114-mrs. peniston ’ve always given [you]109-lily — — ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ Oh , [you]109-lily ’ve been most generous , [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia ; [I]114-mrs. peniston shall never forget [your]109-lily kindness . But perhaps [you]109-lily do n’t quite realize the expense [a girl]2828-a girl is put to nowadays — — ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ [I]109-lily do n’t realize that [YOU]109-lily are put to any expense except for [your]109-lily clothes and [your]109-lily railway fares . [I]109-lily expect [you]109-lily to be handsomely dressed ; but [I]109-lily paid [Celeste]193-celeste ’s bill for [you]109-lily last October . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily hesitated : [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s implacable memory had never been more inconvenient . “ [You]109-lily were as kind as possible ; but [I]109-lily have had to get a few things since — — ”[109-lily] “ What kind of things ? Clothes ? How much have [you]109-lily spent ? Let [me]114-mrs. peniston see the bill — [I]114-mrs. peniston daresay [the woman]366-the woman is swindling [you]109-lily . ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ Oh , no , [I]114-mrs. peniston think not : clothes have grown so frightfully expensive ; and [one]2737-one needs so many different kinds , with country visits , and golf and skating , and [Aiken]241-aiken and Tuxedo — — ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ Let [me]114-mrs. peniston see the bill , ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston repeated . [Lily]109-lily hesitated again . In the first place , [Mme]242-regina . [Celeste]193-celeste had not yet sent in [her]193-celeste account , and secondly , the amount it represented was only a fraction of the sum that [Lily]109-lily needed . “ [She]193-celeste has n’t sent in the bill for [my]109-lily winter things , but [I]109-lily KNOW it ’s large ; and there are one or two other things ; [I]109-lily ’ve been careless and imprudent — [I’m]109-lily frightened to think of what [I]109-lily owe — — ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily raised the troubled loveliness of [her]109-lily face to [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston , vainly hoping that a sight so moving to the other sex might not be without effect upon [her]109-lily own . But the effect produced was that of making [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston shrink back apprehensively . “ Really , [Lily]109-lily , [you]109-lily are old enough to manage [your]109-lily own affairs , and after frightening [me]114-mrs. peniston to death by [your]109-lily performance of last night [you]109-lily might at least choose a better time to worry [me]114-mrs. peniston with such matters . ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston glanced at the clock , and swallowed a tablet of digitalis . “ If [you]109-lily owe [Celeste]193-celeste another thousand , [she]193-celeste may send [me]114-mrs. peniston [her]193-celeste account , ”[114-mrs. peniston] [she]114-mrs. peniston added , as though to end the discussion at any cost . “ [I]114-mrs. peniston am very sorry , [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia ; [I]114-mrs. peniston hate to trouble [you]109-lily at such a time ; but [I]114-mrs. peniston have really no choice — [I]114-mrs. peniston ought to have spoken sooner — [I]114-mrs. peniston owe a great deal more than a thousand dollars . ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ A great deal more ? Do [you]109-lily owe two ? [She]193-celeste must have robbed [you]109-lily ! ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ [I]114-mrs. peniston told [you]109-lily it was not only [Celeste]193-celeste . [I]114-mrs. peniston — there are other bills — more pressing — that must be settled . ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ What on earth have [you]109-lily been buying ? Jewelry ? [You]109-lily must have gone off [your]109-lily head , ”[114-mrs. peniston] said [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston with asperity . “ But if [you]109-lily have run into debt , [you]109-lily must suffer the consequences , and put aside [your]109-lily monthly income till [your]109-lily bills are paid . If [you]109-lily stay quietly [here]2763-here until next spring , instead of racing about all over [the country]304-the country , [you]109-lily will have no expenses at all , and surely in four or five months [you]109-lily can settle the rest of [your]109-lily bills if [I]114-mrs. peniston pay [the dress - maker]2851-the dress - maker now . ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Lily]109-lily was again silent . [She]109-lily knew [she]109-lily could not hope to extract even a thousand dollars from [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston on the mere plea of paying [Celeste]193-celeste ’s bill : [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston would expect to go over [the dress - maker]2851-the dress - maker ’s account , and would make out the cheque to [her]114-mrs. peniston and not to [Lily]109-lily . And yet the money must be obtained before the day was over ! “ The debts [I]109-lily speak of are — different — not like [tradesmen]3522-tradesmen ’s bills , ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily began confusedly ; but [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s look made [her]109-lily almost afraid to continue . Could it be that [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt suspected anything ? The idea precipitated [Lily]109-lily ’s avowal . “ The fact is , [I]109-lily ’ve played cards a good deal — bridge ; [the women]2741-the women all do it ; [girls]2776-girls too — it ’s expected . Sometimes [I]109-lily ’ve won — won a good deal — but lately [I]109-lily ’ve been unlucky — and of course such debts ca n’t be paid off gradually — — ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily paused : [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s face seemed to be petrifying as [she]114-mrs. peniston listened . “ Cards — [you’ve]109-lily played cards for money ? It ’s true , then : when [I]114-mrs. peniston was told so [I]114-mrs. peniston would n’t believe it . [I]114-mrs. peniston wo n’t ask if the other horrors [I]114-mrs. peniston was told were true too ; [I]114-mrs. peniston ’ve heard enough for the state of [my]114-mrs. peniston nerves . When [I]114-mrs. peniston think of the example [you]109-lily ’ve had in [this house]2925-this house ! But [I]114-mrs. peniston suppose it ’s [your]109-lily foreign bringing - up — [no one]2766-no one knew where [[your]109-lily mother]3527-your mother picked up [[her]3527-your mother friends]406-her friends . And [her]3527-your mother Sundays were a scandal — that [I]114-mrs. peniston know . ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston wheeled round suddenly . “ [You]109-lily play cards on Sunday ? ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Lily]109-lily flushed with the recollection of certain rainy Sundays at [Bellomont]3-bellomont and with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets . “ [You]109-lily ’re hard on [me]114-mrs. peniston , [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia : [I]114-mrs. peniston have never really cared for cards , but [a girl]2828-a girl hates to be thought priggish and superior , and [one]2737-one drifts into doing what [the others]3217-the others do . [I]114-mrs. peniston ’ve had a dreadful lesson , and if [you]109-lily ’ll help [me]114-mrs. peniston out this time [I]114-mrs. peniston promise [you]109-lily — ”[114-mrs. peniston] [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston raised [her]114-mrs. peniston hand warningly . “ [You]109-lily need n’t make any promises : it ’s unnecessary . When [I]114-mrs. peniston offered [you]109-lily a [home]400-home [I]114-mrs. peniston did n’t undertake to pay [your]109-lily gambling debts . ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia ! [You]238-aunt julia do n’t mean that [you]238-aunt julia wo n’t help [me]114-mrs. peniston ? ”[114-mrs. peniston] “ [I]109-lily shall certainly not do anything to give the impression that [I]109-lily countenance [your]109-lily behaviour . If [you]109-lily really owe [[your]109-lily dress - maker]2845-your dress - maker , [I]109-lily will settle with [her]2845-your dress - maker — beyond that [I]109-lily recognize no obligation to assume [your]109-lily debts . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily had risen , and stood pale and quivering before [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt . Pride stormed in [her]109-lily , but humiliation forced the cry from [her]109-lily lips : “ [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia , [I]109-lily shall be disgraced — [I]109-lily — ”[109-lily] But [she]109-lily could go no farther . If [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt turned such a stony ear to the fiction of the gambling debts , in what spirit would [she]345-her aunt receive the terrible avowal of the truth ? “ [I]109-lily consider that [you]109-lily ARE disgraced , [Lily]109-lily : disgraced by [your]109-lily conduct far more than by its results . [You]109-lily say [[your]109-lily friends]3005-your friends have persuaded [you]109-lily to play cards with [them]3005-your friends ; well , [they]3005-your friends may as well learn a lesson too . [They]3005-your friends can probably afford to lose a little money — and at any rate , [I]109-lily am not going to waste any of [mine]109-lily in paying [them]3005-your friends . And now [I]109-lily must ask [you]109-lily to leave [me]109-lily — this scene has been extremely painful , and [I]109-lily have [my]109-lily own health to consider . Draw down the blinds , please ; and tell [Jennings]243-jennings [I]109-lily will see [no one]2766-no one this afternoon but [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney . ”[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily went up to [[her]109-lily own room]1393-her own room and bolted the door . [She]109-lily was trembling with fear and anger — the rush of the furies ’ wings was in [her]109-lily ears . [She]109-lily walked up and down [the room]351-the room with blind irregular steps . The last door of escape was closed — [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily shut in with [her]109-lily dishonour . Suddenly [her]109-lily wild pacing brought [her]109-lily before the clock on the chimney - piece . Its hands stood at half - past three , and [she]109-lily remembered that [Selden]108-selden was to come to [her]109-lily at four . [She]109-lily had meant to put [him]108-selden off with a word — but now [her]109-lily heart leaped at the thought of seeing [him]108-selden . Was there not a promise of rescue in [his]108-selden love ? As [she]109-lily had lain at [Gerty]112-gerty ’s side the night before , [she]109-lily had thought of [his]108-selden coming , and of the sweetness of weeping out [her]109-lily pain upon [his]108-selden breast . Of course [she]109-lily had meant to clear [herself]109-lily of its consequences before [she]109-lily met [him]108-selden — [she]109-lily had never really doubted that [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston would come to [her]109-lily aid . And [she]109-lily had felt , even in the full storm of [her]109-lily misery , that [Selden]108-selden ’s love could not be [her]109-lily ultimate refuge ; only it would be so sweet to take a moment ’s shelter there , while [she]109-lily gathered fresh strength to go on . But now [his]108-selden love was [her]109-lily only hope , and as [she]109-lily sat alone with [her]109-lily wretchedness the thought of confiding in [him]108-selden became as seductive as [the river]790-the river ’s flow to the suicide . The first plunge would be terrible — but afterward , what blessedness might come ! [She]109-lily remembered [Gerty]112-gerty ’s words : “ [I]112-gerty know [him]108-selden — [he]108-selden will help [you]109-lily ”[112-gerty] ; and [her]109-lily mind clung to them as [a sick person]1982-a sick person might cling to a healing relic . Oh , if [he]108-selden really understood — if [he]108-selden would help [her]109-lily to gather up [her]109-lily broken life , and put it together in some new semblance in which no trace of the past should remain ! [He]108-selden had always made [her]109-lily feel that [she]109-lily was worthy of better things , and [she]109-lily had never been in greater need of such solace . Once and again [she]109-lily shrank at the thought of imperilling [his]108-selden love by [her]109-lily confession : for love was what [she]109-lily needed — it would take the glow of passion to weld together the shattered fragments of [her]109-lily self - esteem . But [she]109-lily recurred to [Gerty]112-gerty ’s words and held fast to them . [She]109-lily was sure that [Gerty]112-gerty knew [Selden]108-selden ’s feeling for [her]109-lily , and it had never dawned upon [her]109-lily blindness that [Gerty]112-gerty ’s own judgment of [him]108-selden was coloured by emotions far more ardent than [her]109-lily own . Four o’clock found [her]109-lily in [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room : [she]109-lily was sure that [Selden]108-selden would be punctual . But the hour came and passed — it moved on feverishly , measured by [her]109-lily impatient heart - beats . [She]109-lily had time to take a fresh survey of [her]109-lily wretchedness , and to fluctuate anew between the impulse to confide in [Selden]108-selden and the dread of destroying [his]108-selden illusions . But as the minutes passed the need of throwing [herself]109-lily on [his]108-selden comprehension became more urgent : [she]109-lily could not bear the weight of [her]109-lily misery alone . There would be a perilous moment , perhaps : but could [she]109-lily not trust to [her]109-lily beauty to bridge it over , to land [her]109-lily safe in the shelter of [his]108-selden devotion ? But the hour sped on and [Selden]108-selden did not come . Doubtless [he]108-selden had been detained , or had misread [her]109-lily hurriedly scrawled note , taking the four for a five . The ringing of the door - bell a few minutes after five confirmed this supposition , and made [Lily]109-lily hastily resolve to write more legibly in future . The sound of steps in [the hall]533-the hall , and of [the butler]532-the butler ’s voice preceding [them]1986-them , poured fresh energy into [her]109-lily veins . [She]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily once more [the alert and competent moulder of emergencies]1987-the alert and competent moulder of emergencies , and the remembrance of [her]109-lily power over [Selden]108-selden flushed [her]109-lily with sudden confidence . But when the drawing - room door opened it was [Rosedale]124-rosedale who came in . The reaction caused [her]109-lily a sharp pang , but after a passing movement of irritation at the clumsiness of fate , and at [her]109-lily own carelessness in not denying the door to all but [Selden]108-selden , [she]109-lily controlled [herself]109-lily and greeted [Rosedale]124-rosedale amicably . It was annoying that [Selden]108-selden , when [he]108-selden came , should find [that particular visitor in possession]1988-that particular visitor in possession , but [Lily]109-lily was mistress of the art of ridding [herself]109-lily of superfluous company , and to [her]109-lily present mood [Rosedale]124-rosedale seemed distinctly negligible . [His]124-rosedale own view of the situation forced itself upon [her]109-lily after a few moments ’ conversation . [She]109-lily had caught at [the Brys]207-the wellington brys ’ entertainment as an easy impersonal subject , likely to tide [them]1989-them over the interval till [Selden]108-selden appeared , but [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , tenaciously planted beside the tea - table , [his]124-rosedale hands in [his]124-rosedale pockets , [his]124-rosedale legs a little too freely extended , at once gave the topic a personal turn . “ Pretty well done — well , yes , [I]124-rosedale suppose it was : [Welly Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s got [his]124-rosedale back up and do n’t mean to let go till [he]124-rosedale ’s got the hang of the thing . Of course , there were things here and there — things [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher could n’t be expected to see to — the champagne was n’t cold , and the coats got mixed in [the coat - room]1679-the coat - room . [I]124-rosedale would have spent more money on the music . But that ’s [my]124-rosedale character : if [I]124-rosedale want a thing [I]124-rosedale ’m willing to pay : [I]124-rosedale do n’t go up to the counter , and then wonder if the article ’s worth the price . [I]124-rosedale would n’t be satisfied to entertain like [the Welly Brys]199-the brys ; [I]124-rosedale ’d want something that would look more easy and natural , more as if [I]124-rosedale took it in [my]124-rosedale stride . And it takes just two things to do that , [Miss Bart]109-lily : money , and [the right woman to spend it]3537-the right woman to spend it . ”[124-rosedale] [He]124-rosedale paused , and examined [her]1990-her attentively while [she]1990-her affected to rearrange the tea - cups . “ [I]124-rosedale ’ve got the money , ”[124-rosedale] [he]124-rosedale continued , clearing [his]124-rosedale throat , “ and what [I]124-rosedale want is [the woman]366-the woman — and [I]124-rosedale mean to have [her]366-the woman too . ”[124-rosedale] [He]124-rosedale leaned forward a little , resting [his]124-rosedale hands on the head of [his]124-rosedale walking - stick . [He]124-rosedale had seen [men of [Ned Van Alstyne]177-van alstyne ’s type]1991-men of ned van alstyne ’s type bring [their]1991-men of ned van alstyne ’s type hats and sticks into [a drawing - room]1314-a drawing - room , and [he]124-rosedale thought it added a touch of elegant familiarity to [their]1991-men of ned van alstyne ’s type appearance . [Lily]109-lily was silent , smiling faintly , with [her]109-lily eyes absently resting on [his]124-rosedale face . [She]109-lily was in reality reflecting that a declaration would take some time to make , and that [Selden]108-selden must surely appear before the moment of refusal had been reached . [Her]109-lily brooding look , as of a mind withdrawn yet not averted , seemed to [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale full of a subtle encouragement . [He]124-rosedale would not have liked any evidence of eagerness . “ [I]124-rosedale mean to have [her]109-lily too , ”[124-rosedale] [he]124-rosedale repeated , with a laugh intended to strengthen [his]124-rosedale self - assurance . “ [I]124-rosedale generally HAVE got what [I]124-rosedale wanted in life , [Miss Bart]109-lily . [I]124-rosedale wanted money , and [I]124-rosedale ’ve got more than [I]124-rosedale know how to invest ; and now the money does n’t seem to be of any account unless [I]124-rosedale can spend it on [the right woman]3539-the right woman . That ’s what [I]124-rosedale want to do with it : [I]124-rosedale want [[my]124-rosedale wife]2959-my wife to make [all the other women]3186-all the other women feel small . [I]124-rosedale ’d never grudge a dollar that was spent on that . But it is n’t [every woman]3542-every woman can do it , no matter how much [you]3543-you spend on [her]3542-every woman . There was [a girl in some history book who wanted gold shields , or something]3544-a girl in some history book who wanted gold shields , or something , and [the fellows]3545-the fellows threw ’em at [her]3544-a girl in some history book who wanted gold shields , or something , and [she]3544-a girl in some history book who wanted gold shields , or something was crushed under ’em : [they]3545-the fellows killed [her]3544-a girl in some history book who wanted gold shields , or something . Well , that ’s true enough : [some women]1122-some women looked buried under [their]1122-some women jewelry . What [I]124-rosedale want is [a woman who ’ll hold [her]3547-a woman who ’ll hold her head higher the more diamonds i put on it head higher the more diamonds [I]124-rosedale put on it]3547-a woman who ’ll hold her head higher the more diamonds i put on it . And when [I]124-rosedale looked at [you]3543-you the other night at [the Brys ’]3548-the brys ’ , in that plain white dress , looking as if [you]3543-you had a crown on , [I]124-rosedale said to [myself]124-rosedale : ‘ By gad , if [she]3547-a woman who ’ll hold her head higher the more diamonds i put on it had one [she]3547-a woman who ’ll hold her head higher the more diamonds i put on it ’d wear it as if it grew on [her]3547-a woman who ’ll hold her head higher the more diamonds i put on it . ’ ”[124-rosedale] Still [Lily]109-lily did not speak , and [he]1993-you continued , warming with [his]1993-you theme : “ Tell [you]3543-you what it is , though , [that kind of woman]3549-that kind of woman costs more than all the rest of ’em put together . If [a woman]2771-a woman ’s going to ignore [her]2771-a woman pearls , [they]2771-a woman want to be better than anybody else’s — and so it is with everything else . [You]3543-you know what [I]1993-you mean — [you]3543-you know it ’s only the showy things that are cheap . Well , [I]1993-you should want [[my]1993-you wife]2959-my wife to be able to take [the earth]1058-the earth for granted if [she]2959-my wife wanted to . [I]1993-you know there ’s one thing vulgar about money , and that ’s the thinking about it ; and [[my]1993-you wife]2959-my wife would never have to demean [herself]2959-my wife in that way . ”[1993-you] [He]1993-you paused , and then added , with an unfortunate lapse to an earlier manner : “ [I]1993-you guess [you]109-lily know [the lady [I]1993-you ’ve got in view]3554-the lady i ’ve got in view , [Miss Bart]109-lily . ”[1993-you] [Lily]109-lily raised [her]109-lily head , brightening a little under the challenge . Even through the dark tumult of [her]109-lily thoughts , the clink of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s millions had a faintly seductive note . Oh , for enough of [them]1994-them to cancel [her]109-lily one miserable debt ! But [the man behind [them]1994-them]1995-the man behind them grew increasingly repugnant in the light of [Selden]108-selden ’s expected coming . The contrast was too grotesque : [she]109-lily could scarcely suppress the smile it provoked . [She]109-lily decided that directness would be best . “ If [you]1993-you mean [me]109-lily , [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , [I]109-lily am very grateful — very much flattered ; but [I]109-lily do n’t know what [I]109-lily have ever done to make [you]1993-you think — ”[109-lily] “ Oh , if [you]1993-you mean [you]1993-you ’re not dead in love with [me]1996-i , [I]1996-i ’ve got sense enough left to see that . And [I]1996-i ai n’t talking to [you]1993-you as if [you]1993-you were — [I]1996-i presume [I]1996-i know the kind of talk that ’s expected under those circumstances . [I]1996-i ’m confoundedly gone on [you]1993-you — that ’s about the size of it — and [I]1996-i ’m just giving [you]1993-you a plain business statement of the consequences . [You]1993-you ’re not very fond of [me]1996-i — YET — but [you]1993-you ’re fond of luxury , and style , and amusement , and of not having to worry about cash . [You]1993-you like to have a good time , and not have to settle for it ; and what [I]1996-i propose to do is to provide for the good time and do the settling . ”[1996-i] [He]1996-i paused , and [she]1997-you returned with a chilling smile : “ [You]1996-i are mistaken in one point , [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale : whatever [I]1997-you enjoy [I]1997-you am prepared to settle for . ”[1997-you] [She]1997-you spoke with the intention of making [him]1996-i see that , if [his]1996-i words implied a tentative allusion to [her]1997-you private affairs , [she]1997-you was prepared to meet and repudiate it . But if [he]1996-i recognized [her]1997-you meaning it failed to abash [him]1996-i , and [he]1996-i went on in the same tone : “ [I]1996-i did n’t mean to give offence ; excuse [me]1996-i if [I]1996-i ’ve spoken too plainly . But why ai n’t [you]1997-you straight with [me]1996-i — why do [you]1997-you put up that kind of bluff ? [You]1997-you know there ’ve been times when [you]1997-you were bothered — damned bothered — and as [a girl]2828-a girl gets older , and things keep moving along , why , before [she]2828-a girl knows it , the things [she]2828-a girl wants are liable to move past [her]2828-a girl and not come back . [I]1996-i do n’t say it ’s anywhere near that with [you]1997-you yet ; but [you]1997-you ’ve had a taste of bothers that [a girl like [yourself]1997-you]3556-a girl like yourself ought never to have known about , and what [I]1996-i ’m offering [you]1997-you is the chance to turn [your]1997-you back on [them]3557-them once for all . ”[1996-i] The colour burned in [Lily]109-lily ’s face as [he]1998-he ended ; there was no mistaking the point [he]1998-he meant to make , and to permit it to pass unheeded was a fatal confession of weakness , while to resent it too openly was to risk offending [him]1998-he at a perilous moment . Indignation quivered on [her]109-lily lip ; but it was quelled by the secret voice which warned [her]109-lily that [she]109-lily must not quarrel with [him]1998-he . [He]1998-he knew too much about [her]109-lily , and even at the moment when it was essential that [he]1998-he should show [himself]1998-he at [his]1998-he best , [he]1998-he did not scruple to let [her]109-lily see how much [he]1998-he knew . How then would [he]1998-he use [his]1998-he power when [her]109-lily expression of contempt had dispelled [his]1998-he one motive for restraint ? [Her]109-lily whole future might hinge on [her]109-lily way of answering [him]1998-he : [she]109-lily had to stop and consider that , in the stress of [her]109-lily other anxieties , as [a breathless fugitive]1999-a breathless fugitive may have to pause at [the cross - roads]2000-the cross - roads and try to decide coolly which turn to take . “ [You]1998-he are quite right , [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale . [I]2001-her HAVE had bothers ; and [I]2001-her am grateful to [you]1998-he for wanting to relieve [me]2001-her of [them]3558-them . It is not always easy to be quite independent and self - respecting when one is poor and lives among [rich people]3001-rich people ; [I]2001-her have been careless about money , and have worried about [my]2001-her bills . But [I]2001-her should be selfish and ungrateful if [I]2001-her made that a reason for accepting all [you]1998-he offer , with no better return to make than the desire to be free from [my]2001-her anxieties . [You]1998-he must give [me]2001-her time — time to think of [your]1998-he kindness — and of what [I]2001-her could give [you]1998-he in return for it — — ”[2001-her] [She]2001-her held out [her]2001-her hand with a charming gesture in which dismissal was shorn of its rigour . Its hint of future leniency made [Rosedale]124-rosedale rise in obedience to it , a little flushed with [his]124-rosedale unhoped - for success , and disciplined by the tradition of [his]124-rosedale blood to accept what was conceded , without undue haste to press for more . Something in [his]124-rosedale prompt acquiescence frightened [her]2001-her ; [she]2001-her felt behind it the stored force of a patience that might subdue the strongest will . But at least [they]2002-they had parted amicably , and [he]124-rosedale was out of [the house]488-the house without meeting [Selden]108-selden — [Selden]108-selden , whose continued absence now smote [her]2001-her with a new alarm . [Rosedale]124-rosedale had remained over an hour , and [she]2001-her understood that it was now too late to hope for [Selden]108-selden . [He]124-rosedale would write explaining [his]124-rosedale absence , of course ; there would be a note from [him]124-rosedale by the late post . But [her]2001-her confession would have to be postponed ; and the chill of the delay settled heavily on [her]2001-her fagged spirit . It lay heavier when [the postman]2004-the postman ’s last ring brought no note for [her]2001-her , and [she]2001-her had to go [upstairs]2873-upstairs to a lonely night — a night as grim and sleepless as [her]2001-her tortured fancy had pictured it to [Gerty]112-gerty . [She]2001-her had never learned to live with [her]2001-her own thoughts , and to be confronted with [them]2006-them through such hours of lucid misery made the confused wretchedness of [her]2001-her previous vigil seem easily bearable . [Daylight]244-daylight disbanded [the phantom crew]2007-the phantom crew , and made it clear to [her]2001-her that [she]2001-her would hear from [Selden]108-selden before noon ; but the day passed without [his]108-selden writing or coming . [Lily]109-lily remained at [home]400-home , lunching and dining alone with [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt , who complained of flutterings of the heart , and talked icily on general topics . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston went to bed early , and when [she]114-mrs. peniston had gone [Lily]109-lily sat down and wrote a note to [Selden]108-selden . [She]109-lily was about to ring for [a messenger]2010-a messenger to despatch it when [her]109-lily eye fell on a paragraph in the evening paper which lay at [her]109-lily elbow : “ [Mr. Lawrence Selden]108-selden was among the passengers sailing this afternoon for [Havana]51-havana and [the West Indies]52-the west indies on the [Windward Liner Antilles]53-windward liner antilles . ”[109-lily] [She]109-lily laid down the paper and sat motionless , staring at [her]109-lily note . [She]109-lily understood now that [he]108-selden was never coming — that [he]108-selden had gone away because [he]108-selden was afraid that [he]108-selden might come . [She]109-lily rose , and walking across the floor stood gazing at [herself]109-lily for a long time in the brightly lit mirror above the mantelpiece . The lines in [her]109-lily face came out terribly — [she]109-lily looked old ; and when [a girl]2828-a girl looks old to [herself]2828-a girl , how does [she]2828-a girl look to [other people]563-other people ? [She]109-lily moved away , and began to wander aimlessly about [the room]351-the room , fitting [her]109-lily steps with mechanical precision between the monstrous roses of [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s [Axminster]54-axminster]2014-mrs. peniston ’s axminster . Suddenly [she]109-lily noticed that the pen with which [she]109-lily had written to [Selden]108-selden still rested against the uncovered inkstand . [She]109-lily seated [herself]109-lily again , and taking out an envelope , addressed it rapidly to [Rosedale]124-rosedale . Then [she]109-lily laid out a sheet of paper , and sat over it with suspended pen . It had been easy enough to write the date , and “ [Dear Mr. Rosedale”—but]3560-dear mr. rosedale”—but[109-lily] after that [her]109-lily inspiration flagged . [She]109-lily meant to tell [him]108-selden to come to [her]109-lily , but the words refused to shape themselves . At length [she]109-lily began : “ [I]109-lily have been thinking — — ”[109-lily] then [she]109-lily laid the pen down , and sat with [her]109-lily elbows on the table and [her]109-lily face hidden in [her]109-lily hands . Suddenly [she]109-lily started up at the sound of the door - bell . It was not late — barely ten o’clock — and there might still be a note from [Selden]108-selden , or a message — or [he]108-selden might be there [himself]108-selden , on the other side of the door ! The announcement of [his]108-selden sailing might have been a mistake — it might be another [Lawrence Selden]108-selden who had gone to [Havana]51-havana — all these possibilities had time to flash through [her]109-lily mind , and build up the conviction that [she]109-lily was after all to see or hear from [him]108-selden , before the drawing - room door opened to admit [a servant]2015-a servant carrying a telegram . [Lily]109-lily tore it open with shaking hands , and read [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s name below the message : “ Sailing unexpectedly tomorrow . Will [you]108-selden join [us]3561-us on a cruise in [Mediterranean]55-mediterranean ? ”[133-bertha] BOOK TWO Chapter 1 It came vividly to [Selden]108-selden on the Casino steps that [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo had , more than [any other place [he]108-selden knew]2016-any other place he knew , the gift of accommodating itself to [each man]797-each man ’s humour . [His]108-selden own , at the moment , lent [it]2018-it a festive readiness of welcome that might well , in a disenchanted eye , have turned to paint and facility . So frank an appeal for participation — so outspoken a recognition of the holiday vein in human nature — struck refreshingly on a mind jaded by prolonged hard work in surroundings made for the discipline of the senses . As [he]108-selden surveyed [the white square set in an exotic coquetry of architecture]2019-the white square set in an exotic coquetry of architecture , the studied tropicality of [the gardens]787-the gardens , the groups loitering in the foreground against [mauve mountains]2021-mauve mountains which suggested a sublime stage - setting forgotten in a hurried shifting of scenes — as [he]108-selden took in the whole outspread effect of light and leisure , [he]108-selden felt a movement of revulsion from the last few months of [his]108-selden life . The [New York]6-new york winter had presented an interminable perspective of snow - burdened days , reaching toward a spring of raw sunshine and furious air , when the ugliness of things rasped the eye as the gritty wind ground into the skin . [Selden]108-selden , immersed in [his]108-selden work , had told [himself]108-selden that external conditions did not matter to [a man in [his]108-selden state]2022-a man in his state , and that cold and ugliness were a good tonic for relaxed sensibilities . When an urgent case summoned [him]108-selden abroad to confer with [a client in [Paris]24-paris]2023-a client in paris , [he]108-selden broke reluctantly with the routine of [the office]2024-the office ; and it was only now that , having despatched [his]108-selden business , and slipped away for a week in [the south]2025-the south , [he]108-selden began to feel the renewed zest of spectatorship that is the solace of [those who take an objective interest in life]2026-those who take an objective interest in life . The multiplicity of its appeals — the perpetual surprise of its contrasts and resemblances ! All these tricks and turns of the show were upon [him]108-selden with a spring as [he]108-selden descended [the Casino steps]2027-the casino steps and paused on [the pavement at [its]2027-the casino steps doors]2028-the pavement at its doors . [He]108-selden had not been abroad for seven years — and what changes the renewed contact produced ! If the central depths were untouched , hardly a pin - point of surface remained the same . And this was the very place to bring out the completeness of the renewal . The sublimities , the perpetuities , might have left [him]108-selden as [he]108-selden was : but [this tent]2029-this tent pitched for a day ’s revelry spread a roof of oblivion between [himself]108-selden and [his]108-selden fixed sky . It was mid - April , and one felt that the revelry had reached its climax and that [the desultory groups in [the square and gardens]2031-the square and gardens]2030-the desultory groups in the square and gardens would soon dissolve and reform in other scenes . Meanwhile the last moments of the performance seemed to gain an added brightness from the hovering threat of the curtain . The quality of the air , the exuberance of the flowers , the blue intensity of [sea]2032-sea and sky , produced the effect of a closing TABLEAU , when all the lights are turned on at once . This impression was presently heightened by the way in which [a consciously conspicuous group of people]2033-a consciously conspicuous group of people advanced to the middle front , and stood before [Selden]108-selden with the air of [the chief performers gathered together by the exigencies of the final effect]2034-the chief performers gathered together by the exigencies of the final effect . [Their]2033-a consciously conspicuous group of people appearance confirmed the impression that the show had been staged regardless of expense , and emphasized its resemblance to one of those “ costume - plays ”[108-selden] in which [the protagonists]2035-the protagonists walk through the passions without displacing a drapery . [The ladies]832-the ladies stood in unrelated attitudes calculated to isolate [their]832-the ladies effects , and [the men]831-the men hung about [them]832-the ladies as irrelevantly as [stage heroes whose tailors are named in the programme]2038-stage heroes whose tailors are named in the programme . [He]108-selden was vaguely aware that [Miss Bart]109-lily was cruising in [the Mediterranean]55-mediterranean with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets , but it had not occurred to [him]108-selden that there was any chance of running across [her]109-lily on [the Riviera]2070-the riviera , where the season was virtually at an end . As [he]108-selden leaned back , silently contemplating [his]108-selden filigree cup of Turkish coffee , [he]108-selden was trying to put some order in [his]108-selden thoughts , to tell [himself]108-selden how the news of [her]109-lily nearness was really affecting [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden had a personal detachment enabling [him]108-selden , even in moments of emotional high - pressure , to get a fairly clear view of [his]108-selden feelings , and [he]108-selden was sincerely surprised by the disturbance which the sight of [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina had produced in [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden had reason to think that [his]108-selden three months of engrossing professional work , following on the sharp shock of [his]108-selden disillusionment , had cleared [his]108-selden mind of its sentimental vapours . The feeling [he]108-selden had nourished and given prominence to was one of thankfulness for [his]108-selden escape : [he]108-selden was like [a traveller]2071-a traveller so grateful for rescue from a dangerous accident that at first [he]108-selden is hardly conscious of [his]108-selden bruises . Now [he]108-selden suddenly felt the latent ache , and realized that after all [he]108-selden had not come off unhurt . An hour later , at [[Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s side in [the Casino gardens]2073-the casino gardens]2072-mrs. fisher ’s side in the casino gardens , [he]108-selden was trying to find fresh reasons for forgetting the injury received in the contemplation of the peril avoided . [The party]436-the party had dispersed with the loitering indecision characteristic of social movements at [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo , where [the whole place]3584-the whole place , and the long gilded hours of the day , seem to offer an infinity of ways of being idle . [Lord Hubert Dacey]176-lord hubert had finally gone off in quest of [the Duchess of Beltshire]2076-the duchess of beltshire , charged by [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry with the delicate negotiation of securing [that lady]486-that lady ’s presence at dinner , [the Stepneys]204-the stepneys had left for [Nice]66-nice in [[their]204-the stepneys [motor - car]525-motor - car]2078-their motor - car , and [Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry had departed to take [his]245-mr. bry place in the pigeon shooting match which was at the moment engaging [his]245-mr. bry highest faculties . [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry , who had a tendency to grow red and stertorous after luncheon , had been judiciously prevailed upon by [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher to withdraw to [[her]146-carry fisher hotel]2080-her hotel for an hour ’s repose ; and [Selden]108-selden and [[his]108-selden companion]1066-his companion were thus left to a stroll propitious to confidences . The stroll soon resolved itself into a tranquil session on a bench overhung with laurel and Banksian roses , from which [they]204-the stepneys caught a dazzle of blue sea between marble balusters , and the fiery shafts of cactus - blossoms shooting meteor - like from the rock . The soft shade of [their]204-the stepneys niche , and the adjacent glitter of the air , were conducive to an easy lounging mood , and to the smoking of many cigarettes ; and [Selden]108-selden , yielding to these influences , suffered [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher to unfold to [him]108-selden the history of [her]146-carry fisher recent experiences . [She]135-mrs. fisher had come abroad with [the Welly Brys]199-the brys at the moment when fashion flees the inclemency of the [New York]6-new york spring . [The Brys]199-the brys , intoxicated by [their]199-the brys first success , already thirsted for new kingdoms , and [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , viewing [the Riviera]67-the riviera as an easy introduction to [London]13-london society , had guided [their]199-the brys course thither . [She]135-mrs. fisher had affiliations of [her]135-mrs. fisher own in [every capital]2082-every capital , and a facility for picking [them]199-the brys up again after long absences ; and the carefully disseminated rumour of [the Brys]199-the brys ’ wealth had at once gathered about [them]199-the brys [a group of [cosmopolitan pleasure - seekers]2084-cosmopolitan pleasure - seekers]2083-a group of cosmopolitan pleasure - seekers . “ But things are not going as well as [I]135-mrs. fisher expected , ”[135-mrs. fisher] [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher frankly admitted . “ It ’s all very well to say that every body with money can get into society ; but it would be truer to say that NEARLY [everybody]2995-everybody can . [HE]3597-his would get on well enough if [she]135-mrs. fisher ’d let [him]3597-his alone ; [they]199-the brys like [his]3597-his slang and [his]3597-his brag and [his]3597-his blunders .
