If [she]135-mrs. fisher ’d be natural [herself]135-mrs. fisher — fat and vulgar and bouncing — it would be all right ; but as soon as [she]135-mrs. fisher meets [anybody smart]3598-anybody smart [she]135-mrs. fisher tries to be slender and queenly . [She]135-mrs. fisher tried it with [the Duchess of [Beltshire]27-beltshire]2076-the duchess of beltshire and [Lady Skiddaw]149-lady skiddaw , and [they]199-the brys fled . [I]135-mrs. fisher ’ve done [my]135-mrs. fisher best to make [her]135-mrs. fisher see [her]135-mrs. fisher mistake — [I’ve]135-mrs. fisher said to [her]135-mrs. fisher again and again : ‘ Just let [yourself]135-mrs. fisher go , [Louisa]215-louisa ’ ; but [she]135-mrs. fisher keeps up the humbug even with [me]135-mrs. fisher — [I]135-mrs. fisher believe [she]135-mrs. fisher keeps on being queenly in [[her]135-mrs. fisher own room]1393-her own room , with the door shut . “[135-mrs. fisher] The worst of it is , ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher went on , “[2085-she] that [she]2085-she thinks it ’s all [MY]0-i fault . When [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets turned up here six weeks ago , and [everybody]2995-everybody began to make a fuss about [Lily Bart]109-lily , [I]0-i could see [Louisa]215-louisa thought that if [she]2085-she ’d had [Lily]109-lily in tow instead of [me]0-i [she]2085-she would have been hob - nobbing with all the royalties by this time . [She]2085-she does n’t realize that it ’s [Lily]109-lily ’s beauty that does it : [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert tells [me]0-i [Lily]109-lily is thought even handsomer than when [he]176-lord hubert knew [her]109-lily at [Aix]50-aix ten years ago . It seems [she]109-lily was tremendously admired [there]2755-there . [An Italian Prince , rich and the real thing]2088-an italian prince , rich and the real thing , wanted to marry [her]109-lily ; but just at the critical moment [a good - looking step - son]2089-a good - looking step - son turned up , and [Lily]109-lily was silly enough to flirt with [him]2089-a good - looking step - son while [her]109-lily marriage - settlements with [the step - father]2090-the step - father were being drawn up . [Some people]3161-some people said [the young man]483-the young man did it on purpose . [You]2093-you can fancy the scandal : there was an awful row between [the men]831-the men , and [people]2804-people began to look at [Lily]109-lily so queerly that [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston had to pack up and finish [her]114-mrs. peniston cure elsewhere . Not that [SHE]114-mrs. peniston ever understood : to this day [she]114-mrs. peniston thinks that [Aix]50-aix did n’t suit [her]114-mrs. peniston , and mentions [her]109-lily having been sent [there]2755-there as proof of the incompetence of [French doctors]2097-french doctors . That ’s [Lily]109-lily all over , [you]2093-you know : [she]109-lily works like [a slave]2098-a slave preparing the ground and sowing [her]109-lily seed ; but the day [she]109-lily ought to be reaping the harvest [she]109-lily over - sleeps [herself]109-lily or goes off on a picnic . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher paused and looked reflectively at the deep shimmer of sea between the cactus - flowers . “[109-lily] Sometimes , ” [she]0-i added , “[109-lily] [I]0-i think it ’s just flightiness — and sometimes [I]0-i think it ’s because , at heart , [she]114-mrs. peniston despises the things [she]114-mrs. peniston ’s trying for . And it ’s the difficulty of deciding that makes [her]114-mrs. peniston such an interesting study . ” [She]0-i glanced tentatively at [Selden]108-selden ’s motionless profile , and resumed with a slight sigh : “[114-mrs. peniston] Well , all [I]0-i can say is , [I]0-i wish [she]114-mrs. peniston ’d give [ME]0-i some of [her]114-mrs. peniston discarded opportunities . [I]0-i wish [we]2099-we could change places now , for instance . [She]114-mrs. peniston could make a very good thing out of [the Brys]199-the brys if [she]114-mrs. peniston managed them properly , and [I]0-i should know just how to look after [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset while [Bertha]133-bertha is reading [Verlaine]251-verlaine with [Neddy Silverton]252-young silverton . ” [She]0-i met [Selden]108-selden ’s sound of protest with a sharp derisive glance . “[252-young silverton] Well , what ’s the use of mincing matters ? [We]2099-we all know that ’s what [Bertha]133-bertha brought [her]133-bertha abroad for . When [Bertha]133-bertha wants to have a good time [she]133-bertha has to provide occupation for [George]131-mrs. dorset . At first [I]0-i thought [Lily]109-lily was going to play [her]109-lily cards well THIS time , but there are rumours that [Bertha]133-bertha is jealous of [her]133-bertha success here and at [Cannes]62-cannes , and [I]0-i should n’t be surprised if there were a break any day . [Lily]109-lily ’s only safeguard is that [Bertha]133-bertha needs [her]109-lily badly — oh , very badly . [The Silverton]252-young silverton affair is in the acute stage : it ’s necessary that [George]131-mrs. dorset ’s attention should be pretty continuously distracted . And [I]0-i ’m bound to say [Lily]109-lily DOES distract it : [I]0-i believe [he]2100-he ’d marry [her]109-lily tomorrow if [he]2100-he found out there was anything wrong with [Bertha]133-bertha . But [you]2101-you know [him]2100-he — [he]2100-he ’s as blind as [he]2100-he ’s jealous ; and of course [Lily]109-lily ’s present business is to keep [him]2100-he blind . [A clever woman]2102-a clever woman might know just the right moment to tear off the bandage : but [Lily]109-lily is n’t clever in that way , and when [George]131-mrs. dorset does open [his]2100-he eyes [she]109-lily ’ll probably contrive not to be in [his]2100-he line of vision . ” [Selden]108-selden tossed away [his]108-selden cigarette . “[109-lily] By [Jove]169-jove — it ’s time for [[my]0-i train]2103-my train , ” [he]108-selden exclaimed , with a glance at [his]108-selden watch ; adding , in reply to [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s surprised comment—“Why[169-jove] , [I]0-i thought of course [you]2104-you were at [Monte!”—a]253-monte!”—a murmured word to the effect that [he]108-selden was making [Nice]66-nice [his]108-selden head - quarters . “[169-jove] The worst of it is , [she]109-lily snubs [the Brys]199-the brys now , ” [he]108-selden heard irrelevantly flung after [him]108-selden . Ten minutes later , in [the high - perched bedroom of [an hotel overlooking [the Casino]3603-the casino]3602-an hotel overlooking the casino]3601-the high - perched bedroom of an hotel overlooking the casino , [he]108-selden was tossing [his]108-selden effects into a couple of gaping portmanteaux , while [the porter]2853-the porter waited outside to transport [them]3605-them to [the cab]1750-the cab at the door . It took but a brief plunge down [the steep white road]3607-the steep white road to [the station]319-the station to land [him]108-selden safely in the afternoon express for [Nice]66-nice ; and not till [he]108-selden was installed in the corner of [an empty carriage]3609-an empty carriage , did [he]108-selden exclaim to [himself]108-selden , with a reaction of self - contempt : “[109-lily] What the deuce am [I]0-i running away from ? ” The pertinence of the question checked [Selden]108-selden ’s fugitive impulse before [the train]2843-the train had started . It was ridiculous to be flying like [an emotional coward]3611-an emotional coward from an infatuation [his]108-selden reason had conquered . [He]108-selden had instructed [[his]108-selden bankers]3612-his bankers to forward some important business letters to [Nice]66-nice , and at [Nice]66-nice [he]108-selden would quietly await [them]3612-his bankers . [He]108-selden was already annoyed with [himself]108-selden for having left [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo , where [he]108-selden had intended to pass the week which remained to [him]108-selden before sailing ; but it would now be difficult to return on [his]108-selden steps without an appearance of inconsistency from which [his]108-selden pride recoiled . In [his]108-selden inmost heart [he]108-selden was not sorry to put [himself]108-selden beyond the probability of meeting [Miss Bart]109-lily . Completely as [he]108-selden had detached [himself]108-selden from [her]109-lily , [he]108-selden could not yet regard [her]109-lily merely as a social instance ; and viewed in a more personal ways [she]109-lily was not likely to be a reassuring object of study . Chance encounters , or even the repeated mention of [her]109-lily name , would send [his]108-selden thoughts back into grooves from which [he]108-selden had resolutely detached them ; whereas , if [she]109-lily could be entirely excluded from [his]108-selden life , the pressure of new and varied impressions , with which no thought of [her]109-lily was connected , would soon complete the work of separation . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s conversation had , indeed , operated to that end ; but the treatment was too painful to be voluntarily chosen while milder remedies were untried ; and [Selden]108-selden thought [he]108-selden could trust [himself]108-selden to return gradually to a reasonable view of [Miss Bart]109-lily , if only [he]108-selden did not see [her]109-lily . Having reached [the station]319-the station early , [he]108-selden had arrived at this point in [his]108-selden reflections before the increasing throng on [the platform]309-the platform warned [him]108-selden that [he]108-selden could not hope to preserve [his]108-selden privacy ; the next moment there was a hand on the door , and [he]108-selden turned to confront the very face [he]108-selden was fleeing . [Miss Bart]109-lily , glowing with the haste of a precipitate descent upon [the train]2843-the train , headed [a group composed of [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets]3616-a group composed of the dorsets , [young Silverton]252-young silverton and [Lord Hubert Dacey]176-lord hubert , who had barely time to spring into [the carriage]420-the carriage , and envelop [Selden]108-selden in ejaculations of surprise and welcome , before the whistle of departure sounded . [The party]436-the party , it appeared , were hastening to [Nice]66-nice in response to a sudden summons to dine with [the Duchess of [Beltshire]27-beltshire]2076-the duchess of beltshire and to see the water - fete in [the bay]2065-the bay ; a plan evidently improvised — in spite of [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert ’s protesting “[109-lily] Oh , [I]0-i say , [you]2105-you know,”—for the express purpose of defeating [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s endeavour to capture [the Duchess]3567-the duchess . During the laughing relation of this manoeuvre , [Selden]108-selden had time for a rapid impression of [Miss Bart]109-lily , who had seated [herself]109-lily opposite to [him]108-selden in the golden afternoon light . Scarcely three months had elapsed since [he]108-selden had parted from [her]109-lily on the threshold of [[the Brys]199-the brys ’ conservatory]3622-the brys ’ conservatory ; but a subtle change had passed over the quality of [her]109-lily beauty . Then it had had a transparency through which the fluctuations of the spirit were sometimes tragically visible ; now its impenetrable surface suggested a process of crystallization which had fused [her]109-lily whole being into one hard brilliant substance . The change had struck [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher as a rejuvenation : to [Selden]108-selden it seemed like that moment of pause and arrest when the warm fluidity of [youth]624-youth is chilled into its final shape . [He]108-selden felt it in the way [she]109-lily smiled on [him]108-selden , and in the readiness and competence with which , flung unexpectedly into [his]108-selden presence , [she]109-lily took up the thread of [their]3624-their intercourse as though that thread had not been snapped with a violence from which [he]108-selden still reeled . Such facility sickened [him]108-selden — but [he]108-selden told [himself]108-selden that it was with the pang which precedes recovery . Now [he]108-selden would really get well — would eject the last drop of poison from [his]108-selden blood . Already [he]108-selden felt [himself]108-selden calmer in [her]109-lily presence than [he]108-selden had learned to be in the thought of [her]109-lily . [Her]109-lily assumptions and elisions , [her]109-lily short - cuts and long DETOURS , the skill with which [she]109-lily contrived to meet [him]108-selden at a point from which no inconvenient glimpses of the past were visible , suggested what opportunities [she]109-lily had had for practising such arts since [their]3624-their last meeting . [He]108-selden felt that [she]109-lily had at last arrived at an understanding with [herself]109-lily : had made a pact with [her]109-lily rebellious impulses , and achieved a uniform system of self - government , under which all vagrant tendencies were either held captive or forced into the service of [the state]3625-the state . And [he]108-selden saw other things too in [her]109-lily manner : saw how it had adjusted itself to the hidden intricacies of a situation in which , even after [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s elucidating flashes , [he]108-selden still felt [himself]108-selden agrope . Surely [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher could no longer charge [Miss Bart]109-lily with neglecting [her]135-mrs. fisher opportunities ! To [Selden]108-selden ’s exasperated observation [she]109-lily was only too completely alive to [them]3624-their . [She]109-lily was “[0-i] perfect ” to [every one]693-every one : subservient to [Bertha]133-bertha ’s anxious predominance , good - naturedly watchful of [Dorset]133-bertha ’s moods , brightly companionable to [Silverton]252-young silverton and [Dacey]176-lord hubert , the latter of whom met [her]109-lily on an evident footing of old admiration , while [young Silverton]252-young silverton , portentously self - absorbed , seemed conscious of [her]109-lily only as of something vaguely obstructive . And suddenly , as [Selden]108-selden noted the fine shades of manner by which [she]109-lily harmonized [herself]109-lily with [her]109-lily surroundings , it flashed on [him]108-selden that , to need such adroit handling , the situation must indeed be desperate . [She]109-lily was on the edge of something — that was the impression left with [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden seemed to see [her]109-lily poised on the brink of [a chasm]3627-a chasm , with one graceful foot advanced to assert [her]109-lily unconsciousness that the ground was failing [her]109-lily . On [the Promenade des Anglais]3628-the promenade des anglais , where [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton hung on [him]108-selden for the half hour before dinner , [he]108-selden received a deeper impression of the general insecurity . [Silverton]134-ned silverton was in a mood of Titanic pessimism . How [any one]442-any one could come to such a damned hole as [the Riviera]67-the riviera — [any one with a grain of imagination — with the whole Mediterranean to choose from]3630-any one with a grain of imagination — with the whole mediterranean to choose from : but then , if [one]2737-one ’s estimate of [a place]3632-a place depended on the way [they]2737-one broiled a spring chicken ! Gad ! what a study might be made of the tyranny of the stomach — the way a sluggish liver or insufficient gastric juices might affect the whole course of [the universe]622-the universe , overshadow everything in reach — chronic dyspepsia ought to be among the “[169-jove] statutory causes ” ; [a woman]2771-a woman ’s life might be ruined by [a man]2811-a man ’s inability to digest fresh bread . Grotesque ? Yes — and tragic — like most absurdities . There ’s nothing grimmer than the tragedy that wears a comic mask .... Where was [he]108-selden ? Oh — the reason [they]2737-one chucked [Sicily]61-sicily and rushed back ? Well — partly , no doubt , [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s desire to get back to [bridge]3048-bridge and smartness . Dead as a stone to art and poetry — the light never WAS on [sea]2032-sea or [land]3638-land for [her]109-lily ! And of course [she]109-lily persuaded [Dorset]133-bertha that the Italian food was bad for [him]108-selden . Oh , [she]109-lily could make [him]108-selden believe anything — ANYTHING ! [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was aware of it — oh , perfectly : nothing [SHE]131-mrs. dorset did n’t see ! But [she]131-mrs. dorset could hold [her]131-mrs. dorset tongue — [she’d]131-mrs. dorset had to , often enough . Ah — and there were [the ladies]832-the ladies signalling from [the balcony of [the hotel]3643-the hotel]3642-the balcony of the hotel .... [He]108-selden plunged across [the Promenade]3644-the promenade , leaving [Selden]108-selden to a meditative cigar . The conclusions it led [him]108-selden to were fortified , later in the evening , by some of those faint corroborative hints that generate a light of their own in the dusk of a doubting mind . [Selden]108-selden , stumbling on [a chance acquaintance]3645-a chance acquaintance , had dined with [him]108-selden , and adjourned , still in [his]108-selden company , to [the brightly lit Promenade]3646-the brightly lit promenade , where a line of crowded stands commanded the glittering darkness of [the waters]3647-the waters . The night was soft and persuasive . Overhead hung a summer sky furrowed with the rush of rockets ; and from the east a late moon , pushing up beyond [the lofty bend of the coast]3648-the lofty bend of the coast , sent across [the bay]2065-the bay a shaft of brightness which paled to ashes in the red glitter of [the illuminated boats]3650-the illuminated boats . Down [the lantern - hung Promenade]3651-the lantern - hung promenade , snatches of band - music floated above the hum of [the crowd]308-the crowd and the soft tossing of boughs in [dusky gardens]3653-dusky gardens ; and between [these gardens]3654-these gardens and the backs of [the stands]3655-the stands there flowed a stream of [people in whom the vociferous carnival mood seemed tempered by the growing languor of the season]3656-people in whom the vociferous carnival mood seemed tempered by the growing languor of the season . [Selden]108-selden and [[his]108-selden companion]1066-his companion , unable to get seats on [one of the stands facing [the bay]2065-the bay]3658-one of the stands facing the bay , had wandered for a while with [the throng]1653-the throng , and then found a point of vantage on [a high garden - parapet above [the Promenade]3644-the promenade]3661-a high garden - parapet above the promenade . [Long garden]3670-long garden - walls overhung by trees made a dark boundary to [the pavement]3668-the pavement ; [an empty cab]3672-an empty cab trailed along [the deserted thoroughfare]3673-the deserted thoroughfare , and presently [Selden]108-selden saw [two persons]3674-two persons emerge from the opposite shadows , signal to [the cab]1750-the cab , and drive off in [it]1750-the cab toward [the centre of [the town]3677-the town]3676-the centre of the town . Beneath the nearest lamp - post [he]108-selden glanced at [his]108-selden watch and saw that the time was close on eleven . [He]108-selden took [another cross street]3679-another cross street , and without breasting [the throng on [the Promenade]3644-the promenade]3680-the throng on the promenade , made [his]108-selden way to [the fashionable club which overlooks [that thoroughfare]3683-that thoroughfare]3682-the fashionable club which overlooks that thoroughfare . Here , amid the blaze of crowded baccarat tables , [he]108-selden caught sight of [Lord Hubert Dacey]176-lord hubert , seated with [his]176-lord hubert habitual worn smile behind a rapidly dwindling heap of gold . The heap being in due course wiped out , [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert rose with a shrug , and joining [Selden]108-selden , adjourned with [him]108-selden to [the deserted terrace of [the club]3260-the club]3684-the deserted terrace of the club . It was now past midnight , and [the throng on the stands]3686-the throng on the stands was dispersing , while the long trails of red - lit boats scattered and faded beneath a sky repossessed by the tranquil splendour of the moon . [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert looked at [his]176-lord hubert watch . “[169-jove] By [Jove]169-jove , [I]0-i promised to join [the Duchess]3567-the duchess for supper at [the LONDON HOUSE]2107-the london house ; but it ’s past twelve , and [I]0-i suppose [they]2108-they ’ve all scattered . The fact is , [I]0-i lost [them]2108-they in [the crowd]308-the crowd soon after dinner , and took refuge here , for [my]0-i sins . [They]2108-they had seats on one of the stands , but of course [they]2108-they could n’t stop quiet : [the Duchess]3567-the duchess never can . [She]3567-the duchess and [Miss Bart]109-lily went off in quest of what [they]2108-they call adventures — gad , it ai n’t [their]2108-they fault if [they]2108-they do n’t have [some queer ones]2111-some queer ones ! ” [He]2113-he added tentatively , after pausing to grope for a cigarette : “[2111-some queer ones] [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s [an old friend of [yours]2113-he]2112-an old friend of yours , [I]0-i believe ? So [she]3567-the duchess told [me.—Ah]2113-he , thanks — [I]0-i do n’t seem to have one left . ” [He]2113-he lit [Selden]108-selden ’s proffered cigarette , and continued , in [his]2113-he high - pitched drawling tone : “[3567-the duchess] None of [my]0-i business , of course , but [I]0-i did n’t introduce [her]3567-the duchess to [the Duchess]3567-the duchess . [Charming woman]2115-charming woman , [the Duchess]3567-the duchess , [you]2113-he understand ; and [a very good friend of mine]2117-a very good friend of mine ; but RATHER a liberal education . ” [Selden]108-selden received this in silence , and after a few puffs [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert broke out again : “[3567-the duchess] Sort of thing one ca n’t communicate to [the young lady]1349-the young lady — though [young ladies]2119-young ladies nowadays are so competent to judge for [themselves]2119-young ladies ; but in this case — I’m [an old friend]2120-an old friend too , [you]2113-he know . . . and there seemed [no one else]703-no one else to speak to . The whole situation ’s a little mixed , as [I]0-i see it — but there used to be [an aunt somewhere]2122-an aunt somewhere , [a diffuse and innocent person]2123-a diffuse and innocent person , who was great at bridging over chasms [she]2122-an aunt somewhere did n’t see .... Ah , in [New York]6-new york , is [she]2122-an aunt somewhere ? Pity [New York]6-new york ’s such a long way off ! ” Chapter 2 [Miss Bart]109-lily , emerging late the next morning from [[her]109-lily cabin]3687-her cabin , found [herself]109-lily alone on [the deck of [the Sabrina]3689-the sabrina]3688-the deck of the sabrina . The cushioned chairs , disposed expectantly under the wide awning , showed no signs of recent occupancy , and [she]109-lily presently learned from [a steward]3690-a steward that [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset had not yet appeared , and that [the gentlemen]3211-the gentlemen — separately — had gone ashore as soon as [they]3211-the gentlemen had breakfasted . Supplied with these facts , [Lily]109-lily leaned awhile over the side , giving [herself]109-lily up to a leisurely enjoyment of the spectacle before [her]109-lily . Unclouded sunlight enveloped [sea]2032-sea and [shore]3693-shore in a bath of purest radiancy . The purpling waters drew a sharp white line of foam at the base of [the shore]1930-the shore ; against its irregular eminences , [hotels]498-hotels and [villas]3696-villas flashed from the greyish verdure of olive and eucalyptus ; and the background of bare and finely - pencilled mountains quivered in a pale intensity of light . How beautiful it was — and how [she]109-lily loved beauty ! [She]109-lily had always felt that [her]109-lily sensibility in this direction made up for certain obtusenesses of feeling of which [she]109-lily was less proud ; and during the last three months [she]109-lily had indulged it passionately . [The Dorsets]122-the dorsets ’ invitation to go abroad with [them]3211-the gentlemen had come as an almost miraculous release from crushing difficulties ; and [her]109-lily faculty for renewing [herself]109-lily in new scenes , and casting off problems of conduct as easily as the surroundings in which [they]3211-the gentlemen had arisen , made the mere change from [one place]3697-one place to another seem , not merely a postponement , but a solution of [her]109-lily troubles . Moral complications existed for [her]109-lily only in the environment that had produced [them]3211-the gentlemen ; [she]109-lily did not mean to slight or ignore [them]3211-the gentlemen , but [they]3211-the gentlemen lost [their]3211-the gentlemen reality when [they]3211-the gentlemen changed [their]3211-the gentlemen background . [She]109-lily could not have remained in [New York]6-new york without repaying the money [she]109-lily owed to [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ; to acquit [herself]109-lily of that odious debt [she]109-lily might even have faced a marriage with [Rosedale]124-rosedale ; but the accident of placing [the Atlantic]3698-the atlantic between [herself]109-lily and [her]109-lily obligations made [them]3211-the gentlemen dwindle out of sight as if [they]3211-the gentlemen had been milestones and [she]109-lily had travelled past them . [Her]109-lily two months on [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina had been especially calculated to aid this illusion of distance . [She]109-lily had been plunged into new scenes , and had found in [them]3211-the gentlemen a renewal of old hopes and ambitions . The cruise itself charmed [her]109-lily as a romantic adventure . [She]109-lily was vaguely touched by the names and scenes amid which [she]109-lily moved , and had listened to [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton reading Theocritus by moonlight , as [the yacht]3592-the yacht rounded [the Sicilian promontories]3700-the sicilian promontories , with a thrill of the nerves that confirmed [her]109-lily belief in [her]109-lily intellectual superiority . But the weeks at [Cannes]62-cannes and [Nice]66-nice had really given [her]109-lily more pleasure . The gratification of being welcomed in high company , and of making [her]109-lily own ascendency felt there , so that [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily figuring once more as the “[109-lily] beautiful [Miss Bart]109-lily ” in the interesting journal devoted to recording the least movements of [[her]109-lily cosmopolitan companions]3701-her cosmopolitan companions — all these experiences tended to throw into the extreme background of memory the prosaic and sordid difficulties from which [she]109-lily had escaped . If [she]109-lily was faintly aware of fresh difficulties ahead , [she]109-lily was sure of [her]109-lily ability to meet [them]3702-them : it was characteristic of [her]109-lily to feel that the only problems [she]109-lily could not solve were those with which [she]109-lily was familiar . Meanwhile [she]109-lily could honestly be proud of the skill with which [she]109-lily had adapted [herself]109-lily to somewhat delicate conditions . [She]109-lily had reason to think that [she]109-lily had made [herself]109-lily equally necessary to [[her]109-lily host]809-her host and [hostess]1586-hostess ; and if only [she]109-lily had seen any perfectly irreproachable means of drawing a financial profit from the situation , there would have been no cloud on [her]109-lily horizon . The truth was that [her]109-lily funds , as usual , were inconveniently low ; and to neither [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset nor [[his]809-her host wife]592-his wife could this vulgar embarrassment be safely hinted . Still , the need was not a pressing one ; [she]109-lily could worry along , as [she]109-lily had so often done before , with the hope of some happy change of fortune to sustain [her]109-lily ; and meanwhile life was gay and beautiful and easy , and [she]109-lily was conscious of figuring not unworthily in such a setting . [She]109-lily was engaged to breakfast that morning with [the Duchess of Beltshire]249-the duchess , and at twelve o’clock [she]109-lily asked to be set [ashore]3706-ashore in [the gig]3707-the gig . Before this [she]109-lily had sent [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid to enquire if [she]109-lily might see [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ; but the reply came back that [the latter]566-the latter was tired , and trying to sleep . [Lily]109-lily thought [she]109-lily understood the reason of the rebuff . [[Her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess had not been included in [the Duchess]3567-the duchess ’s invitation , though [she]745-her hostess [herself]745-her hostess had made the most loyal efforts in that direction . But [[her]745-her hostess grace]3712-her grace was impervious to hints , and invited or omitted as [she]745-her hostess chose . It was not [Lily]109-lily ’s fault if [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s complicated attitudes did not fall in with [the Duchess]3567-the duchess ’s easy gait . [The Duchess]3567-the duchess , who seldom explained [herself]3567-the duchess , had not formulated [her]3567-the duchess objection beyond saying : “[2124-she] [She]2124-she ’s rather a bore , [you]2125-you know . [The only one of [[your]2125-you friends]3005-your friends [I]0-i like]2126-the only one of your friends i like is that [little Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry — [HE]245-mr. bry ’S funny — ” but [Lily]109-lily knew enough not to press the point , and was not altogether sorry to be thus distinguished at [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s expense . [Bertha]133-bertha certainly HAD grown tiresome since [she]133-bertha had taken to poetry and [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton . On the whole , it was a relief to break away now and then from [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina ; and [the Duchess]249-the duchess ’s little breakfast , organized by [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert with all [his]176-lord hubert usual virtuosity , was the pleasanter to [Lily]109-lily for not including [[her]109-lily travelling - companions]3716-her travelling - companions . [Dorset]133-bertha , of late , had grown more than usually morose and incalculable , and [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton went about with an air that seemed to challenge the universe . The freedom and lightness of the ducal intercourse made an agreeable change from these complications , and [Lily]109-lily was tempted , after luncheon , to adjourn in the wake of [[her]109-lily companions]667-her companions to the hectic atmosphere of [the Casino]3603-the casino . [She]109-lily did not mean to play ; [her]109-lily diminished pocket - money offered small scope for the adventure ; but it amused [her]109-lily to sit on a divan , under the doubtful protection of [the Duchess]3567-the duchess ’s back , while [the latter]566-the latter hung above [her]109-lily stakes at a neighbouring table . [The rooms]3721-the rooms were packed with the gazing throng which , in the afternoon hours , trickles heavily between the tables , like [the Sunday crowd in [a lion - house]3723-a lion - house]3722-the sunday crowd in a lion - house . In the stagnant flow of the mass , identities were hardly distinguishable ; but [Lily]109-lily presently saw [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry cleaving [her]198-mrs. bry determined way through the doors , and , in the broad wake [she]198-mrs. bry left , the light figure of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher bobbing after [her]198-mrs. bry like [a row - boat at the stern of a tug]3724-a row - boat at the stern of a tug . [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry pressed on , evidently animated by the resolve to reach a certain point in [the rooms]3721-the rooms ; but [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , as [she]135-mrs. fisher passed [Lily]109-lily , broke from [her]135-mrs. fisher towing - line , and let [herself]135-mrs. fisher float to [the girl]665-the girl ’s side . “[245-mr. bry] Lose [her]2128-her ? ” [she]109-lily echoed [the latter]566-the latter ’s query , with an indifferent glance at [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s retreating back . “[0-i] [I]0-i daresay — it does n’t matter : [I]0-i HAVE lost [her]2128-her already . ” And , as [Lily]109-lily exclaimed , [she]109-lily added : “[2128-her] [We]2129-we had an awful row this morning . [You]2130-you know , of course , that [the Duchess]3567-the duchess chucked [her]2128-her at dinner last night , and [she]3567-the duchess thinks it was [my]0-i fault — [my]0-i want of management . The worst of it is , the message — just a mere word by telephone — came so late that the dinner HAD to be paid for ; and [Becassin]255-becassin HAD run it up — it had been so drummed into [him]255-becassin that [the Duchess]3567-the duchess was coming ! ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher indulged in a faint laugh at the remembrance . “[3567-the duchess] Paying for what [she]3567-the duchess does n’t get rankles so dreadfully with [Louisa]215-louisa : [I]0-i ca n’t make [her]3567-the duchess see that it ’s one of the preliminary steps to getting what [you]2130-you have n’t paid for — and as [I]0-i was the nearest thing to smash , [she]3567-the duchess smashed [me]0-i to atoms , [poor dear]3119-poor dear ! ” [Lily]109-lily murmured [her]109-lily commiseration . Impulses of sympathy came naturally to [her]109-lily , and it was instinctive to proffer [her]109-lily help to [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher . “[3567-the duchess] If there ’s anything [I]0-i can do — if it ’s only a question of meeting [the Duchess]3567-the duchess ! [I]0-i heard [her]3567-the duchess say [she]3567-the duchess thought [Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry amusing — — ” But [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher interposed with a decisive gesture . “[3567-the duchess] [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear , [I]0-i have [my]0-i pride : the pride of [my]0-i trade . [I]0-i could n’t manage [the Duchess]3567-the duchess , and [I]0-i ca n’t palm off [your]2871-my dear arts on [Louisa Bry]256-louisa as [mine]0-i . [I]0-i ’ve taken the final step : [I]0-i go to [Paris]24-paris tonight with [the Sam Gormers]257-the gormers . [THEY’RE]257-the gormers still in the elementary stage ; [an Italian Prince]2137-an italian prince is a great deal more than [a Prince]2138-a prince to [them]2139-them , and [they]2139-them ’re always on the brink of taking a courier for one . To save [them]2139-them from that is [my]0-i present mission . ” [She]0-i laughed again at the picture . “[0-i] But before [I]0-i go [I]0-i want to make [my]0-i last will and testament — [I]0-i want to leave [you]2871-my dear [the Brys]2140-the brys . ” “[0-i] [Me]0-i ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily joined in [her]0-i amusement . “[0-i] It ’s charming of [you]2871-my dear to remember [me]0-i , [dear]2964-dear ; but really — — ” “[2871-my dear] [You]2871-my dear ’re already so well provided for ? ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher flashed a sharp glance at [her]0-i . “[2871-my dear] ARE [you]2871-my dear , though , [Lily]109-lily — to the point of rejecting [my]0-i offer ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily coloured slowly . “[109-lily] What [I]0-i really meant was , that [the Brys]199-the brys would n’t in the least care to be so disposed of . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher continued to probe [her]2871-my dear embarrassment with an unflinching eye . “[0-i] What [you]2871-my dear really meant was that [you]2871-my dear ’ve snubbed [the Brys]199-the brys horribly ; and [you]2871-my dear know that [they]199-the brys know — — ” “[199-the brys] Carry ! ” “[199-the brys] Oh , on certain sides [Louisa]256-louisa bristles with perceptions . If [you]2871-my dear ’d even managed to have [them]199-the brys asked once on the Sabrina — especially when [royalties]2142-royalties were coming ! But it ’s not too late , ” [she]135-mrs. fisher ended earnestly , “[2142-royalties] it ’s not too late for either of [you]2871-my dear . ” [Lily]109-lily smiled . “[2142-royalties] Stay over , and [I]0-i ’ll get [the Duchess]3567-the duchess to dine with [them]199-the brys . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i sha n’t stay over — [the Gormers]2144-the gormers have paid for [[my]0-i SALON - LIT]2145-my salon - lit , ” said [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher with simplicity . “[2144-the gormers] But get [the Duchess]3567-the duchess to dine with [them]199-the brys all the same . ” [Lily]109-lily ’s smile again flowed into a slight laugh : [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s importunity was beginning to strike [her]109-lily as irrelevant . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m sorry [I]0-i have been negligent about [the Brys]199-the brys — — ” [she]0-i began . “[199-the brys] Oh , as to [the Brys]199-the brys — it ’s [you]2147-you [I]0-i ’m thinking of , ” said [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher abruptly . [She]135-mrs. fisher paused , and then , bending forward , with a lowered voice : “[2147-you] [You]2147-you know [we]2148-us all went on to [Nice]66-nice last night when [the Duchess]3567-the duchess chucked [us]2148-us . It was [Louisa]256-louisa ’s idea — [I]0-i told [her]256-louisa what [I]0-i thought of it . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily assented . “[0-i] Yes — [I]0-i caught sight of [you]2147-you on the way back , at [the station]319-the station . ” “[2147-you] Well , [the man who was in [the carriage]420-the carriage with [you]2147-you and [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset]2151-the man who was in the carriage with you and george dorset — [that horrid little Dabham who does ‘ Society Notes from [the Riviera’—had]69-the riviera’—had been dining with [us]2148-us at [Nice]66-nice]2153-that horrid little dabham who does ‘ society notes from the riviera’—had been dining with us at nice . And [he]2151-the man who was in the carriage with you and george dorset ’s telling [everybody]2995-everybody that [you]2147-you and [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset came back alone after midnight . ” “[2151-the man who was in the carriage with you and george dorset] Alone — ? When [he]2151-the man who was in the carriage with you and george dorset was with [us]2148-us ? ” [Lily]109-lily laughed , but [her]109-lily laugh faded into gravity under the prolonged implication of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s look . “[2151-the man who was in the carriage with you and george dorset] [We]2148-us DID come back alone — if that ’s so very dreadful ! But whose fault was it ? [The Duchess]3567-the duchess was spending the night at [Cimiez]64-cimiez with [the Crown Princess]3593-the crown princess ; [Bertha]133-bertha got bored with the show , and went off early , promising to meet [us]2148-us at [the station]319-the station . [We]2148-us turned up on time , but [she]133-bertha didn’t — [she]133-bertha did n’t turn up at all ! ” [Miss Bart]109-lily made this announcement in the tone of [one who presents , with careless assurance , a complete vindication]3729-one who presents , with careless assurance , a complete vindication ; but [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher received it in a manner almost inconsequent . [She]135-mrs. fisher seemed to have lost sight of [[her]135-mrs. fisher friend]754-her friend ’s part in the incident : [her]135-mrs. fisher inward vision had taken another slant . “[133-bertha] [Bertha]133-bertha never turned up at all ? Then how on earth did [she]133-bertha get back ? ” “[133-bertha] Oh , by [the next train]3052-the next train , [I]0-i suppose ; there were two extra ones for the FETE . At any rate , [I]0-i know [she]133-bertha ’s safe on [the yacht]3592-the yacht , though [I]0-i have n’t yet seen [her]133-bertha ; but [you]2160-you see it was not [my]0-i fault , ” [Lily]109-lily summed up . “[2160-you] Not [your]2160-you fault that [Bertha]133-bertha did n’t turn up ? [[My]0-i poor child]2161-my poor child , if only [you]2160-you do n’t have to pay for it ! ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher rose — [she]135-mrs. fisher had seen [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry surging back in [her]135-mrs. fisher direction . “[2160-you] There ’s [Louisa]256-louisa , and [I]0-i must be off — oh , [we]2162-we ’re on the best of terms externally ; [we]2162-we ’re lunching together ; but at heart it ’s [ME]0-i [she]133-bertha ’s lunching on , ” [she]0-i explained ; and with a last hand - clasp and a last look , [she]0-i added : “[0-i] Remember , [I]0-i leave [her]133-bertha to [you]2160-you ; [she]133-bertha ’s hovering now , ready to take [you]2160-you in . ” * * * * * [Lily]109-lily carried the impression of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s leave - taking away with [her]109-lily from the Casino doors . [She]109-lily had accomplished , before leaving , the first step toward [her]109-lily reinstatement in [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s good graces . An affable advance — a vague murmur that [they]2162-we must see more of [each other]2955-each other — an allusive glance to a near future that was felt to include [the Duchess]3567-the duchess as well as [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina — how easily it was all done , if [one]2737-one possessed the knack of doing it ! [She]109-lily wondered at [herself]109-lily , as [she]109-lily had so often wondered , that , possessing the knack , [she]109-lily did not more consistently exercise it . But sometimes [she]109-lily was forgetful — and sometimes , could it be that [she]109-lily was proud ? Today , at any rate , [she]109-lily had been vaguely conscious of a reason for sinking [her]109-lily pride , had in fact even sunk it to the point of suggesting to [Lord Hubert Dacey]176-lord hubert , whom [she]109-lily ran across on [the Casino steps]2027-the casino steps , that [he]176-lord hubert might really get [the Duchess]3567-the duchess to dine with [the Brys]199-the brys , if [SHE]109-lily undertook to have [them]2162-we asked on [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina . [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert had promised [his]176-lord hubert help , with the readiness on which [she]109-lily could always count : it was [his]176-lord hubert only way of ever reminding [her]109-lily that [he]176-lord hubert had once been ready to do so much more for [her]109-lily . [Her]109-lily path , in short , seemed to smooth itself before [her]109-lily as [she]109-lily advanced ; yet the faint stir of uneasiness persisted . Had it been produced , [she]109-lily wondered , by [her]109-lily chance meeting with [Selden]108-selden ? [She]109-lily thought not — time and change seemed so completely to have relegated [him]108-selden to [his]108-selden proper distance . The sudden and exquisite reaction from [her]109-lily anxieties had had the effect of throwing the recent past so far back that even [Selden]108-selden , as part of it , retained a certain air of unreality . And [he]108-selden had made it so clear that [they]3736-they were not to meet again ; that [he]108-selden had merely dropped down to [Nice]66-nice for a day or two , and had almost [his]108-selden foot on the next steamer . No — that part of the past had merely surged up for a moment on the fleeing surface of events ; and now that it was submerged again , the uncertainty , the apprehension persisted . [They]3736-they grew to sudden acuteness as [she]109-lily caught sight of [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset descending the steps of [the Hotel de [Paris]24-paris]71-the hotel de paris and making for [her]109-lily across [the square]3737-the square . [She]109-lily had meant to drive down to [the quay]2058-the quay and regain [the yacht]3592-the yacht ; but [she]109-lily now had the immediate impression that something more was to happen first . “[133-bertha] Which way are [you]2163-you going ? Shall [we]2164-we walk a bit ? ” [he]108-selden began , putting the second question before the first was answered , and not waiting for a reply to either before [he]108-selden directed [her]109-lily silently toward the comparative seclusion of [the lower gardens]3740-the lower gardens . [She]109-lily detected in [him]108-selden at once all the signs of extreme nervous tension . The skin was puffed out under [his]108-selden sunken eyes , and its sallowness had paled to a leaden white against which [his]108-selden irregular eyebrows and long reddish moustache were relieved with a saturnine effect . [His]108-selden appearance , in short , presented an odd mixture of the bedraggled and the ferocious . [He]108-selden walked beside [her]109-lily in silence , with quick precipitate steps , till [they]2164-we reached [the embowered slopes to the east of [the Casino]3603-the casino]3741-the embowered slopes to the east of the casino ; then , pulling up abruptly , [he]108-selden said : “[133-bertha] Have [you]2163-you seen [Bertha]133-bertha ? ” “[2163-you] No — when [I]0-i left [the yacht]3592-the yacht [she]133-bertha was not yet up . ” [He]108-selden received this with a laugh like the whirring sound in a disabled clock . “[133-bertha] Not yet up ? Had [she]133-bertha gone to bed ? Do [you]2163-you know at what time [she]133-bertha came on board ? This morning at seven ! ” [he]108-selden exclaimed . “[133-bertha] At seven ? ” [Lily]109-lily started . “[133-bertha] What happened — an accident to [the train]2843-the train ? ” [He]108-selden laughed again . “[2167-they] [They]2167-they missed [the train]2843-the train — all [the trains]2169-the trains — [they]2167-they had to drive back . ” “[2167-they] Well — — ? ” [She]109-lily hesitated , feeling at once how little even this necessity accounted for the fatal lapse of hours . “[2167-they] Well , [they]2167-they could n’t get [a carriage]898-a carriage at once — at that time of night , [you]2163-you know — ” the explanatory note made it almost seem as though [he]108-selden were putting the case for [[his]108-selden wife—“and]3743-his wife—“and[2167-they] when [they]2167-they finally did , it was only [a one - horse cab]2171-a one - horse cab , and the horse was lame ! ” “[2167-they] How tiresome ! [I]0-i see , ” [she]109-lily affirmed , with the more earnestness because [she]109-lily was so nervously conscious that [she]109-lily did not ; and after a pause [she]109-lily added : “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m so sorry — but ought [we]2167-they to have waited ? ” “[2163-you] Waited for [the one - horse cab]2172-the one - horse cab ? It would scarcely have carried [the four of [us]2167-they]2173-the four of us , do [you]2163-you think ? ” [She]109-lily took this in what seemed the only possible way , with a laugh intended to sink the question itself in [his]2163-you humorous treatment of it . “[2163-you] Well , it would have been difficult ; [we]2167-they should have had to walk by turns . But it would have been jolly to see the sunrise . ” “[2163-you] Yes : the sunrise WAS jolly , ” [he]2163-you agreed . “[2163-you] Was it ? [You]2163-you saw it , then ? ” “[2163-you] [I]0-i saw it , yes ; from [the deck]2174-the deck . [I]0-i waited up for [them]2175-them . ” “[0-i] Naturally — [I]0-i suppose [you]2163-you were worried . Why did n’t [you]2163-you call on [me]0-i to share [your]2163-you vigil ? ” [He]2163-you stood still , dragging at [his]2163-you moustache with a lean weak hand . “[2163-you] [I]0-i do n’t think [you]2163-you would have cared for its DENOUEMENT , ” [he]2163-you said with sudden grimness . Again [she]109-lily was disconcerted by the abrupt change in [his]2163-you tone , and as in one flash [she]109-lily saw the peril of the moment , and the need of keeping [her]109-lily sense of it out of [her]109-lily eyes . “[2163-you] DENOUEMENT — isn’t that too big a word for such a small incident ? The worst of it , after all , is the fatigue which [Bertha]133-bertha has probably slept off by this time . ” [She]109-lily clung to the note bravely , though its futility was now plain to [her]109-lily in the glare of [his]2163-you miserable eyes . “[133-bertha] Don’t — don’t — — ! ” [he]2163-you broke out , with the hurt cry of [a child]348-a child ; and while [she]109-lily tried to merge [her]109-lily sympathy , and [her]109-lily resolve to ignore any cause for it , in one ambiguous murmur of deprecation , [he]2163-you dropped down on the bench near which [they]3745-they had paused , and poured out the wretchedness of [his]2163-you soul . It was a dreadful hour — an hour from which [she]109-lily emerged shrinking and seared , as though [her]109-lily lids had been scorched by its actual glare . It was not that [she]109-lily had never had premonitory glimpses of such an outbreak ; but rather because , here and there throughout the three months , the surface of life had shown such ominous cracks and vapours that [her]109-lily fears had always been on the alert for an upheaval . There had been moments when the situation had presented itself under a homelier yet more vivid image — that of [a shaky vehicle , dashed by unbroken steeds]3746-a shaky vehicle , dashed by unbroken steeds over [a bumping road]3747-a bumping road , while [she]109-lily cowered within , aware that the harness wanted mending , and wondering what would give way first . Well — everything had given way now ; and the wonder was that [the crazy outfit]3748-the crazy outfit had held together so long . [Her]109-lily sense of being involved in the crash , instead of merely witnessing it from [the road]3749-the road , was intensified by the way in which [Dorset]133-bertha , through [his]2163-you furies of denunciation and wild reactions of self - contempt , made [her]109-lily feel the need [he]2163-you had of [her]109-lily , the place [she]109-lily had taken in [his]2163-you life . But for [her]109-lily , what ear would have been open to [his]2163-you cries ? And what hand but [hers]109-lily could drag [him]2163-you up again to a footing of sanity and self - respect ? All through the stress of the struggle with [him]2163-you , [she]109-lily had been conscious of something faintly maternal in [her]109-lily efforts to guide and uplift [him]2163-you . But for the present , if [he]2163-you clung to [her]109-lily , it was not in order to be dragged up , but to feel some one floundering in the depths with [him]2163-you : [he]2163-you wanted [her]109-lily to suffer with [him]2163-you , not to help [him]2163-you to suffer less . Happily for both , there was little physical strength to sustain [his]2163-you frenzy . It left [him]2163-you , collapsed and breathing heavily , to an apathy so deep and prolonged that [Lily]109-lily almost feared [the passers - by]3750-the passers - by would think it the result of a seizure , and stop to offer [their]3750-the passers - by aid . But [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo is , of all places , the one where the human bond is least close , and odd sights are the least arresting . If a glance or two lingered on [the couple]960-the couple , no intrusive sympathy disturbed [them]960-the couple ; and it was [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily who broke the silence by rising from [her]109-lily seat . With the clearing of [her]109-lily vision the sweep of peril had extended , and [she]109-lily saw that the post of danger was no longer at [Dorset]133-bertha ’s side . “[133-bertha] If [you]2176-he wo n’t go back , [I]0-i must — don’t make [me]0-i leave [you]2176-he ! ” [she]109-lily urged . But [he]2176-he remained mutely resistant , and [she]109-lily added : “[0-i] What are [you]2176-he going to do ? [You]2176-he really ca n’t sit [here]2763-here all night . ” “[2176-he] [I]0-i can go to [an hotel]2178-an hotel . [I]0-i can telegraph [[my]0-i lawyers]2179-my lawyers . ” [He]2176-he sat up , roused by a new thought . “[0-i] By [Jove]169-jove , [Selden]108-selden ’s at [Nice]66-nice — [I’ll]0-i send for [Selden]108-selden ! ” [Lily]109-lily , at this , reseated [herself]109-lily with a cry of alarm . “[0-i] No , no , NO ! ” [she]109-lily protested . [He]2176-he swung round on [her]109-lily distrustfully . “[0-i] Why not [Selden]108-selden ? [He]108-selden ’s [a lawyer]2180-a lawyer is n’t [he]108-selden ? [One]2737-one will do as well as another in a case like this . ” “[108-selden] As badly as another , [you]0-i mean . [I]0-i thought [you]0-i relied on [ME]0-i to help [you]0-i . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i do — by being so sweet and patient with [me]0-i . If it had n’t been for [you]0-i [I]0-i ’d have ended the thing long ago . But now it ’s got to end . ” [He]2176-he rose suddenly , straightening [himself]2176-he with an effort . “[0-i] [You]0-i ca n’t want to see [me]0-i ridiculous . ” [She]0-i looked at [him]2176-he kindly . “[0-i] That ’s just it . ” Then , after a moment ’s pondering , almost to [her]0-i own surprise [she]0-i broke out with a flash of inspiration : “[0-i] Well , go over and see [Mr. Selden]108-selden . [You]0-i ’ll have time to do it before dinner . ” “[0-i] Oh , DINNER — — ” [he]2176-he mocked [her]0-i ; but [she]0-i left [him]2176-he with the smiling rejoinder : “[0-i] Dinner on board , remember ; [we]2182-we ’ll put it off till nine if [you]0-i like . ” It was past four already ; and when [a cab]378-a cab had dropped [her]0-i at [the quay]2058-the quay , and [she]0-i stood waiting for the gig to put off for [her]0-i , [she]0-i began to wonder what had been happening on [the yacht]3592-the yacht . Of [Silverton]134-ned silverton ’s whereabouts there had been no mention . Had [he]134-ned silverton returned to [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina ? Or could [Bertha]133-bertha — the dread alternative sprang on [her]0-i suddenly — could [Bertha]133-bertha , left to [herself]133-bertha , have gone [ashore]3706-ashore to rejoin [him]134-ned silverton ? [Lily]109-lily ’s heart stood still at the thought . All [her]0-i concern had hitherto been for [young Silverton]134-ned silverton , not only because , in such affairs , [the woman]366-the woman ’s instinct is to side with [the man]3104-the man , but because [his]134-ned silverton case made a peculiar appeal to [her]0-i sympathies . [He]134-ned silverton was so desperately in earnest , [poor youth]3758-poor youth , and [his]134-ned silverton earnestness was of so different a quality from [Bertha]133-bertha ’s , though [hers]0-i too was desperate enough . The difference was that [Bertha]133-bertha was in earnest only about [herself]133-bertha , while [he]134-ned silverton was in earnest about [her]133-bertha . But now , at the actual crisis , this difference seemed to throw the weight of destitution on [Bertha]133-bertha ’s side , since at least [he]134-ned silverton had [her]133-bertha to suffer for , and [she]133-bertha had only [herself]133-bertha . At any rate , viewed less ideally , all the disadvantages of such a situation were for [the woman]366-the woman ; and it was to [Bertha]133-bertha that [Lily]109-lily ’s sympathies now went out . [She]109-lily was not fond of [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , but neither was [she]109-lily without a sense of obligation , the heavier for having so little personal liking to sustain it . [Bertha]133-bertha had been kind to [her]109-lily , [they]3760-they had lived together , during the last months , on terms of easy friendship , and the sense of friction of which [Lily]109-lily had recently become aware seemed to make it the more urgent that [she]109-lily should work undividedly in [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s interest . It was in [Bertha]133-bertha ’s interest , certainly , that [she]109-lily had despatched [Dorset]133-bertha to consult with [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . Once the grotesqueness of the situation accepted , [she]109-lily had seen at a glance that it was the safest in which [Dorset]133-bertha could find [himself]133-bertha . Who but [Selden]108-selden could thus miraculously combine the skill to save [Bertha]133-bertha with the obligation of doing so ? The consciousness that much skill would be required made [Lily]109-lily rest thankfully in the greatness of the obligation . Since [he]108-selden would HAVE to pull [Bertha]133-bertha through [she]109-lily could trust [him]108-selden to find a way ; and [she]109-lily put the fulness of [her]109-lily trust in the telegram [she]109-lily managed to send [him]108-selden on [her]109-lily way to [the quay]2058-the quay . Thus far , then , [Lily]109-lily felt that [she]109-lily had done well ; and the conviction strengthened [her]109-lily for the task that remained . [She]109-lily and [Bertha]133-bertha had never been on confidential terms , but at such a crisis the barriers of reserve must surely fall : [Dorset]133-bertha ’s wild allusions to the scene of the morning made [Lily]109-lily feel that [they]3763-they were down already , and that any attempt to rebuild [them]3763-they would be beyond [Bertha]133-bertha ’s strength . [She]109-lily pictured the poor creature shivering behind [her]109-lily fallen defences and awaiting with suspense the moment when [she]109-lily could take refuge in the first shelter that offered . If only that shelter had not already offered itself elsewhere ! As the gig traversed the short distance between [the quay]2058-the quay and [the yacht]3592-the yacht , [Lily]109-lily grew more than ever alarmed at the possible consequences of [her]109-lily long absence . What if [the wretched Bertha , finding in all the long hours]3766-the wretched bertha , finding in all the long hours [no soul]3767-no soul to turn to — but by this time [Lily]109-lily ’s eager foot was on the side - ladder , and [her]109-lily first step on [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina showed the worst of [her]109-lily apprehensions to be unfounded ; for there , in the luxurious shade of [the after - deck]3768-the after - deck , [the wretched Bertha]3769-the wretched bertha , in full command of [her]3769-the wretched bertha usual attenuated elegance , sat dispensing tea to [the Duchess of [Beltshire]27-beltshire]2076-the duchess of beltshire and [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert . The sight filled [Lily]109-lily with such surprise that [she]109-lily felt that [Bertha]133-bertha , at least , must read its meaning in [her]109-lily look , and [she]109-lily was proportionately disconcerted by the blankness of the look returned . But in an instant [she]109-lily saw that [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset had , of necessity , to look blank before the others , and that , to mitigate the effect of [her]109-lily own surprise , [she]109-lily must at once produce some simple reason for it . The long habit of rapid transitions made it easy for [her]109-lily to exclaim to [the Duchess]3567-the duchess : “[0-i] Why , [I]0-i thought [you]0-i ’d gone back to [the Princess]2183-the princess ! ” and this sufficed for [the lady [she]109-lily addressed]3772-the lady she addressed , if it was hardly enough for [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert . At least it opened the way to a lively explanation of how [the Duchess]3567-the duchess was , in fact , going back the next moment , but had first rushed out to [the yacht]3592-the yacht for a word with [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset on the subject of tomorrow ’s dinner — the dinner with [the Brys]199-the brys , to which [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert had finally insisted on dragging [them]199-the brys . “[0-i] To save [my]0-i neck , [you]2184-you know ! ” [he]245-mr. bry explained , with a glance that appealed to [Lily]109-lily for some recognition of [his]245-mr. bry promptness ; and [the Duchess]3567-the duchess added , with [her]3567-the duchess noble candour : “[245-mr. bry] [Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry has promised [him]245-mr. bry a tip , and [he]245-mr. bry says if [we]2185-we go [he]245-mr. bry ’ll pass it onto [us]2185-we . ” This led to some final pleasantries , in which , as it seemed to [Lily]109-lily , [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset bore [her]131-mrs. dorset part with astounding bravery , and at the close of which [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert , from half way down the side - ladder , called back , with an air of numbering heads : “[245-mr. bry] And of course [we]2185-we may count on [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset too ? ” “[245-mr. bry] Oh , count on [him]245-mr. bry , ” [[his]245-mr. bry wife]592-his wife assented gaily . [She]131-mrs. dorset was keeping up well to the last — but as [she]131-mrs. dorset turned back from waving [her]131-mrs. dorset adieux over the side , [Lily]109-lily said to [herself]109-lily that the mask must drop and the soul of fear look out . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset turned back slowly ; perhaps [she]131-mrs. dorset wanted time to steady [her]131-mrs. dorset muscles ; at any rate , they were still under perfect control when , dropping once more into [her]131-mrs. dorset seat behind the tea - table , [she]131-mrs. dorset remarked to [Miss Bart]109-lily with a faint touch of irony : “[245-mr. bry] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i ought to say good morning . ” If it was a cue , [Lily]109-lily was ready to take it , though with only the vaguest sense of what was expected of [her]109-lily in return . There was something unnerving in the contemplation of [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s composure , and [she]0-i had to force the light tone in which [she]0-i answered : “[0-i] [I]0-i tried to see [you]2186-you this morning , but [you]2186-you were not yet up . ” “[0-i] No — [I]0-i got to bed late . After [we]2187-we missed [you]2186-you at [the station]319-the station [I]0-i thought [we]2187-we ought to wait for [you]2186-you till [the last train]2189-the last train . ” [She]0-i spoke very gently , but with just the least tinge of reproach . “[2186-you] [You]2186-you missed [us]2187-we ? [You]2186-you waited for [us]2187-we at [the station]319-the station ? ” Now indeed [Lily]109-lily was too far adrift in bewilderment to measure the other ’s words or keep watch on [her]109-lily own . “[2186-you] But [I]0-i thought [you]2186-you did n’t get to [the station]319-the station till after [the last train]2189-the last train had left ! ” [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , examining [her]109-lily between lowered lids , met this with the immediate query : “[0-i] Who told [you]2186-you that ? ” “[131-mrs. dorset] [George]131-mrs. dorset — [I]0-i saw [him]2193-him just now in [the gardens]787-the gardens . ” “[2193-him] Ah , is that [George]131-mrs. dorset ’s version ? [Poor George]258-poor george — [he]258-poor george was in no state to remember what [I]0-i told [him]258-poor george . [He]258-poor george had one of [his]258-poor george worst attacks this morning , and [I]0-i packed [him]258-poor george off to see [the doctor]2195-the doctor . Do [you]2186-you know if [he]2195-the doctor found [him]258-poor george ? ” [Lily]109-lily , still lost in conjecture , made no reply , and [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset settled [herself]131-mrs. dorset indolently in [her]131-mrs. dorset seat . “[2186-you] [He]2195-the doctor ’ll wait to see [him]258-poor george ; [he]258-poor george was horribly frightened about [himself]258-poor george . It ’s very bad for [him]258-poor george to be worried , and whenever anything upsetting happens , it always brings on an attack . ” This time [Lily]109-lily felt sure that a cue was being pressed on [her]109-lily ; but it was put forth with such startling suddenness , and with so incredible an air of ignoring what it led up to , that [she]109-lily could only falter out doubtfully : “[2186-you] Anything upsetting ? ” “[2186-you] Yes — such as having [you]2186-you so conspicuously on [his]258-poor george hands in the small hours . [You]2186-you know , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear , [you]2186-you ’re rather a big responsibility in such a scandalous place after midnight . ” At that — at the complete unexpectedness and the inconceivable audacity of it — [Lily]109-lily could not restrain the tribute of an astonished laugh . “[2186-you] Well , really — considering it was [you]2186-you who burdened [him]258-poor george with the responsibility ! ” [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset took this with an exquisite mildness . “[2186-you] By not having the superhuman cleverness to discover [you]2186-you in that frightful rush for [the train]2843-the train ? Or the imagination to believe that [you]2186-you ’d take it without [us]2198-us — [you]2186-you and [he]258-poor george all alone — instead of waiting quietly in [the station]319-the station till [we]2198-us DID manage to meet [you]2186-you ? ” [Lily]109-lily ’s colour rose : it was growing clear to [her]109-lily that [Bertha]133-bertha was pursuing an object , following a line [she]133-bertha had marked out for [herself]133-bertha . Only , with such a doom impending , why waste time in these childish efforts to avert it ? The puerility of the attempt disarmed [Lily]109-lily ’s indignation : did it not prove how horribly [the poor creature]3777-the poor creature was frightened ? “[2198-us] No ; by [our]2198-us simply all keeping together at Nice , ” [she]109-lily returned . “[2198-us] Keeping together ? When it was [you]2186-you who seized the first opportunity to rush off with [the Duchess]3567-the duchess and [[her]3567-the duchess friends]406-her friends ? [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear [Lily]109-lily , [you]109-lily are not [a child to be led by the hand]2203-a child to be led by the hand ! ” “[0-i] No — nor to be lectured , [Bertha]133-bertha , really ; if that ’s what [you]133-bertha are doing to [me]0-i now . ” [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset smiled on [her]109-lily reproachfully . “[133-bertha] Lecture [you]109-lily — [I]0-i ? Heaven forbid ! [I]0-i was merely trying to give [you]109-lily a friendly hint . But it ’s usually the other way round , is n’t it ? [I]0-i ’m expected to take hints , not to give them : [I]0-i ’ve positively lived on them all these last months . ” “[0-i] Hints — from [me]0-i to [you]133-bertha ? ” [Lily]109-lily repeated . “[0-i] Oh , [negative ones merely — what not to be and to do and to see]2204-negative ones merely — what not to be and to do and to see . And [I]0-i think [I]0-i ’ve taken [them]2204-negative ones merely — what not to be and to do and to see to admiration . Only , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear , if [you]109-lily ’ll let [me]0-i say so , [I]0-i did n’t understand that one of [my]0-i negative duties was NOT to warn [you]109-lily when [you]109-lily carried [your]109-lily imprudence too far . ” A chill of fear passed over [Miss Bart]109-lily : a sense of remembered treachery that was like the gleam of a knife in the dusk . But compassion , in a moment , got the better of [her]109-lily instinctive recoil . What was this outpouring of senseless bitterness but the tracked creature ’s attempt to cloud the medium through which it was fleeing ? It was on [Lily]109-lily ’s lips to exclaim : “[109-lily] [[You]109-lily poor soul]2206-you poor soul , do n’t double and turn — come straight back to [me]0-i , and [we]2207-we ’ll find a way out ! ” But the words died under the impenetrable insolence of [Bertha]133-bertha ’s smile . [Lily]109-lily sat silent , taking the brunt of it quietly , letting it spend itself on [her]109-lily to the last drop of its accumulated falseness ; then , without a word , [she]109-lily rose and went down to [[her]109-lily cabin]3687-her cabin . Chapter 3 [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s telegram caught [Lawrence Selden]108-selden at the door of [[his]108-selden hotel]3779-his hotel ; and having read it , [he]108-selden turned back to wait for [Dorset]133-bertha . The message necessarily left large gaps for conjecture ; but all that [he]108-selden had recently heard and seen made these but too easy to fill in . On the whole [he]108-selden was surprised ; for though [he]108-selden had perceived that the situation contained all the elements of an explosion , [he]108-selden had often enough , in the range of [his]108-selden personal experience , seen just such combinations subside into harmlessness . Still , [Dorset]133-bertha ’s spasmodic temper , and [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife ’s reckless disregard of appearances , gave the situation a peculiar insecurity ; and it was less from the sense of any special relation to the case than from a purely professional zeal , that [Selden]108-selden resolved to guide [the pair]3781-the pair to safety . Whether , in the present instance , safety for either lay in repairing so damaged a tie , it was no business of [his]108-selden to consider : [he]108-selden had only , on general principles , to think of averting a scandal , and [his]108-selden desire to avert it was increased by [his]108-selden fear of its involving [Miss Bart]109-lily . There was nothing specific in this apprehension ; [he]108-selden merely wished to spare [her]109-lily the embarrassment of being ever so remotely connected with the public washing of the Dorset linen . How exhaustive and unpleasant such a process would be , [he]108-selden saw even more vividly after [his]108-selden two hours ’ talk with [poor Dorset]133-bertha . If anything came out at all , it would be such a vast unpacking of accumulated moral rags as left [him]108-selden , after [[his]108-selden visitor]3782-his visitor had gone , with the feeling that [he]108-selden must fling open the windows and have [[his]108-selden room]1810-his room swept out . But nothing should come out ; and happily for [his]108-selden side of the case , the dirty rags , however pieced together , could not , without considerable difficulty , be turned into a homogeneous grievance . The torn edges did not always fit — there were missing bits , there were disparities of size and colour , all of which it was naturally [Selden]108-selden ’s business to make the most of in putting them under [[his]108-selden client]3242-his client ’s eye . But to [a man in [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset]3785-a man in dorset ’s mood the completest demonstration could not carry conviction , and [Selden]108-selden saw that for the moment all [he]108-selden could do was to soothe and temporize , to offer sympathy and to counsel prudence . [He]108-selden let [Dorset]133-bertha depart charged to the brim with the sense that , till [their]3786-their next meeting , [he]108-selden must maintain a strictly noncommittal attitude ; that , in short , [his]108-selden share in the game consisted for the present in looking on . [Selden]108-selden knew , however , that [he]108-selden could not long keep such violences in equilibrium ; and [he]108-selden promised to meet [Dorset]133-bertha , the next morning , at [an hotel in [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo]3787-an hotel in monte carlo . Meanwhile [he]108-selden counted not a little on the reaction of weakness and self - distrust that , in such natures , follows on every unwonted expenditure of moral force ; and [his]108-selden telegraphic reply to [Miss Bart]109-lily consisted simply in the injunction : “[109-lily] Assume that everything is as usual . ” On this assumption , in fact , the early part of the following day was lived through . [Dorset]133-bertha , as if in obedience to [Lily]109-lily ’s imperative bidding , had actually returned in time for a late dinner on [the yacht]3592-the yacht . The repast had been the most difficult moment of the day . [Dorset]133-bertha was sunk in one of the abysmal silences which so commonly followed on what [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife called [his]108-selden “[109-lily] attacks ” that it was easy , before [the servants]490-the servants , to refer it to this cause ; but [Bertha]133-bertha [herself]133-bertha seemed , perversely enough , little disposed to make use of this obvious means of protection . [She]133-bertha simply left the brunt of the situation on [[her]133-bertha husband]609-her husband ’s hands , as if too absorbed in a grievance of [her]133-bertha own to suspect that [she]133-bertha might be the object of one [herself]133-bertha . To [Lily]109-lily this attitude was the most ominous , because the most perplexing , element in the situation . As [she]109-lily tried to fan the weak flicker of talk , to build up , again and again , the crumbling structure of “[2208-she] appearances , ” [her]109-lily own attention was perpetually distracted by the question : “[2208-she] What on earth can [she]2208-she be driving at ? ” There was something positively exasperating in [Bertha]133-bertha ’s attitude of isolated defiance . If only [she]133-bertha would have given [[her]133-bertha friend]754-her friend a hint [they]3793-they might still have worked together successfully ; but how could [Lily]109-lily be of use , while [she]109-lily was thus obstinately shut out from participation ? To be of use was what [she]133-bertha honestly wanted ; and not for [her]133-bertha own sake but for [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets ’ . [She]133-bertha had not thought of [her]133-bertha own situation at all : [she]133-bertha was simply engrossed in trying to put a little order in [theirs]3793-they . But the close of the short dreary evening left [her]133-bertha with a sense of effort hopelessly wasted . [She]133-bertha had not tried to see [Dorset]133-bertha alone : [she]133-bertha had positively shrunk from a renewal of [his]3794-his confidences . It was [Bertha]133-bertha whose confidence [she]133-bertha sought , and who should as eagerly have invited [her]133-bertha own ; and [Bertha]133-bertha , as if in the infatuation of self - destruction , was actually pushing away [her]133-bertha rescuing hand . [Lily]109-lily , going to bed early , had left [the couple]960-the couple to [themselves]960-the couple ; and it seemed part of the general mystery in which [she]109-lily moved that more than an hour should elapse before [she]109-lily heard [Bertha]133-bertha walk down [the silent passage]3796-the silent passage and regain [[her]133-bertha room]529-her room . The morrow , rising on an apparent continuance of the same conditions , revealed nothing of what had occurred between [the confronted pair]3798-the confronted pair . One fact alone outwardly proclaimed the change [they]960-the couple were all conspiring to ignore ; and that was the non - appearance of [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton . [No one]2766-no one referred to it , and this tacit avoidance of the subject kept it in the immediate foreground of consciousness . But there was another change , perceptible only to [Lily]109-lily ; and that was that [Dorset]133-bertha now avoided [her]109-lily almost as pointedly as [[his]134-ned silverton wife]592-his wife . Perhaps [he]134-ned silverton was repenting [his]134-ned silverton rash outpourings of the previous day ; perhaps only trying , in [his]134-ned silverton clumsy way , to conform to [Selden]108-selden ’s counsel to behave “[2208-she] as usual . ” Such instructions no more make for easiness of attitude than [the photographer]3801-the photographer ’s behest to “[2208-she] look natural ” ; and in a creature as unconscious as poor [Dorset]133-bertha of the appearance [he]134-ned silverton habitually presented , the struggle to maintain a pose was sure to result in queer contortions . It resulted , at any rate , in throwing [Lily]109-lily strangely on [her]109-lily own resources . [She]109-lily had learned , on leaving [[her]109-lily room]529-her room , that [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was still invisible , and that [Dorset]133-bertha had left [the yacht]3592-the yacht early ; and feeling too restless to remain alone , [she]109-lily too had [herself]109-lily ferried [ashore]3706-ashore . Straying toward [the Casino]3603-the casino , [she]109-lily attached [herself]109-lily to [a group of acquaintances from [Nice]66-nice]3806-a group of acquaintances from nice , with whom [she]109-lily lunched , and in whose company [she]109-lily was returning to [the rooms]3721-the rooms when [she]109-lily encountered [Selden]108-selden crossing [the square]3737-the square . [She]109-lily could not , at the moment , separate [herself]109-lily definitely from [[her]109-lily party , who had hospitably assumed that [she]109-lily would remain with [them]3809-her party , who had hospitably assumed that she would remain with them till they took their departure till [they]3809-her party , who had hospitably assumed that she would remain with them till they took their departure took [their]3809-her party , who had hospitably assumed that she would remain with them till they took their departure departure]3809-her party , who had hospitably assumed that she would remain with them till they took their departure ; but [she]109-lily found time for a momentary pause of enquiry , to which [he]2209-he promptly returned : “[2209-he] [I]0-i ’ve seen [him]2209-he again — [he]2209-he ’s just left [me]0-i . ” [She]109-lily waited before [him]2209-he anxiously . “[2209-he] Well ? what has happened ? What WILL happen ? ” “[0-i] Nothing as yet — and nothing in the future , [I]0-i think . ” “[0-i] It ’s over , then ? [It]2210-it ’s settled ? [You]0-i ’re sure ? ” [He]2209-he smiled . “[0-i] Give [me]0-i time . [I]0-i ’m not sure — but [I]0-i ’m a good deal surer . ” And with that [she]109-lily had to content [herself]109-lily , and hasten on to [the expectant group on the steps]3810-the expectant group on the steps . [Selden]108-selden had in fact given [her]109-lily the utmost measure of [his]2209-he sureness , had even stretched it a shade to meet the anxiety in [her]109-lily eyes . And now , as [he]2209-he turned away , strolling down [the hill]1009-the hill toward [the station]319-the station , that anxiety remained with [him]2209-he as the visible justification of [his]2209-he own . It was not , indeed , anything specific that [he]2209-he feared : there had been a literal truth in [his]2209-he declaration that [he]2209-he did not think anything would happen . What troubled [him]2209-he was that , though [Dorset]133-bertha ’s attitude had perceptibly changed , the change was not clearly to be accounted for . It had certainly not been produced by [Selden]108-selden ’s arguments , or by the action of [his]2209-he own soberer reason . Five minutes ’ talk sufficed to show that some alien influence had been at work , and that it had not so much subdued [his]2209-he resentment as weakened [his]2209-he will , so that [he]2209-he moved under it in a state of apathy , like [a dangerous lunatic who has been drugged]3813-a dangerous lunatic who has been drugged . Temporarily , no doubt , however exerted , it worked for the general safety : the question was how long it would last , and by what kind of reaction it was likely to be followed . On these points [Selden]108-selden could gain no light ; for [he]108-selden saw that one effect of the transformation had been to shut [him]108-selden off from free communion with [Dorset]133-bertha . [The latter]566-the latter , indeed , was still moved by the irresistible desire to discuss [his]108-selden wrong ; but , though [he]108-selden revolved about it with the same forlorn tenacity , [Selden]108-selden was aware that something always restrained [him]108-selden from full expression . [His]108-selden state was one to produce first weariness and then impatience in [[his]108-selden hearer]3815-his hearer ; and when [their]3816-their talk was over , [Selden]108-selden began to feel that [he]108-selden had done [his]108-selden utmost , and might justifiably wash [his]108-selden hands of the sequel . It was in this mind that [he]108-selden had been making [his]108-selden way back to [the station]319-the station when [Miss Bart]109-lily crossed [his]108-selden path ; but though , after [his]108-selden brief word with [her]109-lily , [he]108-selden kept mechanically on [his]108-selden course , [he]108-selden was conscious of a gradual change in [his]108-selden purpose . The change had been produced by the look in [her]109-lily eyes ; and in [his]108-selden eagerness to define the nature of that look , [he]108-selden dropped into a seat in [the gardens]787-the gardens , and sat brooding upon the question . It was natural enough , in all conscience , that [she]109-lily should appear anxious : [a young woman placed , in the close intimacy of a yachting - cruise]3819-a young woman placed , in the close intimacy of a yachting - cruise , between [a couple on the verge of disaster]3820-a couple on the verge of disaster , could hardly , aside from [her]109-lily concern for [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends , be insensible to the awkwardness of [her]109-lily own position . The worst of it was that , in interpreting [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s state of mind , so many alternative readings were possible ; and one of these , in [Selden]108-selden ’s troubled mind , took the ugly form suggested by [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher .
