If [the girl]665-the girl was afraid , was [she]665-the girl afraid for [herself]665-the girl or for [[her]665-the girl friends]406-her friends ? And to what degree was [her]665-the girl dread of a catastrophe intensified by the sense of being fatally involved in it ? The burden of offence lying manifestly with [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , this conjecture seemed on the face of it gratuitously unkind ; but [Selden]108-selden knew that in the most one - sided matrimonial quarrel there are generally counter - charges to be brought , and that they are brought with the greater audacity where the original grievance is so emphatic . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher had not hesitated to suggest the likelihood of [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s marrying [Miss Bart]109-lily if “[0-i] anything happened ” ; and though [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s conclusions were notoriously rash , [she]135-mrs. fisher was shrewd enough in reading the signs from which they were drawn . [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset had apparently shown marked interest in [the girl]665-the girl , and this interest might be used to cruel advantage in [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife ’s struggle for rehabilitation . [Selden]108-selden knew that [Bertha]133-bertha would fight to the last round of powder : the rashness of [her]133-bertha conduct was illogically combined with a cold determination to escape its consequences . [She]133-bertha could be as unscrupulous in fighting for [herself]133-bertha as [she]133-bertha was reckless in courting danger , and whatever came to [her]133-bertha hand at such moments was likely to be used as a defensive missile . [He]108-selden did not , as yet , see clearly just what course [she]133-bertha was likely to take , but [his]108-selden perplexity increased [his]108-selden apprehension , and with it the sense that , before leaving , [he]108-selden must speak again with [Miss Bart]109-lily . Whatever [her]133-bertha share in the situation — and [he]108-selden had always honestly tried to resist judging [her]133-bertha by [her]133-bertha surroundings — however free [she]133-bertha might be from any personal connection with it , [she]133-bertha would be better out of the way of a possible crash ; and since [she]133-bertha had appealed to [him]108-selden for help , it was clearly [his]108-selden business to tell [her]133-bertha so . This decision at last brought [him]108-selden to [his]108-selden feet , and carried [him]108-selden back to [the gambling rooms]3826-the gambling rooms , within whose doors [he]108-selden had seen [her]133-bertha disappearing ; but a prolonged exploration of [the crowd]308-the crowd failed to put [him]108-selden on [her]133-bertha traces . [He]108-selden saw instead , to [his]108-selden surprise , [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton loitering somewhat ostentatiously about the tables ; and the discovery that [this actor in the drama]3828-this actor in the drama was not only hovering in the wings , but actually inviting the exposure of the footlights , though it might have seemed to imply that all peril was over , served rather to deepen [Selden]108-selden ’s sense of foreboding . Charged with this impression [he]108-selden returned to [the square]3737-the square , hoping to see [Miss Bart]109-lily move across [it]3737-the square , as [every one in [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo]3830-every one in monte carlo seemed inevitably to do at least a dozen times a day ; but here again [he]108-selden waited vainly for a glimpse of [her]133-bertha , and the conclusion was slowly forced on [him]108-selden that [she]133-bertha had gone back to [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina . It would be difficult to follow [her]133-bertha there , and still more difficult , should [he]108-selden do so , to contrive the opportunity for a private word ; and [he]108-selden had almost decided on the unsatisfactory alternative of writing , when the ceaseless diorama of [the square]3737-the square suddenly unrolled before [him]108-selden the figures of [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert and [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry . Hailing [them]3832-them at once with [his]108-selden question , [he]108-selden learned from [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert that [Miss Bart]109-lily had just returned to [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina in [[Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s company]3833-dorset ’s company ; an announcement so evidently disconcerting to [him]108-selden that [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry , after a glance from [[her]198-mrs. bry companion]445-her companion , which seemed to act like the pressure on a spring , brought forth the prompt proposal that [he]108-selden should come and meet [[his]108-selden friends]889-his friends at dinner that [evening—“At[0-i] Becassin’s]74-evening—“at becassin’s — a little dinner to [the Duchess]3567-the duchess , ” [she]198-mrs. bry flashed out before [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert had time to remove the pressure . [Selden]108-selden ’s sense of the privilege of being included in such company brought [him]108-selden early in the evening to the door of [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant , where [he]108-selden paused to scan the ranks of [diners]3837-diners approaching down [the brightly lit terrace]3838-the brightly lit terrace . There , while [the Brys]199-the brys hovered within over the last agitating alternatives of the MENU , [he]108-selden kept watch for [the guests]1526-the guests from [the Sabrina]3689-the sabrina , who at length rose on the horizon in company with [the Duchess]3567-the duchess , [Lord]3842-lord and [Lady Skiddaw]149-lady skiddaw and [the Stepneys]204-the stepneys . From [this group]3843-this group it was easy for [him]108-selden to detach [Miss Bart]109-lily on the pretext of a moment ’s glance into [one of the brilliant shops along [the terrace]760-the terrace]3844-one of the brilliant shops along the terrace , and to say to [her]0-i , while [they]3846-they lingered together in the white dazzle of [a jeweller]885-a jeweller ’s window : “[0-i] [I]0-i stopped over to see [you]0-i — to beg of [you]0-i to leave [the yacht]3592-the yacht . ” The eyes [she]0-i turned on [him]108-selden showed a quick gleam of [her]0-i former fear . “[0-i] To leave — ? What do [you]0-i mean ? What has happened ? ” “[0-i] Nothing . But if anything should , why be in the way of it ? ” The glare from [the jeweller]557-the jeweller ’s window , deepening the pallor of [her]0-i face , gave to its delicate lines the sharpness of a tragic mask . “[0-i] Nothing will , [I]0-i am sure ; but while there ’s even a doubt left , how can [you]0-i think [I]0-i would leave [Bertha]133-bertha ? ” The words rang out on a note of contempt — was it possibly of contempt for [himself]108-selden ? Well , [he]108-selden was willing to risk its renewal to the extent of insisting , with an undeniable throb of added interest : “[0-i] [You]0-i have [yourself]0-i to think of , [you]0-i know — ” to which , with a strange fall of sadness in [her]0-i voice , [she]0-i answered , meeting [his]108-selden eyes : “[0-i] If [you]0-i knew how little difference that makes ! ” “[0-i] Oh , well , nothing WILL happen , ” [he]108-selden said , more for [his]108-selden own reassurance than for [hers]0-i ; and “[0-i] Nothing , nothing , of course ! ” [she]0-i valiantly assented , as [they]3849-their turned to overtake [[their]3849-their companions]3850-their companions . In [the thronged restaurant]3851-the thronged restaurant , taking [their]3849-their places about [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s illuminated board , [their]3849-their confidence seemed to gain support from the familiarity of [their]3849-their surroundings . Here were [Dorset]133-bertha and [[his]108-selden wife]592-his wife once more presenting [their]3849-their customary faces to [the world]354-the world , [she]0-i engrossed in establishing [her]0-i relation with an intensely new gown , [he]108-selden shrinking with dyspeptic dread from the multiplied solicitations of [the MENU]3854-the menu . The mere fact that [they]3849-their thus showed [themselves]3849-their together , with the utmost openness the place afforded , seemed to declare beyond a doubt that [their]3849-their differences were composed . How this end had been attained was still matter for wonder , but it was clear that for the moment [Miss Bart]109-lily rested confidently in the result ; and [Selden]108-selden tried to achieve the same view by telling [himself]108-selden that [her]109-lily opportunities for observation had been ampler than [his]108-selden own . Meanwhile , as the dinner advanced through a labyrinth of courses , in which it became clear that [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry had occasionally broken away from [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert ’s restraining hand , [Selden]108-selden ’s general watchfulness began to lose itself in a particular study of [Miss Bart]109-lily . It was one of the days when [she]109-lily was so handsome that to be handsome was enough , and all the rest — [her]109-lily grace , [her]109-lily quickness , [her]109-lily social felicities — seemed the overflow of a bounteous nature . But what especially struck [him]108-selden was the way in which [she]109-lily detached [herself]109-lily , by a hundred undefinable shades , from [the persons who most abounded in [her]109-lily own style]3855-the persons who most abounded in her own style . It was in just such company , the fine flower and complete expression of the state [she]109-lily aspired to , that the differences came out with special poignancy , [her]109-lily grace cheapening [the other women]2802-the other women ’s smartness as [her]109-lily finely - discriminated silences made [their]2802-the other women chatter dull . The strain of the last hours had restored to [her]109-lily face the deeper eloquence which [Selden]108-selden had lately missed in it , and the bravery of [her]109-lily words to [him]108-selden still fluttered in [her]109-lily voice and eyes . Yes , [she]109-lily was matchless — it was the one word for [her]109-lily ; and [he]108-selden could give [his]108-selden admiration the freer play because so little personal feeling remained in it . [His]108-selden real detachment from [her]109-lily had taken place , not at the lurid moment of disenchantment , but now , in the sober after - light of discrimination , where [he]108-selden saw [her]109-lily definitely divided from [him]108-selden by the crudeness of a choice which seemed to deny the very differences [he]108-selden felt in [her]109-lily . It was before [him]108-selden again in its completeness — the choice in which [she]109-lily was content to rest : in the stupid costliness of the food and the showy dulness of the talk , in the freedom of speech which never arrived at wit and the freedom of act which never made for romance . The strident setting of [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant , in which [their]3858-their table seemed set apart in a special glare of publicity , and the presence at it of [little Dabham]259-little dabham of the “[0-i] Riviera Notes , ” emphasized the ideals of a world where conspicuousness passed for distinction , and the society column had become the roll of fame . It was as the immortalizer of such occasions that [little Dabham]259-little dabham , wedged in modest watchfulness between [two brilliant neighbours]3859-two brilliant neighbours , suddenly became the centre of [Selden]108-selden ’s scrutiny . How much did [he]108-selden know of what was going on , and how much , for [his]108-selden purpose , was still worth finding out ? [His]108-selden little eyes were like tentacles thrown out to catch the floating intimations with which , to [Selden]108-selden , the air at moments seemed thick ; then again it cleared to its normal emptiness , and [he]108-selden could see nothing in it for [the journalist]3860-the journalist but leisure to note the elegance of [the ladies]832-the ladies ’ gowns . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s , in particular , challenged all the wealth of [Mr. Dabham]259-little dabham ’s vocabulary : it had surprises and subtleties worthy of what [he]108-selden would have called “[0-i] the literary style . ” At first , as [Selden]108-selden had noticed , it had been almost too preoccupying to [[its]131-mrs. dorset wearer]3862-its wearer ; but now [she]109-lily was in full command of it , and was even producing [her]109-lily effects with unwonted freedom . Was [she]109-lily not , indeed , too free , too fluent , for perfect naturalness ? And was not [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , to whom [his]108-selden glance had passed by a natural transition , too jerkily wavering between the same extremes ? [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset indeed was always jerky ; but it seemed to [Selden]108-selden that tonight each vibration swung [him]108-selden farther from [his]108-selden centre . The dinner , meanwhile , was moving to its triumphant close , to the evident satisfaction of [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry , who , throned in apoplectic majesty between [Lord Skiddaw]260-lord skiddaw and [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert , seemed in spirit to be calling on [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher to witness [her]135-mrs. fisher achievement . Short of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher [[her]135-mrs. fisher audience]3863-her audience might have been called complete ; for [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant was crowded with [persons mainly gathered there for the purpose of spectatorship , and accurately posted as to the names and faces of [the celebrities [they]3863-her audience had come to see]3866-the celebrities they had come to see]3865-persons mainly gathered there for the purpose of spectatorship , and accurately posted as to the names and faces of the celebrities they had come to see . [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry , conscious that [all [her]198-mrs. bry feminine guests]3867-all her feminine guests came under that heading , and that [each one]3868-each one looked [her]198-mrs. bry part to admiration , shone on [Lily]109-lily with all the pent - up gratitude that [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher had failed to deserve . [Selden]108-selden , catching the glance , wondered what part [Miss Bart]109-lily had played in organizing the entertainment . [She]198-mrs. bry did , at least , a great deal to adorn it ; and as [he]108-selden watched the bright security with which [she]198-mrs. bry bore [herself]198-mrs. bry , [he]108-selden smiled to think that [he]108-selden should have fancied [her]198-mrs. bry in need of help . Never had [she]198-mrs. bry appeared more serenely mistress of the situation than when , at the moment of dispersal , detaching [herself]198-mrs. bry a little from [the group about the table]3869-the group about the table , [she]198-mrs. bry turned with a smile and a graceful slant of the shoulders to receive [her]198-mrs. bry cloak from [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . The dinner had been protracted over [Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry ’s exceptional cigars and a bewildering array of liqueurs , and many of the other tables were empty ; but [a sufficient number of [diners]3837-diners]3870-a sufficient number of diners still lingered to give relief to the leave - taking of [[Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests . This ceremony was drawn out and complicated by the fact that it involved , on the part of [the Duchess]3567-the duchess and [Lady Skiddaw]149-lady skiddaw , definite farewells , and pledges of speedy reunion in [Paris]24-paris , where [they]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests were to pause and replenish [their]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests wardrobes on the way to [England]75-england . The quality of [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s hospitality , and of the tips [[her]198-mrs. bry husband]609-her husband had presumably imparted , lent to the manner of [the English ladies]3875-the english ladies a general effusiveness which shed the rosiest light over [[their]3875-the english ladies hostess]3876-their hostess ’s future . In its glow [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset and [the Stepneys]3877-the stepneys were also visibly included , and the whole scene had touches of intimacy worth [their]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests weight in gold to the watchful pen of [Mr. Dabham]259-little dabham . A glance at [her]198-mrs. bry watch caused [the Duchess]3567-the duchess to exclaim to [[her]198-mrs. bry sister]2881-her sister that [they]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests had just time to dash for [[their]3872-mrs. bry ’s distinguished guests train]3880-their train , and the flurry of this departure over , [the Stepneys]204-the stepneys , who had [their]204-the stepneys motor at the door , offered to convey [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets and [Miss Bart]109-lily to [the quay]2058-the quay . The offer was accepted , and [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset moved away with [[her]131-mrs. dorset husband]609-her husband in attendance . [Miss Bart]109-lily had lingered for a last word with [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert , and [Stepney]125-jack stepney , on whom [Mr. Bry]245-mr. bry was pressing a final , and still more expensive , cigar , called out : “[0-i] Come on , [Lily]109-lily , if [you]109-lily ’re going back to [the yacht]3592-the yacht . ” [Lily]109-lily turned to obey ; but as [she]109-lily did so , [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , who had paused on [her]131-mrs. dorset way out , moved a few steps back toward the table . “[109-lily] [Miss Bart]109-lily is not going back to [the yacht]3592-the yacht , ” [she]131-mrs. dorset said in a voice of singular distinctness . A startled look ran from eye to eye ; [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry crimsoned to the verge of congestion , [Mrs. Stepney]125-jack stepney slipped nervously behind [[her]125-jack stepney husband]609-her husband , and [Selden]108-selden , in the general turmoil of [his]108-selden sensations , was mainly conscious of a longing to grip [Dabham]259-little dabham by the collar and fling [him]108-selden out into [the street]310-the street . [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , meanwhile , had stepped back to [[his]609-her husband wife]592-his wife ’s side . [His]609-her husband face was white , and [he]609-her husband looked about [him]609-her husband with cowed angry eyes . “[109-lily] [Bertha!—Miss Bart]109-lily . . . this is some misunderstanding . . . some mistake .... ” “[109-lily] [Miss Bart]109-lily remains [here]2763-here , ” [[his]609-her husband wife]592-his wife rejoined incisively . “[109-lily] And , [I]0-i think , [George]131-mrs. dorset , [we]2216-them had better not detain [Mrs. Stepney]125-jack stepney any longer . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily , during this brief exchange of words , remained in admirable erectness , slightly isolated from [the embarrassed group about [her]109-lily]3887-the embarrassed group about her . [She]109-lily had paled a little under the shock of the insult , but the discomposure of the surrounding faces was not reflected in [her]109-lily own . The faint disdain of [her]109-lily smile seemed to lift [her]109-lily high above [[her]109-lily antagonist]961-her antagonist ’s reach , and it was not till [she]109-lily had given [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset the full measure of the distance between [them]2216-them that [she]109-lily turned and extended [her]109-lily hand to [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess . “[131-mrs. dorset] [I]0-i am joining [the Duchess]3567-the duchess tomorrow , ” [she]0-i explained , “[0-i] and it seemed easier for [me]0-i to remain on [shore]3693-shore for the night . ” [She]0-i held firmly to [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry ’s wavering eye while [she]0-i gave this explanation , but when it was over [Selden]108-selden saw [her]0-i send a tentative glance from one to another of [the women]2741-the women ’s faces . [She]0-i read [their]2216-them incredulity in [their]2216-them averted looks , and in the mute wretchedness of [the men behind [them]2216-them]3891-the men behind them , and for a miserable half - second [he]108-selden thought [she]0-i quivered on the brink of failure . Then , turning to [him]108-selden with an easy gesture , and the pale bravery of [her]0-i recovered smile—“Dear[108-selden] [Mr. Selden]108-selden , ” [she]0-i said , “[108-selden] [you]108-selden promised to see [me]0-i to [[my]0-i cab]2219-my cab . ” * * * * * Outside , the sky was gusty and overcast , and as [Lily]109-lily and [Selden]108-selden moved toward [the deserted gardens]3892-the deserted gardens below [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant , spurts of warm rain blew fitfully against [their]2216-them faces . The fiction of [the cab]1750-the cab had been tacitly abandoned ; [they]2216-them walked on in silence , [her]0-i hand on [his]108-selden arm , till the deeper shade of [the gardens]787-the gardens received [them]2216-them , and pausing beside a bench , [he]108-selden said : “[108-selden] Sit down a moment . ” [She]0-i dropped to the seat without answering , but the electric lamp at the bend of [the path]997-the path shed a gleam on the struggling misery of [her]0-i face . [Selden]108-selden sat down beside [her]0-i , waiting for [her]0-i to speak , fearful lest any word [he]108-selden chose should touch too roughly on [her]0-i wound , and kept also from free utterance by the wretched doubt which had slowly renewed itself within [him]108-selden . What had brought [her]0-i to this pass ? What weakness had placed [her]0-i so abominably at [[her]0-i enemy]3897-her enemy ’s mercy ? And why should [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha have turned into [an enemy]3898-an enemy at the very moment when [she]133-bertha so obviously needed the support of [her]133-bertha sex ? Even while [his]108-selden nerves raged at the subjection of [husbands]3899-husbands to [[their]3899-husbands wives]1106-their wives , and at the cruelty of [women]2772-women to [their]2772-women kind , reason obstinately harped on the proverbial relation between smoke and fire . The memory of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s hints , and the corroboration of [his]108-selden own impressions , while they deepened [his]108-selden pity also increased [his]108-selden constraint , since , whichever way [he]108-selden sought a free outlet for sympathy , it was blocked by the fear of committing a blunder . Suddenly it struck [him]108-selden that [his]108-selden silence must seem almost as accusatory as that of [the men [he]108-selden had despised]3902-the men he had despised for turning from [her]135-mrs. fisher ; but before [he]108-selden could find the fitting word [she]135-mrs. fisher had cut [him]108-selden short with a question . “[108-selden] Do [you]2220-he know of [a quiet hotel]2221-a quiet hotel ? [I]0-i can send for [[my]0-i maid]2742-my maid in the morning . ” “[0-i] [An hotel]2178-an hotel — HERE — that [you]2220-he can go to alone ? It ’s not possible . ” [She]135-mrs. fisher met this with a pale gleam of [her]135-mrs. fisher old playfulness . “[0-i] What IS , then ? It ’s too wet to sleep in [the gardens]787-the gardens . ” “[2889-some one] But there must be [some one]2889-some one — — ” “[2889-some one] [Some one to whom [I]0-i can go]2226-some one to whom i can go ? Of course — any number — but at THIS hour ? [You]2220-he see [my]0-i change of plan was rather sudden — — ” “[2220-he] Good God — if [you]2227-you ’d listened to [me]0-i ! ” [he]2220-he cried , venting [his]2220-he helplessness in a burst of anger . [She]135-mrs. fisher still held [him]2220-he off with the gentle mockery of [her]135-mrs. fisher smile . “[2227-you] But have n’t [I]0-i ? ” [she]135-mrs. fisher rejoined . “[2220-he] [You]2220-he advised [me]0-i to leave [the yacht]3592-the yacht , and [I]0-i ’m leaving [it]3592-the yacht . ” [He]2220-he saw then , with a pang of self - reproach , that [she]135-mrs. fisher meant neither to explain nor to defend [herself]135-mrs. fisher ; that by [his]2220-he miserable silence [he]2220-he had forfeited all chance of helping [her]135-mrs. fisher , and that the decisive hour was past . [She]135-mrs. fisher had risen , and stood before [him]2220-he in a kind of clouded majesty , like [some deposed princess]3903-some deposed princess moving tranquilly to exile . “[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily ! ” [he]2220-he exclaimed , with a note of despairing appeal ; but—“Oh[109-lily] , not now , ” [she]135-mrs. fisher gently admonished [him]2220-he ; and then , in all the sweetness of [her]135-mrs. fisher recovered composure : “[109-lily] Since [I]0-i must find shelter somewhere , and since [you]2220-he ’re so kindly here to help [me]0-i — — ” [He]2220-he gathered [himself]2220-he up at the challenge . “[2220-he] [You]109-lily will do as [I]0-i tell [you]109-lily ? There ’s but one thing , then ; [you]109-lily must go straight to [[your]109-lily cousins]2229-your cousins , [the Stepneys]204-the stepneys . ” “[204-the stepneys] Oh — ” broke from [her]135-mrs. fisher with a movement of instinctive resistance ; but [he]2220-he insisted : “[204-the stepneys] Come — it ’s late , and [you]109-lily must appear to have gone [there]2755-there directly . ” [He]2220-he had drawn [her]135-mrs. fisher hand into [his]2220-he arm , but [she]135-mrs. fisher held [him]2220-he back with a last gesture of protest . “[0-i] [I]0-i can’t — [I]0-i can’t — not that — [you]109-lily do n’t know [Gwen]119-gwen : [you]109-lily must n’t ask [me]0-i ! ” “[109-lily] [I]0-i MUST ask [you]109-lily — [you]109-lily must obey [me]0-i , ” [he]2220-he persisted , though infected at heart by [her]135-mrs. fisher own fear . [Her]135-mrs. fisher voice sank to a whisper : “[0-i] And if [she]109-lily refuses?”—but , “[109-lily] Oh , trust [me]0-i — trust [me]0-i ! ” [he]2220-he could only insist in return ; and yielding to [his]2220-he touch , [she]135-mrs. fisher let [him]2220-he lead [her]135-mrs. fisher back in silence to the edge of [the square]3737-the square . In [the cab]1750-the cab [they]3906-they continued to remain silent through the brief drive which carried [them]3906-they to the illuminated portals of [[the Stepneys]204-the stepneys ’ hotel]3907-the stepneys ’ hotel . Here [he]2220-he left [her]135-mrs. fisher outside , in the darkness of the raised hood , while [his]2220-he name was sent up to [Stepney]125-jack stepney , and [he]2220-he paced [the showy hall]3908-the showy hall , awaiting [the latter]566-the latter ’s descent . Ten minutes later [the two men]1871-the two men passed out together between [the gold - laced custodians of the threshold]3911-the gold - laced custodians of the threshold ; but in [the vestibule]3912-the vestibule [Stepney]125-jack stepney drew up with a last flare of reluctance . “[0-i] It ’s understood , then ? ” [he]2220-he stipulated nervously , with [his]2220-he hand on [Selden]108-selden ’s arm . “[2231-she] [She]2231-she leaves tomorrow by [the early train]2232-the early train — and [[my]0-i wife]2959-my wife ’s asleep , and ca n’t be disturbed . ” Chapter 4 The blinds of [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s drawing - room]716-mrs. peniston ’s drawing - room were drawn down against the oppressive June sun , and in the sultry twilight the faces of [[her]114-mrs. peniston assembled relatives]3914-her assembled relatives took on a fitting shadow of bereavement . [They]3914-her assembled relatives were all there : [Van Alstynes]261-van alstynes , [Stepneys]204-the stepneys and [Melsons]262-melsons — even [a stray Peniston]3915-a stray peniston or two , indicating , by a greater latitude in dress and manner , the fact of remoter relationship and more settled hopes . [The Peniston]114-mrs. peniston side was , in fact , secure in the knowledge that the bulk of [[Mr. Peniston]143-mr. peniston ’s property]3916-mr. peniston ’s property “[109-lily] went back ” ; while the direct connection hung suspended on the disposal of [[his]143-mr. peniston widow]3917-his widow ’s private fortune and on the uncertainty of its extent . [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney , in [his]143-mr. peniston new character as [the richest nephew]3918-the richest nephew , tacitly took the lead , emphasizing [his]143-mr. peniston importance by the deeper gloss of [his]143-mr. peniston mourning and the subdued authority of [his]143-mr. peniston manner ; while [[his]143-mr. peniston wife]592-his wife ’s bored attitude and frivolous gown proclaimed [the heiress]1096-the heiress ’s disregard of the insignificant interests at stake . [Old Ned Van Alstyne]263-ned , seated next to [her]592-his wife in a coat that made affliction dapper , twirled [his]263-ned white moustache to conceal the eager twitch of [his]263-ned lips ; and [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , red - nosed and smelling of crape , whispered emotionally to [Mrs. Herbert Melson]172-herbert melson : “[0-i] [I]0-i could n’t BEAR to see [the Niagara]2234-the niagara anywhere else ! ” A rustle of weeds and quick turning of heads hailed the opening of the door , and [Lily Bart]109-lily appeared , tall and noble in [her]109-lily black dress , with [Gerty Farish]112-gerty at [her]109-lily side . [The women]2741-the women ’s faces , as [she]109-lily paused interrogatively on the threshold , were a study in hesitation . [One or two]3922-one or two made faint motions of recognition , which might have been subdued either by the solemnity of the scene , or by the doubt as to how far [the others]3217-the others meant to go ; [Mrs. Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney gave a careless nod , and [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , with a sepulchral gesture , indicated a seat at [her]592-his wife side . But [Lily]109-lily , ignoring the invitation , as well as [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney ’s official attempt to direct [her]109-lily , moved across [the room]351-the room with [her]109-lily smooth free gait , and seated [herself]109-lily in a chair which seemed to have been purposely placed apart from [the others]3217-the others . It was the first time that [she]109-lily had faced [[her]109-lily family]3926-her family since [her]109-lily return from [Europe]21-europe , two weeks earlier ; but if [she]109-lily perceived any uncertainty in [their]3926-her family welcome , it served only to add a tinge of irony to the usual composure of [her]109-lily bearing . The shock of dismay with which , on [the dock]3927-the dock , [she]109-lily had heard from [Gerty Farish]112-gerty of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s sudden death , had been mitigated , almost at once , by the irrepressible thought that now , at last , [she]109-lily would be able to pay [her]109-lily debts . [She]109-lily had looked forward with considerable uneasiness to [her]109-lily first encounter with [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt . [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston had vehemently opposed [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece ’s departure with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets , and had marked [her]114-mrs. peniston continued disapproval by not writing during [Lily]109-lily ’s absence . The certainty that [she]109-lily had heard of the rupture with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets made the prospect of the meeting more formidable ; and how should [Lily]109-lily have repressed a quick sense of relief at the thought that , instead of undergoing the anticipated ordeal , [she]109-lily had only to enter gracefully on a long - assured inheritance ? It had been , in the consecrated phrase , “[0-i] always understood ” that [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston was to provide handsomely for [[her]114-mrs. peniston niece]707-her niece ; and in [the latter]566-the latter ’s mind the understanding had long since crystallized into fact . “[2235-she] [She]2235-she gets everything , of course — [I]0-i do n’t see what [we]2236-we ’re [here]2763-here for , ” [Mrs. Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney remarked with careless loudness to [Ned Van Alstyne]263-ned ; and [the latter]566-the latter ’s deprecating murmur—“Julia[3933-a just woman”—might] was always [a just woman”—might]3933-a just woman”—might have been interpreted as signifying either acquiescence or doubt . “[3933-a just woman”—might] Well , it ’s only about four hundred thousand , ” [Mrs. Stepney]125-jack stepney rejoined with a yawn ; and [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , in the silence produced by [the lawyer]3934-the lawyer ’s preliminary cough , was heard to sob out : “[2238-they] [They]2238-they wo n’t find a towel missing — [I]0-i went over them with [her]2235-she the very day — — ” [Lily]109-lily , oppressed by the close atmosphere , and the stifling odour of fresh mourning , felt [her]109-lily attention straying as [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer]3935-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer , solemnly erect behind the Buhl table at the end of [the room]351-the room , began to rattle through the preamble of the will . “[0-i] It ’s like being in [church]818-church , ” [she]109-lily reflected , wondering vaguely where [Gwen Stepney]264-gwen stepney had got such an awful hat . Then [she]109-lily noticed how stout [Jack]125-jack stepney had grown — [he]3934-the lawyer would soon be almost as plethoric as [Herbert Melson]172-herbert melson , who sat a few feet off , breathing puffily as [he]3934-the lawyer leaned [his]3934-the lawyer black - gloved hands on [his]3934-the lawyer stick . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder why [rich people]3001-rich people always grow fat — [I]0-i suppose it ’s because there ’s nothing to worry [them]3001-rich people . If [I]0-i inherit , [I]0-i shall have to be careful of [my]0-i figure , ” [she]0-i mused , while [the lawyer]3934-the lawyer droned on through a labyrinth of legacies . [The servants]490-the servants came first , then [a few charitable institutions]3939-a few charitable institutions , then several remoter [Melsons]262-melsons and [Stepneys , who stirred consciously as their names rang out , and then subsided into a state of impassiveness befitting the solemnity of the occasion]3940-stepneys , who stirred consciously as their names rang out , and then subsided into a state of impassiveness befitting the solemnity of the occasion . [Ned Van Alstyne]263-ned , [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney , and [a cousin or two]3941-a cousin or two followed , each coupled with the mention of [a few thousands]3942-a few thousands : [Lily]109-lily wondered that [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney was not among [them]3942-a few thousands . Then [she]109-lily heard [her]109-lily own name—“to[3298-my niece] [[my]0-i niece]3298-my niece [Lily]109-lily Bart ten thousand dollars — ” and after that [the lawyer]3934-the lawyer again lost [himself]3934-the lawyer in a coil of unintelligible periods , from which the concluding phrase flashed out with startling distinctness : “[109-lily] and the residue of [my]0-i estate to [[my]0-i dear cousin]2242-my dear cousin and name - sake , [Grace Julia Stepney]187-grace stepney . ” There was a subdued gasp of surprise , a rapid turning of heads , and a surging of sable figures toward the corner in which [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney wailed out [her]203-miss stepney sense of unworthiness through the crumpled ball of a black - edged handkerchief . [Lily]109-lily stood apart from the general movement , feeling [herself]109-lily for the first time utterly alone . [No one]2766-no one looked at [her]109-lily , [no one]2766-no one seemed aware of [her]109-lily presence ; [she]109-lily was probing the very depths of insignificance . And under [her]109-lily sense of the collective indifference came the acuter pang of hopes deceived . Disinherited — [she]109-lily had been disinherited — and for [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney ! [She]109-lily met [Gerty]112-gerty ’s lamentable eyes , fixed on [her]109-lily in a despairing effort at consolation , and the look brought [her]109-lily to [herself]109-lily . There was something to be done before [she]109-lily left [the house]488-the house : to be done with all the nobility [she]109-lily knew how to put into such gestures . [She]109-lily advanced to the group about [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney , and holding out [her]109-lily hand said simply : “[187-grace stepney] [Dear Grace]265-dear grace , [I]0-i am so glad . ” [The other ladies]1587-the other ladies had fallen back at [her]109-lily approach , and a space created itself about [her]109-lily . It widened as [she]109-lily turned to go , and [no one]2766-no one advanced to fill it up . [She]109-lily paused a moment , glancing about [her]109-lily , calmly taking the measure of [her]109-lily situation . [She]109-lily heard [some one]2889-some one ask a question about the date of the will ; [she]109-lily caught a fragment of [the lawyer]3934-the lawyer ’s answer — something about a sudden summons , and an “[265-dear grace] earlier instrument . ” Then the tide of dispersal began to drift past [her]109-lily ; [Mrs. Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney and [Mrs. Herbert Melson]172-herbert melson stood on the doorstep awaiting [their]1587-the other ladies motor ; [a sympathizing group]3951-a sympathizing group escorted [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney to [the cab]1750-the cab it was felt to be fitting [she]187-grace stepney should take , though [she]187-grace stepney lived but [a street or two away]3953-a street or two away ; and [Miss Bart]109-lily and [Gerty]112-gerty found [themselves]1587-the other ladies almost alone in [the purple drawing - room]3954-the purple drawing - room , which more than ever , in [its]3954-the purple drawing - room stuffy dimness , resembled [a well - kept family vault]3955-a well - kept family vault , in which the last corpse had just been decently deposited . * * * * * In [[Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s sitting - room]3956-gerty farish ’s sitting - room , whither a hansom had carried [the two friends]3957-the two friends , [Lily]109-lily dropped into a chair with a faint sound of laughter : it struck [her]109-lily as a humorous coincidence that [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s legacy should so nearly represent the amount of [her]109-lily debt to [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor . The need of discharging that debt had reasserted itself with increased urgency since [her]109-lily return to [America]29-america , and [she]109-lily spoke [her]109-lily first thought in saying to [the anxiously hovering Gerty]112-gerty : “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder when the legacies will be paid . ” But [Miss Farish]113-miss farish could not pause over the legacies ; [she]109-lily broke into a larger indignation . “[0-i] Oh , [Lily]109-lily , it ’s unjust ; it ’s cruel — [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney must FEEL [she]187-grace stepney has no right to all that money ! ” “[187-grace stepney] [Any one who knew how to please [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia]2243-any one who knew how to please aunt julia has a right to [her]238-aunt julia money , ” [Miss Bart]109-lily rejoined philosophically . “[238-aunt julia] But [she]238-aunt julia was devoted to [you]109-lily — [she]238-aunt julia led [every one]693-every one to think — ” [Gerty]112-gerty checked [herself]112-gerty in evident embarrassment , and [Miss Bart]109-lily turned to [her]112-gerty with a direct look . “[238-aunt julia] [Gerty]112-gerty , be honest : this will was made only six weeks ago . [She]238-aunt julia had heard of [my]0-i break with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets ? ” “[238-aunt julia] [Every one]693-every one heard , of course , that there had been some disagreement — some misunderstanding — — ” “[238-aunt julia] Did [she]238-aunt julia hear that [Bertha]133-bertha turned [me]0-i off [the yacht]3592-the yacht ? ” “[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily ! ” “[109-lily] That was what happened , [you]109-lily know . [She]238-aunt julia said [I]0-i was trying to marry [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . [She]238-aunt julia did it to make [him]2247-him think [she]238-aunt julia was jealous . Is n’t that what [she]238-aunt julia told [Gwen Stepney]264-gwen stepney ? ” “[238-aunt julia] [I]0-i do n’t know — [I]0-i do n’t listen to such horrors . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i MUST listen to [them]2248-them — [I]0-i must know where [I]0-i stand . ” [She]0-i paused , and again sounded a faint note of derision . “[0-i] Did [you]109-lily notice [the women]2741-the women ? [They]2741-the women were afraid to snub [me]0-i while [they]2741-the women thought [I]0-i was going to get the money — afterward [they]2741-the women scuttled off as if [I]0-i had the plague . ” [Gerty]112-gerty remained silent , and [she]0-i continued : “[2741-the women] [I]0-i stayed on to see what would happen . [They]2741-the women took [their]2741-the women cue from [Gwen Stepney]264-gwen stepney and [Lulu Melson]215-louisa — [I]0-i saw [them]2741-the women watching to see what [Gwen]264-gwen stepney would do.—Gerty , [I]0-i must know just what is being said of [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]2250-you [I]0-i do n’t listen — — ” “[0-i] [One]2737-one hears such things without listening . ” [She]0-i rose and laid [her]0-i resolute hands on [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s shoulders . “[2737-one] [Gerty]112-gerty , are [people]2804-people going to cut [me]0-i ? ” “[2804-people] [[Your]112-gerty FRIENDS]3005-your friends , [Lily]109-lily — how can [you]112-gerty think it ? ” “[112-gerty] Who are [one ’s friends]2254-one ’s friends at such a time ? And heaven knows what [YOU]112-gerty suspect [me]0-i of ! ” [She]0-i kissed [Gerty]112-gerty with a whimsical murmur . “[112-gerty] [You]112-gerty ’d never let it make any difference — but then [you]112-gerty ’re fond of [criminals]2256-criminals , [Gerty]112-gerty ! How about [the irreclaimable ones]2257-the irreclaimable ones , though ? For [I]0-i ’m absolutely impenitent , [you]112-gerty know . ” [She]0-i drew [herself]0-i up to the full height of [her]0-i slender majesty , towering like some dark angel of defiance above the troubled [Gerty]112-gerty , who could only falter out : “[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily , [Lily]109-lily — how can [you]109-lily laugh about such things ? ” “[109-lily] So as not to weep , perhaps . But no — [I’m]0-i not of the tearful order . [I]0-i discovered early that crying makes [my]0-i nose red , and the knowledge has helped [me]0-i through several painful episodes . ” [She]0-i took a restless turn about [the room]351-the room , and then , reseating [herself]0-i , lifted the bright mockery of [her]0-i eyes to [Gerty]112-gerty ’s anxious countenance . “[0-i] [I]0-i should n’t have minded , [you]112-gerty know , if [I]0-i ’d got the money — ” and at [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s protesting “[0-i] Oh ! ” [she]0-i repeated calmly : “[0-i] Not a straw , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear ; for , in the first place , [they]2259-they would n’t have quite dared to ignore [me]0-i ; and if [they]2259-they had , it would n’t have mattered , because [I]0-i should have been independent of [them]2259-they . But now — ! ” The irony faded from [her]0-i eyes , and [she]0-i bent a clouded face upon [[her]0-i friend]754-her friend . “[112-gerty] How can [you]112-gerty talk so , [Lily]109-lily ? Of course the money ought to have been [yours]112-gerty , but after all that makes no difference . The important thing — — ” [Gerty]112-gerty paused , and then continued firmly : “[112-gerty] The important thing is that [you]112-gerty should clear [yourself]112-gerty — should tell [[your]112-gerty friends]3005-your friends the whole truth . ” “[112-gerty] The whole truth ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily laughed . “[112-gerty] What is truth ? Where [a woman]2771-a woman is concerned , it ’s the story that ’s easiest to believe . In this case it ’s a great deal easier to believe [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s story than [mine]2262-mine , because [she]133-bertha has [a big house]2263-a big house and an opera box , and it ’s convenient to be on good terms with [her]133-bertha . ” [Miss Farish]113-miss farish still fixed [her]109-lily with an anxious gaze . “[133-bertha] But what IS [your]109-lily story , [Lily]109-lily ? [I]0-i do n’t believe [any one]442-any one knows it yet . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i story?—I do n’t believe [I]0-i know it [myself]0-i . [You]2265-you see [I]0-i never thought of preparing a version in advance as [Bertha]133-bertha did — and if [I]0-i had , [I]0-i do n’t think [I]0-i should take the trouble to use it now . ” But [Gerty]112-gerty continued with [her]112-gerty quiet reasonableness : “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t want a version prepared in advance — but [I]0-i want [you]2265-you to tell [me]0-i exactly what happened from the beginning . ” “[2265-you] From the beginning ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily gently mimicked [her]2265-you . “[2265-you] [Dear Gerty]266-dear gerty , how little imagination [you]2265-you [good people]2266-good people have ! Why , the beginning was in [my]0-i cradle , [I]0-i suppose — in the way [I]0-i was brought up , and the things [I]0-i was taught to care for . Or no — [I]0-i wo n’t blame [anybody]361-anybody for [my]0-i faults : [I]0-i ’ll say it was in [my]0-i blood , that [I]0-i got it from [some wicked pleasure - loving ancestress , who reacted against the homely virtues of [New Amsterdam]76-new amsterdam]2268-some wicked pleasure - loving ancestress , who reacted against the homely virtues of new amsterdam , and wanted to be back at [the court of [the Charleses]267-the charleses]2269-the court of the charleses ! ” And as [Miss Farish]113-miss farish continued to press [her]112-gerty with troubled eyes , [she]0-i went on impatiently : “[2265-you] [You]2265-you asked [me]0-i just now for the truth — well , the truth about [any girl]2270-any girl is that once [she]2270-any girl ’s talked about [she]2270-any girl ’s done for ; and the more [she]2270-any girl explains [her]2270-any girl case the worse it looks.—My good [Gerty]112-gerty , [you]112-gerty do n’t happen to have a cigarette about [you]112-gerty ? ” * * * * * In [[her]112-gerty stuffy room]3961-her stuffy room at [the hotel to which [she]112-gerty had gone on landing]3962-the hotel to which she had gone on landing , [Lily Bart]109-lily that evening reviewed [her]112-gerty situation . It was the last week in June , and [none of [[her]112-gerty friends]406-her friends were in [town]305-town]3963-none of her friends were in town . [The few relatives who had stayed on , or returned , for the reading of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s will]3966-the few relatives who had stayed on , or returned , for the reading of mrs. peniston ’s will , had taken flight again that afternoon to [Newport]22-newport or [Long Island]77-long island ; and not one of [them]3966-the few relatives who had stayed on , or returned , for the reading of mrs. peniston ’s will had made any proffer of hospitality to [Lily]109-lily . For the first time in [her]112-gerty life [she]112-gerty found [herself]112-gerty utterly alone except for [Gerty Farish]112-gerty . Even at the actual moment of [her]112-gerty break with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets [she]112-gerty had not had so keen a sense of its consequences , for [the Duchess of [Beltshire]27-beltshire]2076-the duchess of beltshire , hearing of the catastrophe from [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert , had instantly offered [her]2076-the duchess of beltshire protection , and under [her]2076-the duchess of beltshire sheltering wing [Lily]109-lily had made an almost triumphant progress to [London]13-london . There [she]112-gerty had been sorely tempted to linger on in [a society which asked of [her]112-gerty only to amuse and charm it]3968-a society which asked of her only to amuse and charm it , without enquiring too curiously how [she]112-gerty had acquired [her]112-gerty gift for doing so ; but [Selden]108-selden , before [they]3969-they parted , had pressed on [her]112-gerty the urgent need of returning at once to [[her]112-gerty aunt]345-her aunt , and [Lord Hubert]176-lord hubert , when [he]176-lord hubert presently reappeared in [London]13-london , abounded in the same counsel . [Lily]109-lily did not need to be told that [the Duchess]3567-the duchess ’s championship was not the best road to social rehabilitation , and as [she]112-gerty was besides aware that [[her]112-gerty noble defender]3972-her noble defender might at any moment drop [her]112-gerty in favour of [a new PROTEGEE]3973-a new protegee , [she]112-gerty reluctantly decided to return to [America]29-america . But [she]112-gerty had not been ten minutes on [[her]112-gerty native shore]3974-her native shore before [she]112-gerty realized that [she]112-gerty had delayed too long to regain it . [The Dorsets]122-the dorsets , [the Stepneys]204-the stepneys , [the Brys]199-the brys — all [the actors]3013-the actors and [witnesses in the miserable drama]3976-witnesses in the miserable drama — had preceded [her]112-gerty with [their]3977-their version of the case ; and , even had [she]112-gerty seen the least chance of gaining a hearing for [her]112-gerty own , some obscure disdain and reluctance would have restrained [her]112-gerty . [She]112-gerty knew it was not by explanations and counter - charges that [she]112-gerty could ever hope to recover [her]112-gerty lost standing ; but even had [she]112-gerty felt the least trust in [their]3977-their efficacy , [she]112-gerty would still have been held back by the feeling which had kept [her]112-gerty from defending [herself]112-gerty to [Gerty Farish]112-gerty — a feeling that was half pride and half humiliation . For though [she]112-gerty knew [she]112-gerty had been ruthlessly sacrificed to [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s determination to win back [[her]133-bertha husband]609-her husband , and though [her]112-gerty own relation to [Dorset]133-bertha had been that of the merest good - fellowship , yet [she]112-gerty had been perfectly aware from the outset that [her]112-gerty part in the affair was , as [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher brutally put it , to distract [Dorset]133-bertha ’s attention from [[his]609-her husband wife]592-his wife . That was what [she]112-gerty was “[112-gerty] there for ” : it was the price [she]112-gerty had chosen to pay for three months of luxury and freedom from care . [Her]112-gerty habit of resolutely facing the facts , in [her]112-gerty rare moments of introspection , did not now allow [her]112-gerty to put any false gloss on the situation . [She]112-gerty had suffered for the very faithfulness with which [she]112-gerty had carried out [her]112-gerty part of the tacit compact , but the part was not a handsome one at best , and [she]112-gerty saw it now in all the ugliness of failure . [She]112-gerty saw , too , in the same uncompromising light , the train of consequences resulting from that failure ; and these became clearer to [her]112-gerty with every day of [her]112-gerty weary lingering in [town]305-town . [She]112-gerty stayed on partly for the comfort of [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s nearness , and partly for lack of knowing where to go . [She]112-gerty understood well enough the nature of the task before [her]112-gerty . [She]112-gerty must set out to regain , little by little , the position [she]112-gerty had lost ; and the first step in the tedious task was to find out , as soon as possible , on how many of [[her]112-gerty friends]406-her friends [she]112-gerty could count . [Her]112-gerty hopes were mainly centred on [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , who had treasures of easy - going tolerance for those who were amusing or useful to [her]123-mrs. trenor , and in the noisy [rush of whose existence the still small voice of detraction]3982-rush of whose existence the still small voice of detraction was slow to make itself heard . But [Judy]126-judy , though [she]126-judy must have been apprised of [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s return , had not even recognized it by the formal note of condolence which [[her]126-judy friend]754-her friend ’s bereavement demanded . Any advance on [Lily]109-lily ’s side might have been perilous : there was nothing to do but to trust to the happy chance of an accidental meeting , and [Lily]109-lily knew that , even so late in the season , there was always a hope of running across [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends in [their]406-her friends frequent passages through [town]305-town . To this end [she]109-lily assiduously showed [herself]109-lily at [the restaurants [they]406-her friends frequented , where , attended by [the troubled Gerty]112-gerty]3986-the restaurants they frequented , where , attended by the troubled gerty , [she]109-lily lunched luxuriously , as [she]109-lily said , on [her]109-lily expectations . “[112-gerty] [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear [Gerty]112-gerty , [you]112-gerty would n’t have [me]0-i let [the head - waiter]2272-the head - waiter see that [I]0-i ’ve nothing to live on but [Aunt Julia]238-aunt julia ’s legacy ? Think of [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney ’s satisfaction if [she]187-grace stepney came in and found [us]2273-us lunching on cold mutton and tea ! What sweet shall [we]2273-us have today , [dear]2964-dear — [COUPE JACQUES or PECHES A LA MELBA]268-coupe jacques or peches a la melba ? ” [She]109-lily dropped the MENU abruptly , with a quick heightening of colour , and [Gerty]112-gerty , following [her]109-lily glance , was aware of the advance , from [an inner room]3987-an inner room , of a party headed by [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor and [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher . It was impossible for [these ladies]3988-these ladies and [[their]3988-these ladies companions]3850-their companions — among whom [Lily]109-lily had at once distinguished both [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor and [Rosedale]124-rosedale — not to pass , in going out , the table at which [the two girls]1936-the two girls were seated ; and [Gerty]112-gerty ’s sense of the fact betrayed itself in the helpless trepidation of [her]109-lily manner . [Miss Bart]109-lily , on the contrary , borne forward on the wave of [her]109-lily buoyant grace , and neither shrinking from [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends nor appearing to lie in wait for [them]406-her friends , gave to the encounter the touch of naturalness which [she]109-lily could impart to the most strained situations . Such embarrassment as was shown was on [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s side , and manifested itself in the mingling of exaggerated warmth with imperceptible reservations . [Her]109-lily loudly affirmed pleasure at seeing [Miss Bart]109-lily took the form of a nebulous generalization , which included neither enquiries as to [her]109-lily future nor the expression of a definite wish to see [her]109-lily again . [Lily]109-lily , well - versed in the language of these omissions , knew that they were equally intelligible to [the other members of the party]3992-the other members of the party : even [Rosedale]124-rosedale , flushed as [he]124-rosedale was with the importance of keeping such company , at once took the temperature of [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s cordiality , and reflected it in [his]124-rosedale off - hand greeting of [Miss Bart]109-lily . [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , red and uncomfortable , had cut short [his]124-rosedale salutations on the pretext of a word to say to [the head - waiter]2272-the head - waiter ; and [the rest of [the group]959-the group]3994-the rest of the group soon melted away in [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s wake . It was over in a moment — [the waiter]3996-the waiter , MENU in hand , still hung on the result of the choice between [COUPE JACQUES]268-coupe jacques or peches a la melba and [PECHES A LA MELBA]268-coupe jacques or peches a la melba — but [Miss Bart]109-lily , in the interval , had taken the measure of [her]109-lily fate . Where [Judy Trenor]126-judy led , all [the world]354-the world would follow ; and [Lily]109-lily had the doomed sense of [the castaway who has signalled in vain to fleeing sails]3998-the castaway who has signalled in vain to fleeing sails . In a flash [she]109-lily remembered [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s complaints of [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s rapacity , and saw that they denoted an unexpected acquaintance with [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband ’s private affairs . In the large tumultuous disorder of the life at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , where [no one]2766-no one seemed to have time to observe [any one else]4001-any one else , and private aims and personal interests were swept along unheeded in the rush of collective activities , [Lily]109-lily had fancied [herself]109-lily sheltered from inconvenient scrutiny ; but if [Judy]126-judy knew when [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher borrowed money of [[her]109-lily husband]609-her husband , was [she]126-judy likely to ignore the same transaction on [Lily]109-lily ’s part ? If [she]109-lily was careless of [his]609-her husband affections [she]109-lily was plainly jealous of [his]609-her husband pocket ; and in that fact [Lily]109-lily read the explanation of [her]109-lily rebuff . The immediate result of these conclusions was the passionate resolve to pay back [her]109-lily debt to [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor . That obligation discharged , [she]109-lily would have but a thousand dollars of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s legacy left , and nothing to live on but [her]109-lily own small income , which was considerably less than [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s wretched pittance ; but this consideration gave way to the imperative claim of [her]109-lily wounded pride . [She]109-lily must be quits with [the Trenors]111-gus first ; after that [she]109-lily would take thought for the future . In [her]109-lily ignorance of legal procrastinations [she]109-lily had supposed that [her]109-lily legacy would be paid over within a few days of the reading of [[her]109-lily aunt]345-her aunt ’s will ; and after an interval of anxious suspense , [she]109-lily wrote to enquire the cause of the delay . There was another interval before [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer]3935-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer , who was also [one of [the executors]4006-the executors]4005-one of the executors , replied to the effect that , some questions having arisen relative to the interpretation of the will , [he]3935-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer and [[his]3935-mrs. peniston ’s lawyer associates]4007-his associates might not be in a position to pay the legacies till the close of the twelvemonth legally allotted for [their]4006-the executors settlement . Bewildered and indignant , [Lily]109-lily resolved to try the effect of a personal appeal ; but [she]109-lily returned from [her]109-lily expedition with a sense of the powerlessness of beauty and charm against the unfeeling processes of the law . It seemed intolerable to live on for another year under the weight of [her]109-lily debt ; and in [her]109-lily extremity [she]109-lily decided to turn to [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney , who still lingered in [town]305-town , immersed in the delectable duty of “[187-grace stepney] going over ” [her]109-lily benefactress ’s effects . It was bitter enough for [Lily]109-lily to ask a favour of [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , but the alternative was bitterer still ; and one morning [she]109-lily presented [herself]109-lily at [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s]4009-mrs. peniston ’s , where [Grace]187-grace stepney , for the facilitation of [her]187-grace stepney pious task , had taken up [a provisional abode]4010-a provisional abode . The strangeness of entering as a suppliant [the house where [she]187-grace stepney had so long commanded]4011-the house where she had so long commanded , increased [Lily]109-lily ’s desire to shorten the ordeal ; and when [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney entered [the darkened drawing - room]4012-the darkened drawing - room , rustling with the best quality of crape , [[her]203-miss stepney visitor]1346-her visitor went straight to the point : would [she]187-grace stepney be willing to advance the amount of the expected legacy ? [Grace]187-grace stepney , in reply , wept and wondered at the request , bemoaned the inexorableness of the law , and was astonished that [Lily]109-lily had not realized the exact similarity of [their]4014-their positions . Did [she]187-grace stepney think that only the payment of the legacies had been delayed ? Why , [Miss Stepney]203-miss stepney [herself]203-miss stepney had not received a penny of [her]203-miss stepney inheritance , and was paying rent — yes , actually!—for the privilege of living in [a house that belonged to [her]203-miss stepney]4015-a house that belonged to her . [She]203-miss stepney was sure it was not what [poor dear cousin [Julia]187-grace stepney]4016-poor dear cousin julia would have wished — [she]203-miss stepney had told [the executors]4006-the executors so to [their]4006-the executors faces ; but [they]4006-the executors were inaccessible to reason , and there was nothing to do but to wait . Let [Lily]109-lily take example by [her]187-grace stepney , and be patient — let [them]4006-the executors both remember how beautifully patient [cousin Julia]187-grace stepney had always been . [Lily]109-lily made a movement which showed [her]109-lily imperfect assimilation of this example . “[187-grace stepney] But [you]2275-you will have everything , [Grace]187-grace stepney — it would be easy for [you]2275-you to borrow ten times the amount [I]0-i am asking for . ” “[0-i] Borrow — easy for [me]0-i to borrow ? ” [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney rose up before [her]2275-you in sable wrath . “[0-i] Do [you]2275-you imagine for a moment that [I]0-i would raise money on [my]0-i expectations from [cousin Julia]187-grace stepney , when [I]0-i know so well [her]187-grace stepney unspeakable horror of every transaction of the sort ? Why , [Lily]109-lily , if [you]109-lily must know the truth , it was the idea of [your]109-lily being in debt that brought on [her]187-grace stepney illness — [you]109-lily remember [she]187-grace stepney had a slight attack before [you]109-lily sailed . Oh , [I]0-i do n’t know the particulars , of course — [I]0-i do n’t WANT to know them — but there were rumours about [your]109-lily affairs that made [her]187-grace stepney most unhappy — [no one]2766-no one could be with [her]187-grace stepney without seeing that . [I]0-i ca n’t help it if [you]109-lily are offended by [my]0-i telling [you]109-lily this now — if [I]0-i can do anything to make [you]109-lily realize the folly of [your]109-lily course , and how deeply [SHE]187-grace stepney disapproved of it , [I]0-i shall feel it is the truest way of making up to [you]109-lily for [her]187-grace stepney loss . ” Chapter 5 It seemed to [Lily]109-lily , as [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s door closed on [her]109-lily , that [she]109-lily was taking a final leave of [her]109-lily old life . The future stretched before [her]109-lily dull and bare as [the deserted length of [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue]4018-the deserted length of fifth avenue , and opportunities showed as meagrely as the few cabs trailing in quest of fares that did not come . The completeness of the analogy was , however , disturbed as [she]109-lily reached [the sidewalk]382-the sidewalk by the rapid approach of a hansom which pulled up at sight of [her]109-lily . From beneath its luggage - laden top , [she]109-lily caught the wave of a signalling hand ; and the next moment [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , springing to [the street]310-the street , had folded [her]109-lily in a demonstrative embrace . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear , [you]2871-my dear do n’t mean to say [you]2871-my dear ’re still in [town]305-town ? When [I]0-i saw [you]2871-my dear the other day at [Sherry]5-sherry ’s ’s [I]0-i did n’t have time to ask — — ” [She]0-i broke off , and added with a burst of frankness : “[0-i] The truth is [I]0-i was [HORRID]270-horrid , [Lily]109-lily , and [I]0-i ’ve wanted to tell [you]2871-my dear so ever since . ” “[0-i] Oh — — ” [Miss Bart]109-lily protested , drawing back from [her]109-lily penitent clasp ; but [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher went on with [her]135-mrs. fisher usual directness : “[0-i] Look here , [Lily]109-lily , do n’t let ’s beat about the bush : half the trouble in life is caused by pretending there is n’t any . That ’s not [my]0-i way , and [I]0-i can only say [I]0-i ’m thoroughly ashamed of [myself]0-i for following [the other women]2802-the other women ’s lead . But [we]2280-we ’ll talk of that by and bye — tell [me]0-i now where [you]2871-my dear ’re staying and what [your]2871-my dear plans are . [I]0-i do n’t suppose [you]2871-my dear ’re keeping [house]2281-house in [there]2755-there with [Grace Stepney]187-grace stepney , eh?—and it struck [me]0-i [you]2871-my dear might be rather at loose ends . ” In [Lily]109-lily ’s present mood there was no resisting the honest friendliness of this appeal , and [she]0-i said with a smile : “[0-i] [I]0-i am at loose ends for the moment , but [Gerty Farish]112-gerty is still in [town]305-town , and [she]112-gerty ’s good enough to let [me]0-i be with [her]112-gerty whenever [she]112-gerty can spare the time . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher made a slight grimace . “[112-gerty] H’m — that ’s a temperate joy . Oh , [I]0-i know — [Gerty]112-gerty ’s a trump , and worth [all the rest of [us]2285-us]2284-all the rest of us put together ; but A LA LONGUE [you]2871-my dear ’re used to a little higher seasoning , are n’t [you]2871-my dear , [dear]2964-dear ? And besides , [I]0-i suppose [she]112-gerty ’ll be off [herself]112-gerty before long — the first of August , [you]2871-my dear say ? Well , look here , [you]2871-my dear ca n’t spend [your]2871-my dear summer in [town]305-town ; [we]2285-us ’ll talk of that later too . But meanwhile , what do [you]2871-my dear say to putting a few things in a trunk and coming down with [me]0-i to [the Sam Gormers]257-the gormers ’ tonight ? ” And as [Lily]109-lily stared at the breathless suddenness of the suggestion , [she]0-i continued with [her]0-i easy laugh : “[2871-my dear] [You]2871-my dear do n’t know [them]2288-they and [they]2288-they do n’t know [you]2871-my dear ; but that do n’t make a rap of difference . [They]2288-they ’ve taken [the Van Alstyne place at [Roslyn]78-roslyn]2289-the van alstyne place at roslyn , and [I]0-i ’ve got [CARTE BLANCHE]79-carte blanche to bring [[my]0-i friends]2827-my friends down there — the more the merrier . [They]2288-they do things awfully well , and there ’s to be rather a jolly party there this week — — ” [she]0-i broke off , checked by an undefinable change in [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s expression . “[2288-they] Oh , [I]0-i do n’t mean [YOUR]2871-my dear particular set , [you]2871-my dear know : rather [a different crowd]2291-a different crowd , but very good fun . The fact is , [the Gormers]257-the gormers have struck out on a line of [their]2288-they own : what [they]2288-they want is to have a good time , and to have it in [their]2288-they own way . [They]2288-they gave the other thing a few months ’ trial , under [my]0-i distinguished auspices , and [they]2288-they were really doing extremely well — getting on a good deal faster than [the Brys]199-the brys , just because [they]2288-they did n’t care as much — but suddenly [they]2288-they decided that the whole business bored [them]2288-they , and that what [they]2288-they wanted was [a crowd [they]2288-they could really feel at [home]400-home with]2292-a crowd they could really feel at home with . [Rather original of [them]2288-they]2294-rather original of them , do n’t [you]2871-my dear think so ? [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer HAS got aspirations still ; [women]2772-women always have ; but [she]271-mattie gormer ’s awfully easy - going , and [Sam]257-the gormers wo n’t be bothered , and [they]2288-they both like to be [the most important people in sight]2296-the most important people in sight , so [they]2288-they ’ve started a sort of continuous performance of [their]2288-they own , a kind of social [Coney Island]80-coney island , where [everybody]2995-everybody is welcome who can make noise enough and does n’t put on airs . [I]0-i think it ’s awfully good fun [myself]0-i — some of the artistic set , [you]2871-my dear know , [any pretty actress that ’s going]2298-any pretty actress that ’s going , and so on . This week , for instance , [they]2288-they have [Audrey Anstell]272-audrey anstell , who made such a hit last spring in ‘ The Winning of [Winny]273-freddy ’ ; and [Paul Morpeth]208-paul morpeth — [he]208-paul morpeth ’s painting [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer — and [the Dick Bellingers]274-the dick bellingers , and [Kate Corby]171-kate corby — well , every one [you]2871-my dear can think of who ’s jolly and makes a row . Now do n’t stand there with [your]2871-my dear nose in the air , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear — it will be a good deal better than a broiling Sunday in [town]305-town , and [you]2871-my dear ’ll find [clever people]2301-clever people as well as [noisy ones]2302-noisy ones — [Morpeth]208-paul morpeth , who admires [Mattie]271-mattie gormer enormously , always brings one or two of [his]208-paul morpeth set . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher drew [Lily]109-lily toward [the hansom]390-the hansom with friendly authority . “[208-paul morpeth] Jump in now , there ’s [a dear]3385-a dear , and [we]2304-we ’ll drive round to [[your]2871-my dear hotel]2305-your hotel and have [your]2871-my dear things packed , and then [we]2304-we ’ll have tea , and [the two maids]2306-the two maids can meet [us]2304-we at [the train]2843-the train . ” * * * * * It was a good deal better than a broiling Sunday in [town]305-town — of that no doubt remained to [Lily]109-lily as , reclining in the shade of [a leafy verandah]4023-a leafy verandah , [she]109-lily looked seaward across a stretch of greensward picturesquely dotted with groups of ladies in lace raiment and [men in tennis flannels]4024-men in tennis flannels . [The huge Van Alstyne house]4025-the huge van alstyne house and [[its]4025-the huge van alstyne house rambling dependencies]4026-its rambling dependencies were packed to their fullest capacity with [[the Gormers]257-the gormers ’ week - end guests , who now , in the radiance of [the Sunday forenoon]4028-the sunday forenoon]4027-the gormers ’ week - end guests , who now , in the radiance of the sunday forenoon , were dispersing [themselves]4027-the gormers ’ week - end guests , who now , in the radiance of the sunday forenoon over [the grounds]4029-the grounds in quest of the various distractions [the place]3204-the place afforded : distractions ranging from [tennis - courts]4031-tennis - courts to [shooting - galleries]4032-shooting - galleries , from [bridge]3048-bridge and whiskey within doors to motors and steam - launches without . [Lily]109-lily had the odd sense of having been caught up into [the crowd]308-the crowd as carelessly as [a passenger]4035-a passenger is gathered in by [an express train]4036-an express train . [The blonde]4037-the blonde and genial [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer might , indeed , have figured [the conductor]4038-the conductor , calmly assigning seats to the rush of [travellers]4039-travellers , while [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher represented [the porter]2853-the porter pushing [their]4039-travellers bags into place , giving [them]4039-travellers [their]4039-travellers numbers for [the dining - car]4041-the dining - car , and warning [them]4039-travellers when [[their]4039-travellers station]4042-their station was at hand . [The train]2843-the train , meanwhile , had scarcely slackened speed — life whizzed on with a deafening ’ rattle and roar , in which [one traveller]4044-one traveller at least found a welcome refuge from the sound of [her]4044-one traveller own thoughts . [The Gormer MILIEU]276-the gormer milieu represented a social out - skirt which [Lily]109-lily had always fastidiously avoided ; but it struck [her]109-lily , now that [she]109-lily was in it , as only a flamboyant copy of [[her]109-lily own world]4045-her own world , a caricature approximating the real thing as the “[2306-the two maids] society play ” approaches the manners of [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room . [The people]4047-the people about [her]109-lily were doing the same things as [the Trenors]111-gus , [the Van Osburghs]150-the van osburghs and [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets : the difference lay in a hundred shades of aspect and manner , from the pattern of [the men]831-the men ’s waistcoats to the inflexion of [the women]2741-the women ’s voices . Everything was pitched in a higher key , and there was more of each thing : more noise , more colour , more champagne , more familiarity — but also greater good - nature , less rivalry , and a fresher capacity for enjoyment . [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s arrival had been welcomed with an uncritical friendliness that first irritated [her]109-lily pride and then brought [her]109-lily to a sharp sense of [her]109-lily own situation — of the place in life which , for the moment , [she]109-lily must accept and make the best of . [These people]887-these people knew [her]109-lily story — of that [her]109-lily first long talk with [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher had left no doubt : [she]109-lily was publicly branded as [the heroine of a “[2306-the two maids] queer ” episode]4051-the heroine of a “ queer ” episode — but instead of shrinking from [her]109-lily as [[her]109-lily own friends]4052-her own friends had done , [they]887-these people received [her]109-lily without question into the easy promiscuity of [their]887-these people lives . [They]887-these people swallowed [her]109-lily past as easily as [they]887-these people did [Miss Anstell]277-miss anstell ’s , and with no apparent sense of any difference in the size of the mouthful : all [they]887-these people asked was that [she]109-lily should — in [her]109-lily own way , for [they]887-these people recognized a diversity of gifts — contribute as much to the general amusement as [that graceful actress , whose talents , when off the stage , were of the most varied order]4053-that graceful actress , whose talents , when off the stage , were of the most varied order . [Lily]109-lily felt at once that any tendency to be “[2306-the two maids] stuck - up , ” to mark a sense of differences and distinctions , would be fatal to [her]109-lily continuance in the Gormer set . To be taken in on such terms — and into such a world!—was hard enough to the lingering pride in [her]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily realized , with a pang of self - contempt , that to be excluded from it would , after all , be harder still . For , almost at once , [she]109-lily had felt the insidious charm of slipping back into a life where every material difficulty was smoothed away . The sudden escape from [a stifling hotel in [a dusty deserted city]4055-a dusty deserted city to the space and luxury of [a great country - house fanned by sea breezes]4056-a great country - house fanned by sea breezes]4054-a stifling hotel in a dusty deserted city to the space and luxury of a great country - house fanned by sea breezes , had produced a state of moral lassitude agreeable enough after the nervous tension and physical discomfort of the past weeks . For the moment [she]109-lily must yield to the refreshment [her]109-lily senses craved — after that [she]109-lily would reconsider [her]109-lily situation , and take counsel with [her]109-lily dignity . [Her]109-lily enjoyment of [her]109-lily surroundings was , indeed , tinged by the unpleasant consideration that [she]109-lily was accepting the hospitality and courting the approval of [people]2804-people [she]109-lily had disdained under other conditions . But [she]109-lily was growing less sensitive on such points : a hard glaze of indifference was fast forming over [her]109-lily delicacies and susceptibilities , and each concession to expediency hardened the surface a little more . On the Monday , when the party disbanded with uproarious adieux , the return to [town]305-town threw into stronger relief the charms of the life [she]109-lily was leaving . [The other guests]838-the other guests were dispersing to take up the same existence in a different setting : some at [Newport]22-newport , some at [Bar Harbour]81-bar harbour , some in [the elaborate rusticity of [an Adirondack camp]4061-an adirondack camp]4060-the elaborate rusticity of an adirondack camp . Even [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , who welcomed [Lily]109-lily ’s return with tender solicitude , would soon be preparing to join [the aunt with whom [she]109-lily spent [her]109-lily summers on [Lake George]82-lake george]4062-the aunt with whom she spent her summers on lake george : only [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily remained without plan or purpose , stranded in [a backwater of the great current of pleasure]4063-a backwater of the great current of pleasure . But [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , who had insisted on transporting [her]109-lily to [[her]109-lily own house]4064-her own house , where [she]109-lily [herself]109-lily was to perch for a day or two on the way to [the Brys ’ camp]4065-the brys ’ camp , came to the rescue with a new suggestion . “[2306-the two maids] Look here , [Lily]109-lily — [I’ll]2308-i’ll tell [you]109-lily what it is : [I]0-i want [you]109-lily to take [my]0-i place with [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer this summer . [They]2309-they ’re taking a party out to [Alaska]83-alaska next month in [[their]2309-they private car]2310-their private car , and [Mattie]271-mattie gormer , who is [the laziest woman alive]2311-the laziest woman alive , wants [me]0-i to go with [them]2309-they , and relieve [her]271-mattie gormer of the bother of arranging things ; but [the Brys]199-the brys want [me]0-i too — oh , yes , [we]2312-we ’ve made it up : did n’t [I]0-i tell [you?—and]2313-you , to put it frankly , though [I]0-i like [the Gormers]257-the gormers best , there ’s more profit for [me]0-i in [the Brys]199-the brys . The fact is , [they]199-the brys want to try [Newport]22-newport this summer , and if [I]0-i can make it a success for [them]199-the brys [they]199-the brys — well , [they]199-the brys ’ll make it a success for [me]0-i . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher clasped [her]135-mrs. fisher hands enthusiastically . “[199-the brys] Do [you]2313-you know , [Lily]109-lily , the more [I]0-i think of [my]0-i idea the better [I]0-i like it — quite as much for [you]2313-you as for [myself]0-i . [The Gormers]257-the gormers have both taken a tremendous fancy to [you]2313-you , and the trip to [Alaska]83-alaska is — well — the very thing [I]0-i should want for [you]2313-you just at present . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily lifted [her]109-lily eyes with a keen glance . “[2313-you] To take [me]0-i out of [[my]0-i friends]2827-my friends ’ way , [you]2313-you mean ? ” [she]0-i said quietly ; and [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher responded with a deprecating kiss : “[2313-you] To keep [you]2313-you out of [their]2827-my friends sight till [they]2827-my friends realize how much [they]2827-my friends miss [you]2313-you . ” * * * * * [Miss Bart]109-lily went with [the Gormers]257-the gormers to [Alaska]83-alaska ; and the expedition , if it did not produce the effect anticipated by [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend , had at least the negative advantage of removing [her]754-her friend from the fiery centre of criticism and discussion . [Gerty Farish]112-gerty had opposed the plan with all the energy of [her]112-gerty somewhat inarticulate nature . [She]112-gerty had even offered to give up [her]112-gerty visit to [Lake George]82-lake george , and remain in [town]305-town with [Miss Bart]109-lily , if [the latter]566-the latter would renounce [her]112-gerty journey ; but [Lily]109-lily could disguise [her]109-lily real distaste for this plan under a sufficiently valid reason . “[2315-you] [[You]2315-you dear innocent]2316-you dear innocent , do n’t [you]2315-you see , ” [she]0-i protested , “[2315-you] that [Carry]146-carry fisher is quite right , and that [I]0-i must take up [my]0-i usual life , and go about among [people]2804-people as much as possible ? If [[my]0-i old friends]2318-my old friends choose to believe lies about [me]0-i [I]0-i shall have to make new ones , that ’s all ; and [you]2315-you know [beggars]2319-beggars must n’t be [choosers]2320-choosers .
