Not that [I]0-i do n’t like [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer — [I]0-i DO like [her]271-mattie gormer : [she]271-mattie gormer ’s kind and honest and unaffected ; and do n’t [you]2315-you suppose [I]0-i feel grateful to [her]271-mattie gormer for making [me]0-i welcome at a time when , as [you]2315-you ’ve [yourself]2315-you seen , [[my]0-i own family]2321-my own family have unanimously washed [their]2321-my own family hands of [me]0-i ? ” [Gerty]112-gerty shook [her]112-gerty head , mutely unconvinced . [She]112-gerty felt not only that [Lily]109-lily was cheapening [herself]109-lily by making use of an intimacy [she]109-lily would never have cultivated from choice , but that , in drifting back now to [her]109-lily former manner of life , [she]109-lily was forfeiting [her]109-lily last chance of ever escaping from it . [Gerty]112-gerty had but an obscure conception of what [Lily]109-lily ’s actual experience had been : but its consequences had established a lasting hold on [her]109-lily pity since the memorable night when [she]109-lily had offered up [her]109-lily own secret hope to [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s extremity . To characters like [Gerty]112-gerty ’s such a sacrifice constitutes a moral claim on the part of [the person in whose behalf it has been made]4070-the person in whose behalf it has been made . Having once helped [Lily]109-lily , [she]112-gerty must continue to help [her]109-lily ; and helping [her]109-lily , must believe in [her]109-lily , because faith is the main - spring of such natures . But even if [Miss Bart]109-lily , after [her]109-lily renewed taste of the amenities of life , could have returned to the barrenness of a [New York August]86-new york august , mitigated only by [poor Gerty]112-gerty ’s presence , [her]109-lily worldly wisdom would have counselled [her]109-lily against such an act of abnegation . [She]109-lily knew that [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher was right : that an opportune absence might be the first step toward rehabilitation , and that , at any rate , to linger on in [town]305-town out of season was a fatal admission of defeat . From [the Gormers]257-the gormers ’ tumultuous progress across [[their]4072-their native continent]4073-their native continent , [she]109-lily returned with an altered view of [her]109-lily situation . The renewed habit of luxury — the daily waking to an assured absence of care and presence of material ease — gradually blunted [her]109-lily appreciation of these values , and left [her]109-lily more conscious of the void they could not fill . [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer ’s undiscriminating good - nature , and the slap - dash sociability of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends , who treated [Lily]109-lily precisely as [they]406-her friends treated [each other]2955-each other — all these characteristic notes of difference began to wear upon [her]109-lily endurance ; and the more [she]109-lily saw to criticize in [[her]109-lily companions]667-her companions , the less justification [she]109-lily found for making use of [them]667-her companions . The longing to get back to [her]109-lily former surroundings hardened to a fixed idea ; but with the strengthening of [her]109-lily purpose came the inevitable perception that , to attain it , [she]109-lily must exact fresh concessions from [her]109-lily pride . [These]4077-these , for the moment , took the unpleasant form of continuing to cling to [[her]109-lily hosts]1438-her hosts after [their]1438-her hosts return from [Alaska]83-alaska . Little as [she]109-lily was in the key of [their]1438-her hosts MILIEU , [her]109-lily immense social facility , [her]109-lily long habit of adapting [herself]109-lily to [others]1333-others without suffering [her]109-lily own outline to be blurred , the skilled manipulation of all the polished implements of [her]109-lily craft , had won for [her]109-lily an important place in [the Gormer group]4080-the gormer group . If [their]1438-her hosts resonant hilarity could never be [hers]109-lily , [she]109-lily contributed a note of easy elegance more valuable to [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer than the louder passages of [the band]4081-the band . [Sam Gormer]278-sam gormer and [[his]278-sam gormer special cronies]4082-his special cronies stood indeed a little in awe of [her]109-lily ; but [Mattie]271-mattie gormer ’s following , headed by [Paul Morpeth]208-paul morpeth , made [her]109-lily feel that [they]1438-her hosts prized [her]109-lily for the very qualities [they]1438-her hosts most conspicuously lacked . If [Morpeth]208-paul morpeth , whose social indolence was as great as [his]208-paul morpeth artistic activity , had abandoned [himself]208-paul morpeth to the easy current of [the Gormer]87-the gormer existence , where the minor exactions of politeness were unknown or ignored , and [a man]2811-a man could either break [his]2811-a man engagements , or keep them in a painting - jacket and slippers , [he]2811-a man still preserved [his]2811-a man sense of differences , and [his]2811-a man appreciation of graces [he]2811-a man had no time to cultivate . During the preparations for [the Brys]199-the brys ’ TABLEAUX [he]2811-a man had been immensely struck by [Lily]109-lily ’s plastic possibilities—“not[2322-her] the face : too self - controlled for expression ; but the rest of [her]2322-her — gad , what a model [she]2322-her ’d make!”—and though [his]2811-a man abhorrence of [the world in which [he]2811-a man had seen [her]109-lily]4084-the world in which he had seen her was too great for [him]2811-a man to think of seeking [her]109-lily there , [he]2811-a man was fully alive to the privilege of having [her]109-lily to look at and listen to while [he]2811-a man lounged in [[Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer ’s dishevelled drawing - room]4085-mattie gormer ’s dishevelled drawing - room . [Lily]109-lily had thus formed , in the tumult of [her]109-lily surroundings , a little nucleus of friendly relations which mitigated the crudeness of [her]109-lily course in lingering with [the Gormers]257-the gormers after [their]4086-their return . Nor was [she]109-lily without pale glimpses of [her]109-lily own world , especially since the breaking up of the Newport season had set the social current once more toward [Long Island]77-long island . [Kate Corby]171-kate corby , whose tastes made [her]171-kate corby as promiscuous as [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher was rendered by [her]171-kate corby necessities , occasionally descended on [the Gormers]257-the gormers , where , after a first stare of surprise , [she]171-kate corby took [Lily]109-lily ’s presence almost too much as a matter of course . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , too , appearing frequently in [the neighbourhood]4087-the neighbourhood , drove over to impart [her]135-mrs. fisher experiences and give [Lily]109-lily what [she]135-mrs. fisher called the latest report from the weather - bureau ; and [the latter]566-the latter , who had never directly invited [her]135-mrs. fisher confidence , could yet talk with [her]135-mrs. fisher more freely than with [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , in whose presence it was impossible even to admit the existence of much that [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher conveniently took for granted . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , moreover , had no embarrassing curiosity . [She]135-mrs. fisher did not wish to probe the inwardness of [Lily]109-lily ’s situation , but simply to view it from the outside , and draw [her]135-mrs. fisher conclusions accordingly ; and these conclusions , at the end of a confidential talk , [she]135-mrs. fisher summed up to [[her]135-mrs. fisher friend]754-her friend in the succinct remark : “[2322-her] [You]2323-you must marry as soon as [you]2323-you can . ” [Lily]109-lily uttered a faint laugh — for once [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher lacked originality . “[2324-you] Do [you]2324-you mean , like [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , to recommend the unfailing panacea of ‘ [a good man]2325-a good man ’s love ’ ? ” “[2324-you] No — [I]0-i do n’t think either of [[my]0-i candidates]2326-my candidates would answer to that description , ” said [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher after a pause of reflection . “[2326-my candidates] Either ? Are there actually two ? ” “[0-i] Well , perhaps [I]0-i ought to say one and a half — for the moment . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily received this with increasing amusement . “[0-i] Other things being equal , [I]0-i think [I]0-i should prefer [a half - husband]2327-a half - husband : who is [he]2327-a half - husband ? ” “[2327-a half - husband] Do n’t fly out at [me]0-i till [you]2324-you hear [my]0-i reasons — [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . ” “[131-mrs. dorset] Oh — — ” [Lily]109-lily murmured reproachfully ; but [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher pressed on unrebuffed . “[131-mrs. dorset] Well , why not ? [They]2328-they had a few weeks ’ honeymoon when [they]2328-they first got back from [Europe]21-europe , but now things are going badly with [them]2328-they again . [Bertha]133-bertha has been behaving more than ever like [a madwoman]2329-a madwoman , and [George]131-mrs. dorset ’s powers of credulity are very nearly exhausted . [They]2328-they ’re at [[their]2328-they place]2330-their place here , [you]2331-you know , and [I]0-i spent last Sunday with [them]2328-they . It was a ghastly party — [no one else]703-no one else but [poor Neddy Silverton]252-young silverton , who looks like [a galley - slave]2333-a galley - slave ( [they]2328-they used to talk of [my]0-i making [that poor boy]2334-that poor boy unhappy!)—and after luncheon [George]131-mrs. dorset carried [me]0-i off on a long walk , and told [me]0-i the end would have to come soon . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily made an incredulous gesture . “[131-mrs. dorset] As far as that goes , the end will never come — [Bertha]133-bertha will always know how to get [him]2334-that poor boy back when [she]133-bertha wants [him]2334-that poor boy . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher continued to observe [her]109-lily tentatively . “[133-bertha] Not if [he]2334-that poor boy has [any one else to turn to]2335-any one else to turn to ! Yes — that ’s just what it comes to : the poor creature ca n’t stand alone . And [I]0-i remember [him]2334-that poor boy such [a good fellow , full of life and enthusiasm]2336-a good fellow , full of life and enthusiasm . ” [She]0-i paused , and went on , dropping [her]0-i glance from [Lily]109-lily ’s : “[2334-that poor boy] [He]2334-that poor boy would n’t stay with [her]133-bertha ten minutes if [he]2334-that poor boy KNEW — — ” “[2334-that poor boy] Knew — — ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily repeated . “[2334-that poor boy] What [YOU]2337-you must , for instance — with the opportunities [you]2337-you ’ve had ! If [he]2334-that poor boy had positive proof , [I]0-i mean — — ” [Lily]109-lily interrupted [her]0-i with a deep blush of displeasure . “[0-i] Please let [us]2338-us drop the subject , [Carry]146-carry fisher : it ’s too odious to [me]0-i . ” And to divert [[her]0-i companion]445-her companion ’s attention [she]0-i added , with an attempt at lightness : “[146-carry fisher] And [[your]2337-you second candidate]2339-your second candidate ? [We]2338-us must not forget [him]2334-that poor boy . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher echoed [her]0-i laugh . “[0-i] [I]0-i wonder if [you]2337-you ’ll cry out just as loud if [I]0-i say — [Sim Rosedale]124-rosedale ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily did not cry out : [she]0-i sat silent , gazing thoughtfully at [[her]0-i friend]754-her friend . The suggestion , in truth , gave expression to a possibility which , in the last weeks , had more than once recurred to [her]0-i ; but after a moment [she]0-i said carelessly : “[124-rosedale] [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale wants [a wife who can establish [him]124-rosedale in the bosom of the [Van Osburghs]150-the van osburghs and [Trenors]111-gus]2340-a wife who can establish him in the bosom of the van osburghs and trenors . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher caught [her]2337-you up eagerly . “[2340-a wife who can establish him in the bosom of the van osburghs and trenors] And so [YOU]2337-you could — with [his]124-rosedale money ! Do n’t [you]2337-you see how beautifully it would work out for [you]2337-you both ? ” “[2337-you] [I]0-i do n’t see any way of making [him]124-rosedale see it , ” [Lily]109-lily returned , with a laugh intended to dismiss the subject . But in reality it lingered with [her]109-lily long after [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher had taken leave . [She]109-lily had seen very little of [Rosedale]124-rosedale since [her]109-lily annexation by [the Gormers]257-the gormers , for [he]124-rosedale was still steadily bent on penetrating to [the inner Paradise from which [she]109-lily was now excluded]4092-the inner paradise from which she was now excluded ; but once or twice , when nothing better offered , [he]124-rosedale had turned up for a Sunday , and on these occasions [he]124-rosedale had left [her]109-lily in no doubt as to [his]124-rosedale view of [her]109-lily situation . That [he]124-rosedale still admired [her]109-lily was , more than ever , offensively evident ; for in the Gormer circle , where [he]124-rosedale expanded as in [[his]124-rosedale native element]4093-his native element , there were no puzzling conventions to check the full expression of [his]124-rosedale approval . But it was in the quality of [his]124-rosedale admiration that [she]109-lily read [his]124-rosedale shrewd estimate of [her]109-lily case . [He]124-rosedale enjoyed letting [the Gormers]257-the gormers see that [he]124-rosedale had known “[0-i] [Miss Lily”—she]279-miss lily”—she was “[109-lily] [Miss Lily]109-lily ” to [him]124-rosedale now — before [they]4094-their had had the faintest social existence : enjoyed more especially impressing [Paul Morpeth]208-paul morpeth with the distance to which [their]4094-their intimacy dated back . But [he]124-rosedale let it be felt that that intimacy was a mere ripple on the surface of a rushing social current , the kind of relaxation which a man of large interests and manifold preoccupations permits [himself]124-rosedale in [his]124-rosedale hours of ease . The necessity of accepting this view of [their]4094-their past relation , and of meeting it in the key of pleasantry prevalent among [[her]109-lily new friends]4095-her new friends , was deeply humiliating to [Lily]109-lily . But [she]109-lily dared less than ever to quarrel with [Rosedale]124-rosedale . [She]109-lily suspected that [her]109-lily rejection rankled among the most unforgettable of [his]124-rosedale rebuffs , and the fact that [he]124-rosedale knew something of [her]109-lily wretched transaction with [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , and was sure to put the basest construction on it , seemed to place [her]109-lily hopelessly in [his]124-rosedale power . Yet at [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s suggestion a new hope had stirred in [her]109-lily . Much as [she]109-lily disliked [Rosedale]124-rosedale , [she]109-lily no longer absolutely despised [him]124-rosedale . For [he]124-rosedale was gradually attaining [his]124-rosedale object in life , and that , to [Lily]109-lily , was always less despicable than to miss it . With the slow unalterable persistency which [she]109-lily had always felt in [him]124-rosedale , [he]124-rosedale was making [his]124-rosedale way through the dense mass of social antagonisms . Already [his]124-rosedale wealth , and the masterly use [he]124-rosedale had made of it , were giving [him]124-rosedale an enviable prominence in the world of affairs , and placing [Wall Street]44-wall street under obligations which only [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue could repay . In response to these claims , [his]124-rosedale name began to figure on municipal committees and charitable boards ; [he]124-rosedale appeared at banquets to [distinguished strangers]4096-distinguished strangers , and [his]124-rosedale candidacy at [one of [the fashionable clubs]4098-the fashionable clubs]4097-one of the fashionable clubs was discussed with diminishing opposition . [He]124-rosedale had figured once or twice at [the Trenor dinners]4099-the trenor dinners , and had learned to speak with just the right note of disdain of [the big Van [Osburgh]35-osburgh crushes]4100-the big van osburgh crushes ; and all [he]124-rosedale now needed was [a wife whose affiliations would shorten the last tedious steps of]4101-a wife whose affiliations would shorten the last tedious steps of [his]124-rosedale ascent . It was with that object that , a year earlier , [he]124-rosedale had fixed [his]124-rosedale affections on [Miss Bart]109-lily ; but in the interval [he]124-rosedale had mounted nearer to the goal , while [she]109-lily had lost the power to abbreviate the remaining steps of the way . All this [she]109-lily saw with the clearness of vision that came to [her]109-lily in moments of despondency . It was success that dazzled [her]109-lily — [she]109-lily could distinguish facts plainly enough in the twilight of failure . And the twilight , as [she]109-lily now sought to pierce it , was gradually lighted by a faint spark of reassurance . Under the utilitarian motive of [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s wooing [she]109-lily had felt , clearly enough , the heat of personal inclination . [She]109-lily would not have detested [him]124-rosedale so heartily had [she]109-lily not known that [he]124-rosedale dared to admire [her]109-lily . What , then , if the passion persisted , though the other motive had ceased to sustain it ? [She]109-lily had never even tried to please [him]124-rosedale — [he]124-rosedale had been drawn to [her]109-lily in spite of [her]109-lily manifest disdain . What if [she]109-lily now chose to exert the power which , even in its passive state , [he]124-rosedale had felt so strongly ? What if [she]109-lily made [him]124-rosedale marry [her]109-lily for love , now that [he]124-rosedale had no other reason for marrying [her]109-lily ? Chapter 6 As became [persons of]4102-persons of [their]4102-persons of rising consequence , [the Gormers]257-the gormers were engaged in building [a country - house on [Long Island]77-long island]4103-a country - house on long island ; and it was a part of [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s duty to attend [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess on frequent visits of inspection to [the new estate]4105-the new estate . [There]2755-there , while [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer plunged into problems of lighting and sanitation , [Lily]109-lily had leisure to wander , in the bright autumn air , along [the tree - fringed bay to which [the land]4108-the land declined]4107-the tree - fringed bay to which the land declined . Little as [she]109-lily was addicted to solitude , there had come to be moments when it seemed a welcome escape from the empty noises of [her]109-lily life . [She]109-lily was weary of being swept passively along a current of pleasure and business in which [she]109-lily had no share ; weary of seeing [other people]563-other people pursue amusement and squander money , while [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily of no more account among [them]563-other people than an expensive toy in the hands of [a spoiled child]4110-a spoiled child . It was in this frame of mind that , striking back from [the shore]1930-the shore one morning into the windings of [an unfamiliar lane]4112-an unfamiliar lane , [she]109-lily came suddenly upon the figure of [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . [The Dorset place]4113-the dorset place was in [the immediate neighbourhood of [[the Gormers]257-the gormers ’ newly - acquired estate]4115-the gormers ’ newly - acquired estate]4114-the immediate neighbourhood of the gormers ’ newly - acquired estate , and in [her]109-lily motor - flights thither with [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer , [Lily]109-lily had caught one or two passing glimpses of [the couple]960-the couple ; but [they]960-the couple moved in so different an orbit that [she]109-lily had not considered the possibility of a direct encounter . [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , swinging along with bent head , in moody abstraction , did not see [Miss Bart]109-lily till [he]4117-he was close upon [her]109-lily ; but the sight , instead of bringing [him]4117-he to a halt , as [she]109-lily had half - expected , sent [him]4117-he toward [her]109-lily with an eagerness which found expression in [his]4117-he opening words . “[280-miss bart!—you’ll] [Miss Bart!—You’ll]280-miss bart!—you’ll shake hands , wo n’t [you]280-miss bart!—you’ll ? [I]0-i ’ve been hoping to meet [you]280-miss bart!—you’ll — [I]0-i should have written to [you]280-miss bart!—you’ll if [I]0-i ’d dared . ” [His]4117-he face , with its tossed red hair and straggling moustache , had a driven uneasy look , as though life had become an unceasing race between [himself]4117-he and the thoughts at [his]4117-he heels . The look drew a word of compassionate greeting from [Lily]109-lily , and [he]4117-he pressed on , as if encouraged by [her]109-lily tone : “[0-i] [I]0-i wanted to apologize — to ask [you]280-miss bart!—you’ll to forgive [me]0-i for the miserable part [I]0-i played — — ” [She]109-lily checked [him]4117-he with a quick gesture . “[0-i] Do n’t let [us]2341-us speak of it : [I]0-i was very sorry for [you]0-i , ” [she]109-lily said , with a tinge of disdain which , as [she]109-lily instantly perceived , was not lost on [him]4117-he . [He]4117-he flushed to [his]4117-he haggard eyes , flushed so cruelly that [she]109-lily repented the thrust . “[0-i] [You]0-i might well be ; [you]0-i do n’t know — [you]0-i must let [me]0-i explain . [I]0-i was deceived : abominably deceived — — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i am still more sorry for [you]0-i , then , ” [she]109-lily interposed , without irony ; “[0-i] but [you]0-i must see that [I]0-i am not exactly [the person with whom the subject can be discussed]2342-the person with whom the subject can be discussed . ” [He]4117-he met this with a look of genuine wonder . “[0-i] Why not ? Is n’t it to [you]0-i , of [all people]2840-all people , that [I]0-i owe an explanation — — ” “[0-i] No explanation is necessary : the situation was perfectly clear to [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Ah — — ” [he]4117-he murmured , [his]4117-he head drooping again , and [his]4117-he irresolute hand switching at the underbrush along [the lane]1001-the lane . But as [Lily]109-lily made a movement to pass on , [he]4117-he broke out with fresh vehemence : “[0-i] [Miss Bart]109-lily , for [God]165-god ’s sake do n’t turn from [me]0-i ! [We]2344-we used to be [good friends]3136-good friends — [you]0-i were always kind to [me]0-i — and [you]0-i do n’t know how [I]0-i need [a friend]2800-a friend now . ” The lamentable weakness of the words roused a motion of pity in [Lily]109-lily ’s breast . [She]109-lily too needed [friends]3163-friends — [she]109-lily had tasted the pang of loneliness ; and [her]109-lily resentment of [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s cruelty softened [her]109-lily heart to [the poor wretch who was after all [the chief of [Bertha]133-bertha ’s victims]4121-the chief of bertha ’s victims]4120-the poor wretch who was after all the chief of bertha ’s victims . “[0-i] [I]0-i still wish to be kind ; [I]0-i feel no ill - will toward [you]0-i , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] But [you]0-i must understand that after what has happened [we]2347-we ca n’t be [friends]3163-friends again — [we]2347-we ca n’t see [each other]2955-each other . ” “[2347-we] Ah , [you]0-i ARE kind — [you’re]0-i merciful — [you]0-i always were ! ” [He]4122-he fixed [his]4122-he miserable gaze on [her]0-i . “[0-i] But why ca n’t [we]2347-we be [friends]3163-friends — why not , when [I]0-i ’ve repented in dust and ashes ? Is n’t it hard that [you]0-i should condemn [me]0-i to suffer for the falseness , the treachery of [others]1333-others ? [I]0-i was punished enough at the time — is there to be no respite for [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i should have thought [you]0-i had found complete respite in the reconciliation which was effected at [my]0-i expense , ” [Lily]109-lily began , with renewed impatience ; but [he]4123-he broke in imploringly : “[0-i] Do n’t put it in that way — when that ’s been the worst of [my]0-i punishment . [[My]0-i God]3450-my god ! what could [I]0-i do — wasn’t [I]0-i powerless ? [You]0-i were singled out as a sacrifice : any word [I]0-i might have said would have been turned against [you]0-i — — ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have told [you]0-i [I]0-i do n’t blame [you]0-i ; all [I]0-i ask [you]0-i to understand is that , after the use [Bertha]133-bertha chose to make of [me]0-i — after all that [her]133-bertha behaviour has since implied — it ’s impossible that [you]0-i and [I]0-i should meet . ” [He]4124-he continued to stand before [her]0-i , in [his]4124-he dogged weakness . “[0-i] Is it — need it be ? Might n’t there be circumstances — — ? ” [he]4124-he checked [himself]4124-he , slashing at the wayside weeds in a wider radius . Then [he]4124-he began again : “[109-lily] [Miss Bart]109-lily , listen — give [me]0-i a minute . If [we]2353-we ’re not to meet again , at least let [me]0-i have a hearing now . [You]109-lily say [we]2353-we ca n’t be [friends]3163-friends after — after what has happened . But ca n’t [I]0-i at least appeal to [your]0-i pity ? Ca n’t [I]0-i move [you]0-i if [I]0-i ask [you]0-i to think of [me]0-i as [a prisoner]2355-a prisoner — [a prisoner [you]0-i alone can set free]2356-a prisoner you alone can set free ? ” [Lily]109-lily ’s inward start betrayed itself in a quick blush : was it possible that this was really the sense of [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s adumbrations ? “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t see how [I]0-i can possibly be of any help to [you]0-i , ” [she]0-i murmured , drawing back a little from the mounting excitement of [his]4125-his look . [Her]0-i tone seemed to sober [him]4125-his , as it had so often done in [his]4125-his stormiest moments . The stubborn lines of [his]4125-his face relaxed , and [he]4125-his said , with an abrupt drop to docility : “[0-i] [You]0-i WOULD see , if [you]0-i ’d be as merciful as [you]0-i used to be : and heaven knows [I]0-i ’ve never needed it more ! ” [She]0-i paused a moment , moved in spite of [herself]0-i by this reminder of [her]0-i influence over [him]4125-his . [Her]0-i fibres had been softened by suffering , and the sudden glimpse into [his]4125-his mocked and broken life disarmed [her]0-i contempt for [his]4125-his weakness . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very sorry for [you]0-i — [I]0-i would help [you]0-i willingly ; but [you]0-i must have [other friends]2357-other friends , [other advisers]2358-other advisers . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i never had [a friend]2800-a friend like [you]0-i , ” [he]4125-his answered simply . “[0-i] And besides — can’t [you]0-i see?—you’re [the only person”—his voice]4126-the only person”—his voice dropped to a whisper—“the[0-i] only person who knows . ” Again [she]0-i felt [her]0-i colour change ; again [her]0-i heart rose in precipitate throbs to meet what [she]0-i felt was coming . [He]4125-his lifted [his]4125-his eyes to [her]0-i entreatingly . “[0-i] [You]0-i do see , do n’t [you]0-i ? [You]0-i understand ? [I]0-i ’m desperate — [I’m]0-i at the end of [my]0-i tether . [I]0-i want to be free , and [you]0-i can free [me]0-i . [I]0-i know [you]0-i can . [You]0-i do n’t want to keep [me]0-i bound fast in [hell]2360-hell , do [you]0-i ? [You]0-i ca n’t want to take such a vengeance as that . [You]0-i were always kind — [your]0-i eyes are kind now . [You]0-i say [you]0-i ’re sorry for [me]0-i . Well , it rests with [you]0-i to show it ; and heaven knows there ’s nothing to keep [you]0-i back . [You]0-i understand , of course — there would n’t be a hint of publicity — not a sound or a syllable to connect [you]0-i with the thing . It would never come to that , [you]0-i know : all [I]0-i need is to be able to say definitely : ‘ [I]0-i know this — and this — and this’—and the fight would drop , and the way be cleared , and the whole abominable business swept out of sight in a second . ” [He]4127-his spoke pantingly , like [a tired runner]4128-a tired runner , with breaks of exhaustion between [his]4127-his words ; and through the breaks [she]0-i caught , as through the shifting rents of a fog , great golden vistas of peace and safety . For there was no mistaking the definite intention behind [his]4127-his vague appeal ; [she]0-i could have filled up the blanks without the help of [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s insinuations . Here was [a man who turned to [her]0-i in the extremity of [his]4127-his loneliness and [his]4127-his humiliation]4129-a man who turned to her in the extremity of his loneliness and his humiliation : if [she]0-i came to [him]4127-his at such a moment [he]4127-his would be [hers]0-i with all the force of [his]4127-his deluded faith . And the power to make [him]4127-his so lay in [her]0-i hand — lay there in a completeness [he]4127-his could not even remotely conjecture . Revenge and rehabilitation might be [hers]0-i at a stroke — there was something dazzling in the completeness of the opportunity . [She]0-i stood silent , gazing away from [him]4127-his down [the autumnal stretch of [the deserted lane]4131-the deserted lane]4130-the autumnal stretch of the deserted lane . And suddenly fear possessed [her]0-i — fear of [herself]0-i , and of the terrible force of the temptation . All [her]0-i past weaknesses were like so many eager accomplices drawing [her]0-i toward the path [their]4132-their feet had already smoothed . [She]0-i turned quickly , and held out [her]0-i hand to [Dorset]133-bertha . “[2361-i’m] Goodbye — [I’m]2361-i’m sorry ; there ’s nothing in [the world]354-the world that [I]0-i can do . ” “[0-i] Nothing ? Ah , do n’t say that , ” [he]4127-his cried ; “[2361-i’m] say what ’s true : that [you]0-i abandon [me]0-i like [the others]3217-the others . [You]0-i , [the only creature who could have saved [me]0-i]2364-the only creature who could have saved me ! ” “[2361-i’m] Goodbye — goodbye , ” [she]0-i repeated hurriedly ; and as [she]0-i moved away [she]0-i heard [him]4127-his cry out on a last note of entreaty : “[2361-i’m] At least [you]0-i ’ll let [me]0-i see [you]0-i once more ? ” * * * * * [Lily]109-lily , on regaining [the Gormer grounds]4133-the gormer grounds , struck rapidly across [the lawn]788-the lawn toward [the unfinished house]4135-the unfinished house , where [she]109-lily fancied that [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess might be speculating , not too resignedly , on the cause of [her]109-lily delay ; for , like [many unpunctual persons]4137-many unpunctual persons , [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer disliked to be kept waiting . As [Miss Bart]109-lily reached [the avenue]1038-the avenue , however , [she]109-lily saw [a smart phaeton]4139-a smart phaeton with a high - stepping pair disappear behind the shrubbery in the direction of the gate ; and on the doorstep stood [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer , with a glow of retrospective pleasure on [her]275-mrs. gormer open countenance . At sight of [Lily]109-lily the glow deepened to an embarrassed red , and [she]0-i said with a slight laugh : “[0-i] Did [you]2365-you see [[my]0-i visitor]2366-my visitor ? Oh , [I]0-i thought [you]2365-you came back by [the avenue]1038-the avenue . It was [Mrs. George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset — [she]131-mrs. dorset said [she]131-mrs. dorset ’d dropped in to make a neighbourly call . ” [Lily]109-lily met the announcement with [her]109-lily usual composure , though [her]109-lily experience of [Bertha]133-bertha ’s idiosyncrasies would not have led [her]109-lily to include the neighbourly instinct among [them]4140-them ; and [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer , relieved to see that [she]109-lily gave no sign of surprise , went on with a deprecating laugh : “[131-mrs. dorset] Of course what really brought [her]131-mrs. dorset was curiosity — [she]131-mrs. dorset made [me]0-i take [her]131-mrs. dorset all over [the house]488-the house . But [no one]2766-no one could have been nicer — no airs , [you]2365-you know , and so good - natured : [I]0-i can quite see why [people]2804-people think [her]131-mrs. dorset so fascinating . ” This surprising event , coinciding too completely with [her]109-lily meeting with [Dorset]133-bertha to be regarded as contingent upon it , had yet immediately struck [Lily]109-lily with a vague sense of foreboding . It was not in [Bertha]133-bertha ’s habits to be neighbourly , much less to make advances to [any one outside the immediate circle of [her]133-bertha affinities]4141-any one outside the immediate circle of her affinities . [She]133-bertha had always consistently ignored the world of [outer aspirants]4142-outer aspirants , or had recognized [its individual members]4143-its individual members only when prompted by motives of self - interest ; and the very capriciousness of [her]133-bertha condescensions had , as [Lily]109-lily was aware , given them special value in the eyes of [the persons [she]109-lily distinguished]4144-the persons she distinguished . [Lily]109-lily saw this now in [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer ’s unconcealable complacency , and in the happy irrelevance with which , for the next day or two , [she]109-lily quoted [Bertha]133-bertha ’s opinions and speculated on the origin of [her]133-bertha gown . All the secret ambitions which [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer ’s native indolence , and the attitude of [[her]275-mrs. gormer companions]667-her companions , kept in habitual abeyance , were now germinating afresh in the glow of [Bertha]133-bertha ’s advances ; and whatever the cause of the latter , [Lily]109-lily saw that , if they were followed up , [they]4146-they were likely to have a disturbing effect upon [her]109-lily own future . [She]109-lily had arranged to break the length of [her]109-lily stay with [[her]109-lily new friends]4095-her new friends by one or two visits to [other acquaintances]4148-other acquaintances as recent ; and on [her]109-lily return from this somewhat depressing excursion [she]109-lily was immediately conscious that [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s influence was still in the air . There had been another exchange of visits , a tea at [a country - club]4149-a country - club , an encounter at a hunt ball ; there was even a rumour of an approaching dinner , which [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer , with an unnatural effort at discretion , tried to smuggle out of the conversation whenever [Miss Bart]109-lily took part in it . [The latter]566-the latter had already planned to return to [town]305-town after a farewell Sunday with [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends ; and , with [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s aid , had discovered [a small private hotel]4153-a small private hotel where [she]109-lily might establish [herself]109-lily for the winter . [The hotel]3643-the hotel being on the edge of [a fashionable neighbourhood]4155-a fashionable neighbourhood , the price of the few square feet [she]109-lily was to occupy was considerably in excess of [her]109-lily means ; but [she]109-lily found a justification for [her]109-lily dislike of [poorer quarters]4156-poorer quarters in the argument that , at this particular juncture , it was of the utmost importance to keep up a show of prosperity . In reality , it was impossible for [her]109-lily , while [she]109-lily had the means to pay [her]109-lily way for a week ahead , to lapse into a form of existence like [[Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s]4157-gerty farish ’s . [She]109-lily had never been so near the brink of insolvency ; but [she]109-lily could at least manage to meet [her]109-lily weekly hotel bill , and having settled the heaviest of [her]109-lily previous debts out of the money [she]109-lily had received from [Trenor]123-mrs. trenor , [she]109-lily had a still fair margin of credit to go upon . The situation , however , was not agreeable enough to lull [her]109-lily to complete unconsciousness of its insecurity . [[Her]109-lily rooms]4158-her rooms , with [their]4158-her rooms cramped outlook down a sallow vista of brick walls and fire - escapes , [her]109-lily lonely meals in [the dark restaurant with [its]4159-the dark restaurant with its surcharged ceiling and haunting smell of coffee surcharged ceiling and haunting smell of coffee]4159-the dark restaurant with its surcharged ceiling and haunting smell of coffee — all these material discomforts , which were yet to be accounted as so many privileges soon to be withdrawn , kept constantly before [her]109-lily the disadvantages of [her]109-lily state ; and [her]109-lily mind reverted the more insistently to [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s counsels . Beat about the question as [she]109-lily would , [she]109-lily knew the outcome of it was that [she]109-lily must try to marry [Rosedale]124-rosedale ; and in this conviction [she]109-lily was fortified by an unexpected visit from [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . [She]109-lily found [him]124-rosedale , on the first Sunday after [her]109-lily return to [town]305-town , pacing [[her]109-lily narrow sitting - room]4161-her narrow sitting - room to the imminent peril of the few knick - knacks with which [she]109-lily had tried to disguise its plush exuberances ; but the sight of [her]109-lily seemed to quiet [him]124-rosedale , and [he]124-rosedale said meekly that [he]124-rosedale had n’t come to bother [her]109-lily — that [he]124-rosedale asked only to be allowed to sit for half an hour and talk of anything [she]109-lily liked . In reality , as [she]109-lily knew , [he]124-rosedale had but one subject : [himself]124-rosedale and [his]124-rosedale wretchedness ; and it was the need of [her]109-lily sympathy that had drawn [him]124-rosedale back . But [he]124-rosedale began with a pretence of questioning [her]109-lily about [herself]109-lily , and as [she]109-lily replied , [she]109-lily saw that , for the first time , a faint realization of [her]109-lily plight penetrated the dense surface of [his]124-rosedale self - absorption . Was it possible that [[her]109-lily old beast of [an aunt]4163-an aunt]4162-her old beast of an aunt had actually cut [her]109-lily off ? That [she]109-lily was living alone like this because there was [no one else]703-no one else for [her]109-lily to go to , and that [she]109-lily really had n’t more than enough to keep alive on till the wretched little legacy was paid ? The fibres of sympathy were nearly atrophied in [him]124-rosedale , but [he]124-rosedale was suffering so intensely that [he]124-rosedale had a faint glimpse of what other sufferings might mean — and , as [she]109-lily perceived , an almost simultaneous perception of the way in which [her]109-lily particular misfortunes might serve [him]124-rosedale . When at length [she]109-lily dismissed [him]124-rosedale , on the pretext that [she]109-lily must dress for dinner , [he]124-rosedale lingered entreatingly on the threshold to blurt out : “[2804-people] It ’s been such a comfort — do say [you]2371-you ’ll let [me]0-i see [you]2371-you again — ” But to this direct appeal it was impossible to give an assent ; and [she]109-lily said with friendly decisiveness : “[2371-you] [I]0-i ’m sorry — but [you]0-i know why [I]0-i ca n’t . ” [He]124-rosedale coloured to the eyes , pushed the door shut , and stood before [her]109-lily embarrassed but insistent . “[0-i] [I]0-i know how [you]0-i might , if [you]0-i would — if things were different — and it lies with [you]0-i to make them so . It ’s just a word to say , and [you]0-i put [me]0-i out of [my]0-i misery ! ” [Their]2372-their eyes met , and for a second [she]109-lily trembled again with the nearness of the temptation . “[0-i] [You]0-i ’re mistaken ; [I]0-i know nothing ; [I]0-i saw nothing , ” [she]109-lily exclaimed , striving , by sheer force of reiteration , to build a barrier between [herself]109-lily and [her]109-lily peril ; and as [he]124-rosedale turned away , groaning out “[0-i] [You]0-i sacrifice [us]2372-their both , ” [she]109-lily continued to repeat , as if it were a charm : “[0-i] [I]0-i know nothing — absolutely nothing . ” * * * * * [Lily]109-lily had seen little of [Rosedale]124-rosedale since [her]109-lily illuminating talk with [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , but on the two or three occasions when [they]2372-their had met [she]109-lily was conscious of having distinctly advanced in [his]124-rosedale favour . There could be no doubt that [he]124-rosedale admired [her]109-lily as much as ever , and [she]109-lily believed it rested with [herself]109-lily to raise [his]124-rosedale admiration to the point where it should bear down the lingering counsels of expediency . The task was not an easy one ; but neither was it easy , in [her]109-lily long sleepless nights , to face the thought of what [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset was so clearly ready to offer . Baseness for baseness , [she]109-lily hated the other least : there were even moments when a marriage with [Rosedale]124-rosedale seemed the only honourable solution of [her]109-lily difficulties . [She]109-lily did not indeed let [her]109-lily imagination range beyond the day of plighting : after that everything faded into a haze of material well - being , in which the personality of [[her]109-lily benefactor]4165-her benefactor remained mercifully vague . [She]109-lily had learned , in [her]109-lily long vigils , that there were certain things not good to think of , certain midnight images that must at any cost be exorcised — and one of these was the image of [herself]109-lily as [[Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s wife]4166-rosedale ’s wife . [Carry Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , on the strength , as [she]135-mrs. fisher frankly owned , of [the Brys]199-the brys ’ Newport success , had taken for the autumn months [a small house at [Tuxedo]1-tuxedo]4167-a small house at tuxedo ; and [thither Lily]109-lily was bound on the Sunday after [Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s visit . Though it was nearly dinner - time when [she]109-lily arrived , [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess was still out , and the firelit quiet of [the small silent house]4169-the small silent house descended on [her]109-lily spirit with a sense of peace and familiarity . It may be doubted if such an emotion had ever before been evoked by [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s surroundings ; but , contrasted to [the world in which [Lily]109-lily had lately lived]4170-the world in which lily had lately lived , there was an air of repose and stability in the very placing of the furniture , and in the quiet competence of [the parlour - maid who led [her]109-lily up to [[her]109-lily room]529-her room]4171-the parlour - maid who led her up to her room . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s unconventionality was , after all , a merely superficial divergence from an inherited social creed , while the manners of [the Gormer circle]4173-the gormer circle represented [their]4173-the gormer circle first attempt to formulate such a creed for [themselves]4173-the gormer circle . It was the first time since [her]109-lily return from [Europe]21-europe that [Lily]109-lily had found [herself]109-lily in a congenial atmosphere , and the stirring of familiar associations had almost prepared [her]109-lily , as [she]109-lily descended the stairs before dinner , to enter upon [a group of [[her]109-lily old acquaintances]4175-her old acquaintances]4174-a group of her old acquaintances . But this expectation was instantly checked by the reflection that [the friends who remained loyal]4176-the friends who remained loyal were precisely those who would be least willing to expose [her]109-lily to such encounters ; and it was hardly with surprise that [she]109-lily found , instead , [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale kneeling domestically on [the drawing - room]2810-the drawing - room hearth before [[his]124-rosedale hostess ’s little girl]4178-his hostess ’s little girl . [Rosedale]124-rosedale in the paternal role was hardly a figure to soften [Lily]109-lily ; yet [she]109-lily could not but notice a quality of homely goodness in [his]124-rosedale advances to [the child]4179-the child . [They]4180-they were not , at any rate , the premeditated and perfunctory endearments of [the guest]4181-the guest under [[his]124-rosedale hostess]864-his hostess ’s eye , for [he]124-rosedale and [the little girl]4183-the little girl had [the room]351-the room to [themselves]4180-they ; and something in [his]124-rosedale attitude made [him]124-rosedale seem a simple and kindly being compared to the small critical creature who endured [his]124-rosedale homage . Yes , [he]124-rosedale would be kind — [Lily]109-lily , from the threshold , had time to feel — kind in [his]124-rosedale gross , unscrupulous , rapacious way , the way of the predatory creature with [[his]124-rosedale mate]4185-his mate . [She]109-lily had but a moment in which to consider whether this glimpse of [the fireside man]4186-the fireside man mitigated [her]109-lily repugnance , or gave it , rather , a more concrete and intimate form ; for at sight of [her]109-lily [he]124-rosedale was immediately on [his]124-rosedale feet again , [the florid and dominant Rosedale of [[Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer ’s drawing - room]4188-mattie gormer ’s drawing - room]4187-the florid and dominant rosedale of mattie gormer ’s drawing - room . It was no surprise to [Lily]109-lily to find that [he]124-rosedale had been selected as [[her]109-lily only fellow - guest]4189-her only fellow - guest . Though [she]109-lily and [[her]109-lily hostess]745-her hostess had not met since [the latter]566-the latter ’s tentative discussion of [her]109-lily future , [Lily]109-lily knew that the acuteness which enabled [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher to lay a safe and pleasant course through a world of antagonistic forces was not infrequently exercised for the benefit of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends . It was , in fact , characteristic of [Carry]146-carry fisher that , while [she]109-lily actively gleaned [her]109-lily own stores from the fields of affluence , [her]109-lily real sympathies were on the other side — with the unlucky , [the unpopular]4193-the unpopular , the unsuccessful , with all [[her]109-lily hungry fellow - toilers]4194-her hungry fellow - toilers in the shorn stubble of success . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s experience guarded [her]109-lily against the mistake of exposing [Lily]109-lily , for the first evening , to the unmitigated impression of [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s personality . [Kate Corby]171-kate corby and [two or three men]4195-two or three men dropped in to dinner , and [Lily]109-lily , alive to every detail of [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s method , saw that such opportunities as had been contrived for [her]109-lily were to be deferred till [she]109-lily had , as it were , gained courage to make effectual use of [them]4197-them . [She]109-lily had a sense of acquiescing in this plan with the passiveness of [a sufferer]4198-a sufferer resigned to [the surgeon]4199-the surgeon ’s touch ; and this feeling of almost lethargic helplessness continued when , after the departure of [the guests]1526-the guests , [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher followed [her]109-lily [upstairs]2873-upstairs . “[0-i] May [I]0-i come in and smoke a cigarette over [your]0-i fire ? If [we]2373-we talk in [[my]0-i room]3493-my room [we]2373-we shall disturb [the child]4179-the child . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher looked about [her]0-i with the eye of [the solicitous hostess]4202-the solicitous hostess . “[2373-we] [I]0-i hope [you]0-i ’ve managed to make [yourself]0-i comfortable , [dear]2964-dear ? Is n’t it [a jolly little house]2377-a jolly little house ? It ’s such a blessing to have a few quiet weeks with [the baby]2378-the baby . ” [Carry]146-carry fisher , in [her]0-i rare moments of prosperity , became so expansively maternal that [Miss Bart]109-lily sometimes wondered whether , if [she]0-i could ever get time and money enough , [she]0-i would not end by devoting [them]4203-them both to [[her]0-i daughter]631-her daughter . “[2379-a stern task - master] It ’s a well - earned rest : [I]0-i ’ll say that for [myself]0-i , ” [she]0-i continued , sinking down with a sigh of content on the pillowed lounge near the fire . “[0-i] [Louisa Bry]256-louisa is [a stern task - master]2379-a stern task - master : [I]0-i often used to wish [myself]0-i back with [the Gormers]257-the gormers . Talk of love making [people]2804-people jealous and suspicious — it ’s nothing to social ambition ! [Louisa]256-louisa used to lie awake at night wondering whether [the women who called on [us]2382-us]2381-the women who called on us called on [ME]0-i because [I]0-i was with [her]256-louisa , or on [HER]256-louisa because [she]256-louisa was with [me]0-i ; and [she]256-louisa was always laying traps to find out what [I]0-i thought . Of course [I]0-i had to disown [[my]0-i oldest friends]2383-my oldest friends , rather than let [her]256-louisa suspect [she]256-louisa owed [me]0-i the chance of making a single acquaintance — when , all the while , that was what [she]256-louisa had [me]0-i there for , and what [she]256-louisa wrote [me]0-i a handsome cheque for when the season was over ! ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher was not a woman who talked of [herself]135-mrs. fisher without cause , and the practice of direct speech , far from precluding in [her]135-mrs. fisher an occasional resort to circuitous methods , served rather , at crucial moments , the purpose of [the juggler]4205-the juggler ’s chatter while [he]4205-the juggler shifts the contents of [his]4205-the juggler sleeves . Through the haze of [her]135-mrs. fisher cigarette - smoke [she]135-mrs. fisher continued to gaze meditatively at [Miss Bart]109-lily , who , having dismissed [[her]0-i maid]565-her maid , sat before the toilet table shaking out over [her]0-i shoulders the loosened undulations of [her]0-i hair . “[2384-you] [Your]2384-you hair ’s wonderful , [Lily]109-lily . Thinner — ? What does that matter , when it ’s so light and alive ? [So many women]2385-so many women ’s worries seem to go straight to [their]2385-so many women hair — but [yours]2384-you looks as if there had never been an anxious thought under it . [I]0-i never saw [you]2384-you look better than [you]2384-you did this evening . [Mattie Gormer]271-mattie gormer told [me]0-i that [Morpeth]208-paul morpeth wanted to paint [you]2384-you — why do n’t [you]2384-you let [him]208-paul morpeth ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s immediate answer was to address a critical glance to the reflection of the countenance under discussion . Then [she]0-i said , with a slight touch of irritation : “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t care to accept a portrait from [Paul Morpeth]208-paul morpeth . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher mused . “[208-paul morpeth] N — no . And just now , especially — well , [he]208-paul morpeth can do [you]2384-you after [you]2384-you ’re married . ” [She]0-i waited a moment , and then went on : “[208-paul morpeth] By the way , [I]0-i had a visit from [Mattie]271-mattie gormer the other day . [She]0-i turned up here last Sunday — and with [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , of [all people in [the world]354-the world]2386-all people in the world ! ” [She]0-i paused again to measure the effect of this announcement on [[her]0-i hearer]1077-her hearer , but the brush in [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s lifted hand maintained its unwavering stroke from brow to nape . “[0-i] [I]0-i never was more astonished , ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher pursued . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know [two women]3181-two women less predestined to intimacy — from [Bertha]133-bertha ’s standpoint , that is ; for of course [poor Mattie]271-mattie gormer thinks it natural enough that [she]271-mattie gormer should be singled out — [I’ve]0-i no doubt the rabbit always thinks it is fascinating [the anaconda]2389-the anaconda . Well , [you]2390-you know [I]0-i ’ve always told [you]2390-you that [Mattie]271-mattie gormer secretly longed to bore [herself]271-mattie gormer with the really fashionable ; and now that the chance has come , [I]0-i see that [she]271-mattie gormer ’s capable of sacrificing [all [her]271-mattie gormer old friends]2391-all her old friends to it . ” [Lily]109-lily laid aside [her]109-lily brush and turned a penetrating glance upon [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend . “[271-mattie gormer] Including [ME]0-i ? ” [she]109-lily suggested . “[0-i] Ah , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear , ” murmured [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , rising to push back a log from the hearth . “[0-i] That ’s what [Bertha]133-bertha means , is n’t it ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily went on steadily . “[133-bertha] For of course [she]133-bertha always means something ; and before [I]0-i left [Long Island]77-long island [I]0-i saw that [she]133-bertha was beginning to lay [her]133-bertha toils for [Mattie]271-mattie gormer . ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher sighed evasively . “[133-bertha] [She]133-bertha has [her]133-bertha fast now , at any rate . To think of that loud independence of [Mattie]271-mattie gormer ’s being only a subtler form of snobbishness ! [Bertha]133-bertha can already make [her]133-bertha believe anything [she]133-bertha pleases — and [I]0-i ’m afraid [she]133-bertha ’s begun , [[my]0-i poor child]2161-my poor child , by insinuating horrors about [you]2161-my poor child . ” [Lily]109-lily flushed under the shadow of [her]109-lily drooping hair . “[133-bertha] [The world]354-the world is too vile , ” [she]109-lily murmured , averting [herself]109-lily from [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s anxious scrutiny . “[133-bertha] [It]354-the world ’s not [a pretty place]2395-a pretty place ; and the only way to keep a footing in [it]354-the world is to fight it on its own terms — and above all , [[my]0-i dear]2871-my dear , not alone ! ” [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher gathered up [her]135-mrs. fisher floating implications in a resolute grasp . “[2161-my poor child] [You]2161-my poor child ’ve told [me]0-i so little that [I]0-i can only guess what has been happening ; but in the rush [we]2397-we all live in there ’s no time to keep on hating [any one]442-any one without a cause , and if [Bertha]133-bertha is still nasty enough to want to injure [you]2161-my poor child with [other people]563-other people it must be because [she]133-bertha ’s still afraid of [you]2161-my poor child . From [her]133-bertha standpoint there ’s only one reason for being afraid of [you]2161-my poor child ; and [my]0-i own idea is that , if [you]2161-my poor child want to punish [her]133-bertha , [you]2161-my poor child hold the means in [your]2161-my poor child hand . [I]0-i believe [you]2161-my poor child can marry [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset tomorrow ; but if [you]2161-my poor child do n’t care for that particular form of retaliation , the only thing to save [you]2161-my poor child from [Bertha]133-bertha is to marry [somebody else]2400-somebody else . ” Chapter 7 The light projected on the situation by [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher had the cheerless distinctness of a winter dawn . It outlined the facts with a cold precision unmodified by shade or colour , and refracted , as it were , from the blank walls of the surrounding limitations : [she]133-bertha had opened windows from which no sky was ever visible . But [the idealist subdued to vulgar necessities]4209-the idealist subdued to vulgar necessities must employ vulgar minds to draw the inferences to which [he]4209-the idealist subdued to vulgar necessities can not stoop ; and it was easier for [Lily]109-lily to let [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher formulate [her]135-mrs. fisher case than to put it plainly to [herself]135-mrs. fisher . Once confronted with it , however , [she]135-mrs. fisher went the full length of its consequences ; and these had never been more clearly present to [her]135-mrs. fisher than when , the next afternoon , [she]135-mrs. fisher set out for a walk with [Rosedale]124-rosedale . It was one of those still November days when the air is haunted with the light of summer , and something in the lines of the landscape , and in the golden haze which bathed them , recalled to [Miss Bart]109-lily the September afternoon when [she]109-lily had climbed [the slopes of [Bellomont]3-bellomont with [Selden]108-selden]4210-the slopes of bellomont with selden . The importunate memory was kept before [her]135-mrs. fisher by its ironic contrast to [her]135-mrs. fisher present situation , since [her]135-mrs. fisher walk with [Selden]108-selden had represented an irresistible flight from just such a climax as the present excursion was designed to bring about . But other memories importuned [her]135-mrs. fisher also ; the recollection of similar situations , as skillfully led up to , but through some malice of fortune , or [her]135-mrs. fisher own unsteadiness of purpose , always failing of the intended result . Well , [her]135-mrs. fisher purpose was steady enough now . [She]135-mrs. fisher saw that the whole weary work of rehabilitation must begin again , and against far greater odds , if [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha should succeed in breaking up [her]133-bertha friendship with [the Gormers]257-the gormers ; and [her]135-mrs. fisher longing for shelter and security was intensified by the passionate desire to triumph over [Bertha]133-bertha , as only wealth and predominance could triumph over [her]133-bertha . As [the wife of [Rosedale]124-rosedale]4211-the wife of rosedale — [the Rosedale]124-rosedale [she]135-mrs. fisher felt it in [her]135-mrs. fisher power to create — [she]135-mrs. fisher would at least present an invulnerable front to [[her]135-mrs. fisher enemy]3897-her enemy . [She]135-mrs. fisher had to draw upon this thought , as upon some fiery stimulant , to keep up [her]135-mrs. fisher part in the scene toward which [Rosedale]124-rosedale was too frankly tending . As [she]135-mrs. fisher walked beside [him]124-rosedale , shrinking in every nerve from the way in which [his]124-rosedale look and tone made free of [her]135-mrs. fisher , yet telling [herself]135-mrs. fisher that this momentary endurance of [his]124-rosedale mood was the price [she]135-mrs. fisher must pay for [her]135-mrs. fisher ultimate power over [him]124-rosedale , [she]135-mrs. fisher tried to calculate the exact point at which concession must turn to resistance , and the price [HE]124-rosedale would have to pay be made equally clear to [him]124-rosedale . But [his]124-rosedale dapper self - confidence seemed impenetrable to such hints , and [she]135-mrs. fisher had a sense of something hard and self - contained behind the superficial warmth of [his]124-rosedale manner . [They]4213-they had been seated for some time in the seclusion of [a rocky glen above [the lake]3276-the lake]4214-a rocky glen above the lake , when [she]135-mrs. fisher suddenly cut short the culmination of an impassioned period by turning upon [him]124-rosedale the grave loveliness of [her]135-mrs. fisher gaze . “[0-i] [I]0-i DO believe what [you]2401-you say , [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , ” [she]135-mrs. fisher said quietly ; “[2401-you] and [I]0-i am ready to marry [you]2401-you whenever [you]2401-you wish . ” [Rosedale]124-rosedale , reddening to the roots of [his]124-rosedale glossy hair , received this announcement with a recoil which carried [him]124-rosedale to [his]124-rosedale feet , where [he]124-rosedale halted before [her]135-mrs. fisher in an attitude of almost comic discomfiture . “[0-i] For [I]0-i suppose that is what [you]2401-you do wish , ” [she]135-mrs. fisher continued , in the same quiet tone . “[2401-you] And , though [I]0-i was unable to consent when [you]2401-you spoke to [me]0-i in this way before , [I]0-i am ready , now that [I]0-i know [you]2401-you so much better , to trust [my]0-i happiness to [your]2401-you hands . ” [She]135-mrs. fisher spoke with the noble directness which [she]135-mrs. fisher could command on such occasions , and which was like a large steady light thrown across the tortuous darkness of the situation . In its inconvenient brightness [Rosedale]124-rosedale seemed to waver a moment , as though conscious that every avenue of escape was unpleasantly illuminated . Then [he]124-rosedale gave a short laugh , and drew out a gold cigarette - case , in which , with plump jewelled fingers , [he]124-rosedale groped for a gold - tipped cigarette . Selecting one , [he]124-rosedale paused to contemplate it a moment before saying : “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear [Miss Lily]109-lily , [I]0-i ’m sorry if there ’s been any little misapprehension between [us]2403-we — but [you]109-lily made [me]0-i feel [my]0-i suit was so hopeless that [I]0-i had really no intention of renewing it . ” [Lily]109-lily ’s blood tingled with the grossness of the rebuff ; but [she]0-i checked the first leap of [her]0-i anger , and said in a tone of gentle dignity : “[109-lily] [I]0-i have no one but [myself]0-i to blame if [I]0-i gave [you]0-i the impression that [my]0-i decision was final . ” [Her]0-i word - play was always too quick for [him]4216-him , and this reply held [him]4216-him in puzzled silence while [she]0-i extended [her]0-i hand and added , with the faintest inflection of sadness in [her]0-i voice : “[0-i] Before [we]2403-we bid [each other]2955-each other goodbye , [I]0-i want at least to thank [you]0-i for having once thought of [me]0-i as [you]0-i did . ” The touch of [her]0-i hand , the moving softness of [her]0-i look , thrilled a vulnerable fibre in [Rosedale]124-rosedale . It was [her]0-i exquisite inaccessibleness , the sense of distance [she]0-i could convey without a hint of disdain , that made it most difficult for [him]4216-him to give [her]0-i up . “[0-i] Why do [you]0-i talk of saying goodbye ? Ai n’t [we]2403-we going to be [good friends]3136-good friends all the same ? ” [he]124-rosedale urged , without releasing [her]0-i hand . [She]0-i drew it away quietly . “[0-i] What is [your]0-i idea of being [good friends]3136-good friends ? ” [she]0-i returned with a slight smile . “[0-i] Making love to [me]0-i without asking [me]0-i to marry [you]0-i ? ” [Rosedale]124-rosedale laughed with a recovered sense of ease . “[0-i] Well , that ’s about the size of it , [I]0-i suppose . [I]0-i ca n’t help making love to [you]0-i — [I]0-i do n’t see how [any man]2407-any man could ; but [I]0-i do n’t mean to ask [you]0-i to marry [me]0-i as long as [I]0-i can keep out of it . ” [She]0-i continued to smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i like [your]0-i frankness ; but [I]0-i am afraid [our]2408-our friendship can hardly continue on those terms . ” [She]0-i turned away , as though to mark that its final term had in fact been reached , and [he]124-rosedale followed [her]0-i for a few steps with a baffled sense of [her]0-i having after all kept the game in [her]0-i own hands . “[0-i] [Miss Lily]109-lily — — ” [he]124-rosedale began impulsively ; but [she]0-i walked on without seeming to hear [him]124-rosedale . [He]124-rosedale overtook [her]0-i in a few quick strides , and laid an entreating hand on [her]0-i arm . “[109-lily] [Miss Lily]109-lily — don’t hurry away like that . [You]109-lily ’re beastly hard on [a fellow]3096-a fellow ; but if [you]109-lily do n’t mind speaking the truth [I]0-i do n’t see why [you]109-lily should n’t allow [me]0-i to do the same . ” [She]0-i had paused a moment with raised brows , drawing away instinctively from [his]124-rosedale touch , though [she]0-i made no effort to evade [his]124-rosedale words . “[109-lily] [I]0-i was under the impression , ” [she]0-i rejoined , “[109-lily] that [you]109-lily had done so without waiting for [my]0-i permission . ” “[109-lily] Well — why should n’t [you]109-lily hear [my]0-i reasons for doing it , then ? [We]2410-us ’re neither of [us]2410-us such new hands that a little plain speaking is going to hurt [us]2410-us . [I]0-i ’m all broken up on [you]109-lily : there ’s nothing new in that . [I]0-i ’m more in love with [you]109-lily than [I]0-i was this time last year ; but [I]0-i ’ve got to face the fact that the situation is changed . ” [She]0-i continued to confront [him]4217-him with the same air of ironic composure . “[109-lily] [You]109-lily mean to say that [I]0-i ’m not as desirable a match as [you]109-lily thought [me]0-i ? ” “[109-lily] Yes ; that ’s what [I]0-i do mean , ” [he]4217-him answered resolutely . “[0-i] [I]0-i wo n’t go into what ’s happened . [I]0-i do n’t believe the stories about [you]109-lily — [I]0-i do n’t WANT to believe them . But [they]2411-they ’re there , and [my]0-i not believing [them]2411-they ai n’t going to alter the situation . ” [She]0-i flushed to [her]0-i temples , but the extremity of [her]0-i need checked the retort on [her]0-i lip and [she]0-i continued to face [him]4217-him composedly . “[2411-they] If they are not true , ” [she]0-i said , “[2411-they] does n’t THAT alter the situation ? ” [He]4217-him met this with a steady gaze of [his]4217-him small stock - taking eyes , which made [her]0-i feel [herself]0-i no more than [some superfine human merchandise]4218-some superfine human merchandise . “[2411-they] [I]0-i believe it does in novels ; but [I]0-i ’m certain it do n’t in real life . [You]109-lily know that as well as [I]0-i do : if [we]2412-we ’re speaking the truth , let ’s speak the whole truth . Last year [I]0-i was wild to marry [you]109-lily , and [you]109-lily would n’t look at [me]0-i : this year — well , [you]109-lily appear to be willing . Now , what has changed in the interval ? [Your]109-lily situation , that ’s all . Then [you]109-lily thought [you]109-lily could do better ; now — — ” “[0-i] [You]0-i think [you]0-i can ? ” broke from [her]109-lily ironically . “[0-i] Why , yes , [I]0-i do : in one way , that is . ” [He]4219-his stood before [her]109-lily , [his]4219-his hands in [his]4219-his pockets , [his]4219-his chest sturdily expanded under its vivid waistcoat . “[0-i] It ’s this way , [you]109-lily see : [I]0-i ’ve had a pretty steady grind of it these last years , working up [my]0-i social position . Think it ’s funny [I]0-i should say that ? Why should [I]0-i mind saying [I]0-i want to get into [society]3024-society ? [A man ai n’t ashamed to say [he]2414-a man ai n’t ashamed to say he wants to own a racing stable or a picture gallery wants to own [a racing stable]2415-a racing stable or [a picture gallery]1499-a picture gallery]2414-a man ai n’t ashamed to say he wants to own a racing stable or a picture gallery . Well , a taste for society ’s just another kind of hobby . Perhaps [I]0-i want to get even with some of [the people who cold - shouldered [me]0-i last year]2417-the people who cold - shouldered me last year — put it that way if it sounds better . Anyhow , [I]0-i want to have the run of [the best houses]2418-the best houses ; and [I]0-i ’m getting it too , little by little . But [I]0-i know the quickest way to queer [yourself]2419-you with [the right people]2420-the right people is to be seen with [the wrong ones]2421-the wrong ones ; and that ’s the reason [I]0-i want to avoid mistakes . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily continued to stand before [him]2419-you in a silence that might have expressed either mockery or a half - reluctant respect for [his]2419-you candour , and after a moment ’s pause [he]2419-you went on : “[0-i] There it is , [you]2419-you see . [I]0-i ’m more in love with [you]2419-you than ever , but if [I]0-i married [you]2419-you now [I]0-i ’d queer [myself]0-i for good and all , and everything [I]0-i ’ve worked for all these years would be wasted . ” [She]0-i received this with a look from which all tinge of resentment had faded . After the tissue of social falsehoods in which [she]0-i had so long moved it was refreshing to step into the open daylight of an avowed expediency . “[0-i] [I]0-i understand [you]0-i , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] A year ago [I]0-i should have been of use to [you]0-i , and now [I]0-i should be an encumbrance ; and [I]0-i like [you]0-i for telling [me]0-i so quite honestly . ” [She]0-i extended [her]0-i hand with a smile . Again the gesture had a disturbing effect upon [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s self - command . “[0-i] By [George]131-mrs. dorset , [you]131-mrs. dorset ’re [a dead game sport]2422-a dead game sport , [you]131-mrs. dorset are ! ” [he]124-rosedale exclaimed ; and as [she]0-i began once more to move away , [he]124-rosedale broke out suddenly—“Miss[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily — stop . [You]109-lily know [I]0-i do n’t believe those stories — [I]0-i believe they were all got up by [a woman who did n’t hesitate to sacrifice [you]0-i to [her]2423-a woman who did n’t hesitate to sacrifice you to her own convenience own convenience]2423-a woman who did n’t hesitate to sacrifice you to her own convenience — — ” [Lily]109-lily drew away with a movement of quick disdain : it was easier to endure [his]124-rosedale insolence than [his]124-rosedale commiseration . “[2423-a woman who did n’t hesitate to sacrifice you to her own convenience] [You]109-lily are very kind ; but [I]0-i do n’t think [we]2424-we need discuss the matter farther . ” But [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s natural imperviousness to hints made it easy for [him]124-rosedale to brush such resistance aside . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t want to discuss anything ; [I]0-i just want to put a plain case before [you]109-lily , ” [he]124-rosedale persisted . [She]109-lily paused in spite of [herself]109-lily , held by the note of a new purpose in [his]124-rosedale look and tone ; and [he]124-rosedale went on , keeping [his]124-rosedale eyes firmly upon [her]109-lily : “[0-i] The wonder to [me]0-i is that [you]109-lily ’ve waited so long to get square with [that woman]3225-that woman , when [you]109-lily ’ve had the power in [your]109-lily hands . ” [She]109-lily continued silent under the rush of astonishment that [his]124-rosedale words produced , and [he]124-rosedale moved a step closer to ask with low - toned directness : “[109-lily] Why do n’t [you]109-lily use those letters of hers [you]109-lily bought last year ? ” [Lily]109-lily stood speechless under the shock of the interrogation . In the words preceding it [she]109-lily had conjectured , at most , an allusion to [her]109-lily supposed influence over [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ; nor did the astonishing indelicacy of the reference diminish the likelihood of [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s resorting to it . But now [she]109-lily saw how far short of the mark [she]109-lily had fallen ; and the surprise of learning that [he]124-rosedale had discovered the secret of the letters left [her]109-lily , for the moment , unconscious of the special use to which [he]124-rosedale was in the act of putting [his]124-rosedale knowledge . [Her]109-lily temporary loss of self - possession gave [him]124-rosedale time to press [his]124-rosedale point ; and [he]124-rosedale went on quickly , as though to secure completer control of the situation : “[109-lily] [You]109-lily see [I]0-i know where [you]109-lily stand — [I]0-i know how completely [she]2426-she ’s in [your]109-lily power . That sounds like stage - talk , do n’t it?—but there ’s a lot of truth in some of those old gags ; and [I]0-i do n’t suppose [you]109-lily bought those letters simply because [you]109-lily ’re collecting autographs . ” [She]109-lily continued to look at [him]124-rosedale with a deepening bewilderment : [her]109-lily only clear impression resolved itself into a scared sense of [his]124-rosedale power . “[109-lily] [You]109-lily ’re wondering how [I]0-i found out about [’em]2427-’em ? ” [he]124-rosedale went on , answering [her]109-lily look with a note of conscious pride . “[0-i] Perhaps [you]109-lily ’ve forgotten that [I]0-i ’m [the owner of the Benedick]2428-the owner of the benedick — but never mind about that now . Getting on to things is a mighty useful accomplishment in business , and [I]0-i ’ve simply extended it to [my]0-i private affairs . For this IS partly [my]0-i affair , [you]109-lily see — at least , it depends on [you]109-lily to make it so . Let ’s look the situation straight in the eye . [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset , for reasons [we]2429-we need n’t go into , did [you]109-lily a beastly bad turn last spring . [Everybody]2995-everybody knows what [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset is , and [[her]131-mrs. dorset best friends]2431-her best friends would n’t believe [her]131-mrs. dorset on oath where [their]2431-her best friends own interests were concerned ; but as long as [they]2431-her best friends ’re out of the row it ’s much easier to follow [her]131-mrs. dorset lead than to set [themselves]2431-her best friends against it , and [you]109-lily ’ve simply been sacrificed to [their]2431-her best friends laziness and selfishness . Is n’t that a pretty fair statement of the case?—Well , [some people]3161-some people say [you]109-lily ’ve got the neatest kind of an answer in [your]109-lily hands : that [George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset would marry [you]109-lily tomorrow , if [you]109-lily ’d tell [him]2433-he all [you]109-lily know , and give [him]2433-he the chance to show [the lady]602-the lady the door . [I]0-i daresay [he]2433-he would ; but [you]109-lily do n’t seem to care for that particular form of getting even , and , taking a purely business view of the question , [I]0-i think [you]109-lily ’re right . In a deal like that , [nobody]2435-nobody comes out with perfectly clean hands , and the only way for [you]109-lily to start fresh is to get [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha to back [you]109-lily up , instead of trying to fight [her]133-bertha . ” [He]2433-he paused long enough to draw breath , but not to give [her]602-the lady time for the expression of [her]602-the lady gathering resistance ; and as [he]2433-he pressed on , expounding and elucidating [his]2433-he idea with the directness of [the man who has no doubts of [his]2433-he cause]4220-the man who has no doubts of his cause , [she]602-the lady found the indignation gradually freezing on [her]602-the lady lip , found [herself]602-the lady held fast in the grasp of [his]2433-he argument by the mere cold strength of its presentation . There was no time now to wonder how [he]2433-he had heard of [her]602-the lady obtaining the letters : all [her]602-the lady world was dark outside the monstrous glare of [his]2433-he scheme for using them . And it was not , after the first moment , the horror of the idea that held [her]602-the lady spell - bound , subdued to [his]2433-he will ; it was rather its subtle affinity to [her]602-the lady own inmost cravings . [He]2433-he would marry [her]602-the lady tomorrow if [she]602-the lady could regain [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s friendship ; and to induce the open resumption of that friendship , and the tacit retractation of all that had caused its withdrawal , [she]602-the lady had only to put to [the lady]602-the lady the latent menace contained in the packet so miraculously delivered into [her]602-the lady hands . [Lily]109-lily saw in a flash the advantage of this course over that which poor [Dorset]133-bertha had pressed upon [her]109-lily . The other plan depended for its success on the infliction of an open injury , while this reduced the transaction to a private understanding , of which [no third person]4222-no third person need have the remotest hint . Put by [Rosedale]124-rosedale in terms of businesslike give - and - take , this understanding took on the harmless air of a mutual accommodation , like a transfer of property or a revision of boundary lines . It certainly simplified life to view it as a perpetual adjustment , a play of party politics , in which every concession had its recognized equivalent : [Lily]109-lily ’s tired mind was fascinated by this escape from fluctuating ethical estimates into a region of concrete weights and measures . [Rosedale]124-rosedale , as [she]602-the lady listened , seemed to read in [her]602-the lady silence not only a gradual acquiescence in [his]124-rosedale plan , but a dangerously far - reaching perception of the chances it offered ; for as [she]602-the lady continued to stand before [him]124-rosedale without speaking , [he]124-rosedale broke out , with a quick return upon [himself]124-rosedale : “[2436-you] [You]2436-you see how simple it is , do n’t [you]2436-you ? Well , do n’t be carried away by the idea that it ’s TOO simple . It is n’t exactly as if [you]2436-you ’d started in with a clean bill of health . Now [we]2437-we ’re talking let ’s call things by [their]2438-their right names , and clear the whole business up . [You]2436-you know well enough that [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha could n’t have touched [you]2436-you if there had n’t been — well — questions asked before — little points of interrogation , eh ? Bound to happen to [a good - looking girl with stingy relatives]2439-a good - looking girl with stingy relatives , [I]0-i suppose ; anyhow , [they]2440-they DID happen , and [she]2439-a good - looking girl with stingy relatives found the ground prepared for [her]2439-a good - looking girl with stingy relatives . Do [you]2436-you see where [I]0-i ’m coming out ? [You]2436-you do n’t want these little questions cropping up again . It ’s one thing to get [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha into line — but what [you]2436-you want is to keep [her]133-bertha there . [You]2436-you can frighten [her]133-bertha fast enough — but how are [you]2436-you going to keep [her]133-bertha frightened ? By showing [her]133-bertha that [you]2436-you ’re as powerful as [she]133-bertha is . All the letters in [the world]354-the world wo n’t do that for [you]2436-you as [you]2436-you are now ; but with a big backing behind [you]2436-you , [you]2436-you ’ll keep [her]133-bertha just where [you]2436-you want [her]133-bertha to be . That ’s [MY]0-i share in the business — that ’s what [I]0-i ’m offering [you]2436-you . [You]2436-you ca n’t put the thing through without [me]0-i — don’t run away with any idea that [you]2436-you can . In six months [you]2436-you ’d be back again among [your]2436-you old worries , or worse ones ; and here [I]0-i am , ready to lift [you]2436-you out of ’em tomorrow if [you]2436-you say so . DO [you]2436-you say so , [Miss Lily]109-lily ? ” [he]4223-he added , moving suddenly nearer . The words , and the movement which accompanied them , combined to startle [Lily]109-lily out of the state of tranced subservience into which [she]109-lily had insensibly slipped . Light comes in devious ways to the groping consciousness , and it came to [her]109-lily now through the disgusted perception that [[her]109-lily would - be accomplice]4224-her would - be accomplice assumed , as a matter of course , the likelihood of [her]109-lily distrusting [him]4223-he and perhaps trying to cheat [him]4223-he of [his]4223-he share of the spoils . This glimpse of [his]4223-he inner mind seemed to present the whole transaction in a new aspect , and [she]109-lily saw that the essential baseness of the act lay in its freedom from risk . [She]109-lily drew back with a quick gesture of rejection , saying , in a voice that was a surprise to [her]109-lily own ears : “[2436-you] [You]2436-you are mistaken — quite mistaken — both in the facts and in what [you]2436-you infer from them . ” [Rosedale]124-rosedale stared a moment , puzzled by [her]109-lily sudden dash in a direction so different from that toward which [she]109-lily had appeared to be letting [him]4223-he guide [her]109-lily . “[2436-you] Now what [on earth]2442-on earth does that mean ? [I]0-i thought [we]2443-we understood [each other]2955-each other ! ” [he]4223-he exclaimed ; and to [her]109-lily murmur of “[0-i] Ah , [we]2443-we do NOW , ” [he]4223-he retorted with a sudden burst of violence : “[0-i] [I]0-i suppose it ’s because the letters are to [HIM]2445-him , then ? Well , [I]0-i ’ll be damned if [I]0-i see what thanks [you]2436-you ’ve got from [him]2445-him ! ” Chapter 8 The autumn days declined to winter .
