Once more the leisure world was in transition between [country]4225-country and [town]305-town , and [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue , still deserted at the week - end , showed from Monday to Friday a broadening stream of carriages between [house - fronts]4227-house - fronts gradually restored to consciousness . The Horse Show , some two weeks earlier , had produced a passing semblance of reanimation , filling [the theatres]1479-the theatres and [restaurants]1480-restaurants with a human display of the same costly and high - stepping kind as circled daily about its ring . In [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s world the Horse Show , and the public it attracted , had ostensibly come to be classed among the spectacles disdained of [the elect]4230-the elect ; but , as [the feudal lord]4231-the feudal lord might sally forth to join in the dance on [[his]4231-the feudal lord village green]4232-his village green , so society , unofficially and incidentally , still condescended to look in upon the scene . [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer , among [the rest]4233-the rest , was not above seizing such an occasion for the display of [herself]275-mrs. gormer and [her]275-mrs. gormer horses ; and [Lily]109-lily was given one or two opportunities of appearing at [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend ’s side in [the most conspicuous box [the house]488-the house afforded]4235-the most conspicuous box the house afforded . But this lingering semblance of intimacy made [her]109-lily only the more conscious of a change in the relation between [Mattie]271-mattie gormer and [herself]109-lily , of a dawning discrimination , a gradually formed social standard , emerging from [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer ’s chaotic view of life . It was inevitable that [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily should constitute the first sacrifice to this new ideal , and [she]109-lily knew that , once [the Gormers]257-the gormers were established in [town]305-town , the whole drift of fashionable life would facilitate [Mattie]271-mattie gormer ’s detachment from [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily had , in short , failed to make [herself]109-lily indispensable ; or rather , [her]109-lily attempt to do so had been thwarted by an influence stronger than any [she]109-lily could exert . That influence , in its last analysis , was simply the power of money : [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ’s social credit was based on an impregnable bank - account . [Lily]109-lily knew that [Rosedale]124-rosedale had overstated neither the difficulty of [her]109-lily own position nor the completeness of the vindication [he]124-rosedale offered : once [Bertha]133-bertha ’s match in material resources , [her]109-lily superior gifts would make it easy for [her]109-lily to dominate [[her]109-lily adversary]4238-her adversary . An understanding of what such domination would mean , and of the disadvantages accruing from [her]109-lily rejection of it , was brought [home]400-home to [Lily]109-lily with increasing clearness during the early weeks of the winter . Hitherto , [she]109-lily had kept up a semblance of movement outside the main flow of the social current ; but with the return to [town]305-town , and the concentrating of scattered activities , the mere fact of not slipping back naturally into [her]109-lily old habits of life marked [her]109-lily as being unmistakably excluded from [them]4241-them . If [one]2737-one were not a part of the season ’s fixed routine , one swung unsphered in a void of social non - existence . [Lily]109-lily , for all [her]109-lily dissatisfied dreaming , had never really conceived the possibility of revolving about [a different centre]4243-a different centre : it was easy enough to despise [the world]354-the world , but decidedly difficult to find [any other habitable region]4245-any other habitable region . [Her]109-lily sense of irony never quite deserted [her]109-lily , and [she]109-lily could still note , with self - directed derision , the abnormal value suddenly acquired by the most tiresome and insignificant details of [her]109-lily former life . [Its]4246-its very drudgeries had a charm now that [she]109-lily was involuntarily released from [them]4241-them : card - leaving , note - writing , enforced civilities to [the dull and elderly , and the smiling endurance of tedious dinners]4247-the dull and elderly , and the smiling endurance of tedious dinners — how pleasantly such obligations would have filled the emptiness of [her]109-lily days ! [She]109-lily did indeed leave cards in plenty ; [she]109-lily kept [herself]109-lily , with a smiling and valiant persistence , well in the eye of [[her]109-lily world]4248-her world ; nor did [she]109-lily suffer any of those gross rebuffs which sometimes produce a wholesome reaction of contempt in [[their]4241-them victim]4249-their victim . Society did not turn away from [her]109-lily , it simply drifted by , preoccupied and inattentive , letting [her]109-lily feel , to the full measure of [her]109-lily humbled pride , how completely [she]109-lily had been [the creature of its favour]4250-the creature of its favour . [She]109-lily had rejected [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s suggestion with a promptness of scorn almost surprising to [herself]109-lily : [she]109-lily had not lost [her]109-lily capacity for high flashes of indignation . But [she]109-lily could not breathe long on the heights ; there had been nothing in [her]109-lily training to develop any continuity of moral strength : what [she]109-lily craved , and really felt [herself]109-lily entitled to , was a situation in which the noblest attitude should also be the easiest . Hitherto [her]109-lily intermittent impulses of resistance had sufficed to maintain [her]109-lily self - respect . If [she]109-lily slipped [she]109-lily recovered [her]109-lily footing , and it was only afterward that [she]109-lily was aware of having recovered it each time on a slightly lower level . [She]109-lily had rejected [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s offer without conscious effort ; [her]109-lily whole being had risen against it ; and [she]109-lily did not yet perceive that , by the mere act of listening to [him]124-rosedale , [she]109-lily had learned to live with ideas which would once have been intolerable to [her]109-lily . * * * * * To [Gerty Farish]112-gerty , keeping watch over [her]109-lily with a tenderer if less discerning eye than [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s , the results of the struggle were already distinctly visible . [She]109-lily did not , indeed , know what hostages [Lily]109-lily had already given to expediency ; but [she]109-lily saw [her]109-lily passionately and irretrievably pledged to the ruinous policy of “[0-i] keeping up . ” [Gerty]112-gerty could smile now at [her]112-gerty own early dream of [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s renovation through adversity : [she]112-gerty understood clearly enough that [Lily]109-lily was not of those to whom privation teaches the unimportance of what [they]4252-they have lost . But this very fact , to [Gerty]112-gerty , made [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend the more piteously in want of aid , the more exposed to the claims of a tenderness [she]109-lily was so little conscious of needing . [Lily]109-lily , since [her]109-lily return to [town]305-town , had not often climbed [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s stairs . There was something irritating to [her]109-lily in the mute interrogation of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s sympathy : [she]109-lily felt the real difficulties of [her]109-lily situation to be incommunicable to [any one whose theory of values]4255-any one whose theory of values was so different from [her]109-lily own , and the restrictions of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s life , which had once had the charm of contrast , now reminded [her]109-lily too painfully of the limits to which [her]109-lily own existence was shrinking . When at length , one afternoon , [she]109-lily put into execution the belated resolve to visit [[her]109-lily friend]754-her friend , this sense of shrunken opportunities possessed [her]109-lily with unusual intensity . The walk up [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue , unfolding before [her]109-lily , in the brilliance of the hard winter sunlight , an interminable procession of [fastidiously - equipped carriages]4257-fastidiously - equipped carriages — giving [her]109-lily , through the little squares of brougham - windows , peeps of familiar profiles bent above visiting - lists , of hurried hands dispensing notes and cards to [attendant footmen]4258-attendant footmen — this glimpse of the ever - revolving wheels of the great social machine made [Lily]109-lily more than ever conscious of the steepness and narrowness of [[Gerty]112-gerty ’s stairs]4259-gerty ’s stairs , and of [the cramped blind alley of life to which [they]4259-gerty ’s stairs led]4260-the cramped blind alley of life to which they led . Dull stairs destined to be mounted by [dull people]2895-dull people : how many [thousands of insignificant figures]4262-thousands of insignificant figures were going up and down such stairs all over [the world]354-the world at that very moment — figures as shabby and uninteresting as that of [the middle - aged lady in limp black who descended [Gerty]112-gerty ’s flight as [Lily]109-lily climbed to it]4264-the middle - aged lady in limp black who descended gerty ’s flight as lily climbed to it ! “[0-i] That was poor [Miss Jane Silverton]281-miss jane — [she]281-miss jane came to talk things over with [me]0-i : [she]281-miss jane and [[her]281-miss jane sister]2881-her sister want to do something to support [themselves]2447-they , ” [Gerty]112-gerty explained , as [Lily]109-lily followed [her]0-i into [the sitting - room]1834-the sitting - room . “[281-miss jane] To support [themselves]2447-they ? Are [they]2447-they so hard up ? ” [Miss Bart]109-lily asked with a touch of irritation : [she]109-lily had not come to listen to the woes of [other people]563-other people . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m afraid [they]2447-they have nothing left : [Ned]263-ned ’s debts have swallowed up everything . [They]2447-they had such hopes , [you]2448-you know , when [he]263-ned broke away from [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ; [they]2447-they thought [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha would be such a good influence , because [she]133-bertha does n’t care for cards , and — well , [she]133-bertha talked quite beautifully to poor [Miss Jane]281-miss jane about feeling as if [Ned]263-ned were [[her]133-bertha younger brother]2449-her younger brother , and wanting to carry [him]263-ned off on [the yacht]3592-the yacht , so that [he]263-ned might have a chance to drop cards and racing , and take up [his]263-ned literary work again . ” [Miss Farish]113-miss farish paused with a sigh which reflected the perplexity of [[her]113-miss farish departing visitor]4267-her departing visitor . “[133-bertha] But that is n’t all ; it is n’t even the worst . It seems that [Ned]263-ned has quarrelled with [the Dorsets]122-the dorsets ; or at least [Bertha]133-bertha wo n’t allow [him]263-ned to see [her]133-bertha , and [he]263-ned is so unhappy about it that [he]263-ned has taken to gambling again , and going about with all sorts of [queer people]2451-queer people . And [cousin Grace Van Osburgh]179-cousin grace accuses [him]263-ned of having had a very bad influence on [Freddy]273-freddy , who left [Harvard]91-harvard last spring , and has been a great deal with [Ned]263-ned ever since . [She]133-bertha sent for [Miss Jane]281-miss jane , and made a dreadful scene ; and [Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney and [Herbert Melson]172-herbert melson , who were there too , told [Miss Jane]281-miss jane that [Freddy]273-freddy was threatening to marry [some dreadful woman to whom [Ned]263-ned had introduced [him]263-ned , and that [they]2453-they could do nothing with [him]263-ned because now [he]263-ned ’s of age [he]263-ned has [his]263-ned own money]2452-some dreadful woman to whom ned had introduced him , and that they could do nothing with him because now he ’s of age he has his own money . [You]2454-you can fancy how poor [Miss Jane]281-miss jane felt — [she]281-miss jane came to [me]0-i at once , and seemed to think that if [I]0-i could get [her]281-miss jane something to do [she]281-miss jane could earn enough to pay [Ned]263-ned ’s debts and send [him]263-ned away — [I’m]0-i afraid [she]281-miss jane has no idea how long it would take [her]281-miss jane to pay for one of [his]263-ned evenings at [bridge]3048-bridge . And [he]263-ned was horribly in debt when [he]263-ned came back from the cruise — [I]0-i ca n’t see why [he]263-ned should have spent so much more money under [Bertha]133-bertha ’s influence than [Carry]146-carry fisher ’s : can [you]2454-you ? ” [Lily]109-lily met this query with an impatient gesture . “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear]2871-my dear [Gerty]112-gerty , [I]0-i always understand how [people]2804-people can spend much more money — never how [they]2804-people can spend any less ! ” [She]0-i loosened [her]0-i furs and settled [herself]0-i in [Gerty]112-gerty ’s easy - chair , while [[her]0-i friend]754-her friend busied [herself]754-her friend with the tea - cups . “[2458-they] But what can [they]2458-they do — [the Miss Silvertons]282-the miss silvertons ? How do [they]2458-they mean to support [themselves]2458-they ? ” [she]0-i asked , conscious that the note of irritation still persisted in [her]0-i voice . It was the very last topic [she]0-i had meant to discuss — it really did not interest [her]0-i in the least — but [she]0-i was seized by a sudden perverse curiosity to know how the two colourless shrinking victims of [young Silverton]281-miss jane ’s sentimental experiments meant to cope with the grim necessity which lurked so close to [her]0-i own threshold . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know — [I]0-i am trying to find something for [them]2458-they . [Miss Jane]281-miss jane reads aloud very nicely — but it ’s so hard to find [any one who is willing to be read to]2459-any one who is willing to be read to . And [Miss Annie]283-miss annie paints a little — — ” “[283-miss annie] Oh , [I]0-i know — apple - blossoms on blotting - paper ; just the kind of thing [I]0-i shall be doing [myself]0-i before long ! ” exclaimed [Lily]109-lily , starting up with a vehemence of movement that threatened destruction to [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s fragile tea - table . [Lily]109-lily bent over to steady the cups ; then [she]109-lily sank back into [her]109-lily seat . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’d forgotten there was no room to dash about in — how beautifully [one]2737-one does have to behave in [a small flat]2461-a small flat ! Oh , [Gerty]112-gerty , [I]0-i was n’t meant to be good , ” [she]0-i sighed out incoherently . [Gerty]112-gerty lifted an apprehensive look to [her]112-gerty pale face , in which the eyes shone with a peculiar sleepless lustre . “[0-i] [You]0-i look horribly tired , [Lily]109-lily ; take [your]0-i tea , and let [me]0-i give [you]0-i this cushion to lean against . ” [Miss Bart]109-lily accepted the cup of tea , but put back the cushion with an impatient hand . “[0-i] Do n’t give [me]0-i that ! [I]0-i do n’t want to lean back — [I]0-i shall go to sleep if [I]0-i do . ” “[0-i] Well , why not , [dear]2964-dear ? [I]0-i ’ll be as quiet as a mouse , ” [Gerty]112-gerty urged affectionately . “[0-i] No — no ; do n’t be quiet ; talk to [me]0-i — keep [me]0-i awake ! [I]0-i do n’t sleep at night , and in the afternoon a dreadful drowsiness creeps over [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i do n’t sleep at night ? Since when ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know — [I]0-i ca n’t remember . ” [She]0-i rose and put the empty cup on the tea - tray . “[0-i] Another , and stronger , please ; if [I]0-i do n’t keep awake now [I]0-i shall see horrors tonight — perfect horrors ! ” “[0-i] But they ’ll be worse if [you]0-i drink too much tea . ” “[0-i] No , no — give it to [me]0-i ; and do n’t preach , please , ” [Lily]109-lily returned imperiously . [Her]109-lily voice had a dangerous edge , and [Gerty]112-gerty noticed that [her]109-lily hand shook as [she]109-lily held it out to receive the second cup . “[0-i] But [you]2964-dear look so tired : [I]0-i ’m sure [you]2964-dear must be ill — — ” [Miss Bart]109-lily set down [her]109-lily cup with a start . “[0-i] Do [I]0-i look ill ? Does [my]0-i face show it ? ” [She]109-lily rose and walked quickly toward the little mirror above the writing - table . “[0-i] What a horrid looking - glass — it ’s all blotched and discoloured . [Any one]442-any one would look ghastly in it ! ” [She]109-lily turned back , fixing [her]109-lily plaintive eyes on [Gerty]112-gerty . “[2964-dear] [[You]2964-dear stupid dear]2464-you stupid dear , why do [you]2964-dear say such odious things to [me]0-i ? It ’s enough to make one ill to be told [one]2737-one looks so ! And looking ill means looking ugly . ” [She]109-lily caught [Gerty]112-gerty ’s wrists , and drew [her]112-gerty close to the window . “[2964-dear] After all , [I]0-i ’d rather know the truth . Look [me]0-i straight in the face , [Gerty]112-gerty , and tell [me]0-i : am [I]0-i perfectly frightful ? ” “[112-gerty] [You]112-gerty ’re perfectly beautiful now , [Lily]109-lily : [your]112-gerty eyes are shining , and [your]112-gerty cheeks have grown so pink all of a sudden — — ” “[112-gerty] Ah , they WERE pale , then — ghastly pale , when [I]0-i came in ? Why do n’t [you]2964-dear tell [me]0-i frankly that [I]0-i ’m [a wreck]2466-a wreck ? [My]0-i eyes are bright now because [I]0-i ’m so nervous — but in the mornings they look like lead . And [I]0-i can see the lines coming in [my]0-i face — the lines of worry and disappointment and failure ! Every sleepless night leaves a new one — and how can [I]0-i sleep , when [I]0-i have such dreadful things to think about ? ” “[0-i] Dreadful things — what things ? ” asked [Gerty]112-gerty , gently detaching [her]112-gerty wrists from [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s feverish fingers . “[0-i] What things ? Well , poverty , for one — and [I]0-i do n’t know any that ’s more dreadful . ” [Lily]109-lily turned away and sank with sudden weariness into the easy - chair near the tea - table . “[2964-dear] [You]2964-dear asked [me]0-i just now if [I]0-i could understand why [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton spent so much money . Of course [I]0-i understand — [he]134-ned silverton spends it on living with [the rich]3224-the rich . [You]2964-dear think [we]2468-we live ON [the rich]3224-the rich , rather than with [them]3224-the rich : and so [we]2468-we do , in a sense — but it ’s a privilege [we]2468-we have to pay for ! [We]2468-we eat [their]3224-the rich dinners , and drink [their]3224-the rich wine , and smoke [their]3224-the rich cigarettes , and use [[their]3224-the rich carriages]2470-their carriages and [their]3224-the rich opera - boxes and [[their]3224-the rich private cars]2471-their private cars — yes , but there ’s a tax to pay on every one of those luxuries . [The man]3104-the man pays it by big tips to [the servants]490-the servants , by playing cards beyond [his]3104-the man means , by flowers and presents — and — and — lots of other things that cost ; [the girl]665-the girl pays it by tips and cards too — oh , yes , [I]0-i ’ve had to take up bridge again — and by going to [the best dress - makers]2475-the best dress - makers , and having just the right dress for every occasion , and always keeping [herself]665-the girl fresh and exquisite and amusing ! ” [She]665-the girl leaned back for a moment , closing [her]665-the girl eyes , and as [she]665-the girl sat there , [her]665-the girl pale lips slightly parted , and the lids dropped above [her]665-the girl fagged brilliant gaze , [Gerty]112-gerty had a startled perception of the change in [her]665-the girl face — of the way in which an ashen daylight seemed suddenly to extinguish its artificial brightness . [She]665-the girl looked up , and the vision vanished . “[0-i] It does n’t sound very amusing , does it ? And it isn’t — [I’m]0-i sick to death of it ! And yet the thought of giving it all up nearly kills [me]0-i — it ’s what keeps [me]0-i awake at night , and makes [me]0-i so crazy for [your]2476-you strong tea . For [I]0-i ca n’t go on in this way much longer , [you]2476-you know — [I’m]0-i nearly at the end of [my]0-i tether . And then what can [I]0-i do — how on earth am [I]0-i to keep [myself]0-i alive ? [I]0-i see [myself]0-i reduced to the fate of [that poor Silverton woman]2477-that poor silverton woman — slinking about to [employment agencies]2478-employment agencies , and trying to sell painted blotting - pads to [[Women]2772-women ’s Exchanges]2480-women ’s exchanges ! And there are [thousands and thousands of women]2481-thousands and thousands of women trying to do the same thing already , and not [one of the number who has less idea how to earn a dollar than [I]0-i have]2482-one of the number who has less idea how to earn a dollar than i have ! ” [She]0-i rose again with a hurried glance at the clock . “[2481-thousands and thousands of women] It ’s late , and [I]0-i must be off — [I]0-i have an appointment with [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher . Do n’t look so worried , [you]2476-you dear thing — don’t think too much about the nonsense [I]0-i ’ve been talking . ” [She]0-i was before the mirror again , adjusting [her]0-i hair with a light hand , drawing down [her]0-i veil , and giving a dexterous touch to [her]0-i furs . “[0-i] Of course , [you]2476-you know , it has n’t come to the [employment agencies]2478-employment agencies and the painted blotting - pads yet ; but [I]0-i ’m rather hard up just for the moment , and if [I]0-i could find something to do — notes to write and visiting - lists to make up , or that kind of thing — it would tide [me]0-i over till the legacy is paid . And [Carry]146-carry fisher has promised to find [somebody who wants a kind of social secretary]2484-somebody who wants a kind of social secretary — [you]2476-you know [she]2484-somebody who wants a kind of social secretary makes a specialty of [the helpless rich]2485-the helpless rich . ” * * * * * [Miss Bart]109-lily had not revealed to [Gerty]112-gerty the full extent of [her]109-lily anxiety . [She]109-lily was in fact in urgent and immediate need of money : money to meet the vulgar weekly claims which could neither be deferred nor evaded . To give up [[her]0-i apartment]4270-her apartment , and shrink to the obscurity of [a boarding - house]1517-a boarding - house , or the provisional hospitality of a bed in [[Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s sitting - room]3956-gerty farish ’s sitting - room , was an expedient which could only postpone the problem confronting [her]0-i ; and it seemed wiser as well as more agreeable to remain where [she]0-i was and find some means of earning [her]0-i living . The possibility of having to do this was one which [she]0-i had never before seriously considered , and the discovery that , as [a bread - winner]4273-a bread - winner , [she]0-i was likely to prove as helpless and ineffectual as [poor Miss Silverton]281-miss jane , was a severe shock to [her]0-i self - confidence . Having been accustomed to take [herself]0-i at the popular valuation , as [a person of energy and resource]4274-a person of energy and resource , naturally fitted to dominate any situation in which [she]0-i found [herself]0-i , [she]0-i vaguely imagined that such gifts would be of value to [seekers]4275-seekers after social guidance ; but there was unfortunately no specific head under which the art of saying and doing the right thing could be offered in the market , and even [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s resourcefulness failed before the difficulty of discovering a workable vein in the vague wealth of [Lily]109-lily ’s graces . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher was full of indirect expedients for enabling [[her]135-mrs. fisher friends]406-her friends to earn a living , and could conscientiously assert that [she]135-mrs. fisher had put several opportunities of this kind before [Lily]109-lily ; but more legitimate methods of bread - winning were as much out of [her]135-mrs. fisher line as they were beyond the capacity of [the sufferers [she]135-mrs. fisher was generally called upon to assist]4277-the sufferers she was generally called upon to assist . [Lily]109-lily ’s failure to profit by the chances already afforded [her]109-lily might , moreover , have justified the abandonment of farther effort on [her]109-lily behalf ; but [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s inexhaustible good - nature made [her]109-lily an adept at creating artificial demands in response to an actual supply . In the pursuance of this end [she]0-i at once started on a voyage of discovery in [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s behalf ; and as the result of [her]0-i explorations [she]0-i now summoned [the latter]566-the latter with the announcement that [she]0-i had “[2484-somebody who wants a kind of social secretary] found something . ” * * * * * Left to [herself]0-i , [Gerty]112-gerty mused distressfully upon [[her]0-i friend]754-her friend ’s plight , and [her]0-i own inability to relieve it . It was clear to [her]112-gerty that [Lily]109-lily , for the present , had no wish for the kind of help [she]109-lily could give . [Miss Farish]113-miss farish could see no hope for [[her]113-miss farish friend]754-her friend but in a life completely reorganized and detached from its old associations ; whereas all [Lily]109-lily ’s energies were centred in the determined effort to hold fast to those associations , to keep [herself]0-i visibly identified with [them]566-the latter , as long as the illusion could be maintained . Pitiable as such an attitude seemed to [Gerty]112-gerty , [she]112-gerty could not judge it as harshly as [Selden]108-selden , for instance , might have done . [She]112-gerty had not forgotten the night of emotion when [she]112-gerty and [Lily]109-lily had lain in [each other]2955-each other ’s arms , and [she]112-gerty had seemed to feel [her]112-gerty very heart ’s blood passing into [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend . The sacrifice [she]112-gerty had made had seemed unavailing enough ; no trace remained in [Lily]109-lily of the subduing influences of that hour ; but [Gerty]112-gerty ’s tenderness , disciplined by long years of contact with obscure and inarticulate suffering , could wait on its object with a silent forbearance which took no account of time . [She]112-gerty could not , however , deny [herself]112-gerty the solace of taking anxious counsel with [Lawrence Selden]108-selden , with whom , since [his]108-selden return from [Europe]21-europe , [she]112-gerty had renewed [her]112-gerty old relation of cousinly confidence . [Selden]108-selden [himself]108-selden had never been aware of any change in [their]4283-their relation . [He]108-selden found [Gerty]112-gerty as [he]108-selden had left [her]112-gerty , simple , undemanding and devoted , but with a quickened intelligence of the heart which [he]108-selden recognized without seeking to explain it . To [Gerty]112-gerty [herself]112-gerty it would once have seemed impossible that [she]112-gerty should ever again talk freely with [him]108-selden of [Lily Bart]109-lily ; but what had passed in the secrecy of [her]112-gerty own breast seemed to resolve itself , when the mist of the struggle cleared , into a breaking down of the bounds of self , a deflecting of the wasted personal emotion into the general current of human understanding . It was not till some two weeks after [her]112-gerty visit from [Lily]109-lily that [Gerty]112-gerty had the opportunity of communicating [her]112-gerty fears to [Selden]108-selden . [The latter]566-the latter , having presented [himself]108-selden on a Sunday afternoon , had lingered on through the dowdy animation of [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin ’s tea - hour , conscious of something in [her]112-gerty voice and eye which solicited a word apart ; and as soon as [the last visitor]4286-the last visitor was gone [Gerty]112-gerty opened [her]112-gerty case by asking how lately [he]108-selden had seen [Miss Bart]109-lily . [Selden]108-selden ’s perceptible pause gave [her]112-gerty time for a slight stir of surprise . “[2484-somebody who wants a kind of social secretary] [I]0-i have n’t seen [her]2486-her at all — [I’ve]0-i perpetually missed seeing [her]2486-her since [she]2486-her came back . ” This unexpected admission made [Gerty]112-gerty pause too ; and [she]112-gerty was still hesitating on the brink of [her]112-gerty subject when [he]108-selden relieved [her]112-gerty by adding : “[2486-her] [I]0-i ’ve wanted to see [her]2486-her — but [she]2486-her seems to have been absorbed by [the Gormer set]2487-the gormer set since [her]2486-her return from [Europe]21-europe . ” “[2486-her] That ’s all the more reason : [she]2486-her ’s been very unhappy . ” “[2486-her] Unhappy at being with [the Gormers]257-the gormers ? ” “[257-the gormers] Oh , [I]0-i do n’t defend [her]2486-her intimacy with [the Gormers]257-the gormers ; but that too is at an end now , [I]0-i think . [You]2488-you know [people]2804-people have been very unkind since [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha quarrelled with [her]2486-her . ” “[133-bertha] Ah — — ” [Selden]108-selden exclaimed , rising abruptly to walk to the window , where [he]108-selden remained with [his]108-selden eyes on [the darkening street]4287-the darkening street while [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin continued to explain : “[133-bertha] [Judy Trenor]126-judy and [[her]126-judy own family]2490-her own family have deserted [her]126-judy too — and all because [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha has said such horrible things . And [she]2486-her is very poor — [you]2488-you know [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston cut [her]2486-her off with a small legacy , after giving [her]2486-her to understand that [she]2486-her was to have everything . ” “[114-mrs. peniston] Yes — [I]0-i know , ” [Selden]108-selden assented curtly , turning back into [the room]351-the room , but only to stir about with restless steps in the circumscribed space between door and window . “[114-mrs. peniston] Yes — [she]2486-her ’s been abominably treated ; but it ’s unfortunately the precise thing that [a man who wants to show [his]2491-a man who wants to show his sympathy sympathy]2491-a man who wants to show his sympathy ca n’t say to [her]2486-her . ” [His]108-selden words caused [Gerty]112-gerty a slight chill of disappointment . “[2491-a man who wants to show his sympathy] There would be other ways of showing [your]2488-you sympathy , ” [she]2488-you suggested . [Selden]108-selden , with a slight laugh , sat down beside [her]2488-you on the little sofa which projected from the hearth . “[2488-you] What are [you]2488-you thinking of , [you]2488-you incorrigible missionary ? ” [he]108-selden asked . [Gerty]112-gerty ’s colour rose , and [her]2488-you blush was for a moment [her]2488-you only answer . Then [she]0-i made it more explicit by saying : “[2488-you] [I]0-i am thinking of the fact that [you]2488-you and [she]2486-her used to be [great friends]2492-great friends — that [she]2486-her used to care immensely for what [you]2488-you thought of [her]2486-her — and that , if [she]2486-her takes [your]2488-you staying away as a sign of what [you]2488-you think now , [I]0-i can imagine its adding a great deal to [her]2486-her unhappiness . ” “[0-i] [[My]0-i dear child]2493-my dear child , do n’t add to it still more — at least to [your]2493-my dear child conception of it — by attributing to [her]2486-her all sorts of susceptibilities of [your]2493-my dear child own . ” [Selden]108-selden , for [his]108-selden life , could not keep a note of dryness out of [his]108-selden voice ; but [he]108-selden met [Gerty]112-gerty ’s look of perplexity by saying more mildly : “[2493-my dear child] But , though [you]2493-my dear child immensely exaggerate the importance of anything [I]0-i could do for [Miss Bart]109-lily , [you]2493-my dear child ca n’t exaggerate [my]0-i readiness to do it — if [you]2493-my dear child ask [me]0-i to . ” [He]108-selden laid [his]108-selden hand for a moment on [hers]112-gerty , and there passed between [them]4290-them , on the current of the rare contact , one of those exchanges of meaning which fill the hidden reservoirs of affection . [Gerty]112-gerty had the feeling that [he]108-selden measured the cost of [her]112-gerty request as plainly as [she]112-gerty read the significance of [his]108-selden reply ; and the sense of all that was suddenly clear between [them]4290-them made [her]112-gerty next words easier to find . “[2493-my dear child] [I]0-i do ask [you]2493-my dear child , then ; [I]0-i ask [you]2493-my dear child because [she]109-lily once told [me]0-i that [you]2493-my dear child had been a help to [her]109-lily , and because [she]109-lily needs help now as [she]109-lily has never needed it before . [You]2493-my dear child know how dependent [she]109-lily has always been on ease and luxury — how [she]109-lily has hated what was shabby and ugly and uncomfortable . [She]109-lily ca n’t help it — [she]109-lily was brought up with those ideas , and has never been able to find [her]109-lily way out of them . But now all the things [she]109-lily cared for have been taken from [her]109-lily , and [the people who taught [her]109-lily to care for [them]2495-them]2494-the people who taught her to care for them have abandoned [her]109-lily too ; and it seems to [me]0-i that if [some one]2889-some one could reach out a hand and show [her]109-lily the other side — show [her]109-lily how much is left in life and in [herself]109-lily — — ” [Gerty]112-gerty broke off , abashed at the sound of [her]112-gerty own eloquence , and impeded by the difficulty of giving precise expression to [her]112-gerty vague yearning for [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s retrieval . “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t help [her]109-lily [myself]0-i : [she]109-lily ’s passed out of [my]0-i reach , ” [she]0-i continued . “[109-lily] [I]0-i think [she]109-lily ’s afraid of being a burden to [me]0-i . When [she]109-lily was last [here]2763-here , two weeks ago , [she]109-lily seemed dreadfully worried about [her]109-lily future : [she]109-lily said [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher was trying to find something for [her]109-lily to do . A few days later [she]109-lily wrote [me]0-i that [she]109-lily had taken a position as [private secretary]2498-private secretary , and that [I]0-i was not to be anxious , for everything was all right , and [she]109-lily would come in and tell [me]0-i about it when [she]109-lily had time ; but [she]109-lily has never come , and [I]0-i do n’t like to go to [her]109-lily , because [I]0-i am afraid of forcing [myself]0-i on [her]109-lily when [I]0-i ’m not wanted . Once , when [we]2499-we were [children]2919-children , and [I]0-i had rushed up after a long separation , and thrown [my]0-i arms about [her]109-lily , [she]109-lily said : ‘ Please do n’t kiss [me]0-i unless [I]0-i ask [you]0-i to , [Gerty’—and]284-gerty’—and [she]109-lily DID ask [me]0-i , a minute later ; but since then [I]0-i ’ve always waited to be asked . ” [Selden]108-selden had listened in silence , with the concentrated look which [his]108-selden thin dark face could assume when [he]108-selden wished to guard it against any involuntary change of expression . When [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin ended , [he]108-selden said with a slight smile : “[109-lily] Since [you]109-lily ’ve learned the wisdom of waiting , [I]0-i do n’t see why [you]109-lily urge [me]0-i to rush in — ” but the troubled appeal of [her]340-his cousin eyes made [him]108-selden add , as [he]108-selden rose to take leave : “[109-lily] Still , [I]0-i ’ll do what [you]109-lily wish , and not hold [you]109-lily responsible for [my]0-i failure . ” [Selden]108-selden ’s avoidance of [Miss Bart]109-lily had not been as unintentional as [he]108-selden had allowed [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin to think . At first , indeed , while the memory of [their]4294-their last hour at [Monte Carlo]56-monte carlo still held the full heat of [his]108-selden indignation , [he]108-selden had anxiously watched for [her]340-his cousin return ; but [she]340-his cousin had disappointed [him]108-selden by lingering in [England]75-england , and when [she]340-his cousin finally reappeared it happened that [business]4295-business had called [him]108-selden to [the West]4296-the west , whence [he]108-selden came back only to learn that [she]340-his cousin was starting for [Alaska]83-alaska with [the Gormers]257-the gormers . The revelation of this suddenly - established intimacy effectually chilled [his]108-selden desire to see [her]340-his cousin . If , at a moment when [her]340-his cousin whole life seemed to be breaking up , [she]340-his cousin could cheerfully commit its reconstruction to [the Gormers]257-the gormers , there was no reason why such accidents should ever strike [her]340-his cousin as irreparable . Every step [she]340-his cousin took seemed in fact to carry [her]340-his cousin farther from [the region where , once or twice , [he]108-selden and [she]340-his cousin had met]4297-the region where , once or twice , he and she had met for an illumined moment ; and the recognition of this fact , when its first pang had been surmounted , produced in [him]108-selden a sense of negative relief . It was much simpler for [him]108-selden to judge [Miss Bart]109-lily by [her]340-his cousin habitual conduct than by the rare deviations from it which had thrown [her]340-his cousin so disturbingly in [his]108-selden way ; and every act of [hers]340-his cousin which made the recurrence of such deviations more unlikely , confirmed the sense of relief with which [he]108-selden returned to the conventional view of [her]340-his cousin . But [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s words had sufficed to make [him]108-selden see how little this view was really [his]108-selden , and how impossible it was for [him]108-selden to live quietly with the thought of [Lily Bart]109-lily . To hear that [she]340-his cousin was in need of help — even such vague help as [he]108-selden could offer — was to be at once repossessed by that thought ; and by the time [he]108-selden reached [the street]310-the street [he]108-selden had sufficiently convinced [himself]108-selden of the urgency of [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin ’s appeal to turn [his]108-selden steps directly toward [[Lily]109-lily ’s hotel]4300-lily ’s hotel . There [his]108-selden zeal met a check in the unforeseen news that [Miss Bart]109-lily had moved away ; but , on [his]108-selden pressing [his]108-selden enquiries , [the clerk]4301-the clerk remembered that [she]340-his cousin had left an address , for which [he]108-selden presently began to search through [his]108-selden books . It was certainly strange that [she]340-his cousin should have taken this step without letting [Gerty Farish]112-gerty know of [her]340-his cousin decision ; and [Selden]108-selden waited with a vague sense of uneasiness while the address was sought for . The process lasted long enough for uneasiness to turn to apprehension ; but when at length a slip of paper was handed [him]108-selden , and [he]108-selden read on it : “[0-i] Care of [Mrs. Norma Hatch]285-mrs. hatch , [Emporium Hotel]92-emporium hotel , ” [his]108-selden apprehension passed into an incredulous stare , and this into the gesture of disgust with which [he]108-selden tore the paper in two , and turned to walk quickly homeward . Chapter 9 When [Lily]109-lily woke on the morning after [her]109-lily translation to [the Emporium Hotel]4302-the emporium hotel , [her]109-lily first feeling was one of purely physical satisfaction . The force of contrast gave an added keenness to the luxury of lying once more in a soft - pillowed bed , and looking across [a spacious sunlit room]4303-a spacious sunlit room at a breakfast - table set invitingly near the fire . Analysis and introspection might come later ; but for the moment [she]109-lily was not even troubled by the excesses of the upholstery or the restless convolutions of the furniture . The sense of being once more lapped and folded in ease , as in some dense mild medium impenetrable to discomfort , effectually stilled the faintest note of criticism . When , the afternoon before , [she]109-lily had presented [herself]109-lily to [the lady to whom [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher had directed [her]109-lily]4304-the lady to whom carry fisher had directed her , [she]109-lily had been conscious of entering [a new world]1061-a new world . [Carry]146-carry fisher ’s vague presentment of [Mrs. Norma Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ( whose reversion to [her]285-mrs. hatch Christian name was explained as the result of [her]285-mrs. hatch latest divorce ) , left [her]109-lily under the implication of coming “[285-mrs. hatch] from [the West]93-the west , ” with the not unusual extenuation of having brought a great deal of money with [her]285-mrs. hatch . [She]285-mrs. hatch was , in short , rich , helpless , unplaced : the very subject for [Lily]109-lily ’s hand . [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher had not specified the line [[her]135-mrs. fisher friend]754-her friend was to take ; [she]135-mrs. fisher owned [herself]135-mrs. fisher unacquainted with [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch , whom [she]135-mrs. fisher “[285-mrs. hatch] knew about ” through [Melville Stancy]286-mr. stancy , [a lawyer in [his]286-mr. stancy leisure moments , and the Falstaff of a certain section of festive club life]4307-a lawyer in his leisure moments , and the falstaff of a certain section of festive club life . Socially , [Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy might have been said to form a connecting link between [the Gormer world]4308-the gormer world and [the more dimly - lit region on which [Miss Bart]109-lily now found [herself]109-lily entering]4309-the more dimly - lit region on which miss bart now found herself entering . It was , however , only figuratively that the illumination of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s world could be described as dim : in actual fact , [Lily]109-lily found [her]285-mrs. hatch seated in a blaze of electric light , impartially projected from various ornamental excrescences on a vast concavity of pink damask and gilding , from which [she]285-mrs. hatch rose like [Venus]287-venus from [her]285-mrs. hatch shell . The analogy was justified by the appearance of [the lady , whose large - eyed prettiness had the fixity of something impaled and shown under glass]4310-the lady , whose large - eyed prettiness had the fixity of something impaled and shown under glass . This did not preclude the immediate discovery that [she]285-mrs. hatch was some years younger than [[her]285-mrs. hatch visitor]1346-her visitor , and that under [her]285-mrs. hatch showiness , [her]285-mrs. hatch ease , the aggression of [her]285-mrs. hatch dress and voice , there persisted that ineradicable innocence which , in [ladies of [her]285-mrs. hatch nationality]4312-ladies of her nationality , so curiously coexists with startling extremes of experience . The environment in which [Lily]109-lily found [herself]109-lily was as strange to [her]109-lily as [[its]4313-its inhabitants]4314-its inhabitants . [She]109-lily was unacquainted with [the world of [the fashionable New York hotel]4316-the fashionable new york hotel]4315-the world of the fashionable new york hotel — [a world over - heated , over - upholstered]4317-a world over - heated , over - upholstered , and over - fitted with mechanical appliances for the gratification of fantastic requirements , while the comforts of a civilized life were as unattainable as in [a desert]4318-a desert . Through this atmosphere of torrid splendour moved [wan beings as richly upholstered as the furniture]4319-wan beings as richly upholstered as the furniture , [beings without definite pursuits or permanent relations]4320-beings without definite pursuits or permanent relations , who drifted on a languid tide of curiosity from [restaurant]4321-restaurant to [concert - hall]4322-concert - hall , from [palm - garden]4323-palm - garden to [music - room]4324-music - room , from “[0-i] art exhibit ” to [dress - maker]4325-dress - maker ’s opening . High - stepping horses or elaborately equipped motors waited to carry [these ladies]3988-these ladies into vague metropolitan distances , whence [they]3988-these ladies returned , still more wan from the weight of [their]3988-these ladies sables , to be sucked back into the stifling inertia of [the hotel]3643-the hotel routine . Somewhere behind [them]3988-these ladies , in the background of [their]3988-these ladies lives , there was doubtless a real past , peopled by real human activities : [they]3988-these ladies [themselves]3988-these ladies were probably the product of strong ambitions , persistent energies , diversified contacts with the wholesome roughness of life ; yet [they]3988-these ladies had no more real existence than [the poet]4328-the poet ’s shades in limbo . [Lily]109-lily had not been long in [this pallid world]4329-this pallid world without discovering that [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch was [its]4329-this pallid world most substantial figure . [That lady]486-that lady , though still floating in the void , showed faint symptoms of developing an outline ; and in this endeavour [she]486-that lady was actively seconded by [Mr. Melville Stancy]286-mr. stancy . It was [Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy , [a man of large resounding presence , suggestive of convivial occasions and of a chivalry finding expression in “[0-i] first - night ” boxes]4331-a man of large resounding presence , suggestive of convivial occasions and of a chivalry finding expression in “ first - night ” boxes and thousand dollar bonbonnieres , who had transplanted [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch from the scene of [her]285-mrs. hatch first development to the higher stage of hotel life in [the metropolis]472-the metropolis . It was [he]286-mr. stancy who had selected the horses with which [she]285-mrs. hatch had taken the blue ribbon at the Show , had introduced [her]285-mrs. hatch to [the photographer whose portraits of [her]285-mrs. hatch formed the recurring ornament of “[288-sunday supplements] [Sunday Supplements]288-sunday supplements , ” and had got together the group which constituted [[her]285-mrs. hatch social world]4334-her social world]4333-the photographer whose portraits of her formed the recurring ornament of “ sunday supplements , ” and had got together the group which constituted her social world . It was a small group still , with heterogeneous figures suspended in [large unpeopled spaces]4335-large unpeopled spaces ; but [Lily]109-lily did not take long to learn that its regulation was no longer in [Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy ’s hands . As often happens , [the pupil]4336-the pupil had outstripped [the teacher]4337-the teacher , and [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch was already aware of heights of elegance as well as depths of luxury beyond [the world of [the Emporium]94-the emporium]4338-the world of the emporium . This discovery at once produced in [her]285-mrs. hatch a craving for higher guidance , for the adroit feminine hand which should give the right turn to [her]285-mrs. hatch correspondence , the right “[288-sunday supplements] look ” to [her]285-mrs. hatch hats , the right succession to the items of [her]285-mrs. hatch MENUS . It was , in short , as the regulator of a germinating social life that [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s guidance was required ; [her]285-mrs. hatch ostensible duties as [secretary]4339-secretary being restricted by the fact that [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch , as yet , knew hardly any one to write to . The daily details of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s existence were as strange to [Lily]109-lily as [its]109-lily general tenor . [The lady]602-the lady ’s habits were marked by an Oriental indolence and disorder peculiarly trying to [[her]602-the lady companion]445-her companion . [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch and [[her]285-mrs. hatch friends]406-her friends seemed to float together outside the bounds of time and space . No definite hours were kept ; no fixed obligations existed : night and day flowed into one another in a blur of confused and retarded engagements , so that [one]2737-one had the impression of lunching at the tea - hour , while dinner was often merged in the noisy after - theatre supper which prolonged [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s vigil till daylight . Through this jumble of futile activities came and went [a strange throng of hangers - on]4344-a strange throng of hangers - on — manicures , [beauty - doctors]4345-beauty - doctors , [hair - dressers]4346-hair - dressers , [teachers of bridge , of French , of “[288-sunday supplements] physical development ”]4347-teachers of bridge , of french , of “ physical development ” : figures sometimes indistinguishable , by [their]4344-a strange throng of hangers - on appearance , or by [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s relation to [them]4344-a strange throng of hangers - on , from [the visitors constituting [her]285-mrs. hatch recognized society]4348-the visitors constituting her recognized society . But strangest of all to [Lily]109-lily was the encounter , in this latter group , of several of [[her]109-lily acquaintances]603-her acquaintances . [She]109-lily had supposed , and not without relief , that [she]109-lily was passing , for the moment , completely out of [her]109-lily own circle ; but [she]109-lily found that [Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy , one side of whose sprawling existence overlapped the edge of [[Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s world]4350-mrs. fisher ’s world , had drawn several of [its]286-mr. stancy brightest ornaments into [the circle of [the Emporium]4352-the emporium]4351-the circle of the emporium . To find [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton among [the habitual frequenters of [[Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s drawing - room]4354-mrs. hatch ’s drawing - room]4353-the habitual frequenters of mrs. hatch ’s drawing - room was one of [Lily]109-lily ’s first astonishments ; but [she]109-lily soon discovered that [he]134-ned silverton was not [[Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy ’s most important recruit]4355-mr. stancy ’s most important recruit . It was on little [Freddy Van Osburgh]273-freddy , [the small slim heir of [the Van Osburgh millions]4357-the van osburgh millions]4356-the small slim heir of the van osburgh millions , that the attention of [[Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s group]4358-mrs. hatch ’s group was centred . [Freddy]273-freddy , barely out of college , had risen above the horizon since [Lily]109-lily ’s eclipse , and [she]109-lily now saw with surprise what an effulgence [he]273-freddy shed on the outer twilight of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s existence . This , then , was one of the things that [young men]3246-young men “[288-sunday supplements] went in ” for when released from the official social routine ; this was the kind of “[288-sunday supplements] previous engagement ” that so frequently caused [them]3246-young men to disappoint the hopes of [anxious hostesses]4360-anxious hostesses . [Lily]109-lily had an odd sense of being behind the social tapestry , on the side where the threads were knotted and the loose ends hung . For a moment [she]109-lily found a certain amusement in the show , and in [her]109-lily own share of it : the situation had an ease and unconventionality distinctly refreshing after [her]109-lily experience of the irony of conventions . But these flashes of amusement were but brief reactions from the long disgust of [her]109-lily days . Compared with the vast gilded void of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s existence , the life of [[Lily]109-lily ’s former friends]4361-lily ’s former friends seemed packed with ordered activities . Even [the most irresponsible pretty woman of [her]109-lily acquaintance]4362-the most irresponsible pretty woman of her acquaintance had [her]109-lily inherited obligations , [her]109-lily conventional benevolences , [her]109-lily share in the working of the great civic machine ; and all hung together in the solidarity of these traditional functions . The performance of specific duties would have simplified [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s position ; but the vague attendance on [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch was not without its perplexities . It was not [[her]109-lily employer]4363-her employer who created these perplexities . [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch showed from the first an almost touching desire for [Lily]109-lily ’s approval . Far from asserting the superiority of wealth , [her]109-lily beautiful eyes seemed to urge the plea of inexperience : [she]109-lily wanted to do what was “[288-sunday supplements] nice , ” to be taught how to be “[288-sunday supplements] lovely . ” The difficulty was to find any point of contact between [her]109-lily ideals and [Lily]109-lily ’s . [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch swam in a haze of indeterminate enthusiasms , of aspirations culled from the stage , the newspapers , the fashion journals , and a gaudy world of sport still more completely beyond [[her]109-lily companion]445-her companion ’s ken . To separate from these confused conceptions those most likely to advance [the lady]602-the lady on [her]602-the lady way , was [Lily]109-lily ’s obvious duty ; but its performance was hampered by rapidly - growing doubts . [Lily]109-lily was in fact becoming more and more aware of a certain ambiguity in [her]109-lily situation . It was not that [she]109-lily had , in the conventional sense , any doubt of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s irreproachableness . [The lady]602-the lady ’s offences were always against taste rather than conduct ; [her]602-the lady divorce record seemed due to geographical rather than ethical conditions ; and [her]602-the lady worst laxities were likely to proceed from a wandering and extravagant good - nature . But if [Lily]109-lily did not mind [her]109-lily detaining [her]109-lily manicure for luncheon , or offering [the “[288-sunday supplements] Beauty - Doctor]4367-the “ beauty - doctor ” a seat in [Freddy Van Osburgh]273-freddy ’s box at the play , [she]109-lily was not equally at ease in regard to some less apparent lapses from convention . [Ned Silverton]134-ned silverton ’s relation to [Stancy]286-mr. stancy seemed , for instance , closer and less clear than any natural affinities would warrant ; and [both]1799-both appeared united in the effort to cultivate [Freddy Van Osburgh]273-freddy ’s growing taste for [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch . There was as yet nothing definable in the situation , which might well resolve itself into a huge joke on the part of [the other two]4369-the other two ; but [Lily]109-lily had a vague sense that the subject of [their]1799-both experiment was too young , too rich and too credulous . [Her]109-lily embarrassment was increased by the fact that [Freddy]273-freddy seemed to regard [her]109-lily as cooperating with [himself]273-freddy in the social development of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch : a view that suggested , on [his]273-freddy part , a permanent interest in [the lady]602-the lady ’s future . There were moments when [Lily]109-lily found an ironic amusement in this aspect of the case . The thought of launching such a missile as [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch at the perfidious bosom of society was not without its charm : [Miss Bart]109-lily had even beguiled [her]109-lily leisure with visions of [the fair Norma]4371-the fair norma introduced for the first time to a family banquet at [the Van Osburghs ’]3057-the van osburghs ’ . But the thought of being personally connected with the transaction was less agreeable ; and [her]109-lily momentary flashes of amusement were followed by increasing periods of doubt . The sense of these doubts was uppermost when , late one afternoon , [she]109-lily was surprised by a visit from [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . [He]108-selden found [her]109-lily alone in [the wilderness of pink damask]4373-the wilderness of pink damask , for in [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s world the tea - hour was not dedicated to social rites , and [the lady]602-the lady was in the hands of [[her]602-the lady masseuse]4375-her masseuse . [Selden]108-selden ’s entrance had caused [Lily]109-lily an inward start of embarrassment ; but [his]108-selden air of constraint had the effect of restoring [her]109-lily self - possession , and [she]109-lily took at once the tone of surprise and pleasure , wondering frankly that [he]108-selden should have traced [her]109-lily to so unlikely a place , and asking what had inspired [him]108-selden to make the search . [Selden]108-selden met this with an unusual seriousness : [she]109-lily had never seen [him]108-selden so little master of the situation , so plainly at the mercy of any obstructions [she]109-lily might put in [his]108-selden way . “[0-i] [I]0-i wanted to see [you]2501-you , ” [he]108-selden said ; and [she]109-lily could not resist observing in reply that [he]108-selden had kept [his]108-selden wishes under remarkable control . [She]109-lily had in truth felt [his]108-selden long absence as one of the chief bitternesses of the last months : [his]108-selden desertion had wounded sensibilities far below the surface of [her]109-lily pride . [Selden]108-selden met the challenge with directness . “[0-i] Why should [I]0-i have come , unless [I]0-i thought [I]0-i could be of use to [you]0-i ? It is [my]0-i only excuse for imagining [you]0-i could want [me]0-i . ” This struck [her]109-lily as a clumsy evasion , and the thought gave a flash of keenness to [her]109-lily answer . “[0-i] Then [you]0-i have come now because [you]0-i think [you]0-i can be of use to [me]0-i ? ” [He]108-selden hesitated again . “[0-i] Yes : in the modest capacity of [a person to talk things over with]2502-a person to talk things over with . ” For [a clever man]4376-a clever man it was certainly a stupid beginning ; and the idea that [his]108-selden awkwardness was due to the fear of [her]109-lily attaching a personal significance to [his]108-selden visit , chilled [her]109-lily pleasure in seeing [him]108-selden . Even under the most adverse conditions , that pleasure always made itself felt : [she]109-lily might hate [him]108-selden , but [she]109-lily had never been able to wish [him]108-selden out of [the room]351-the room . [She]109-lily was very near hating [him]108-selden now ; yet the sound of [his]108-selden voice , the way the light fell on [his]108-selden thin dark hair , the way [he]108-selden sat and moved and wore [his]108-selden clothes — [she]109-lily was conscious that even these trivial things were inwoven with [her]109-lily deepest life . In [his]108-selden presence a sudden stillness came upon [her]109-lily , and the turmoil of [her]109-lily spirit ceased ; but an impulse of resistance to this stealing influence now prompted [her]109-lily to say : “[0-i] It ’s very good of [you]2503-you to present [yourself]2503-you in that capacity ; but what makes [you]2503-you think [I]0-i have anything particular to talk about ? ” Though [she]109-lily kept the even tone of light intercourse , the question was framed in a way to remind [him]108-selden that [his]108-selden good offices were unsought ; and for a moment [Selden]108-selden was checked by it . The situation between [them]4378-them was one which could have been cleared up only by a sudden explosion of feeling ; and [their]4378-them whole training and habit of mind were against the chances of such an explosion . [Selden]108-selden again glanced about [[Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s drawing - room]4354-mrs. hatch ’s drawing - room ; then [he]108-selden said , with a decision which [he]108-selden seemed to have gathered from this final inspection : “[2503-you] [You]2503-you are to let [me]0-i take [you]2503-you away from [here]2763-here . ” [Lily]109-lily flushed at the suddenness of the attack ; then [she]109-lily stiffened under it and said coldly : “[0-i] And may [I]0-i ask where [you]2503-you mean [me]0-i to go ? ” “[0-i] Back to [Gerty]112-gerty in the first place , if [you]2503-you will ; the essential thing is that it should be away from here . ” The unusual harshness of [his]108-selden tone might have shown [her]109-lily how much the words cost [him]108-selden ; but [she]109-lily was in no state to measure [his]108-selden feelings while [her]109-lily own were in a flame of revolt . To neglect [her]109-lily , perhaps even to avoid [her]109-lily , at a time when [she]109-lily had most need of [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends , and then suddenly and unwarrantably to break into [her]109-lily life with this strange assumption of authority , was to rouse in [her]109-lily every instinct of pride and self - defence . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very much obliged to [you]2503-you , ” [she]0-i said , “[0-i] for taking such an interest in [my]0-i plans ; but [I]0-i am quite contented where [I]0-i am , and have no intention of leaving . ” [Selden]108-selden had risen , and was standing before [her]0-i in an attitude of uncontrollable expectancy . “[0-i] That simply means that [you]0-i do n’t know where [you]0-i are ! ” [he]108-selden exclaimed . [Lily]109-lily rose also , with a quick flash of anger . “[0-i] If [you]2503-you have come here to say disagreeable things about [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch — — ” “[2503-you] It is only with [your]2503-you relation to [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch that [I]0-i am concerned . ” “[0-i] [My]0-i relation to [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch is one [I]0-i have no reason to be ashamed of .
