[Gerty]112-gerty , [I]0-i know , is eager to make such an arrangement , and would be quite happy in it — — ” “[112-gerty] But [I]0-i should not , ” [Miss Bart]109-lily interposed . “[0-i] There are many reasons why it would be neither kind to [Gerty]112-gerty nor wise for [myself]0-i . ” [She]109-lily paused a moment , and as [he]4382-he seemed to await a farther explanation , added with a quick lift of [her]109-lily head : “[0-i] [You]0-i will perhaps excuse [me]0-i from giving [you]0-i these reasons . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i have no claim to know [them]2509-them , ” [Selden]108-selden answered , ignoring [her]109-lily tone ; “[0-i] no claim to offer any comment or suggestion beyond the one [I]0-i have already made . And [my]0-i right to make that is simply the universal right of [a man]2811-a man to enlighten [a woman]2771-a woman when [he]2811-a man sees [her]2771-a woman unconsciously placed in a false position . ” [Lily]109-lily smiled . “[2811-a man] [I]0-i suppose , ” [she]0-i rejoined , “[0-i] that by a false position [you]0-i mean one outside of what [we]2512-we call society ; but [you]0-i must remember that [I]0-i had been excluded from [those sacred precincts]2513-those sacred precincts long before [I]0-i met [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch . As far as [I]0-i can see , there is very little real difference in being inside or out , and [I]0-i remember [your]0-i once telling [me]0-i that it was only [those inside who took the difference seriously]2514-those inside who took the difference seriously . ” [She]109-lily had not been without intention in making this allusion to [their]2512-we memorable talk at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and [she]109-lily waited with an odd tremor of the nerves to see what response it would bring ; but the result of the experiment was disappointing . [Selden]108-selden did not allow the allusion to deflect [him]108-selden from [his]108-selden point ; [he]108-selden merely said with completer fulness of emphasis : “[0-i] The question of being inside or out is , as [you]0-i say , a small one , and it happens to have nothing to do with the case , except in so far as [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s desire to be inside may put [you]0-i in the position [I]0-i call false . ” In spite of the moderation of [his]108-selden tone , each word [he]108-selden spoke had the effect of confirming [Lily]109-lily ’s resistance . The very apprehensions [he]108-selden aroused hardened [her]109-lily against [him]108-selden : [she]109-lily had been on the alert for the note of personal sympathy , for any sign of recovered power over [him]108-selden ; and [his]108-selden attitude of sober impartiality , the absence of all response to [her]109-lily appeal , turned [her]109-lily hurt pride to blind resentment of [his]108-selden interference . The conviction that [he]108-selden had been sent by [Gerty]112-gerty , and that , whatever straits [he]108-selden conceived [her]109-lily to be in , [he]108-selden would never voluntarily have come to [her]109-lily aid , strengthened [her]109-lily resolve not to admit [him]108-selden a hair ’s breadth farther into [her]109-lily confidence . However doubtful [she]109-lily might feel [her]109-lily situation to be , [she]109-lily would rather persist in darkness than owe [her]109-lily enlightenment to [Selden]108-selden . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know , ” [she]0-i said , when [he]108-selden had ceased to speak , “[2515-you] why [you]2515-you imagine [me]0-i to be situated as [you]2515-you describe ; but as [you]2515-you have always told [me]0-i that the sole object of a bringing - up like [mine]0-i was to teach [a girl]2828-a girl to get what [she]2828-a girl wants , why not assume that that is precisely what [I]0-i am doing ? ” The smile with which [she]0-i summed up [her]0-i case was like a clear barrier raised against farther confidences : its brightness held [him]108-selden at such a distance that [he]108-selden had a sense of being almost out of hearing as [he]108-selden rejoined : “[0-i] [I]0-i am not sure that [I]0-i have ever called [you]0-i [a successful example of that kind of bringing - up]2517-a successful example of that kind of bringing - up . ” [Her]0-i colour rose a little at the implication , but [she]0-i steeled [herself]0-i with a light laugh . “[2515-you] Ah , wait a little longer — give [me]0-i a little more time before [you]2515-you decide ! ” And as [he]108-selden wavered before [her]0-i , still watching for a break in the impenetrable front [she]0-i presented : “[2515-you] Do n’t give [me]0-i up ; [I]0-i may still do credit to [my]0-i training ! ” [she]0-i affirmed . Chapter 10 “[109-lily] Look at those spangles , [Miss Bart]109-lily — every one of ’em sewed on crooked . ” [The tall forewoman]4383-the tall forewoman , [a pinched perpendicular figure]4384-a pinched perpendicular figure , dropped the condemned structure of wire and net on the table at [Lily]109-lily ’s side , and passed on to [the next figure in the line]4385-the next figure in the line . There were twenty of [them]4386-their in [the work - room]4387-the work - room , [their]4386-their fagged profiles , under exaggerated hair , bowed in the harsh north light above the utensils of [their]4386-their art ; for it was something more than an industry , surely , this creation of ever - varied settings for the face of [fortunate womanhood]4388-fortunate womanhood . [Their]4386-their own faces were sallow with the unwholesomeness of hot air and sedentary toil , rather than with any actual signs of want : [they]4386-their were employed in [a fashionable millinery establishment]4389-a fashionable millinery establishment , and were fairly well clothed and well paid ; but [the youngest among [them]4386-their]4390-the youngest among them was as dull and colourless as [the middle - aged]4391-the middle - aged . In [the whole work - room]4392-the whole work - room there was only one skin beneath which the blood still visibly played ; and that now burned with vexation as [Miss Bart]109-lily , under the lash of [the forewoman]4393-the forewoman ’s comment , began to strip the hat - frame of its over - lapping spangles . To [Gerty Farish]112-gerty ’s hopeful spirit a solution appeared to have been reached when [she]4393-the forewoman remembered how beautifully [Lily]109-lily could trim hats . Instances of [young lady - milliners]4394-young lady - milliners establishing [themselves]4394-young lady - milliners under fashionable patronage , and imparting to [their]4394-young lady - milliners “[109-lily] creations ” that indefinable touch which [the professional hand]4395-the professional hand can never give , had flattered [Gerty]112-gerty ’s visions of the future , and convinced even [Lily]109-lily that [her]109-lily separation from [Mrs. Norma Hatch]285-mrs. hatch need not reduce [her]109-lily to dependence on [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends . The parting had occurred a few weeks after [Selden]108-selden ’s visit , and would have taken place sooner had it not been for the resistance set up in [Lily]109-lily by [his]108-selden ill - starred offer of advice . The sense of being involved in a transaction [she]109-lily would not have cared to examine too closely had soon afterward defined itself in the light of a hint from [Mr. Stancy]286-mr. stancy that , if [she]109-lily “[2518-them] saw [them]2518-them through , ” [she]109-lily would have no reason to be sorry . The implication that such loyalty would meet with a direct reward had hastened [her]109-lily flight , and flung [her]109-lily back , ashamed and penitent , on the broad bosom of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s sympathy . [She]109-lily did not , however , propose to lie there prone , and [Gerty]112-gerty ’s inspiration about the hats at once revived [her]109-lily hopes of profitable activity . Here was , after all , something that [her]109-lily charming listless hands could really do ; [she]109-lily had no doubt of [their]2518-them capacity for knotting a ribbon or placing a flower to advantage . And of course only these finishing touches would be expected of [her]109-lily : subordinate fingers , blunt , grey , needle - pricked fingers , would prepare the shapes and stitch the linings , while [she]109-lily presided over [the charming little front shop]4397-the charming little front shop — [a shop all white panels , mirrors , and moss - green hangings — where [her]109-lily finished creations]4398-a shop all white panels , mirrors , and moss - green hangings — where her finished creations , hats , wreaths , aigrettes and the rest , perched on their stands like birds just poising for flight . But at the very outset of [Gerty]112-gerty ’s campaign this vision of [the green - and - white shop]4399-the green - and - white shop had been dispelled . [Other young ladies of fashion]4400-other young ladies of fashion had been thus “[2518-them] set up , ” selling [their]4400-other young ladies of fashion hats by the mere attraction of a name and the reputed knack of tying a bow ; but [these privileged beings]4401-these privileged beings could command a faith in [their]4401-these privileged beings powers materially expressed by the readiness to pay [their]4401-these privileged beings shop - rent and advance a handsome sum for current expenses . Where was [Lily]109-lily to find such support ? And even could it have been found , how were [the ladies on whose approval [she]109-lily depended to be induced to give [her]109-lily [their]4402-the ladies on whose approval she depended to be induced to give her their patronage patronage]4402-the ladies on whose approval she depended to be induced to give her their patronage ? [Gerty]112-gerty learned that whatever sympathy [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend ’s case might have excited a few months since had been imperilled , if not lost , by [her]109-lily association with [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch . Once again , [Lily]109-lily had withdrawn from an ambiguous situation in time to save [her]109-lily self - respect , but too late for public vindication . [Freddy Van Osburgh]273-freddy was not to marry [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ; [he]273-freddy had been rescued at the eleventh hour — some said by the efforts of [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor and [Rosedale]124-rosedale — and despatched to [Europe]21-europe with [old Ned Van Alstyne]263-ned ; but the risk [he]273-freddy had run would always be ascribed to [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s connivance , and would somehow serve as a summing - up and corroboration of the vague general distrust of [her]109-lily . It was a relief to those who had hung back from [her]109-lily to find [themselves]4402-the ladies on whose approval she depended to be induced to give her their patronage thus justified , and [they]4402-the ladies on whose approval she depended to be induced to give her their patronage were inclined to insist a little on [her]109-lily connection with the Hatch case in order to show that [they]4402-the ladies on whose approval she depended to be induced to give her their patronage had been right . [Gerty]112-gerty ’s quest , at any rate , brought up against a solid wall of resistance ; and even when [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher , momentarily penitent for [her]146-carry fisher share in the Hatch affair , joined [her]146-carry fisher efforts to [Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s , [they]4404-they met with no better success . [Gerty]112-gerty had tried to veil [her]112-gerty failure in tender ambiguities ; but [Carry]146-carry fisher , always the soul of candour , put the case squarely to [[her]112-gerty friend]754-her friend . “[2518-them] [I]0-i went straight to [Judy Trenor]126-judy ; [she]126-judy has fewer prejudices than the others , and besides [she]126-judy ’s always hated [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha . But what HAVE [you]0-i done to [her]126-judy , [Lily]109-lily ? At the very first word about giving [you]0-i a start [she]126-judy flamed out about some money [you]0-i ’d got from [Gus]161-gus trenor ; [I]0-i never knew [her]126-judy so hot before . [You]0-i know [she]126-judy ’ll let [him]161-gus trenor do anything but spend money on [[his]161-gus trenor friends]889-his friends : the only reason [she]126-judy ’s decent to [me]0-i now is that [she]126-judy knows [I]0-i ’m not hard up.—He speculated for [you]0-i , [you]0-i say ? Well , what ’s the harm ? [He]161-gus trenor had no business to lose . [He]161-gus trenor DIDN’T lose ? Then what on earth — but [I]0-i never COULD understand [you]0-i , [Lily]109-lily ! ” The end of it was that , after anxious enquiry and much deliberation , [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher and [Gerty]112-gerty , for once oddly united in [their]4406-their effort to help [[their]4406-their friend]4407-their friend , decided on placing [her]109-lily in [the work - room of [Mme]242-regina . [[Regina]242-regina ’s renowned millinery establishment]242-regina]4408-the work - room of mme . regina ’s renowned millinery establishment . Even this arrangement was not effected without considerable negotiation , for [Mme]242-regina . [Regina]242-regina had a strong prejudice against untrained assistance , and was induced to yield only by the fact that [she]242-regina owed the patronage of [Mrs. Bry]198-mrs. bry and [Mrs. Gormer]275-mrs. gormer to [Carry Fisher]135-mrs. fisher ’s influence . [She]242-regina had been willing from the first to employ [Lily]109-lily in [the show - room]4409-the show - room : as a displayer of hats , [a fashionable beauty]4410-a fashionable beauty might be a valuable asset . But to this suggestion [Miss Bart]109-lily opposed a negative which [Gerty]112-gerty emphatically supported , while [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , inwardly unconvinced , but resigned to this latest proof of [Lily]109-lily ’s unreason , agreed that perhaps in the end it would be more useful that [she]109-lily should learn the trade . To [[Regina]242-regina ’s work - room]4411-regina ’s work - room [Lily]109-lily was therefore committed by [[her]109-lily friends]406-her friends , and there [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher left [her]109-lily with a sigh of relief , while [Gerty]112-gerty ’s watchfulness continued to hover over [her]109-lily at a distance . [Lily]109-lily had taken up [her]109-lily work early in January : it was now two months later , and [she]109-lily was still being rebuked for [her]109-lily inability to sew spangles on a hat - frame . As [she]109-lily returned to [her]109-lily work [she]109-lily heard a titter pass down the tables . [She]109-lily knew [she]109-lily was an object of criticism and amusement to [the other work - women]4413-the other work - women . [They]406-her friends were , of course , aware of [her]109-lily history — the exact situation of [every girl in [the room]351-the room]4414-every girl in the room was known and freely discussed by [all the others]4416-all the others — but the knowledge did not produce in [them]406-her friends any awkward sense of class distinction : it merely explained why [her]109-lily untutored fingers were still blundering over the rudiments of the trade . [Lily]109-lily had no desire that [they]406-her friends should recognize any social difference in [her]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily had hoped to be received as [their]406-her friends equal , and perhaps before long to show [herself]109-lily [[their]406-her friends superior]4417-their superior by a special deftness of touch , and it was humiliating to find that , after two months of drudgery , [she]109-lily still betrayed [her]109-lily lack of early training . Remote was the day when [she]109-lily might aspire to exercise the talents [she]109-lily felt confident of possessing ; only [experienced workers]4418-experienced workers were entrusted with the delicate art of shaping and trimming the hat , and [the forewoman]4393-the forewoman still held [her]109-lily inexorably to the routine of preparatory work . [She]109-lily began to rip the spangles from the frame , listening absently to the buzz of talk which rose and fell with the coming and going of [[Miss Haines]291-miss haines ’s active figure]4420-miss haines ’s active figure . The air was closer than usual , because [Miss Haines]291-miss haines , who had a cold , had not allowed a window to be opened even during the noon recess ; and [Lily]109-lily ’s head was so heavy with the weight of a sleepless night that the chatter of [[her]109-lily companions]667-her companions had the incoherence of a dream . “[0-i] [I]0-i TOLD [her]2520-her [he]2521-he ’d never look at [her]2520-her again ; and [he]2521-he did n’t . [I]0-i would n’t have , either — [I]0-i think [she]2520-her acted real mean to [him]2521-he . [He]2521-he took [her]2520-her to [the Arion Ball]96-the arion ball , and had a hack for [her]2520-her both ways .... [She]2520-her ’s taken ten bottles , and [her]2520-her headaches do n’t seem no better — but [she]2520-her ’s written a testimonial to say the first bottle cured [her]2520-her , and [she]2520-her got five dollars and [her]2520-her picture in the paper .... [Mrs. Trenor]123-mrs. trenor ’s hat ? The one with the green Paradise ? Here , [Miss Haines]291-miss haines — it’ll be ready right off .... That was one of [the Trenor girls]929-the trenor girls [here]2763-here yesterday with [Mrs. George Dorset]131-mrs. dorset . How ’d [I]0-i know ? Why , [Madam]292-madam sent for [me]0-i to alter the flower in that Virot hat — the blue tulle : [she]2520-her ’s tall and slight , with [her]2520-her hair fuzzed out — a good deal like [Mamie Leach]293-mamie leach , on’y thinner .... ” On and on it flowed , a current of meaningless sound , on which , startlingly enough , a familiar name now and then floated to the surface . It was the strangest part of [Lily]109-lily ’s strange experience , the hearing of these names , the seeing the fragmentary and distorted image of [the world]354-the world [she]109-lily had lived in reflected in the mirror of [the working - girls]4423-the working - girls ’ minds . [She]109-lily had never before suspected the mixture of insatiable curiosity and contemptuous freedom with which [she]109-lily and [[her]109-lily kind]4424-her kind were discussed in this underworld of [toilers who lived on [their]4425-toilers who lived on their vanity and self - indulgence vanity and self - indulgence]4425-toilers who lived on their vanity and self - indulgence . [Every girl in Mme . [[Regina]242-regina ’s work - room]4411-regina ’s work - room]4426-every girl in mme . regina ’s work - room knew to whom the headgear in [her]109-lily hands was destined , and had [her]109-lily opinion of [its future wearer]4428-its future wearer , and a definite knowledge of [the latter]566-the latter ’s place in the social system . That [Lily]109-lily was a star fallen from that sky did not , after the first stir of curiosity had subsided , materially add to [their]4423-the working - girls interest in [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily had fallen , [she]109-lily had “[2520-her] gone under , ” and true to the ideal of [their]4423-the working - girls race , [they]4423-the working - girls were awed only by success — by the gross tangible image of material achievement . The consciousness of [her]109-lily different point of view merely kept [them]4423-the working - girls at a little distance from [her]109-lily , as though [she]109-lily were [a foreigner with whom it was an effort to talk]4430-a foreigner with whom it was an effort to talk . “[2520-her] [Miss Bart]109-lily , if [you]109-lily ca n’t sew those spangles on more regular [I]0-i guess [you]109-lily ’d better give the hat to [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy . ” [Lily]109-lily looked down ruefully at [her]109-lily handiwork . [The forewoman]4393-the forewoman was right : the sewing on of the spangles was inexcusably bad . What made [her]109-lily so much more clumsy than usual ? Was it a growing distaste for [her]109-lily task , or actual physical disability ? [She]109-lily felt tired and confused : it was an effort to put [her]109-lily thoughts together . [She]109-lily rose and handed the hat to [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy , who took it with a suppressed smile . “[294-miss kilroy] [I]0-i ’m sorry ; [I]0-i ’m afraid [I]0-i am not well , ” [she]0-i said to [the forewoman]4393-the forewoman . [Miss Haines]291-miss haines offered no comment . From the first [she]291-miss haines had augured ill of Mme . [Regina]242-regina ’s consenting to include [a fashionable apprentice]4433-a fashionable apprentice among [[her]291-miss haines workers]4434-her workers . In [that temple of art]4435-that temple of art [no raw beginners]4436-no raw beginners were wanted , and [Miss Haines]291-miss haines would have been more than human had [she]291-miss haines not taken a certain pleasure in seeing [her]291-miss haines forebodings confirmed . “[2524-you] [You]2524-you ’d better go back to binding edges , ” [she]291-miss haines said drily . [Lily]109-lily slipped out last among [the band of [liberated work - women]4438-liberated work - women]4437-the band of liberated work - women . [She]109-lily did not care to be mingled in [their]4437-the band of liberated work - women noisy dispersal : once in [the street]310-the street , [she]109-lily always felt an irresistible return to [her]109-lily old standpoint , an instinctive shrinking from all that was unpolished and promiscuous . In the days — how distant they now seemed!—when [she]109-lily had visited [the Girls ’ Club with [Gerty Farish]112-gerty]4440-the girls ’ club with gerty farish , [she]109-lily had felt an enlightened interest in [the working - classes]4441-the working - classes ; but that was because [she]109-lily looked down on [them]4441-the working - classes from above , from the happy altitude of [her]109-lily grace and [her]109-lily beneficence . Now that [she]109-lily was on a level with [them]4441-the working - classes , the point of view was less interesting . [She]109-lily felt a touch on [her]109-lily arm , and met the penitent eye of [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy . “[109-lily] [Miss Bart]109-lily , [I]0-i guess [you]109-lily can sew those spangles on as well as [I]0-i can when [you]109-lily ’re feeling right . [Miss Haines]291-miss haines did n’t act fair to [you]109-lily . ” [Lily]109-lily ’s colour rose at the unexpected advance : it was a long time since real kindness had looked at [her]109-lily from any eyes but [Gerty]112-gerty ’s . “[291-miss haines] Oh , thank [you]109-lily : [I]0-i ’m not particularly well , but [Miss Haines]291-miss haines was right . [I]0-i AM clumsy . ” “[0-i] Well , it ’s mean work for [anybody with a headache]2525-anybody with a headache . ” [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy paused irresolutely . “[109-lily] [You]109-lily ought to go right [home]400-home and lay down . Ever try orangeine ? ” “[109-lily] Thank [you]109-lily . ” [Lily]109-lily held out [her]109-lily hand . “[109-lily] It ’s very kind of [you]109-lily — [I]0-i mean to go [home]400-home . ” [She]109-lily looked gratefully at [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy , but [neither]1056-neither knew what more to say . [Lily]109-lily was aware that [the other]367-the other was on the point of offering to go [home]400-home with [her]109-lily , but [she]109-lily wanted to be alone and silent — even kindness , the sort of kindness that [Miss Kilroy]294-miss kilroy could give , would have jarred on [her]109-lily just then . “[0-i] Thank [you]109-lily , ” [she]109-lily repeated as [she]109-lily turned away . [She]109-lily struck westward through [the dreary March twilight]4445-the dreary march twilight , toward [the street where [[her]109-lily boarding - house stood]4447-her boarding - house stood]4446-the street where her boarding - house stood . [She]109-lily had resolutely refused [Gerty]112-gerty ’s offer of hospitality . Something of [[her]109-lily mother]569-her mother ’s fierce shrinking from observation and sympathy was beginning to develop in [her]109-lily , and the promiscuity of small quarters and close intimacy seemed , on the whole , less endurable than the solitude of [a hall bedroom in [a house where [she]109-lily could come and go unremarked among [other workers]4451-other workers]4450-a house where she could come and go unremarked among other workers]4449-a hall bedroom in a house where she could come and go unremarked among other workers . For a while [she]109-lily had been sustained by this desire for privacy and independence ; but now , perhaps from increasing physical weariness , the lassitude brought about by hours of unwonted confinement , [she]109-lily was beginning to feel acutely the ugliness and discomfort of [her]109-lily surroundings . The day ’s task done , [she]109-lily dreaded to return to [[her]109-lily narrow room]4452-her narrow room , with [its]4452-her narrow room blotched wall - paper and shabby paint ; and [she]109-lily hated every step of the walk thither , through the degradation of [[a New York]4453-a new york street in the last stages of decline from fashion to commerce]4454-a new york street in the last stages of decline from fashion to commerce . But what [she]109-lily dreaded most of all was having to pass [the chemist ’s]4455-the chemist ’s at [the corner of [Sixth Avenue]97-sixth avenue]4456-the corner of sixth avenue . [She]109-lily had meant to take [another street]4457-another street : [she]109-lily had usually done so of late . But today [her]109-lily steps were irresistibly drawn toward the flaring plate - glass corner ; [she]109-lily tried to take the lower crossing , but a laden dray crowded [her]109-lily back , and [she]109-lily struck across [the street]310-the street obliquely , reaching [the sidewalk]382-the sidewalk just opposite [the chemist]4460-the chemist ’s door . Over the counter [she]109-lily caught the eye of [the clerk who had waited on [her]109-lily before]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before , and slipped the prescription into [his]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before hand . There could be no question about the prescription : it was a copy of one of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s , obligingly furnished by [[that lady]486-that lady ’s chemist]4463-that lady ’s chemist . [Lily]109-lily was confident that [the clerk]4301-the clerk would fill it without hesitation ; yet the nervous dread of a refusal , or even of an expression of doubt , communicated itself to [her]109-lily restless hands as [she]109-lily affected to examine the bottles of perfume stacked on the glass case before [her]109-lily . [The clerk]4301-the clerk had read the prescription without comment ; but in the act of handing out the bottle [he]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before paused . “[109-lily] [You]2528-you do n’t want to increase the dose , [you]2528-you know , ” [he]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before remarked . [Lily]109-lily ’s heart contracted . What did [he]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before mean by looking at [her]109-lily in that way ? “[2528-you] Of course not , ” [she]109-lily murmured , holding out [her]109-lily hand . “[2528-you] That ’s all right : it ’s a queer - acting drug . A drop or two more , and off [you]2528-you go — [the doctors]2962-the doctors do n’t know why . ” The dread lest [he]4461-the clerk who had waited on her before should question [her]109-lily , or keep the bottle back , choked the murmur of acquiescence in [her]109-lily throat ; and when at length [she]109-lily emerged safely from [the shop]1410-the shop [she]109-lily was almost dizzy with the intensity of [her]109-lily relief . The mere touch of the packet thrilled [her]109-lily tired nerves with the delicious promise of a night of sleep , and in the reaction from [her]109-lily momentary fear [she]109-lily felt as if the first fumes of drowsiness were already stealing over [her]109-lily . In [her]109-lily confusion [she]109-lily stumbled against [a man who was hurrying down the last steps of [the elevated station]4468-the elevated station]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station . [He]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station drew back , and [she]109-lily heard [her]109-lily name uttered with surprise . It was [Rosedale]124-rosedale , fur - coated , glossy and prosperous — but why did [she]109-lily seem to see [him]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station so far off , and as if through a mist of splintered crystals ? Before [she]109-lily could account for the phenomenon [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily shaking hands with [him]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station . [They]4469-they had parted with scorn on [her]109-lily side and anger upon [his]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station ; but all trace of these emotions seemed to vanish as [their]4469-they hands met , and [she]109-lily was only aware of a confused wish that [she]109-lily might continue to hold fast to [him]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station . “[2962-the doctors] Why , what ’s the matter , [Miss Lily]109-lily ? Well , take [your]109-lily tea strong , then ; and , [waiter]2533-waiter , get a cushion for [the lady]602-the lady ’s back . ” [Lily]109-lily smiled faintly at the injunction to take [her]109-lily tea strong . It was the temptation [she]109-lily was always struggling to resist . [Her]109-lily craving for the keen stimulant was forever conflicting with that other craving for sleep — the midnight craving which only the little phial in [her]109-lily hand could still . But today , at any rate , the tea could hardly be too strong : [she]109-lily counted on it to pour warmth and resolution into [her]109-lily empty veins . As [she]109-lily leaned back before [him]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station , [her]109-lily lids drooping in utter lassitude , though the first warm draught already tinged [her]109-lily face with returning life , [Rosedale]124-rosedale was seized afresh by the poignant surprise of [her]109-lily beauty . The dark pencilling of fatigue under [her]109-lily eyes , the morbid blue - veined pallor of the temples , brought out the brightness of [her]109-lily hair and lips , as though all [her]109-lily ebbing vitality were centred there . Against the dull chocolate - coloured background of [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant , the purity of [her]109-lily head stood out as it had never done in the most brightly lit [ball - room]4475-ball - room . [He]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station looked at [her]109-lily with a startled uncomfortable feeling , as though [her]109-lily beauty were a forgotten enemy that had lain in ambush and now sprang out on [him]4467-a man who was hurrying down the last steps of the elevated station unawares . Beneath it [she]0-i discovered an increasing sense of loneliness — a dread of returning to the solitude of [[her]0-i room]529-her room , while [she]0-i could be anywhere else , or in any company but [her]0-i own . [Circumstances]296-circumstances , of late , had combined to cut [her]0-i off more and more from [[her]0-i few remaining friends]4493-her few remaining friends . On [Carry Fisher]146-carry fisher ’s part the withdrawal was perhaps not quite involuntary . Having made [her]146-carry fisher final effort on [Lily]109-lily ’s behalf , and landed [her]109-lily safely in [[Mme . Regina]242-regina ’s work - room]4494-mme . regina ’s work - room , [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher seemed disposed to rest from [her]135-mrs. fisher labours ; and [Lily]109-lily , understanding the reason , could not condemn [her]135-mrs. fisher . [Carry]146-carry fisher had in fact come dangerously near to being involved in the episode of [Mrs. Norma Hatch]285-mrs. hatch , and it had taken some verbal ingenuity to extricate [herself]146-carry fisher . [She]146-carry fisher frankly owned to having brought [Lily]109-lily and [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch together , but then [she]146-carry fisher did not know [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch — [she]146-carry fisher had expressly warned [Lily]109-lily that [she]146-carry fisher did not know [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch — and besides , [she]146-carry fisher was not [[Lily]109-lily ’s keeper]4495-lily ’s keeper , and really [the girl]665-the girl was old enough to take care of [herself]665-the girl . [Carry]146-carry fisher did not put [her]146-carry fisher own case so brutally , but [she]146-carry fisher allowed it to be thus put for [her]146-carry fisher by [[her]146-carry fisher latest bosom friend]4497-her latest bosom friend , [Mrs. Jack Stepney]125-jack stepney : [Mrs. Stepney]125-jack stepney , trembling over the narrowness of [[her]146-carry fisher only brother]4498-her only brother ’s escape , but eager to vindicate [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher , at whose house [she]146-carry fisher could count on the “[0-i] jolly parties ” which had become a necessity to [her]146-carry fisher since marriage had emancipated [her]146-carry fisher from the [Van Osburgh]119-gwen point of view . [Lily]109-lily understood the situation and could make allowances for it . [Carry]146-carry fisher had been [a good friend to [her]146-carry fisher]4499-a good friend to her in difficult days , and perhaps only a friendship like [Gerty]112-gerty ’s could be proof against such an increasing strain . [Gerty]112-gerty ’s friendship did indeed hold fast ; yet [Lily]109-lily was beginning to avoid [her]146-carry fisher also . For [she]146-carry fisher could not go to [[Gerty]112-gerty ’s]4500-gerty ’s without risk of meeting [Selden]108-selden ; and to meet [him]108-selden now would be pure pain . It was pain enough even to think of [him]108-selden , whether [she]146-carry fisher considered [him]108-selden in the distinctness of [her]146-carry fisher waking thoughts , or felt the obsession of [his]108-selden presence through the blur of [her]146-carry fisher tormented nights . That was one of the reasons why [she]146-carry fisher had turned again to [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s prescription . In the uneasy snatches of [her]146-carry fisher natural dreams [he]108-selden came to [her]146-carry fisher sometimes in the old guise of fellowship and tenderness ; and [she]146-carry fisher would rise from the sweet delusion mocked and emptied of [her]146-carry fisher courage . But in the sleep which the phial procured [she]146-carry fisher sank far below such half - waking visitations , sank into depths of dreamless annihilation from which [she]146-carry fisher woke each morning with an obliterated past . Gradually , to be sure , the stress of the old thoughts would return ; but at least they did not importune [her]146-carry fisher waking hour . The drug gave [her]146-carry fisher a momentary illusion of complete renewal , from which [she]146-carry fisher drew strength to take up [her]146-carry fisher daily work . The strength was more and more needed as the perplexities of [her]146-carry fisher future increased . [She]146-carry fisher knew that to [Gerty]112-gerty and [Mrs. Fisher]135-mrs. fisher [she]146-carry fisher was only passing through a temporary period of probation , since [they]4501-they believed that the apprenticeship [she]146-carry fisher was serving at [Mme .]242-regina [Regina]242-regina ’s would enable [her]146-carry fisher , when [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s legacy was paid , to realize the vision of the green - and - white shop with the fuller competence acquired by [her]146-carry fisher preliminary training . But to [Lily]109-lily [herself]109-lily , aware that the legacy could not be put to such a use , the preliminary training seemed a wasted effort . [She]146-carry fisher understood clearly enough that , even if [she]146-carry fisher could ever learn to compete with hands formed from childhood for [their]4501-they special work , the small pay [she]146-carry fisher received would not be a sufficient addition to [her]146-carry fisher income to compensate [her]146-carry fisher for such drudgery . And the realization of this fact brought [her]146-carry fisher recurringly face to face with the temptation to use the legacy in establishing [[her]146-carry fisher business]4502-her business . Once installed , and in command of [her]146-carry fisher own work - women , [she]146-carry fisher believed [she]146-carry fisher had sufficient tact and ability to attract [a fashionable CLIENTELE]4503-a fashionable clientele ; and if the business succeeded [she]146-carry fisher could gradually lay aside money enough to discharge [her]146-carry fisher debt to [Trenor]126-judy . But the task might take years to accomplish , even if [she]146-carry fisher continued to stint [herself]146-carry fisher to the utmost ; and meanwhile [her]146-carry fisher pride would be crushed under the weight of an intolerable obligation . These were [her]146-carry fisher superficial considerations ; but under them lurked the secret dread that the obligation might not always remain intolerable . [She]146-carry fisher knew [she]146-carry fisher could not count on [her]146-carry fisher continuity of purpose , and what really frightened [her]146-carry fisher was the thought that [she]146-carry fisher might gradually accommodate [herself]146-carry fisher to remaining indefinitely in [Trenor]126-judy ’s debt , as [she]146-carry fisher had accommodated [herself]146-carry fisher to the part allotted [her]146-carry fisher on [the Sabrina]70-the sabrina , and as [she]146-carry fisher had so nearly drifted into acquiescing with [Stancy]286-mr. stancy ’s scheme for the advancement of [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch . [Her]146-carry fisher danger lay , as [she]146-carry fisher knew , in [her]146-carry fisher old incurable dread of discomfort and poverty ; in the fear of that mounting tide of dinginess against which [[her]146-carry fisher mother]569-her mother had so passionately warned [her]146-carry fisher . And now a new vista of peril opened before [her]146-carry fisher . [She]146-carry fisher understood that [Rosedale]124-rosedale was ready to lend [her]146-carry fisher money ; and the longing to take advantage of [his]124-rosedale offer began to haunt [her]146-carry fisher insidiously . It was of course impossible to accept a loan from [Rosedale]124-rosedale ; but proximate possibilities hovered temptingly before [her]146-carry fisher . [She]146-carry fisher was quite sure that [he]124-rosedale would come and see [her]146-carry fisher again , and almost sure that , if [he]124-rosedale did , [she]146-carry fisher could bring [him]124-rosedale to the point of offering to marry [her]146-carry fisher on the terms [she]146-carry fisher had previously rejected . Would [she]146-carry fisher still reject [them]4505-them if [they]4505-them were offered ? More and more , with every fresh mischance befalling [her]146-carry fisher , did the pursuing furies seem to take the shape of [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha ; and close at hand , safely locked among [her]146-carry fisher papers , lay the means of ending [their]4505-them pursuit . The temptation , which [her]146-carry fisher scorn of [Rosedale]124-rosedale had once enabled [her]146-carry fisher to reject , now insistently returned upon [her]146-carry fisher ; and how much strength was left [her]146-carry fisher to oppose it ? What little there was must at any rate be husbanded to the utmost ; [she]146-carry fisher could not trust [herself]146-carry fisher again to the perils of a sleepless night . Through the long hours of silence the dark spirit of fatigue and loneliness crouched upon [her]146-carry fisher breast , leaving [her]146-carry fisher so drained of bodily strength that [her]146-carry fisher morning thoughts swam in a haze of weakness . The only hope of renewal lay in the little bottle at [her]146-carry fisher bed - side ; and how much longer that hope would last [she]146-carry fisher dared not conjecture . Chapter 11 [Lily]109-lily , lingering for a moment on the corner , looked out on the afternoon spectacle of [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue . It was a day in late April , and the sweetness of spring was in the air . It mitigated the ugliness of [the long crowded thoroughfare]4506-the long crowded thoroughfare , blurred the gaunt roof - lines , threw a mauve veil over the discouraging perspective of [the side streets]332-the side streets , and gave a touch of poetry to the delicate haze of green that marked the entrance to [the Park]747-the park . As [Lily]109-lily stood [there]2755-there , [she]109-lily recognized several familiar faces in [the passing carriages]4510-the passing carriages . The season was over , and its ruling forces had disbanded ; but [a few]4511-a few still lingered , delaying [their]4511-a few departure for [Europe]21-europe , or passing through [town]305-town on [their]4511-a few return from [the South]100-the south . Among [them]4511-a few was [Mrs. Van Osburgh]110-mrs. van osburgh , swaying majestically in [her]110-mrs. van osburgh C - spring barouche , with [Mrs. Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce at [her]110-mrs. van osburgh side , and [the new heir to [the Gryce]129-mrs. gryce millions enthroned before [them]4511-a few on [[his]4513-the new heir to the gryce millions enthroned before them on his nurse ’s knees nurse]4514-his nurse ’s knees]4513-the new heir to the gryce millions enthroned before them on his nurse ’s knees . [They]4511-a few were succeeded by [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s electric victoria , in which [that lady]486-that lady reclined in the lonely splendour of a spring toilet obviously designed for [company]4516-company ; and a moment or two later came [Judy Trenor]126-judy , accompanied by [Lady Skiddaw]149-lady skiddaw , who had come over for [her]110-mrs. van osburgh annual tarpon fishing and a dip into “[0-i] [the street . ”]4517-the street . ” This fleeting glimpse of [her]110-mrs. van osburgh past served to emphasize the sense of aimlessness with which [Lily]109-lily at length turned toward [home]400-home . [She]109-lily had nothing to do for the rest of the day , nor for the days to come ; for the season was over in [millinery]4519-millinery as well as in society , and a week earlier [Mme]242-regina . [Regina]242-regina had notified [her]109-lily that [her]109-lily services were no longer required . [Mme]242-regina . [Regina]242-regina always reduced [her]242-regina staff on the first of May , and [Miss Bart]109-lily ’s attendance had of late been so irregular — [she]109-lily had so often been unwell , and had done so little work when [she]109-lily came — that it was only as a favour that [her]109-lily dismissal had hitherto been deferred . [Lily]109-lily did not question the justice of the decision . [She]109-lily was conscious of having been forgetful , awkward and slow to learn . It was bitter to acknowledge [her]109-lily inferiority even to [herself]109-lily , but the fact had been brought [home]400-home to [her]109-lily that as a bread - winner [she]109-lily could never compete with professional ability . Since [she]109-lily had been brought up to be ornamental , [she]109-lily could hardly blame [herself]109-lily for failing to serve any practical purpose ; but the discovery put an end to [her]109-lily consoling sense of universal efficiency . As [she]109-lily turned [homeward]4521-homeward [her]109-lily thoughts shrank in anticipation from the fact that there would be nothing to get up for the next morning . The luxury of lying late in bed was a pleasure belonging to the life of ease ; it had no part in the utilitarian existence of [the boarding - house]4522-the boarding - house . [She]109-lily liked to leave [[her]109-lily room]529-her room early , and to return to [it]529-her room as late as possible ; and [she]109-lily was walking slowly now in order to postpone the detested approach to [her]109-lily doorstep . But [the doorstep]1699-the doorstep , as [she]109-lily drew near [it]1699-the doorstep , acquired a sudden interest from the fact that [it]1699-the doorstep was occupied — and indeed filled — by the conspicuous figure of [Mr. Rosedale]124-rosedale , whose presence seemed to take on an added amplitude from the meanness of [his]124-rosedale surroundings . The sight stirred [Lily]109-lily with an irresistible sense of triumph . [Rosedale]124-rosedale , a day or two after [their]4525-their chance meeting , had called to enquire if [she]109-lily had recovered from [her]109-lily indisposition ; but since then [she]109-lily had not seen or heard from [him]124-rosedale , and [his]124-rosedale absence seemed to betoken a struggle to keep away , to let [her]109-lily pass once more out of [his]124-rosedale life . If this were the case , [his]124-rosedale return showed that the struggle had been unsuccessful , for [Lily]109-lily knew [he]124-rosedale was not the man to waste [his]124-rosedale time in an ineffectual sentimental dalliance . [He]124-rosedale was too busy , too practical , and above all too much preoccupied with [his]124-rosedale own advancement , to indulge in such unprofitable asides . In the peacock - blue parlour , with its bunches of dried pampas grass , and discoloured steel engravings of sentimental episodes , [he]124-rosedale looked about [him]124-rosedale with unconcealed disgust , laying [his]124-rosedale hat distrustfully on the dusty console adorned with a Rogers statuette . [Lily]109-lily sat down on one of the plush and rosewood sofas , and [he]124-rosedale deposited [himself]124-rosedale in a rocking - chair draped with a starched antimacassar which scraped unpleasantly against the pink fold of skin above [his]124-rosedale collar . “[0-i] [My]0-i goodness — [you]0-i ca n’t go on living [here]2763-here ! ” [he]124-rosedale exclaimed . [Lily]109-lily smiled at [his]124-rosedale tone . “[0-i] [I]0-i am not sure that [I]0-i can ; but [I]0-i have gone over [my]0-i expenses very carefully , and [I]0-i rather think [I]0-i shall be able to manage it . ” “[0-i] Be able to manage it ? That ’s not what [I]0-i mean — it ’s no place for [you]0-i ! ” “[0-i] It ’s what [I]0-i mean ; for [I]0-i have been out of work for the last week . ” “[0-i] Out of work — out of work ! What a way for [you]0-i to talk ! The idea of [your]0-i having to work — it ’s preposterous . ” [He]124-rosedale brought out [his]124-rosedale sentences in short violent jerks , as though they were forced up from a deep inner crater of indignation . “[0-i] It ’s a farce — a crazy farce , ” [he]124-rosedale repeated , [his]124-rosedale eyes fixed on the long vista of [the room]351-the room reflected in the blotched glass between the windows . [Lily]109-lily continued to meet [his]124-rosedale expostulations with a smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t know why [I]0-i should regard [myself]0-i as an exception — — ” [she]0-i began . “[0-i] Because [you]0-i ARE ; that ’s why ; and [your]0-i being in [a place like this]2552-a place like this is a damnable outrage . [I]0-i ca n’t talk of it calmly . ” [She]0-i had in truth never seen [him]124-rosedale so shaken out of [his]124-rosedale usual glibness ; and there was something almost moving to [her]0-i in [his]124-rosedale inarticulate struggle with [his]124-rosedale emotions . [He]124-rosedale rose with a start which left the rocking - chair quivering on its beam ends , and placed [himself]124-rosedale squarely before [her]0-i . “[0-i] Look here , [Miss Lily]109-lily , [I]0-i ’m going to [Europe]21-europe next week : going over to [Paris]24-paris and [London]13-london for a couple of months — and [I]0-i ca n’t leave [you]0-i like this . [I]0-i ca n’t do it . [I]0-i know it ’s none of [my]0-i business — [you’ve]0-i let [me]0-i understand that often enough ; but things are worse with [you]0-i now than they have been before , and [you]0-i must see that [you]0-i ’ve got to accept help from [somebody]2553-somebody . [You]0-i spoke to [me]0-i the other day about some debt to [Trenor]126-judy . [I]0-i know what [you]0-i mean — and [I]0-i respect [you]0-i for feeling as [you]0-i do about it . ” A blush of surprise rose to [Lily]109-lily ’s pale face , but before [she]109-lily could interrupt [him]2554-one man [he]2554-one man had continued eagerly : “[0-i] Well , [I]0-i ’ll lend [you]0-i the money to pay [Trenor]126-judy ; and [I]0-i won’t — [I]0-i — see here , do n’t take [me]0-i up till [I]0-i ’ve finished . What [I]0-i mean is , it ’ll be a plain business arrangement , such as [one man]2554-one man would make with [another]2555-another . Now , what have [you]0-i got to say against that ? ” [Lily]109-lily ’s blush deepened to a glow in which humiliation and gratitude were mingled ; and both sentiments revealed themselves in the unexpected gentleness of [her]109-lily reply . “[0-i] Only this : that it is exactly what [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor proposed ; and that [I]0-i can never again be sure of understanding the plainest business arrangement . ” Then , realizing that this answer contained a germ of injustice , [she]0-i added , even more kindly : “[0-i] Not that [I]0-i do n’t appreciate [your]0-i kindness — that [I]0-i ’m not grateful for it . But a business arrangement between [us]2556-us would in any case be impossible , because [I]0-i shall have no security to give when [my]0-i debt to [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor has been paid . ” [Rosedale]124-rosedale received this statement in silence : [he]124-rosedale seemed to feel the note of finality in [her]109-lily voice , yet to be unable to accept it as closing the question between [them]2556-us . In the silence [Lily]109-lily had a clear perception of what was passing through [his]124-rosedale mind . Whatever perplexity [he]124-rosedale felt as to the inexorableness of [her]109-lily course — however little [he]124-rosedale penetrated its motive — [she]109-lily saw that it unmistakably tended to strengthen [her]109-lily hold over [him]124-rosedale . It was as though the sense in [her]109-lily of unexplained scruples and resistances had the same attraction as the delicacy of feature , the fastidiousness of manner , which gave [her]109-lily an external rarity , an air of being impossible to match . As [he]124-rosedale advanced in social experience this uniqueness had acquired a greater value for [him]124-rosedale , as though [he]124-rosedale were [a collector who had learned to distinguish minor differences of design and quality in some long - coveted object]4527-a collector who had learned to distinguish minor differences of design and quality in some long - coveted object . [Lily]109-lily , perceiving all this , understood that [he]124-rosedale would marry [her]109-lily at once , on the sole condition of a reconciliation with [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ; and the temptation was the less easy to put aside because , little by little , circumstances were breaking down [her]109-lily dislike for [Rosedale]124-rosedale . The dislike , indeed , still subsisted ; but it was penetrated here and there by the perception of mitigating qualities in [him]124-rosedale : of a certain gross kindliness , a rather helpless fidelity of sentiment , which seemed to be struggling through the hard surface of [his]124-rosedale material ambitions . Reading [his]124-rosedale dismissal in [her]109-lily eyes , [he]124-rosedale held out [his]124-rosedale hand with a gesture which conveyed something of this inarticulate conflict . “[2557-you] If [you]2557-you ’d only let [me]0-i , [I]0-i ’d set [you]2557-you up over [them]2558-them all — [I’d]0-i put [you]2557-you where [you]2557-you could wipe [your]2557-you feet on ’em ! ” [he]124-rosedale declared ; and it touched [her]109-lily oddly to see that [his]124-rosedale new passion had not altered [his]124-rosedale old standard of values . * * * * * [Lily]109-lily took no sleeping - drops that night . [She]109-lily lay awake viewing [her]109-lily situation in the crude light which [Rosedale]124-rosedale ’s visit had shed on it . In fending off the offer [he]124-rosedale was so plainly ready to renew , had [she]109-lily not sacrificed to one of those abstract notions of honour that might be called the conventionalities of the moral life ? What debt did [she]109-lily owe to [a social order which had condemned and banished [her]109-lily without trial]4528-a social order which had condemned and banished her without trial ? [She]109-lily had never been heard in [her]109-lily own defence ; [she]109-lily was innocent of the charge on which [she]109-lily had been found guilty ; and the irregularity of [her]109-lily conviction might seem to justify the use of methods as irregular in recovering [her]109-lily lost rights . [Bertha Dorset]133-bertha , to save [herself]133-bertha , had not scrupled to ruin [her]133-bertha by an open falsehood ; why should [she]133-bertha hesitate to make private use of the facts that chance had put in [her]133-bertha way ? After all , half the opprobrium of such an act lies in the name attached to it . Call it blackmail and it becomes unthinkable ; but explain that it injures [no one]2766-no one , and that the rights regained by it were unjustly forfeited , and [he]124-rosedale must be [a formalist indeed who can find no plea in its defence]4530-a formalist indeed who can find no plea in its defence . The arguments pleading for it with [Lily]109-lily were the old unanswerable ones of the personal situation : the sense of injury , the sense of failure , the passionate craving for a fair chance against the selfish despotism of society . [She]109-lily had learned by experience that [she]109-lily had neither the aptitude nor the moral constancy to remake [her]109-lily life on new lines ; to become [a worker]4531-a worker among [workers]4532-workers , and let the world of luxury and pleasure sweep by [her]109-lily unregarded . [She]109-lily could not hold [herself]109-lily much to blame for this ineffectiveness , and [she]109-lily was perhaps less to blame than [she]109-lily believed . Inherited tendencies had combined with early training to make [her]109-lily the highly specialized product [she]109-lily was : an organism as helpless out of its narrow range as the sea - anemone torn from the rock . [She]109-lily had been fashioned to adorn and delight ; to what other end does nature round the rose - leaf and paint the humming - bird ’s breast ? And was it [her]109-lily fault that the purely decorative mission is less easily and harmoniously fulfilled among [social beings]4533-social beings than in [the world of nature]4534-the world of nature ? That it is apt to be hampered by material necessities or complicated by moral scruples ? These last were the two antagonistic forces which fought out [their]4535-their battle in [her]109-lily breast during the long watches of the night ; and when [she]109-lily rose the next morning [she]109-lily hardly knew where the victory lay . [She]109-lily was exhausted by the reaction of a night without sleep , coming after many nights of rest artificially obtained ; and in the distorting light of fatigue the future stretched out before [her]109-lily grey , interminable and desolate . [She]109-lily lay late in bed , refusing the coffee and fried eggs which [the friendly Irish servant]4536-the friendly irish servant thrust through [her]109-lily door , and hating the intimate domestic noises of [the house]488-the house and the cries and rumblings of [the street]310-the street . [Her]109-lily week of idleness had brought [home]400-home to [her]109-lily with exaggerated force these small aggravations of [the boarding - house world]4540-the boarding - house world , and [she]109-lily yearned for [that other luxurious world , whose machinery is so carefully concealed that one scene flows into another without perceptible agency]4541-that other luxurious world , whose machinery is so carefully concealed that one scene flows into another without perceptible agency . At length [she]109-lily rose and dressed . Since [she]109-lily had left [Mme . Regina]242-regina ’s [she]109-lily had spent [her]109-lily days in [the streets]1755-the streets , partly to escape from the uncongenial promiscuities of [the boarding - house]4522-the boarding - house , and partly in the hope that physical fatigue would help [her]109-lily to sleep . But once out of [the house]488-the house , [she]109-lily could not decide where to go ; for [she]109-lily had avoided [Gerty]112-gerty since [her]109-lily dismissal from [the milliner ’s]4545-the milliner ’s , and [she]109-lily was not sure of a welcome anywhere else . The morning was in harsh contrast to the previous day . A cold grey sky threatened rain , and a high wind drove the dust in wild spirals up and down [the streets]1755-the streets . [Lily]109-lily walked up [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue toward [the Park]747-the park , hoping to find [a sheltered nook where [she]109-lily might sit]4548-a sheltered nook where she might sit ; but the wind chilled [her]109-lily , and after an hour ’s wandering under the tossing boughs [she]109-lily yielded to [her]109-lily increasing weariness , and took refuge in [a little restaurant in [Fifty - ninth Street]102-fifty - ninth street]4549-a little restaurant in fifty - ninth street . [She]109-lily was not hungry , and had meant to go without luncheon ; but [she]109-lily was too tired to return [home]400-home , and the long perspective of white tables showed alluringly through the windows . [The room]351-the room was full of [women]2772-women and [girls]2776-girls , all too much engaged in the rapid absorption of tea and pie to remark [her]109-lily entrance . A hum of shrill voices reverberated against the low ceiling , leaving [Lily]109-lily shut out in a little circle of silence . [She]109-lily felt a sudden pang of profound loneliness . [She]109-lily had lost the sense of time , and it seemed to [her]109-lily as though [she]109-lily had not spoken to [any one]442-any one for days . [Her]109-lily eyes sought the faces about [her]109-lily , craving a responsive glance , some sign of an intuition of [her]109-lily trouble . But [the sallow preoccupied women]4555-the sallow preoccupied women , with [their]4555-the sallow preoccupied women bags and note - books and rolls of music , were all engrossed in [their]4555-the sallow preoccupied women own affairs , and even those who sat by [themselves]4555-the sallow preoccupied women were busy running over proof - sheets or devouring magazines between [their]4555-the sallow preoccupied women hurried gulps of tea . [Lily]109-lily alone was stranded in a great waste of disoccupation . [She]109-lily drank several cups of the tea which was served with [her]109-lily portion of stewed oysters , and [her]109-lily brain felt clearer and livelier when [she]109-lily emerged once more into [the street]310-the street . [She]109-lily realized now that , as [she]109-lily sat in [the restaurant]3836-the restaurant , [she]109-lily had unconsciously arrived at a final decision . The discovery gave [her]109-lily an immediate illusion of activity : it was exhilarating to think that [she]109-lily had actually a reason for hurrying [home]400-home . To prolong [her]109-lily enjoyment of the sensation [she]109-lily decided to walk ; but the distance was so great that [she]109-lily found [herself]109-lily glancing nervously at the clocks on the way . One of the surprises of [her]109-lily unoccupied state was the discovery that time , when it is left to itself and no definite demands are made on it , can not be trusted to move at any recognized pace . Usually it loiters ; but just when one has come to count upon its slowness , it may suddenly break into a wild irrational gallop . [She]109-lily found , however , on reaching [home]400-home , that the hour was still early enough for [her]109-lily to sit down and rest a few minutes before putting [her]109-lily plan into execution . The delay did not perceptibly weaken [her]109-lily resolve . [She]109-lily was frightened and yet stimulated by the reserved force of resolution which [she]109-lily felt within [herself]109-lily : [she]109-lily saw it was going to be easier , a great deal easier , than [she]109-lily had imagined . At five o’clock [she]109-lily rose , unlocked [her]109-lily trunk , and took out a sealed packet which [she]109-lily slipped into the bosom of [her]109-lily dress . Even the contact with the packet did not shake [her]109-lily nerves as [she]109-lily had half - expected it would . [She]109-lily seemed encased in a strong armour of indifference , as though the vigorous exertion of [her]109-lily will had finally benumbed [her]109-lily finer sensibilities . [She]109-lily dressed [herself]109-lily once more for [the street]310-the street , locked [her]109-lily door and went out . When [she]109-lily emerged on [the pavement]3668-the pavement , the day was still high , but a threat of rain darkened the sky and cold gusts shook the signs projecting from [the basement shops along [the street]310-the street]4562-the basement shops along the street . [She]109-lily reached [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue and began to walk slowly northward . [She]109-lily was sufficiently familiar with [Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s habits to know that [she]109-lily could always be found at [home]400-home after five . [She]109-lily might not , indeed , be accessible to [visitors]616-visitors , especially to [a visitor]4566-a visitor so unwelcome , and against whom it was quite possible that [she]109-lily had guarded [herself]109-lily by special orders ; but [Lily]109-lily had written a note which [she]109-lily meant to send up with [her]109-lily name , and which [she]109-lily thought would secure [her]109-lily admission . [She]109-lily had allowed [herself]109-lily time to walk to [[Mrs. Dorset]131-mrs. dorset ’s]4567-mrs. dorset ’s , thinking that the quick movement through the cold evening air would help to steady [her]109-lily nerves ; but [she]109-lily really felt no need of being tranquillized . [Her]109-lily survey of the situation remained calm and unwavering . As [she]109-lily reached [Fiftieth Street]103-fiftieth street the clouds broke abruptly , and a rush of cold rain slanted into [her]109-lily face . [She]109-lily had no umbrella and the moisture quickly penetrated [her]109-lily thin spring dress . [She]109-lily was still half a mile from [her]109-lily destination , and [she]109-lily decided to walk across to [Madison Avenue]7-madison avenue and take [the electric car]4568-the electric car . As [she]109-lily turned into [the side street]1749-the side street , a vague memory stirred in [her]109-lily . The row of budding trees , [the new brick and limestone house - fronts]334-the new brick and limestone house - fronts , [the Georgian flat - house with flower - boxes on [its]4571-the georgian flat - house with flower - boxes on its balconies balconies]4571-the georgian flat - house with flower - boxes on its balconies , were merged together into the setting of a familiar scene . It was down [this street]4572-this street that [she]109-lily had walked with [Selden]108-selden , that September day two years ago ; a few yards ahead was the doorway [they]4573-they had entered together . The recollection loosened a throng of benumbed sensations — longings , regrets , imaginings , the throbbing brood of the only spring [her]109-lily heart had ever known . It was strange to find [herself]109-lily passing [[his]108-selden house]4574-his house on such an errand . [She]109-lily seemed suddenly to see [her]109-lily action as [he]108-selden would see it — and the fact of [his]108-selden own connection with it , the fact that , to attain [her]109-lily end , [she]109-lily must trade on [his]108-selden name , and profit by a secret of [his]108-selden past , chilled [her]109-lily blood with shame . What a long way [she]109-lily had travelled since the day of [their]4573-they first talk together ! Even then [her]109-lily feet had been set in the path [she]109-lily was now following — even then [she]109-lily had resisted the hand [he]108-selden had held out . All [her]109-lily resentment of [his]108-selden fancied coldness was swept away in this overwhelming rush of recollection . Twice [he]108-selden had been ready to help [her]109-lily — to help [her]109-lily by loving [her]109-lily , as [he]108-selden had said — and if , the third time , [he]108-selden had seemed to fail [her]109-lily , whom but [herself]109-lily could [she]109-lily accuse ? ... Well , that part of [her]109-lily life was over ; [she]109-lily did not know why [her]109-lily thoughts still clung to it . But the sudden longing to see [him]108-selden remained ; it grew to hunger as [she]109-lily paused on the pavement opposite [his]108-selden door . [The street]310-the street was dark and empty , swept by the rain . [She]109-lily had a vision of [[his]108-selden quiet room]4576-his quiet room , of the bookshelves , and the fire on the hearth . [She]109-lily looked up and saw a light in [his]108-selden window ; then [she]109-lily crossed [the street]310-the street and entered [the house]488-the house . Chapter 12 [The library]941-the library looked as [she]109-lily had pictured [it]941-the library . The green - shaded lamps made tranquil circles of light in the gathering dusk , a little fire flickered on the hearth , and [Selden]108-selden ’s easy - chair , which stood near [it]941-the library , had been pushed aside when [he]108-selden rose to admit [her]109-lily . [He]108-selden had checked [his]108-selden first movement of surprise , and stood silent , waiting for [her]109-lily to speak , while [she]109-lily paused a moment on the threshold , assailed by a rush of memories . The scene was unchanged . [She]109-lily recognized the row of shelves from which [he]108-selden had taken down [his]108-selden La Bruyere , and the worn arm of the chair [he]108-selden had leaned against while [she]109-lily examined the precious volume . But then the wide September light had filled [the room]351-the room , making it seem a part of [the outer world]1335-the outer world : now the shaded lamps and the warm hearth , detaching it from the gathering darkness of [the street]310-the street , gave it a sweeter touch of intimacy . Becoming gradually aware of the surprise under [Selden]108-selden ’s silence , [Lily]109-lily turned to [him]2559-you and said simply : “[0-i] [I]0-i came to tell [you]2559-you that [I]0-i was sorry for the way [we]2560-we parted — for what [I]0-i said to [you]2559-you that day at [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch ’s . ” The words rose to [her]109-lily lips spontaneously . Even on [her]109-lily way up [the stairs]1290-the stairs , [she]109-lily had not thought of preparing a pretext for [her]109-lily visit , but [she]109-lily now felt an intense longing to dispel the cloud of misunderstanding that hung between [them]2560-we . [Selden]108-selden returned [her]109-lily look with a smile . “[0-i] [I]0-i was sorry too that [we]2560-we should have parted in that way ; but [I]0-i am not sure [I]0-i did n’t bring it on [myself]0-i . Luckily [I]0-i had foreseen the risk [I]0-i was taking — — ” “[0-i] So that [you]2559-you really did n’t care — — ? ” broke from [her]109-lily with a flash of [her]109-lily old irony . “[2559-you] So that [I]0-i was prepared for the consequences , ” [he]108-selden corrected good - humouredly . “[2559-you] But [we]2560-we ’ll talk of all this later . Do come and sit by the fire . [I]0-i can recommend that arm - chair , if [you]2559-you ’ll let [me]0-i put a cushion behind [you]2559-you . ” While [he]108-selden spoke [she]109-lily had moved slowly to the middle of [the room]351-the room , and paused near [his]108-selden writing - table , where the lamp , striking upward , cast exaggerated shadows on the pallor of [her]109-lily delicately - hollowed face . “[2559-you] [You]2559-you look tired — do sit down , ” [he]108-selden repeated gently . [She]109-lily did not seem to hear the request . “[2559-you] [I]0-i wanted [you]2559-you to know that [I]0-i left [Mrs. Hatch]285-mrs. hatch immediately after [I]0-i saw [you]2559-you , ” [she]0-i said , as though continuing [her]0-i confession . “[0-i] Yes — yes ; [I]0-i know , ” [he]2559-you assented , with a rising tinge of embarrassment . “[0-i] And that [I]0-i did so because [you]2559-you told [me]0-i to . Before [you]2559-you came [I]0-i had already begun to see that it would be impossible to remain with [her]285-mrs. hatch — for the reasons [you]2559-you gave [me]0-i ; but [I]0-i would n’t admit it — [I]0-i would n’t let [you]2559-you see that [I]0-i understood what [you]2559-you meant . ” “[2559-you] Ah , [I]0-i might have trusted [you]2559-you to find [your]2559-you own way out — don’t overwhelm [me]0-i with the sense of [my]0-i officiousness ! ” [His]2559-you light tone , in which , had [her]0-i nerves been steadier , [she]0-i would have recognized the mere effort to bridge over an awkward moment , jarred on [her]0-i passionate desire to be understood . In [her]0-i strange state of extra - lucidity , which gave [her]0-i the sense of being already at the heart of the situation , it seemed incredible that [any one]442-any one should think it necessary to linger in the conventional outskirts of word - play and evasion . “[2559-you] It was not that — [I]0-i was not ungrateful , ” [she]0-i insisted . But the power of expression failed [her]0-i suddenly ; [she]0-i felt a tremor in [her]0-i throat , and two tears gathered and fell slowly from [her]0-i eyes . [Selden]108-selden moved forward and took [her]0-i hand . “[0-i] [You]2559-you are very tired . Why wo n’t [you]2559-you sit down and let [me]0-i make [you]2559-you comfortable ? ” [He]108-selden drew [her]0-i to the arm - chair near the fire , and placed a cushion behind [her]0-i shoulders . “[0-i] And now [you]2559-you must let [me]0-i make [you]2559-you some tea : [you]2559-you know [I]0-i always have that amount of hospitality at [my]0-i command . ” [She]0-i shook [her]0-i head , and two more tears ran over . But [she]0-i did not weep easily , and the long habit of self - control reasserted itself , though [she]0-i was still too tremulous to speak . “[2559-you] [You]2559-you know [I]0-i can coax the water to boil in five minutes , ” [Selden]108-selden continued , speaking as though [she]0-i were [a troubled child]4586-a troubled child . [His]108-selden words recalled the vision of that other afternoon when [they]4587-they had sat together over [his]108-selden tea - table and talked jestingly of [her]0-i future . There were moments when that day seemed more remote than any other event in [her]0-i life ; and yet [she]0-i could always relive it in its minutest detail . [She]0-i made a gesture of refusal . “[0-i] No : [I]0-i drink too much tea . [I]0-i would rather sit quiet — [I]0-i must go in a moment , ” [she]0-i added confusedly . [Selden]108-selden continued to stand near [her]0-i , leaning against the mantelpiece . The tinge of constraint was beginning to be more distinctly perceptible under the friendly ease of [his]108-selden manner . [Her]0-i self - absorption had not allowed [her]0-i to perceive it at first ; but now that [her]0-i consciousness was once more putting forth its eager feelers , [she]0-i saw that [her]0-i presence was becoming an embarrassment to [him]108-selden . Such a situation can be saved only by an immediate outrush of feeling ; and on [Selden]108-selden ’s side the determining impulse was still lacking . The discovery did not disturb [Lily]109-lily as it might once have done . [She]0-i had passed beyond the phase of well - bred reciprocity , in which every demonstration must be scrupulously proportioned to the emotion it elicits , and generosity of feeling is the only ostentation condemned . But the sense of loneliness returned with redoubled force as [she]0-i saw [herself]0-i forever shut out from [Selden]108-selden ’s inmost self . [She]0-i had come to [him]108-selden with no definite purpose ; the mere longing to see [him]108-selden had directed [her]0-i ; but the secret hope [she]0-i had carried with [her]0-i suddenly revealed itself in its death - pang . “[0-i] [I]0-i must go , ” [she]0-i repeated , making a motion to rise from [her]0-i chair . “[0-i] But [I]0-i may not see [you]2561-you again for a long time , and [I]0-i wanted to tell [you]2561-you that [I]0-i have never forgotten the things [you]2561-you said to [me]0-i at [Bellomont]3-bellomont , and that sometimes — sometimes when [I]0-i seemed farthest from remembering them — [they]2562-they have helped [me]0-i , and kept [me]0-i from mistakes ; kept [me]0-i from really becoming what [many people]2563-many people have thought [me]0-i . ” Strive as [she]0-i would to put some order in [her]0-i thoughts , the words would not come more clearly ; yet [she]0-i felt that [she]0-i could not leave [him]2561-you without trying to make [him]2561-you understand that [she]0-i had saved [herself]0-i whole from the seeming ruin of [her]0-i life . A change had come over [Selden]108-selden ’s face as [she]0-i spoke . [Its]108-selden guarded look had yielded to an expression still untinged by personal emotion , but full of a gentle understanding . “[2562-they] [I]0-i am glad to have [you]2564-you tell [me]0-i that ; but nothing [I]0-i have said has really made the difference . The difference is in [yourself]2564-you — it will always be there . And since it IS there , it ca n’t really matter to [you]2564-you what [people]2804-people think : [you]2564-you are so sure that [[your]2564-you friends]3005-your friends will always understand [you]2564-you . ” “[2564-you] Ah , do n’t say that — don’t say that what [you]2564-you have told [me]0-i has made no difference . It seems to shut [me]0-i out — to leave [me]0-i all alone with [the other people]2567-the other people . ” [She]0-i had risen and stood before [him]2564-you , once more completely mastered by the inner urgency of the moment . The consciousness of [his]2564-you half - divined reluctance had vanished . Whether [he]2564-you wished it or not , [he]2564-you must see [her]0-i wholly for once before [they]4588-they parted . [Her]0-i voice had gathered strength , and [she]0-i looked [him]2564-you gravely in the eyes as [she]0-i continued . “[2564-you] Once — twice — [you]2564-you gave [me]0-i the chance to escape from [my]0-i life , and [I]0-i refused it : refused it because [I]0-i was [a coward]3040-a coward . Afterward [I]0-i saw [my]0-i mistake — [I]0-i saw [I]0-i could never be happy with what had contented [me]0-i before . But it was too late : [you]2564-you had judged [me]0-i — [I]0-i understood . It was too late for happiness — but not too late to be helped by the thought of what [I]0-i had missed . That is all [I]0-i have lived on — don’t take it from [me]0-i now ! Even in [my]0-i worst moments it has been like a little light in the darkness . [Some women]1122-some women are strong enough to be good by [themselves]1122-some women , but [I]0-i needed the help of [your]2564-you belief in [me]0-i . Perhaps [I]0-i might have resisted a great temptation , but [the little ones]2570-the little ones would have pulled [me]0-i down . And then [I]0-i remembered — [I]0-i remembered [your]2564-you saying that such a life could never satisfy [me]0-i ; and [I]0-i was ashamed to admit to [myself]0-i that it could . That is what [you]2564-you did for [me]0-i — that is what [I]0-i wanted to thank [you]2564-you for . [I]0-i wanted to tell [you]2564-you that [I]0-i have always remembered ; and that [I]0-i have tried — tried hard .... ” [She]0-i broke off suddenly . [Her]0-i tears had risen again , and in drawing out [her]0-i handkerchief [her]0-i fingers touched the packet in the folds of [her]0-i dress . A wave of colour suffused [her]0-i , and the words died on [her]0-i lips . Then [she]0-i lifted [her]0-i eyes to [his]4589-his and went on in an altered voice . “[0-i] [I]0-i have tried hard — but life is difficult , and [I]0-i am [a very useless person]2571-a very useless person . [I]0-i can hardly be said to have an independent existence . [I]0-i was just a screw or a cog in the great machine [I]0-i called life , and when [I]0-i dropped out of it [I]0-i found [I]0-i was of no use anywhere else . What can [one]2737-one do when [one]2737-one finds that one only fits into one hole ? [One]2737-one must get back to it or be thrown out into [the rubbish heap]2575-the rubbish heap — and [you]2576-you do n’t know what it ’s like in [the rubbish heap]2575-the rubbish heap ! ” [Her]0-i lips wavered into a smile — [she]0-i had been distracted by the whimsical remembrance of the confidences [she]0-i had made to [him]2576-you , two years earlier , in [that very room]4590-that very room . Then [she]0-i had been planning to marry [Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce — what was it [she]0-i was planning now ? The blood had risen strongly under [Selden]108-selden ’s dark skin , but [his]2576-you emotion showed itself only in an added seriousness of manner . “[2576-you] [You]2576-you have something to tell [me]0-i — do [you]2576-you mean to marry ? ” [he]2576-you said abruptly . [Lily]109-lily ’s eyes did not falter , but a look of wonder , of puzzled self - interrogation , formed itself slowly in their depths . In the light of [his]2576-you question , [she]0-i had paused to ask [herself]0-i if [her]0-i decision had really been taken when [she]0-i entered [the room]351-the room . “[0-i] [You]0-i always told [me]0-i [I]0-i should have to come to it sooner or later ! ” [she]0-i said with a faint smile . “[0-i] And [you]0-i have come to it now ? ” “[0-i] [I]0-i shall have to come to it — presently . But there is something else [I]0-i must come to first . ” [She]0-i paused again , trying to transmit to [her]0-i voice the steadiness of [her]0-i recovered smile . “[0-i] There is some one [I]0-i must say goodbye to . Oh , not [YOU]0-i — [we]2578-we are sure to see [each other]2955-each other again — but the Lily Bart [you]0-i knew . [I]0-i have kept [her]2580-her with [me]0-i all this time , but now [we]2578-we are going to part , and [I]0-i have brought [her]2580-her back to [you]0-i — [I]0-i am going to leave [her]2580-her here . When [I]0-i go out presently [she]2580-her will not go with [me]0-i . [I]0-i shall like to think that [she]2580-her has stayed with [you]0-i — and [she]2580-her ’ll be no trouble , [she]2580-her ’ll take up [no room]2581-no room . ” [She]0-i went toward [him]4592-he , and put out [her]0-i hand , still smiling . “[0-i] Will [you]0-i let [her]2580-her stay with [you]0-i ? ” [she]0-i asked . [He]4592-he caught [her]0-i hand , and [she]0-i felt in [his]4592-he the vibration of feeling that had not yet risen to [his]4592-he lips . “[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily — can’t [I]0-i help [you]109-lily ? ” [he]4592-he exclaimed . [She]0-i looked at [him]4592-he gently . “[0-i] Do [you]0-i remember what [you]0-i said to [me]0-i once ? That [you]0-i could help [me]0-i only by loving [me]0-i ? Well — [you]0-i did love [me]0-i for a moment ; and it helped [me]0-i . It has always helped [me]0-i . But the moment is gone — it was [I]0-i who let it go . And [one]2737-one must go on living . Goodbye . ” [She]0-i laid [her]0-i other hand on [his]4592-he , and [they]4593-they looked at [each other]2955-each other with a kind of solemnity , as though [they]4593-they stood in the presence of death . Something in truth lay dead between [them]4593-they — the love [she]0-i had killed in [him]4592-he and could no longer call to life . But something lived between [them]4593-they also , and leaped up in [her]0-i like an imperishable flame : it was the love [his]4592-he love had kindled , the passion of [her]0-i soul for [his]4592-he . In its light everything else dwindled and fell away from [her]0-i . [She]0-i understood now that [she]0-i could not go forth and leave [[her]0-i old self]4595-her old self with [him]4592-he : that self must indeed live on in [his]4592-he presence , but it must still continue to be [hers]0-i . [Selden]108-selden had retained [her]0-i hand , and continued to scrutinize [her]0-i with a strange sense of foreboding .
