The external aspect of the situation had vanished for [him]4592-he as completely as for [her]0-i : [he]4592-he felt it only as one of those rare moments which lift the veil from [their]4596-their faces as [they]4596-their pass . “[109-lily] [Lily]109-lily , ” [he]4592-he said in a low voice , “[109-lily] [you]109-lily must n’t speak in this way . [I]0-i ca n’t let [you]109-lily go without knowing what [you]109-lily mean to do . Things may change — but they do n’t pass . [You]109-lily can never go out of [my]0-i life . ” [She]0-i met [his]4592-he eyes with an illumined look . “[109-lily] No , ” [she]0-i said . “[109-lily] [I]0-i see that now . Let [us]2583-us always be [friends]3163-friends . Then [I]0-i shall feel safe , whatever happens . ” “[0-i] Whatever happens ? What do [you]0-i mean ? What is going to happen ? ” [She]0-i turned away quietly and walked toward the hearth . “[0-i] Nothing at present — except that [I]0-i am very cold , and that before [I]0-i go [you]0-i must make up the fire for [me]0-i . ” [She]0-i knelt on the hearth - rug , stretching [her]0-i hands to the embers . Puzzled by the sudden change in [her]0-i tone , [he]4592-he mechanically gathered a handful of wood from the basket and tossed it on the fire . As [he]4592-he did so , [he]4592-he noticed how thin [her]0-i hands looked against the rising light of the flames . [He]4592-he saw too , under the loose lines of [her]0-i dress , how the curves of [her]0-i figure had shrunk to angularity ; [he]4592-he remembered long afterward how the red play of the flame sharpened the depression of [her]0-i nostrils , and intensified the blackness of the shadows which struck up from [her]0-i cheekbones to [her]0-i eyes . [She]0-i knelt there for a few moments in silence ; a silence which [he]4592-he dared not break . When [she]0-i rose [he]4592-he fancied that [he]4592-he saw [her]0-i draw something from [her]0-i dress and drop it into the fire ; but [he]4592-he hardly noticed the gesture at the time . [His]4592-he faculties seemed tranced , and [he]4592-he was still groping for the word to break the spell . [She]0-i went up to [him]4592-he and laid [her]0-i hands on [his]4592-he shoulders . “[0-i] Goodbye , ” [she]0-i said , and as [he]4592-he bent over [her]0-i [she]0-i touched [his]4592-he forehead with [her]0-i lips . Chapter 13 [The street]310-the street - lamps were lit , but the rain had ceased , and there was a momentary revival of light in the upper sky . [Lily]109-lily walked on unconscious of [her]109-lily surroundings . [She]109-lily was still treading the buoyant ether which emanates from the high moments of life . But gradually it shrank away from [her]109-lily and [she]109-lily felt the dull pavement beneath [her]109-lily feet . The sense of weariness returned with accumulated force , and for a moment [she]109-lily felt that [she]109-lily could walk no farther . [She]109-lily had reached [the corner of [Forty - first Street]104-forty - first street and [Fifth Avenue]12-fifth avenue]4598-the corner of forty - first street and fifth avenue , and [she]109-lily remembered that in [Bryant Park]105-bryant park there were seats where [she]109-lily might rest . [That melancholy pleasure - ground]4599-that melancholy pleasure - ground was almost deserted when [she]109-lily entered [it]4599-that melancholy pleasure - ground , and [she]109-lily sank down on an empty bench in the glare of an electric street - lamp . The warmth of the fire had passed out of [her]109-lily veins , and [she]109-lily told [herself]109-lily that [she]109-lily must not sit long in the penetrating dampness which struck up from the wet asphalt . But [her]109-lily will - power seemed to have spent itself in a last great effort , and [she]109-lily was lost in the blank reaction which follows on an unwonted expenditure of energy . And besides , what was there to go [home]400-home to ? Nothing but the silence of [[her]109-lily cheerless room]4601-her cheerless room — that silence of the night which may be more racking to tired nerves than the most discordant noises : that , and the bottle of chloral by [her]109-lily bed . The thought of the chloral was the only spot of light in the dark prospect : [she]109-lily could feel its lulling influence stealing over [her]109-lily already . But [she]109-lily was troubled by the thought that it was losing its power — [she]109-lily dared not go back to it too soon . Of late the sleep it had brought [her]109-lily had been more broken and less profound ; there had been nights when [she]109-lily was perpetually floating up through it to consciousness . What if the effect of the drug should gradually fail , as all narcotics were said to fail ? [She]109-lily remembered [the chemist]4460-the chemist ’s warning against increasing the dose ; and [she]109-lily had heard before of the capricious and incalculable action of the drug . [Her]109-lily dread of returning to a sleepless night was so great that [she]109-lily lingered on , hoping that excessive weariness would reinforce the waning power of the chloral . Night had now closed in , and the roar of traffic in [Forty - second Street]104-forty - first street was dying out . As complete darkness fell on [the square]3737-the square [the lingering occupants of the benches]4604-the lingering occupants of the benches rose and dispersed ; but now and then [a stray figure , hurrying homeward]4605-a stray figure , hurrying homeward , struck across the path where [Lily]109-lily sat , looming black for a moment in the white circle of electric light . [One or two of [these passers - by]4607-these passers - by]4606-one or two of these passers - by slackened [their]4606-one or two of these passers - by pace to glance curiously at [her]109-lily lonely figure ; but [she]109-lily was hardly conscious of [their]4606-one or two of these passers - by scrutiny . Suddenly , however , [she]109-lily became aware that one of the passing shadows remained stationary between [her]109-lily line of vision and the gleaming asphalt ; and raising [her]109-lily eyes [she]109-lily saw [a young woman]4608-a young woman bending over [her]109-lily . “[0-i] Excuse [me]0-i — are [you]0-i sick?—Why , it ’s [Miss Bart]109-lily ! ” a half - familiar voice exclaimed . [Lily]109-lily looked up . [The speaker]1340-the speaker was [a poorly - dressed young woman with a bundle under [her]0-i arm]4610-a poorly - dressed young woman with a bundle under her arm . [Her]0-i face had the air of unwholesome refinement which ill - health and over - work may produce , but its common prettiness was redeemed by the strong and generous curve of the lips . “[109-lily] [You]0-i do n’t remember [me]0-i , ” [she]0-i continued , brightening with the pleasure of recognition , “[0-i] but [I]0-i ’d know [you]0-i anywhere , [I]0-i ’ve thought of [you]0-i such a lot . [I]0-i guess [[my]0-i folks]2585-my folks all know [your]0-i name by heart . [I]0-i was [one of the girls at [[Miss Farish]113-miss farish ’s club]2587-miss farish ’s club]2586-one of the girls at miss farish ’s club — [you]0-i helped [me]0-i to go to [the country]304-the country that time [I]0-i had lung - trouble . [My]0-i name ’s [Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther . [It]2589-it was [Nettie Crane]298-nettie crane then — but [I]0-i daresay [you]0-i do n’t remember that either . ” Yes : [Lily]109-lily was beginning to remember . The episode of [Nettie Crane]298-nettie crane ’s timely rescue from disease had been one of the most satisfying incidents of [her]109-lily connection with [Gerty]112-gerty ’s charitable work . [She]109-lily had furnished [the girl]665-the girl with the means to go to [a sanatorium]4612-a sanatorium in [the mountains]4613-the mountains : it struck [her]109-lily now with a peculiar irony that the money [she]109-lily had used had been [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor ’s . [She]109-lily tried to reply , to assure [the speaker]1340-the speaker that [she]109-lily had not forgotten ; but [her]109-lily voice failed in the effort , and [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily sinking under a great wave of physical weakness . [Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther , with a startled exclamation , sat down and slipped a shabbily - clad arm behind [her]297-nettie struther back . “[0-i] Why , [Miss Bart]109-lily , [you]109-lily ARE sick . Just lean on [me]0-i a little till [you]109-lily feel better . ” A faint glow of returning strength seemed to pass into [Lily]109-lily from the pressure of the supporting arm . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m only tired — it is nothing , ” [she]0-i found voice to say in a moment ; and then , as [she]0-i met the timid appeal of [[her]0-i companion]445-her companion ’s eyes , [she]0-i added involuntarily : “[0-i] [I]0-i have been unhappy — in great trouble . ” “[109-lily] [YOU]109-lily in trouble ? [I]0-i ’ve always thought of [you]109-lily as being so high up , where everything was just grand . Sometimes , when [I]0-i felt real mean , and got to wondering why things were so queerly fixed in [the world]354-the world , [I]0-i used to remember that [you]109-lily were having a lovely time , anyhow , and that seemed to show there was a kind of justice somewhere . But [you]109-lily must n’t sit here too long — it ’s fearfully damp . Do n’t [you]109-lily feel strong enough to walk on a little ways now ? ” [she]0-i broke off . “[109-lily] Yes — yes ; [I]0-i must go [home]400-home , ” [Lily]109-lily murmured , rising . [Her]109-lily eyes rested wonderingly on the thin shabby figure at [her]109-lily side . [She]109-lily had known [Nettie Crane]298-nettie crane as one of [the discouraged victims of over - work and anaemic parentage]4616-the discouraged victims of over - work and anaemic parentage : [one of the superfluous fragments of life destined to be swept prematurely into [that social refuse - heap of which [Lily]109-lily had so lately expressed [her]109-lily dread]4618-that social refuse - heap of which lily had so lately expressed her dread]4617-one of the superfluous fragments of life destined to be swept prematurely into that social refuse - heap of which lily had so lately expressed her dread . But [Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther ’s frail envelope was now alive with hope and energy : whatever fate the future reserved for [her]297-nettie struther , [she]297-nettie struther would not be cast into [the refuse - heap]4619-the refuse - heap without a struggle . “[0-i] [I]0-i am very glad to have seen [you]109-lily , ” [Lily]109-lily continued , summoning a smile to [her]109-lily unsteady lips . “[0-i] It ’ll be [my]0-i turn to think of [you]109-lily as happy — and [the world]354-the world will seem a less unjust place to [me]0-i too . ” “[0-i] Oh , but [I]0-i ca n’t leave [you]109-lily like this — [you’re]109-lily not fit to go [home]400-home alone . And [I]0-i ca n’t go with [you]109-lily either ! ” [Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther wailed with a start of recollection . “[0-i] [You]109-lily see , it ’s [[my]0-i husband]3199-my husband ’s night - shift — [he]3199-my husband ’s [a motor - man]2595-a motor - man — and [the friend [I]0-i leave [the baby]2378-the baby with]2596-the friend i leave the baby with has to step [upstairs]2873-upstairs to get [[HER]2596-the friend i leave the baby with husband]609-her husband ’s supper at seven . [I]0-i did n’t tell [you]109-lily [I]0-i had [a baby]2882-a baby , did [I]0-i ? [She]2882-a baby ’ll be four months old day after tomorrow , and to look at [her]2882-a baby [you]109-lily would n’t think [I]0-i ’d ever had a sick day . [I]0-i ’d give anything to show [you]109-lily [the baby]2378-the baby , [Miss Bart]109-lily , and [we]2602-we live right down [the street]310-the street [here]2763-here — it ’s only three blocks off . ” [She]0-i lifted [her]0-i eyes tentatively to [Lily]109-lily ’s face , and then added with a burst of courage : “[109-lily] Why wo n’t [you]109-lily get right into [the cars]2605-the cars and come [home]400-home with [me]0-i while [I]0-i get [baby]2607-baby ’s supper ? It ’s real warm in [[our]2602-we kitchen]2608-our kitchen , and [you]109-lily can rest there , and [I]0-i ’ll take [YOU]109-lily home as soon as ever [she]2378-the baby drops off to sleep . ” It WAS warm in [the kitchen]576-the kitchen , which , when [Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther ’s match had made a flame leap from the gas - jet above the table , revealed itself to [Lily]109-lily as extraordinarily small and almost miraculously clean . A fire shone through the polished flanks of the iron stove , and near it stood a crib in which [a baby]2882-a baby was sitting upright , with incipient anxiety struggling for expression on a countenance still placid with sleep . Having passionately celebrated [her]0-i reunion with [[her]0-i offspring]4622-her offspring , and excused [herself]0-i in cryptic language for the lateness of [her]0-i return , [Nettie]297-nettie struther restored [the baby]2378-the baby to the crib and shyly invited [Miss Bart]109-lily to the rocking - chair near the stove . “[0-i] [We]2602-we ’ve got [a parlour]2609-a parlour too , ” [she]0-i explained with pardonable pride ; “[0-i] but [I]0-i guess it ’s warmer in [here]2763-here , and [I]0-i do n’t want to leave [you]109-lily alone while [I]0-i ’m getting [baby]2607-baby ’s supper . ” On receiving [Lily]109-lily ’s assurance that [she]0-i much preferred the friendly proximity of the [kitchen]4624-kitchen fire , [Mrs. Struther]299-mrs. struther proceeded to prepare a bottle of infantile food , which [she]299-mrs. struther tenderly applied to [the baby]2378-the baby ’s impatient lips ; and while the ensuing degustation went on , [she]299-mrs. struther seated [herself]299-mrs. struther with a beaming countenance beside [[her]299-mrs. struther visitor]1346-her visitor . “[0-i] [You]109-lily ’re sure [you]109-lily wo n’t let [me]0-i warm up a drop of coffee for [you]109-lily , [Miss Bart]109-lily ? There ’s some of [baby]2607-baby ’s fresh milk left over — well , maybe [you]109-lily ’d rather just sit quiet and rest a little while . It ’s too lovely having [you]109-lily [here]2763-here . [I]0-i ’ve thought of it so often that [I]0-i ca n’t believe it ’s really come true . [I]0-i ’ve said to [George]131-mrs. dorset again and again : ‘ [I]0-i just wish [Miss Bart]109-lily could see [me]0-i NOW — ’ and [I]0-i used to watch for [your]109-lily name in the papers , and [we]2614-we ’d talk over what [you]109-lily were doing , and read the descriptions of the dresses [you]109-lily wore . [I]0-i have n’t seen [your]109-lily name for a long time , though , and [I]0-i began to be afraid [you]109-lily were sick , and it worried [me]0-i so that [George]131-mrs. dorset said [I]0-i ’d get sick [myself]0-i , fretting about it . ” [Her]0-i lips broke into a reminiscent smile . “[131-mrs. dorset] Well , [I]0-i ca n’t afford to be sick again , that ’s a fact : the last spell nearly finished [me]0-i . When [you]109-lily sent [me]0-i off that time [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i ’d come back alive , and [I]0-i did n’t much care if [I]0-i did . [You]109-lily see [I]0-i did n’t know about [George]131-mrs. dorset and [the baby]2378-the baby then . ” [She]0-i paused to readjust the bottle to [the child]4179-the child ’s bubbling mouth . “[0-i] [[You]109-lily precious]2616-you precious — don’t [you]109-lily be in too much of a hurry ! Was it mad with [mommer]2617-mommer for getting [its]2617-mommer supper so late ? Marry [Anto’nette]300-anto’nette — that ’s what [we]2618-we call [her]300-anto’nette : after [the French queen]2619-the french queen in that play at [the Garden]772-the garden — [I]0-i told [George]131-mrs. dorset [the actress]2621-the actress reminded [me]0-i of [you]109-lily , and that made [me]0-i fancy the name .... [I]0-i never thought [I]0-i ’d get married , [you]109-lily know , and [I]0-i ’d never have had the heart to go on working just for [myself]0-i . ” [She]0-i broke off again , and meeting the encouragement in [Lily]109-lily ’s eyes , went on , with a flush rising under [her]0-i anaemic skin : “[109-lily] [You]109-lily see [I]0-i was n’t only just SICK that time [you]109-lily sent [me]0-i off — [I]0-i was dreadfully unhappy too . [I]0-i ’d known [a gentleman where [I]0-i was employed]2622-a gentleman where i was employed — [I]0-i do n’t know as [you]109-lily remember [I]0-i did type - writing in [a big importing firm]2623-a big importing firm — and — well — [I]0-i thought [we]2624-we were to be married : [he]2622-a gentleman where i was employed ’d gone steady with [me]0-i six months and given [me]0-i [[his]2622-a gentleman where i was employed mother]2809-his mother ’s wedding ring . But [I]0-i presume [he]2622-a gentleman where i was employed was too stylish for [me]0-i — [he]2622-a gentleman where i was employed travelled for [the firm]2626-the firm , and had seen a great deal of society . [Work girls]2627-work girls are n’t looked after the way [you]109-lily are , and [they]2627-work girls do n’t always know how to look after [themselves]2627-work girls . [I]0-i did n’t . . . and it pretty near killed [me]0-i when [he]2622-a gentleman where i was employed went away and left off writing .... “ It was then [I]2628-i came down sick — [I]2628-i thought it was the end of everything . [I]2628-i guess it would have been if [you]109-lily had n’t sent [me]2628-i off . But when [I]2628-i found [I]2628-i was getting well [I]2628-i began to take heart in spite of [myself]2628-i . And then , when [I]2628-i got back [home]400-home , [George]131-mrs. dorset came round and asked [me]2628-i to marry [him]2622-a gentleman where i was employed . At first [I]2628-i thought [I]2628-i could n’t , because [we]4629-we ’d been brought up together , and [I]2628-i knew [he]2622-a gentleman where i was employed knew about [me]2628-i . But after a while [I]2628-i began to see that that made it easier . [I]2628-i never could have told [another man]4630-another man , and [I]2628-i ’d never have married without telling ; but if [George]131-mrs. dorset cared for [me]2628-i enough to have [me]2628-i as [I]2628-i was , [I]2628-i did n’t see why [I]2628-i should n’t begin over again — and [I]2628-i did . ”[2628-i] The strength of the victory shone forth from [her]2628-i as [she]2628-i lifted [her]2628-i irradiated face from [the child]4179-the child on [her]2628-i knees . “ But , mercy , [I]2628-i did n’t mean to go on like this about [myself]2628-i , with [you]4179-the child sitting there looking so fagged out . Only it ’s so lovely having [you]4179-the child [here]2763-here , and letting [you]4179-the child see just how [you]4179-the child ’ve helped [me]2628-i . ”[2628-i] [The baby]2378-the baby had sunk back blissfully replete , and [Mrs. Struther]299-mrs. struther softly rose to lay the bottle aside . Then [she]2628-i paused before [Miss Bart]109-lily . “ [I]2628-i only wish [I]2628-i could help [YOU]4179-the child — but [I]2628-i suppose there ’s nothing on [earth]4632-earth [I]2628-i could do , ”[2628-i] [she]2628-i murmured wistfully . [Lily]109-lily , instead of answering , rose with a smile and held out [her]109-lily arms ; and [the mother]473-the mother , understanding the gesture , laid [[her]473-the mother child]2632-her child in them . [The baby]2378-the baby , feeling [herself]2378-the baby detached from [her]2378-the baby habitual anchorage , made an instinctive motion of resistance ; but the soothing influences of digestion prevailed , and [Lily]109-lily felt the soft weight sink trustfully against [her]109-lily breast . [The child]4179-the child ’s confidence in its safety thrilled [her]109-lily with a sense of warmth and returning life , and [she]109-lily bent over , wondering at the rosy blur of the little face , the empty clearness of the eyes , the vague tendrilly motions of the folding and unfolding fingers . At first the burden in [her]109-lily arms seemed as light as a pink cloud or a heap of down , but as [she]109-lily continued to hold it the weight increased , sinking deeper , and penetrating [her]109-lily with a strange sense of weakness , as though [the child]4179-the child entered into [her]109-lily and became a part of [herself]109-lily . [She]109-lily looked up , and saw [Nettie]297-nettie struther ’s eyes resting on [her]109-lily with tenderness and exultation . “ Would n’t it be too lovely for anything if [she]4179-the child could grow up to be just like [you]109-lily ? Of course [I]297-nettie struther know [she]4179-the child never COULD — but [mothers]4633-mothers are always dreaming the craziest things for [[their]4633-mothers children]4634-their children . ”[297-nettie struther] [Lily]109-lily clasped [the child]4179-the child close for a moment and laid [her]4179-the child back in [[her]4179-the child mother]569-her mother ’s arms . “ Oh , [she]4179-the child must not do that — [I]109-lily should be afraid to come and see [her]4179-the child too often ! ”[109-lily] [she]109-lily said with a smile ; and then , resisting [Mrs. Struther]299-mrs. struther ’s anxious offer of companionship , and reiterating the promise that of course [she]109-lily would come back soon , and make [George]131-mrs. dorset ’s acquaintance , and see [the baby]2378-the baby in [her]109-lily bath , [she]109-lily passed out of [the kitchen]576-the kitchen and went alone down [the tenement stairs]2640-the tenement stairs . * * * * * As [she]109-lily reached [the street]310-the street [she]109-lily realized that [she]109-lily felt stronger and happier : the little episode had done [her]109-lily good . It was the first time [she]109-lily had ever come across the results of [her]109-lily spasmodic benevolence , and the surprised sense of human fellowship took the mortal chill from [her]109-lily heart . It was not till [she]109-lily entered [her]109-lily own door that [she]109-lily felt the reaction of a deeper loneliness . It was long after seven o’clock , and the light and odours proceeding from [the basement]2642-the basement made it manifest that the boarding - house dinner had begun . [She]109-lily hastened up to [[her]109-lily room]529-her room , lit the gas , and began to dress . [She]109-lily did not mean to pamper [herself]109-lily any longer , to go without food because [her]109-lily surroundings made it unpalatable . Since it was [her]109-lily fate to live in [a boarding - house]1517-a boarding - house , [she]109-lily must learn to fall in with the conditions of the life . Nevertheless [she]109-lily was glad that , when [she]109-lily descended to the heat and glare of [the dining - room]3142-the dining - room , the repast was nearly over . * * * * * In [[her]109-lily own room]1393-her own room again , [she]109-lily was seized with a sudden fever of activity . For weeks past [she]109-lily had been too listless and indifferent to set [her]109-lily possessions in order , but now [she]109-lily began to examine systematically the contents of [her]109-lily drawers and cupboard . [She]109-lily had a few handsome dresses left — survivals of [her]109-lily last phase of splendour , on [the Sabrina]3689-the sabrina and in [London]13-london — but when [she]109-lily had been obliged to part with [[her]109-lily maid]565-her maid [she]109-lily had given [the woman]366-the woman a generous share of [her]109-lily cast - off apparel . The remaining dresses , though they had lost their freshness , still kept the long unerring lines , the sweep and amplitude of [the great artist]2650-the great artist ’s stroke , and as [she]109-lily spread them out on the bed the scenes in which they had been worn rose vividly before [her]109-lily . An association lurked in every fold : each fall of lace and gleam of embroidery was like a letter in the record of [her]109-lily past . [She]109-lily was startled to find how the atmosphere of [her]109-lily old life enveloped [her]109-lily . But , after all , it was the life [she]109-lily had been made for : every dawning tendency in [her]109-lily had been carefully directed toward it , all [her]109-lily interests and activities had been taught to centre around it . [She]109-lily was like some rare flower grown for exhibition , a flower from which every bud had been nipped except the crowning blossom of [her]109-lily beauty . Last of all , [she]109-lily drew forth from the bottom of [her]109-lily trunk a heap of white drapery which fell shapelessly across [her]109-lily arm . It was the Reynolds dress [she]109-lily had worn in [the Bry TABLEAUX]107-the bry tableaux . It had been impossible for [her]109-lily to give it away , but [she]109-lily had never seen it since that night , and the long flexible folds , as [she]109-lily shook them out , gave forth an odour of violets which came to [her]109-lily like a breath from the flower - edged fountain where [she]109-lily had stood with [Lawrence Selden]108-selden and disowned [her]109-lily fate . [She]109-lily put back the dresses one by one , laying away with each some gleam of light , some note of laughter , some stray waft from the rosy shores of pleasure . [She]109-lily was still in a state of highly - wrought impressionability , and every hint of the past sent a lingering tremor along [her]109-lily nerves . [She]109-lily had just closed [her]109-lily trunk on the white folds of the Reynolds dress when [she]109-lily heard a tap at [her]109-lily door , and the red fist of [the Irish maid - servant]2651-the irish maid - servant thrust in a belated letter . Carrying it to the light , [Lily]109-lily read with surprise the address stamped on the upper corner of the envelope . It was a business communication from [the office of [[her]109-lily aunt ’s executors]2653-her aunt ’s executors]2652-the office of her aunt ’s executors , and [she]109-lily wondered what unexpected development had caused [them]2653-her aunt ’s executors to break silence before the appointed time . [She]109-lily opened the envelope and a cheque fluttered to the floor . As [she]109-lily stooped to pick it up the blood rushed to [her]109-lily face . The cheque represented the full amount of [Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s legacy , and the letter accompanying it explained that [the executors]4006-the executors , having adjusted the business of [the estate]2655-the estate with less delay than [they]4006-the executors had expected , had decided to anticipate the date fixed for the payment of the bequests . [Lily]109-lily sat down beside the desk at the foot of [her]109-lily bed , and spreading out the cheque , read over and over the TEN THOUSAND DOLLARS written across it in a steely business hand . Ten months earlier the amount it stood for had represented the depths of penury ; but [her]109-lily standard of values had changed in the interval , and now visions of wealth lurked in every flourish of the pen . As [she]109-lily continued to gaze at it , [she]109-lily felt the glitter of the visions mounting to [her]109-lily brain , and after a while [she]109-lily lifted the lid of the desk and slipped the magic formula out of sight . It was easier to think without those five figures dancing before [her]109-lily eyes ; and [she]109-lily had a great deal of thinking to do before [she]109-lily slept . [She]109-lily opened [her]109-lily cheque - book , and plunged into such anxious calculations as had prolonged [her]109-lily vigil at [Bellomont]3-bellomont on the night when [she]109-lily had decided to marry [Percy Gryce]129-mrs. gryce . Poverty simplifies book - keeping , and [her]109-lily financial situation was easier to ascertain than it had been then ; but [she]109-lily had not yet learned the control of money , and during [her]109-lily transient phase of luxury at [the Emporium]4352-the emporium [she]109-lily had slipped back into habits of extravagance which still impaired [her]109-lily slender balance . A careful examination of [her]109-lily cheque - book , and of the unpaid bills in [her]109-lily desk , showed that , when the latter had been settled , [she]109-lily would have barely enough to live on for the next three or four months ; and even after that , if [she]109-lily were to continue [her]109-lily present way of living , without earning any additional money , all incidental expenses must be reduced to the vanishing point . [She]109-lily hid [her]109-lily eyes with a shudder , beholding [herself]109-lily at the entrance of that ever - narrowing perspective down which [she]109-lily had seen [Miss Silverton]281-miss jane ’s dowdy figure take its despondent way . It was no longer , however , from the vision of material poverty that [she]109-lily turned with the greatest shrinking . [She]109-lily had a sense of deeper impoverishment — of an inner destitution compared to which outward conditions dwindled into insignificance . It was indeed miserable to be poor — to look forward to a shabby , anxious middle - age , leading by dreary degrees of economy and self - denial to gradual absorption in the dingy communal existence of [the boarding - house]4522-the boarding - house . But there was something more miserable still — it was the clutch of solitude at [her]109-lily heart , the sense of being swept like a stray uprooted growth down the heedless current of the years . That was the feeling which possessed [her]109-lily now — the feeling of being something rootless and ephemeral , mere spin - drift of the whirling surface of existence , without anything to which the poor little tentacles of self could cling before the awful flood submerged [them]2658-them . And as [she]109-lily looked back [she]109-lily saw that there had never been a time when [she]109-lily had had any real relation to life . [[Her]109-lily parents]2659-her parents too had been rootless , blown hither and thither on every wind of fashion , without any personal existence to shelter [them]2659-her parents from its shifting gusts . [She]109-lily [herself]109-lily had grown up without [any one spot of [earth]4632-earth]2660-any one spot of earth being dearer to [her]109-lily than another : there was no centre of early pieties , of grave endearing traditions , to which [her]109-lily heart could revert and from which it could draw strength for itself and tenderness for [others]1333-others . In whatever form a slowly - accumulated past lives in the blood — whether in the concrete image of [the old house]2663-the old house stored with visual memories , or in the conception of [the house]488-the house not built with hands , but made up of inherited passions and loyalties — it has the same power of broadening and deepening the individual existence , of attaching it by mysterious links of kinship to all the mighty sum of human striving . Such a vision of the solidarity of life had never before come to [Lily]109-lily . [She]109-lily had had a premonition of it in the blind motions of [her]109-lily mating - instinct ; but they had been checked by the disintegrating influences of the life about [her]109-lily . [All [the men]831-the men and women [she]109-lily knew]2665-all the men and women she knew were like atoms whirling away from [each other in some wild centrifugal dance]2667-each other in some wild centrifugal dance : [her]109-lily first glimpse of the continuity of life had come to [her]109-lily that evening in [[Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther ’s kitchen]2668-nettie struther ’s kitchen . [The poor little working - girl who had found strength to gather up the fragments of [her]109-lily life , and build [herself]109-lily a shelter with [them]2665-all the men and women she knew]2669-the poor little working - girl who had found strength to gather up the fragments of her life , and build herself a shelter with them , seemed to [Lily]109-lily to have reached the central truth of existence . It was a meagre enough life , on the grim edge of poverty , with scant margin for possibilities of sickness or mischance , but it had the frail audacious permanence of a bird ’s nest built on the edge of [a cliff]2670-a cliff — a mere wisp of leaves and straw , yet so put together that the lives entrusted to it may hang safely over [the abyss]2671-the abyss . Yes — but it had taken two to build the nest ; [the man]3104-the man ’s faith as well as [the woman]366-the woman ’s courage . [Lily]109-lily remembered [Nettie]297-nettie struther ’s words : [I]0-i KNEW [HE]3104-the man KNEW ABOUT [ME]0-i . [[Her]366-the woman husband]609-her husband ’s faith in [her]366-the woman had made [her]366-the woman renewal possible — it is so easy for [a woman]2771-a woman to become what [the man [she]2771-a woman loves]2676-the man she loves believes [her]2771-a woman to be ! Well — [Selden]108-selden had twice been ready to stake [his]108-selden faith on [Lily Bart]109-lily ; but the third trial had been too severe for [his]108-selden endurance . The very quality of [his]108-selden love had made it the more impossible to recall to life . If it had been a simple instinct of the blood , the power of [her]366-the woman beauty might have revived it . But the fact that it struck deeper , that it was inextricably wound up with inherited habits of thought and feeling , made it as impossible to restore to growth as a deep - rooted plant torn from its bed . [Selden]108-selden had given [her]109-lily of [his]108-selden best ; but [he]108-selden was as incapable as [herself]109-lily of an uncritical return to former states of feeling . There remained to [her]109-lily , as [she]109-lily had told [him]108-selden , the uplifting memory of [his]108-selden faith in [her]109-lily ; but [she]109-lily had not reached the age when [a woman]2771-a woman can live on [her]2771-a woman memories . As [she]109-lily held [[Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther ’s child]2678-nettie struther ’s child in [her]109-lily arms the frozen currents of youth had loosed themselves and run warm in [her]109-lily veins : the old life - hunger possessed [her]109-lily , and all [her]109-lily being clamoured for its share of personal happiness . Yes — it was happiness [she]109-lily still wanted , and the glimpse [she]109-lily had caught of it made everything else of no account . One by one [she]109-lily had detached [herself]109-lily from the baser possibilities , and [she]109-lily saw that nothing now remained to [her]109-lily but the emptiness of renunciation . It was growing late , and an immense weariness once more possessed [her]109-lily . It was not the stealing sense of sleep , but a vivid wakeful fatigue , a wan lucidity of mind against which all the possibilities of the future were shadowed forth gigantically . [She]109-lily was appalled by the intense cleanness of the vision ; [she]109-lily seemed to have broken through the merciful veil which intervenes between intention and action , and to see exactly what [she]109-lily would do in all the long days to come . There was the cheque in [her]109-lily desk , for instance — [she]109-lily meant to use it in paying [her]109-lily debt to [Trenor]161-gus trenor ; but [she]109-lily foresaw that when the morning came [she]109-lily would put off doing so , would slip into gradual tolerance of the debt . The thought terrified [her]109-lily — [she]109-lily dreaded to fall from the height of [her]109-lily last moment with [Lawrence Selden]108-selden . But how could [she]109-lily trust [herself]109-lily to keep [her]109-lily footing ? [She]109-lily knew the strength of the opposing impulses — [she]109-lily could feel the countless hands of habit dragging [her]109-lily back into some fresh compromise with fate . [She]109-lily felt an intense longing to prolong , to perpetuate , the momentary exaltation of [her]109-lily spirit . If only life could end now — end on this tragic yet sweet vision of lost possibilities , which gave [her]109-lily a sense of kinship with all the loving and foregoing in [the world]354-the world ! [She]109-lily reached out suddenly and , drawing the cheque from [her]109-lily writing - desk , enclosed it in an envelope which [she]109-lily addressed to [[her]109-lily bank]2680-her bank . [She]109-lily then wrote out a cheque for [Trenor]161-gus trenor , and placing it , without an accompanying word , in an envelope inscribed with [his]161-gus trenor name , laid the two letters side by side on [her]109-lily desk . After that [she]109-lily continued to sit at the table , sorting [her]109-lily papers and writing , till the intense silence of [the house]488-the house reminded [her]109-lily of the lateness of the hour . In [the street]310-the street the noise of wheels had ceased , and the rumble of the “ elevated ”[109-lily] came only at long intervals through the deep unnatural hush . In the mysterious nocturnal separation from all outward signs of life , [she]109-lily felt [herself]109-lily more strangely confronted with [her]109-lily fate . The sensation made [her]109-lily brain reel , and [she]109-lily tried to shut out consciousness by pressing [her]109-lily hands against [her]109-lily eyes . But the terrible silence and emptiness seemed to symbolize [her]109-lily future — [she]109-lily felt as though [the house]488-the house , [the street]310-the street , [the world]354-the world were all empty , and [she]109-lily alone left sentient in [a lifeless universe]2686-a lifeless universe . But this was the verge of delirium . . . [she]109-lily had never hung so near the dizzy brink of the unreal . Sleep was what [she]109-lily wanted — [she]109-lily remembered that [she]109-lily had not closed [her]109-lily eyes for two nights . The little bottle was at [her]109-lily bed - side , waiting to lay its spell upon [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily rose and undressed hastily , hungering now for the touch of [her]109-lily pillow . [She]109-lily felt so profoundly tired that [she]109-lily thought [she]109-lily must fall asleep at once ; but as soon as [she]109-lily had lain down every nerve started once more into separate wakefulness . It was as though a great blaze of electric light had been turned on in [her]109-lily head , and [her]109-lily poor little anguished self shrank and cowered in it , without knowing where to take refuge . [She]109-lily had not imagined that such a multiplication of wakefulness was possible : [her]109-lily whole past was reenacting itself at a hundred different points of consciousness . Where was the drug that could still this legion of insurgent nerves ? The sense of exhaustion would have been sweet compared to this shrill beat of activities ; but weariness had dropped from [her]109-lily as though some cruel stimulant had been forced into [her]109-lily veins . [She]109-lily could bear it — yes , [she]109-lily could bear it ; but what strength would be left [her]109-lily the next day ? [Perspective]301-perspective had disappeared — the next day pressed close upon [her]109-lily , and on its heels came the days that were to follow — [they]2687-they swarmed about [her]109-lily like [a shrieking mob]2688-a shrieking mob . [She]109-lily must shut [them]2687-they out for a few hours ; [she]109-lily must take a brief bath of oblivion . [She]109-lily put out [her]109-lily hand , and measured the soothing drops into a glass ; but as [she]109-lily did so , [she]109-lily knew [they]2687-they would be powerless against the supernatural lucidity of [her]109-lily brain . [She]109-lily had long since raised the dose to its highest limit , but tonight [she]109-lily felt [she]109-lily must increase it . [She]109-lily knew [she]109-lily took a slight risk in doing so — [she]109-lily remembered [the chemist]4460-the chemist ’s warning . If sleep came at all , it might be a sleep without waking . But after all that was but one chance in a hundred : the action of the drug was incalculable , and the addition of a few drops to the regular dose would probably do no more than procure for [her]109-lily the rest [she]109-lily so desperately needed .... [She]109-lily did not , in truth , consider the question very closely — the physical craving for sleep was [her]109-lily only sustained sensation . [Her]109-lily mind shrank from the glare of thought as instinctively as eyes contract in a blaze of light — darkness , darkness was what [she]109-lily must have at any cost . [She]109-lily raised [herself]109-lily in bed and swallowed the contents of the glass ; then [she]109-lily blew out [her]109-lily candle and lay down . [She]109-lily lay very still , waiting with a sensuous pleasure for the first effects of the soporific . [She]109-lily knew in advance what form [they]2690-they would take — the gradual cessation of the inner throb , the soft approach of passiveness , as though an invisible hand made magic passes over [her]109-lily in the darkness . The very slowness and hesitancy of the effect increased its fascination : it was delicious to lean over and look down into the dim abysses of unconsciousness . Tonight the drug seemed to work more slowly than usual : each passionate pulse had to be stilled in turn , and it was long before [she]109-lily felt [them]2690-they dropping into abeyance , like [sentinels]2691-sentinels falling asleep at [their]2691-sentinels posts . But gradually the sense of complete subjugation came over [her]109-lily , and [she]109-lily wondered languidly what had made [her]109-lily feel so uneasy and excited . [She]109-lily saw now that there was nothing to be excited about — [she]109-lily had returned to [her]109-lily normal view of life . Tomorrow would not be so difficult after all : [she]109-lily felt sure that [she]109-lily would have the strength to meet it . [She]109-lily did not quite remember what it was that [she]109-lily had been afraid to meet , but the uncertainty no longer troubled [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily had been unhappy , and now [she]109-lily was happy — [she]109-lily had felt [herself]109-lily alone , and now the sense of loneliness had vanished . [She]109-lily stirred once , and turned on [her]109-lily side , and as [she]109-lily did so , [she]109-lily suddenly understood why [she]109-lily did not feel [herself]109-lily alone . It was odd — but [[Nettie Struther]297-nettie struther ’s child]2678-nettie struther ’s child was lying on [her]109-lily arm : [she]109-lily felt the pressure of its little head against [her]109-lily shoulder . [She]109-lily did not know how it had come there , but [she]109-lily felt no great surprise at the fact , only a gentle penetrating thrill of warmth and pleasure . [She]109-lily settled [herself]109-lily into an easier position , hollowing [her]109-lily arm to pillow the round downy head , and holding [her]109-lily breath lest a sound should disturb [the sleeping child]2693-the sleeping child . As [she]109-lily lay there [she]109-lily said to [herself]109-lily that there was something [she]109-lily must tell [Selden]108-selden , some word [she]109-lily had found that should make life clear between [them]2694-them . [She]109-lily tried to repeat the word , which lingered vague and luminous on the far edge of thought — [she]109-lily was afraid of not remembering it when [she]109-lily woke ; and if [she]109-lily could only remember it and say it to [him]108-selden , [she]109-lily felt that everything would be well . Slowly the thought of the word faded , and sleep began to enfold [her]109-lily . [She]109-lily struggled faintly against it , feeling that [she]109-lily ought to keep awake on account of [the baby]2378-the baby ; but even this feeling was gradually lost in an indistinct sense of drowsy peace , through which , of a sudden , a dark flash of loneliness and terror tore its way . [She]109-lily started up again , cold and trembling with the shock : for a moment [she]109-lily seemed to have lost [her]109-lily hold of [the child]4179-the child . But no — [she]109-lily was mistaken — the tender pressure of its body was still close to [hers]109-lily : the recovered warmth flowed through [her]109-lily once more , [she]109-lily yielded to it , sank into it , and slept . Chapter 14 The next morning rose mild and bright , with a promise of summer in the air . The sunlight slanted joyously down [[Lily]109-lily ’s street]2697-lily ’s street , mellowed [the blistered house - front]2698-the blistered house - front , gilded the paintless railings of [the doorstep]1699-the doorstep , and struck prismatic glories from the panes of [her]109-lily darkened window . When such a day coincides with the inner mood there is intoxication in its breath ; and [Selden]108-selden , hastening along [the street]310-the street through the squalor of its morning confidences , felt [himself]108-selden thrilling with a youthful sense of adventure . [He]108-selden had cut loose from the familiar shores of habit , and launched [himself]108-selden on uncharted seas of emotion ; all the old tests and measures were left behind , and [his]108-selden course was to be shaped by new stars . That course , for the moment , led merely to [[Miss Bart]109-lily ’s boarding - house]2701-miss bart ’s boarding - house ; but [[its]2701-miss bart ’s boarding - house shabby doorstep]2702-its shabby doorstep had suddenly become the threshold of [the untried]2703-the untried . As [he]108-selden approached [he]108-selden looked up at the triple row of windows , wondering boyishly which one of them was [hers]109-lily . It was nine o’clock , and [the house]488-the house , being tenanted by [workers]4532-workers , already showed an awakened front to [the street]310-the street . [He]108-selden remembered afterward having noticed that only one blind was down . [He]108-selden noticed too that there was a pot of pansies on one of the window sills , and at once concluded that the window must be [hers]109-lily : it was inevitable that [he]108-selden should connect [her]109-lily with the one touch of beauty in the dingy scene . Nine o’clock was an early hour for a visit , but [Selden]108-selden had passed beyond all such conventional observances . [He]108-selden only knew that [he]108-selden must see [Lily Bart]109-lily at once — [he]108-selden had found the word [he]108-selden meant to say to [her]109-lily , and it could not wait another moment to be said . It was strange that it had not come to [his]108-selden lips sooner — that [he]108-selden had let [her]109-lily pass from [him]108-selden the evening before without being able to speak it . But what did that matter , now that a new day had come ? It was not a word for twilight , but for the morning . [Selden]108-selden ran eagerly up the steps and pulled the bell ; and even in [his]108-selden state of self - absorption it came as a sharp surprise to [him]108-selden that the door should open so promptly . It was still more of a surprise to see , as [he]108-selden entered , that [it]2707-it had been opened by [Gerty Farish]112-gerty — and that behind [her]109-lily , in an agitated blur , [several other figures]2708-several other figures ominously loomed . “ [Lawrence]108-selden ! ”[112-gerty] [Gerty]112-gerty cried in a strange voice , “ how could [you]108-selden get [here]2763-here so quickly?”—and[112-gerty] the trembling hand [she]109-lily laid on [him]108-selden seemed instantly to close about [his]108-selden heart . [He]108-selden noticed the other faces , vague with fear and conjecture — [he]108-selden saw [the landlady]2709-the landlady ’s imposing bulk sway professionally toward [him]108-selden ; but [he]108-selden shrank back , putting up [his]108-selden hand , while [his]108-selden eyes mechanically mounted the steep black walnut stairs , up which [he]108-selden was immediately aware that [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin was about to lead [him]108-selden . [A voice in the background]2711-a voice in the background said that [the doctor]2195-the doctor might be back at any minute — and that nothing , [upstairs]2873-upstairs , was to be disturbed . [Some one else]2936-some one else exclaimed : “ It was the greatest mercy — ”[2936-some one else] then [Selden]108-selden felt that [Gerty]112-gerty had taken [him]108-selden gently by the hand , and that [they]2715-they were to be suffered to go up alone . In silence [they]2715-they mounted the three flights , and walked along [the passage]2716-the passage to a closed door . [Gerty]112-gerty opened the door , and [Selden]108-selden went in after [her]112-gerty . Though the blind was down , the irresistible sunlight poured a tempered golden flood into [the room]351-the room , and in its light [Selden]108-selden saw a narrow bed along the wall , and on the bed , with motionless hands and calm unrecognizing face , the semblance of [Lily Bart]109-lily . That it was [her]109-lily real self , every pulse in [him]108-selden ardently denied . [Her]109-lily real self had lain warm on [his]108-selden heart but a few hours earlier — what had [he]108-selden to do with this estranged and tranquil face which , for the first time , neither paled nor brightened at [his]108-selden coming ? [Gerty]112-gerty , strangely tranquil too , with the conscious self - control of [one who has ministered to much pain]2718-one who has ministered to much pain , stood by the bed , speaking gently , as if transmitting a final message . “ [The doctor]2195-the doctor found a bottle of chloral — [she]109-lily had been sleeping badly for a long time , and [she]109-lily must have taken an overdose by mistake .... There is no doubt of that — no doubt — there will be no question — [he]2195-the doctor has been very kind . [I]109-lily told [him]2195-the doctor that [you]4637-you and [I]109-lily would like to be left alone with [her]109-lily — to go over [her]109-lily things before [any one else]4001-any one else comes . [I]109-lily know it is what [she]109-lily would have wished . ”[109-lily] [Selden]108-selden was hardly conscious of what [she]109-lily said . [He]108-selden stood looking down on the sleeping face which seemed to lie like a delicate impalpable mask over the living lineaments [he]108-selden had known . [He]108-selden felt that [the real Lily]109-lily was still there , close to [him]108-selden , yet invisible and inaccessible ; and the tenuity of the barrier between [them]2719-them mocked [him]108-selden with a sense of helplessness . There had never been more than a little impalpable barrier between [them]2719-them — and yet [he]108-selden had suffered it to keep [them]2719-them apart ! And now , though it seemed slighter and frailer than ever , it had suddenly hardened to adamant , and [he]108-selden might beat [his]108-selden life out against it in vain . [He]108-selden had dropped on [his]108-selden knees beside the bed , but a touch from [Gerty]112-gerty aroused [him]108-selden . [He]108-selden stood up , and as [their]2719-them eyes met [he]108-selden was struck by the extraordinary light in [[his]108-selden cousin]340-his cousin ’s face . “ [You]340-his cousin understand what [the doctor]2195-the doctor has gone for ? [He]2195-the doctor has promised that there shall be no trouble — but of course the formalities must be gone through . And [I]108-selden asked [him]2195-the doctor to give [us]2719-them time to look through [her]340-his cousin things first — — ”[108-selden] [He]108-selden nodded , and [she]340-his cousin glanced about [the small bare room]2721-the small bare room . “ It wo n’t take long , ”[340-his cousin] [she]340-his cousin concluded . “ No — it wo n’t take long , ”[108-selden] [he]108-selden agreed . [She]340-his cousin held [his]108-selden hand in [hers]340-his cousin a moment longer , and then , with a last look at the bed , moved silently toward the door . On the threshold [she]340-his cousin paused to add : “ [You]108-selden will find [me]340-his cousin [downstairs]937-downstairs if [you]108-selden want [me]340-his cousin . ”[340-his cousin] [Selden]108-selden roused [himself]108-selden to detain [her]340-his cousin . “ But why are [you]340-his cousin going ? [She]340-his cousin would have wished — — ”[340-his cousin] [Gerty]112-gerty shook [her]112-gerty head with a smile . “ No : this is what [she]340-his cousin would have wished — — ”[112-gerty] and as [she]340-his cousin spoke a light broke through [Selden]108-selden ’s stony misery , and [he]108-selden saw deep into the hidden things of love . The door closed on [Gerty]112-gerty , and [he]108-selden stood alone with [the motionless sleeper on the bed]2722-the motionless sleeper on the bed . [His]108-selden impulse was to return to [her]340-his cousin side , to fall on [his]108-selden knees , and rest [his]108-selden throbbing head against the peaceful cheek on the pillow . [They]2723-they had never been at peace together , [they]2723-they two ; and now [he]108-selden felt [himself]108-selden drawn downward into the strange mysterious depths of [her]340-his cousin tranquillity . But [he]108-selden remembered [Gerty]112-gerty ’s warning words — [he]108-selden knew that , though time had ceased in [this room]3334-this room , [its]3334-this room feet were hastening relentlessly toward the door . [Gerty]112-gerty had given [him]108-selden this supreme half hour , and [he]108-selden must use it as [she]340-his cousin willed . [He]108-selden turned and looked about [him]108-selden , sternly compelling [himself]108-selden to regain [his]108-selden consciousness of outward things . There was very little furniture in [the room]351-the room . The shabby chest of drawers was spread with a lace cover , and set out with a few gold - topped boxes and bottles , a rose - coloured pin - cushion , a glass tray strewn with tortoise - shell hair - pins — [he]108-selden shrank from the poignant intimacy of these trifles , and from the blank surface of the toilet - mirror above them . These were the only traces of luxury , of that clinging to the minute observance of personal seemliness , which showed what [her]340-his cousin other renunciations must have cost . There was no other token of [her]340-his cousin personality about [the room]351-the room , unless it showed itself in the scrupulous neatness of the scant articles of furniture : a washing - stand , two chairs , a small writing - desk , and the little table near the bed . On this table stood the empty bottle and glass , and from these also [he]108-selden averted [his]108-selden eyes . The desk was closed , but on [its]2727-its slanting lid lay two letters which [he]108-selden took up . One bore the address of [a bank]2728-a bank , and as it was stamped and sealed , [Selden]108-selden , after a moment ’s hesitation , laid it aside . On the other letter [he]108-selden read [Gus Trenor]161-gus trenor ’s name ; and the flap of the envelope was still ungummed . Temptation leapt on [him]108-selden like the stab of a knife . [He]108-selden staggered under it , steadying [himself]108-selden against the desk . Why had [she]340-his cousin been writing to [Trenor]161-gus trenor — writing , presumably , just after [their]2729-their parting of the previous evening ? The thought unhallowed the memory of that last hour , made a mock of the word [he]108-selden had come to speak , and defiled even the reconciling silence upon which it fell . [He]108-selden felt [himself]108-selden flung back on all the ugly uncertainties from which [he]108-selden thought [he]108-selden had cast loose forever . After all , what did [he]108-selden know of [her]340-his cousin life ? Only as much as [she]340-his cousin had chosen to show [him]108-selden , and measured by [the world]354-the world ’s estimate , how little that was ! By what right — the letter in [his]108-selden hand seemed to ask — by what right was it [he]108-selden who now passed into [her]340-his cousin confidence through the gate which death had left unbarred ? [His]108-selden heart cried out that it was by right of [their]2729-their last hour together , the hour when [she]340-his cousin [herself]340-his cousin had placed the key in [his]108-selden hand . Yes — but what if the letter to [Trenor]161-gus trenor had been written afterward ? [He]108-selden put it from [him]108-selden with sudden loathing , and setting [his]108-selden lips , addressed [himself]108-selden resolutely to what remained of [his]108-selden task . After all , that task would be easier to perform , now that [his]108-selden personal stake in it was annulled . [He]108-selden raised the lid of the desk , and saw within it a cheque - book and a few packets of bills and letters , arranged with the orderly precision which characterized all [her]340-his cousin personal habits . [He]108-selden looked through the letters first , because it was the most difficult part of the work . [They]2731-they proved to be few and unimportant , but among [them]2731-they [he]108-selden found , with a strange commotion of the heart , the note [he]108-selden had written [her]340-his cousin the day after [the Brys]199-the brys ’ entertainment . “ When may [I]108-selden come to [you?”—his]161-gus trenor[108-selden] words overwhelmed [him]108-selden with a realization of the cowardice which had driven [him]108-selden from [her]340-his cousin at the very moment of attainment . Yes — [he]108-selden had always feared [his]108-selden fate , and [he]108-selden was too honest to disown [his]108-selden cowardice now ; for had not all [his]108-selden old doubts started to life again at the mere sight of [Trenor]161-gus trenor ’s name ? [He]108-selden laid the note in [his]108-selden card - case , folding it away carefully , as something made precious by the fact that [she]340-his cousin had held it so ; then , growing once more aware of the lapse of time , [he]108-selden continued [his]108-selden examination of the papers . To [his]108-selden surprise , [he]108-selden found that all the bills were receipted ; there was not an unpaid account among them . [He]108-selden opened the cheque - book , and saw that , the very night before , a cheque of ten thousand dollars from [[Mrs. Peniston]114-mrs. peniston ’s executors]2732-mrs. peniston ’s executors had been entered in it . The legacy , then , had been paid sooner than [Gerty]112-gerty had led [him]108-selden to expect . But , turning another page or two , [he]108-selden discovered with astonishment that , in spite of this recent accession of funds , the balance had already declined to a few dollars . A rapid glance at the stubs of the last cheques , all of which bore the date of the previous day , showed that between four or five hundred dollars of the legacy had been spent in the settlement of bills , while the remaining thousands were comprehended in one cheque , made out , at the same time , to [Charles Augustus Trenor]161-gus trenor . [Selden]108-selden laid the book aside , and sank into the chair beside the desk . [He]108-selden leaned [his]108-selden elbows on it , and hid [his]108-selden face in [his]108-selden hands . The bitter waters of life surged high about [him]108-selden , their sterile taste was on [his]108-selden lips . Did the cheque to [Trenor]161-gus trenor explain the mystery or deepen it ? At first [his]108-selden mind refused to act — [he]108-selden felt only the taint of such a transaction between [a man like [Trenor]161-gus trenor]2733-a man like trenor and [a girl like [Lily Bart]109-lily]2734-a girl like lily bart . Then , gradually , [his]108-selden troubled vision cleared , old hints and rumours came back to [him]108-selden , and out of the very insinuations [he]108-selden had feared to probe , [he]108-selden constructed an explanation of the mystery . It was true , then , that [she]2734-a girl like lily bart had taken money from [Trenor]161-gus trenor ; but true also , as the contents of the little desk declared , that the obligation had been intolerable to [her]2734-a girl like lily bart , and that at the first opportunity [she]2734-a girl like lily bart had freed [herself]2734-a girl like lily bart from it , though the act left [her]2734-a girl like lily bart face to face with bare unmitigated poverty . That was all [he]108-selden knew — all [he]108-selden could hope to unravel of the story . The mute lips on the pillow refused [him]108-selden more than this — unless indeed [they]2735-they had told [him]108-selden the rest in the kiss [they]2735-they had left upon [his]108-selden forehead . Yes , [he]108-selden could now read into that farewell all that [his]108-selden heart craved to find there ; [he]108-selden could even draw from it courage not to accuse [himself]108-selden for having failed to reach the height of [his]108-selden opportunity . [He]108-selden saw that all the conditions of life had conspired to keep [them]2736-them apart ; since [his]108-selden very detachment from the external influences which swayed [her]2734-a girl like lily bart had increased [his]108-selden spiritual fastidiousness , and made it more difficult for [him]108-selden to live and love uncritically . But at least [he]108-selden HAD loved [her]2734-a girl like lily bart — had been willing to stake [his]108-selden future on [his]108-selden faith in [her]2734-a girl like lily bart — and if the moment had been fated to pass from [them]2736-them before [they]2736-them could seize it , [he]108-selden saw now that , for both , it had been saved whole out of the ruin of [their]2736-them lives . It was this moment of love , this fleeting victory over [themselves]2736-them , which had kept [them]2736-them from atrophy and extinction ; which , in [her]2734-a girl like lily bart , had reached out to [him]108-selden in every struggle against the influence of [her]2734-a girl like lily bart surroundings , and in [him]108-selden , had kept alive the faith that now drew [him]108-selden penitent and reconciled to [her]2734-a girl like lily bart side . [He]108-selden knelt by the bed and bent over [her]2734-a girl like lily bart , draining [their]2736-them last moment to its lees ; and in the silence there passed between [them]2736-them the word which made all clear . THE END = Transcriber ’s Note= : 1 . [I]0-i have modernized this text by modernizing the contractions : do n’t becomes do n’t , etc . 2 . [I]0-i have retained the British spelling of words like favour and colour . 3 . [I]0-i found and corrected one instance of the name “ [Gertie]113-miss farish , ”[0-i] which [I]0-i changed to “ [Gerty]112-gerty ”[0-i] to be consistent with rest of the book . [Linda Ruoff]302-linda ruoff * * *
